revision.text: #Redirect [[Project:Sandbox]] <!-- COMMENT: The sandbox is not a content article, so it's in the project namespace. This redirect from the main, article namespace makes it easier to find. -->

Different users have access to different functions of the site. While anyone can do most things on the site, including reading and editing, '''administrators''' can access a few additional functions.
*Deleting and undeleting pages and page histories. Administrators can also delete uploaded files, but cannot undelete them. *Locking (protecting) a page so it can not be edited or renamed by users without admin rights. *Blocking IP addresses or user names from editing; and very quick "rollback" of undesirable edits. *Editing the interface by changing system messages and skins.
A '''bureaucrat''' can make other users into bureaucrats or administrators on their own wiki. They are not currently able to remove admin access from any user. Please contact one of the community staff if you need this done.
Some Wikia staff members have full access to all Wikia. They will be shown in [[Special:Listusers/staff]] on any wiki. Please see the Central Wikia [[Wikia:Contact us|contact page]] for details on how to contact Wikia staff.
==Who are this wiki's administrators?== The "founder" of a wiki, the person who first requested it, is given administrator access automatically. Founders are also given bureaucrat access so they can make any other user on their wiki an administrator or bureaucrat. For a complete list of users with administrator access, see [[Special:Listadmins]].
You may also wish to list them on this page.
*[[User:Dizzymisscindie]]
==How do I use administrator powers?== See the [[Help:Administrators' how-to guide|administrators' how-to guide]] for a guide on using admin functions.
==Becoming an administrator== For you to become an administrator, someone with bureaucrat access must make you one. On larger Wikias, there will usually be a community page for requests, with a page name such as "[[{{ns:project}}:Requests for adminship]]". On a smaller wiki, you may simply ask on the community portal or ask a bureaucrat directly on his or her talk page.
If there are no active bureaucrats and you wish to become an administrator, please contact the [[Wikia:Community support|community staff on the Central Wikia.]]
==What can administrators not do?== Administrators should not use their administrator powers to settle editing disputes; for example, to lock a page on a version he or she prefers in an editing dispute that isn't vandalism. Administrator powers should be use to help keep the wiki clear of vandalism, spam, and users who make malicious edits, but not for simple disagreements between users acting in good faith. Idealy an admin shouldn't be considered "in charge". The ideal admin is just someone who is trusted to have a few extra buttons and to use them for the benefit of the Wikia community.
[[category:administration of this site]]

[[Project:Administrators|Administrators]] can '''protect''' and unprotect pages. Protection of a page or image means that a non-admin cannot modify it.
The majority of pages on all Wikia should remain publicly editable, and '''not protected'''. Pages may, however, be temporarily or permanently protected for legal reasons (for example, license texts should not be changed) or in cases of extreme vandalism or edit warring.
==Uses==
*Protecting highly vandalised pages, such as the [[Main Page]] on large wikis. *Maintaining the integrity of the site's logo and favicon. *Maintaining the integrity of key [[Project:copyrights|copyright]] and license pages. *Protecting the interface and system messages in the MediaWiki namespace (these are protected automatically)
A '''temporary''' protection is used for: *Enforcing a "cool down" period to stop an "edit war", upon request. *Protecting a page or image that has been a recent target of ''persistent'' vandalism or ''persistent'' edits by a banned user.
There is no need to protect personal .css and .js pages like user/monobook.css or user/cologneblue.js. Only the accounts associated with these pages (and admins) are able to edit them. (For more information on using these pages, see the [[Wikia:Help:User style|help page on Central]]
==Rules== #Do not make the common mistake of protecting pages unnecessarily. For example, do not protect a page simply because it is the Main Page. #Do not [[Help:Editing|edit]] a temporarily protected page except to add a notice explaining the page is protected. #Do not protect a page you are involved in an edit dispute over. Admin powers are not editor privileges - admins should only act as servants to the user community at large. #Avoid favoring one version of the article over another, unless one version is vandalism. #Temporarily protected pages should not be left protected for very long. #Talk pages and user talk pages are not protected except in extreme circumstances. #The protection of a page on any particular version is not meant to express support for that version and requests should therefore not be made that the protected version be reverted to a different one.

[[Wikipedia:Wikipedia|Wikipedia]], the free encyclopedia, is the largest and most successful wiki. This page lists some of the overarching guidelines that have helped make Wikipedia a success. You may like to consider them for this Wikia. # '''BE BOLD!''' in updating pages. Go ahead, it's a wiki!
Encourage others, including those who disagree with you, likewise to '''BE BOLD!''' # '''Be civil''' to other users at all times. # '''Ignore all rules'''. If the rules discourage you from improving or maintaining the wiki's quality, ignore them. # '''When in doubt, take it to the [[Help:Talk page|talk page]]'''. We have all the time in the world. Mutual respect is the guiding behavioural principle of Wikia and, although everyone knows that their writing may be edited mercilessly, it is easier to accept changes if the reasons for them are understood. If you discuss changes on the article's ''talk'' (or ''discussion'') page before you make them, you should reach consensus faster and happier. #'''[[Project:Copyrights|Respect copyright]]'''. Wikia uses the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GNU_Free_Documentation_License GNU Free Documentation License]. Everything you contribute must be compatible with that license. # '''Decent edit summaries''' and clear and transparent explanations are universally appreciated. Other editors need to understand your process, and it also helps you yourself to understand what you did after a long leave of absence from an article. Please state '''''what''''' you changed and '''''why'''''. If the explanation is too long, add more on the discussion page. #'''Assume good faith'''; in other words, try to consider the person on the other end of the discussion is a thinking, rational being who is trying to positively contribute to the project â€” unless, and only unless, you have firm, solid, and objective proof to the contrary. Merely disagreeing with you is no such proof. #Particularly, '''don't revert good faith edits'''. [[Help:Reverting|Reverting]] is a little ''too'' powerful sometimes. Don't succumb to the temptation, unless you're reverting very obvious vandalism (like "LALALALAL*&*@#@THIS_SUX0RZ", or someone changing "1+2=3" to "1+2='''17'''"). If you really can't stand something, revert once, with an edit summary something like "(rv) I disagree strongly, I'll explain why in talk." and immediately take it to talk. # '''No personal attacks'''. Don't write that user such and so is an idiot, or insult him/her (even if (s)he ''is'' an idiot). Instead, explain what they did wrong, why it is wrong, and how to fix it. If possible, fix it yourself (but see above). # '''Be graceful''': ''Be liberal in what you accept, be conservative in what you do''. Try to accommodate other people's quirks the best you can, but try to be as polite, solid and straightforward as possible yourself. # '''Sign your posts on talk pages''' using ~~~~ which gets replaced by your username and timestamp when you hit submit. But don't sign on mainspace articles. # '''Use the preview button'''; it prevents edit conflicts. It's important to have fun... but try to make sure those around you have fun too! {{Wikipedia|Wikipedia:Simplified Ruleset}}

Welcome to the '''{{SITENAME}}'s sandbox'''!
This page exists so that you can practice editing or formatting (see [[Help:Editing|Editing help]]) without changing any serious content. Feel free to try wiki editing out here first.
There is a [[wikia:Help:Tutorial_1|tutorial]] on the Central (coordinating) Wikia that will step you through more of the things you can do. Wiki allow for rather complicated formatting. It can look overwhelming when you begin, but don't let it worry you. Just start with the basics... enter some text, and learn the other pieces as you go. Your content contributions are welcome and important. The wiki is a collaborative effort and others can help with formatting and other improvements.
Best wishes!
[[Category:Templates|Sandbox]]

revision.comment: Adapted from another Wikia (most of it my work, I think)
revision.text:
==Willkommen, bienvenue, welcome, welkom== Welcome to our wiki! We hope you can make continuing contributions of articles and/or discussion and other improvements.
If you are new to Wikia or wikis in general, be sure to visit the [[project:Community Portal|"Community portal"]] for an outline of some of the main parts of the site and a link to pages that tell you '''how to edit'''.
Do keep an eye on the [[Special:Recentchanges|"recent changes" page]], where all edits and their authors (anonymous or signed-in) are listed. Bookmark it, maybe. (And help delete spam - unpleasant but a fact of life.)
'''Discussion''' of any aspect of the site, '''and enquiries''', can be made at [[Talk:Main_Page]] or on the [[Help:Talk page|"discussion" page]] associated with each article. It helps if you sign and date your contributions there, so that readers know "who to talk to" and whether your message is probably still of current interest. If you write on a user's "talk" page, that user will get an alerting message on next visit.
(''It would help some of us to know how you discovered this site.'')
Enjoy!

revision.comment: How to use it and copy it etc
revision.text:
==How to use the template== Just type <nowiki>{{subst:welc}}</nowiki> on a user's Talk page then add your signature. As soon as you Save, the entry will lose its link to the template and become ordinary text, which you can edit to personalise it.
==Use of "subst:" prefix== Using the prefix before any template name copies the template then cuts the connexion. If you omit the "subst:" the result copies just the same but will not be editable and will always show the current version of the template - probably not a good idea for a one-off welcoming message although it is useful for many other templates.
==Edit it to make it more specific to the wiki== For example, it could say "Welcome to the '''<font color=blue>XYZWV Wiki</font>'''". Maybe add a link to a page you particularly want new users to look at.
==Make another one just for you to use== On your user page you could create a link to something like <nowiki>[[template:welcJG]]</nowiki> then make the resulting page a copy of [[template:welc]] and modify it any way you like. Then you can type or paste <nowiki>{{subst:welcJG}}</nowiki> on a newcomer's page and not need further personalising.
[[category:help]]
[[Category:Browse]]

This is our top-level category. (Looking at it another way, it is our root category!)
Ideally, every other category should be a subcategory of at least one other, and every article should be in at least one category; many will fit well into two (eg location and subject-matter). A full list of existing categories can be found at [[Special:Categories]].
To add a new category, just add <nowiki>[[category:categoryname]]</nowiki> to the article or existing category page (after checking whether any existing category is suitable).

Articles in this category have been labeled for deletion. If you wish to discuss the deletion of these pages, please use the [[Category talk:Candidates for deletion|talk page]].
To add a page to this category, type [[template:Delete|<nowiki>{{delete}}</nowiki>]] on the page.
[[category:administration of this site]]

revision.text: '''''Please use this page to discuss pages that have been labeled for deletion.'''''

This category is intended to contain all the "help" pages for this Wikia: pages that can help contributors and/or readers. Most, but not all, have "Help:" at the beginning of their page names and are therefore in the "Help" namespace; an automatically-generated list of those can be found at [[Special:Allpages]] by running down the "Namespace" menu. Many wikis also make much use of a [[Help:Contents]] page, where headings and tables may be used to cover the main areas, in contrast to a [[Special:Categories|category]], which is fairly rigidly based on alphabetical order.
If you find helpful pages that you think should be here, you may include them here just by typing <nowiki>[[category:help]]</nowiki> on them.
You can also: * ask questions at the [[Forum:Index|forum]] * talk to one of the [[Special:Listadmins|site administrators]] or any currently active contributor (the people whose names appear on [[Special:Recentchanges|the "Recent changes" page]]); use their User Talk pages.
If you can't find what you need on this wiki, you can seek help at the [[Wikia:Wikia|Central Wikia]]. There are more help pages at [[Wikia:Category:Help]], and you can use the [[Wikia:Forum:Index|Central forum]].
If you still need help, you may want to contact the [[Wikia:Community support|Wikia community support team]].
[[Category:Browse]]
[[category:copyright]]

Hi, I am Jimbo, the founder, along with Angela, of Wikia, and the founder of Wikipedia.
Leave me a message on [[User_talk:Jimbo Wales]] my user talk page.

This account is used by '''[[Wikia:Wikia, Inc.|Wikia, Inc.]]''', in particular by the [[wikia:Technical Team|developers]] when they run the maintenance script rebuildMessages.php. The script is part of [[wikia:MediaWiki|MediaWiki]], it updates or rebuilds the interface messages to be equal to the MediaWiki default on Wikia. This account is not a bot and cannot be blocked. If there is a problem with the text of the default messages, please inform the [[wikia:Community Team|Community Support Team]]. Requests to start or stop the script should be made to Wikia staff on the [irc://irc.freenode.net/wikia #wikia] channel on irc.freenode.net (you can use [http://irc.wikia.com irc.wikia.com] alternatively). ---- * ''[[Special:Contributions/MediaWiki default|Contributions]]'' * ''See also [[User:Default]]''

This account was used by '''[[Wikia:Wikia, Inc.|Wikia, Inc.]]''' to import the starter content to this wiki in an automated way (initial help pages, some templates, MediaWiki messages, and else).
The single edits (except the common MediaWiki messages) were originally made by '''[[wikia:Community Team|Wikia staff]]''' and are realeased under the [[wikia:Text_of_the_GNU_Free_Documentation_License|GFDL]] (attribute to "Wikia, Inc." instead of "Default" if needed).

===Most Recent Episode of Gilmore Girls=== * '''Recently Aired: [[Gilmore Girls Only]]''' Lorelai plans to drive to North Carolina for the Mia's wedding; Rory has a fight with Logan about his immature reaction to his business deal and decides to go with Lorelai. Emily invites herself along in an effort to get away from Richard, who is driving her crazy while he recuperates at home. Lane and Zach ask Luke to be the godfather to their twins. Lane goes into labor and Luke helps get everyone to the hospital on time. ===Upcoming Gilmore Girls Airdates=== * Gilmore Girls will be airing the following episodes on the following dates in the US: ** '''April 17, 2007''': Gilmore Girls will be airing Episode 18 of Season 7 at 8:00pm on [[Wikipedia:The_CW_Television_Network|The CW]]. ** '''April 24, 2007''': Gilmore Girls will be airing Episode 19 of Season 7 at 8:00pm on [[Wikipedia:The_CW_Television_Network|The CW]]. ** '''May 1, 2007''': Gilmore Girls will be airing Episode 20 of Season 7 at 8:00pm on [[Wikipedia:The_CW_Television_Network|The CW]].
|width="45%" class="MainPageBG" style="border: 1px solid #c6c9ff; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff"|
===About This Wiki=== Welcome to the '''Gilmore Girls Wiki''', the unofficial encyclopedia for [[Wikipedia:The_CW_Television_Network|The CW]] television show ''Gilmore Girls''. The wiki format of the site allows ''anyone'' to contribute to the '''Gilmore Wiki'''. Some of the articles on the wiki will have extreme attention to detail and may be fairly lengthy. If you are a member of a Gilmore Girls Message Board or Forum, please make sure to advertise the Wiki! The site presently contains '''{{NUMBEROFARTICLES}}''' articles. Please note that this wiki naturally contains '''SPOILERS'''. If you don't want anything spoiled you might want to either browse carefully or come back when you have watched every episode of ''Gilmore Girls''. Read our [[Spoilers|Spoiler Policy]] for more information.
[[Image:mainpage.png]]
|}

The '''Gilmore Girls Wiki''' is a free ''Gilmore Girls'' reference site which is being written collaboratively by the readers. Anyone can edit this site. The Gilmore Girls Wiki should be like a encyclopedia.
The Gilmore Girls Wiki is a [[wikipedia:wiki|wiki]], meaning that anyone can contribute to any article. You can contribute by clicking on the '''Edit''' button on the top of each page.
The Gilmore Girls Wiki project was started in March 2007. There are currently {{NUMBEROFARTICLES}} articles at the Gilmore Girls Wiki at the moment.
The Gilmore Girls Wiki is in no way related to [[wikipedia:The_CW_Television_Network|The CW]], etc. ''Gilmore Girls'' is copyrighted by The CW. All rights reserved.
'''WARNING: The Gilmore Girls Wiki contains spoilers on episodes of the show. Only information from episodes which have aired in the [[wikipedia:United States of America|United States]] are acceptable for publication on this site.'''
We'd like to credit http://lost.wikia.com for template and layout ideas, as we've nabbed bits of their coding here and there. Thank you, LOST Wikia!

[[Image:portal.png|left]] Here, you can talk about the Wiki and ways you want to improve it, policy changes or anything '''Gilmore Girls Wiki''' related. Please remember that the Community Portal is for discussion of the wiki only.
Please read the '''[[Help:Contents|Help]]''' pages before asking any questions.
Timestamp your posts by including four tildes at the end (<nowiki>~~~~</nowiki>) or by pressing the Signature button on the editing toolbar.<br clear="both">
* To follow the changes to this wiki, and to look out for new events and problem edits, use '''[[Special:Recentchanges|recent changes]]'''.
* If you want to discuss anything about an article, you can use '''[[Help:Talk page|the talk pages]]'''.
* For more general discussion, use '''[[Forum:Index|the forum]]'''.
* If you need help editing, you could start with '''[[Wikia:Help:Tutorial|the tutorial]] on the Central Wikia'''.
* There are also more help pages in '''[[:category:Help|the help category]]'''.
[[Category: GG Wiki administration]]

The '''text''' of this site is freely licensed under the terms of the '''GNU Free Documentation License''' (GFDL). Reusers of the content must retain it under the same licence, ensuring it remains free. Please read the [[Wikia:Text of the GNU Free Documentation License]] for full details of this licence. :Permission is granted to copy, distribute and/or modify this document under the terms of the GNU Free Documentation License, Version 1.2 or any later version published by the Free Software Foundation; with no Invariant Sections, with no Front-Cover Texts, and with no Back-Cover Texts. :A copy of the license is included in the section entitled "[[Wikia:Text of the GNU Free Documentation License|GNU Free Documentation License]]". :Content on Wikia is covered by disclaimers and the Wikia terms of use (see below). ==GNU Free Documentation License== The '''GNU Free Documentation License''' ('''GFDL''') is a copyleft license for free content, designed by the Free Software Foundation (FSF). The GFDL is a "copyleft" license, meaning the content can be copied, modified, and redistributed so long as the new version grants the same freedoms to others and acknowledges the authors of the Wikia page. Wikia content will, therefore, will remain free forever and can be used by anybody subject to certain restrictions, most of which serve to ensure that freedom. Wikipedia, one of the web's most popular reference works, uses the GFDL. Using the same license as that site makes it easy for Wikia users to reuse the content from Wikipedia. You must adhere to the GFDL when using Wikipedia content. ==Image guidelines== GFDL or public domain images are strongly preferred on Wikia. Copyright-violating images are subject to deletion. Copyright information must be added to the image description page of every uploaded image. Images and other uploaded files may be available under an alternative free license, or used under fair use guidelines. ==See also== For more information, see the following pages on the Central Wikia: * [[Wikia:Wikia disclaimers]] * [[Wikia:terms of use]] * '''[[Wikia:Designated agent]]''' * [[Wikia:Multi-licensing]]: License your own edits under the GFDL plus something else [[Category:GG Wiki administration]]

The rules of this wiki are simple, but please follow them! # '''BE BOLD!''' in updating pages. Go ahead, it's a wiki!
Encourage others, including those who disagree with you, likewise to '''BE BOLD!''' # '''Be civil''' to other users at all times. # '''Ignore all rules'''. If the rules discourage you from improving or maintaining the wiki's quality, ignore them. # '''When in doubt, take it to the [[Help:Talk page|talk page]]'''. We have all the time in the world. Mutual respect is the guiding behavioural principle of Wikia and, although everyone knows that their writing may be edited mercilessly, it is easier to accept changes if the reasons for them are understood. If you discuss changes on the article's ''talk'' (or ''discussion'') page before you make them, you should reach consensus faster and happier. #'''[[Copyright Policy|Respect copyright]]'''. Wikia uses the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GNU_Free_Documentation_License GNU Free Documentation License]. Everything you contribute must be compatible with that license. # '''Decent edit summaries''' and clear and transparent explanations are universally appreciated. Other editors need to understand your process, and it also helps you yourself to understand what you did after a long leave of absence from an article. Please state '''''what''''' you changed and '''''why'''''. If the explanation is too long, add more on the discussion page. #'''Assume good faith'''; in other words, try to consider the person on the other end of the discussion is a thinking, rational being who is trying to positively contribute to the project â€” unless, and only unless, you have firm, solid, and objective proof to the contrary. Merely disagreeing with you is no such proof. #Particularly, '''don't revert good faith edits'''. [[Help:Reverting|Reverting]] is a little ''too'' powerful sometimes. Don't succumb to the temptation, unless you're reverting very obvious vandalism (like "LALALALAL*&*@#@THIS_SUX0RZ", or someone changing "1+2=3" to "1+2='''17'''"). If you really can't stand something, revert once, with an edit summary something like "(rv) I disagree strongly, I'll explain why in talk." and immediately take it to talk. # '''No personal attacks'''. Don't write that user such and so is an idiot, or insult him/her (even if (s)he ''is'' an idiot). Instead, explain what they did wrong, why it is wrong, and how to fix it. If possible, fix it yourself (but see above). # '''Be graceful''': ''Be liberal in what you accept, be conservative in what you do''. Try to accommodate other people's quirks the best you can, but try to be as polite, solid and straightforward as possible yourself. # '''Sign your posts on talk pages''' using ~~~~ which gets replaced by your username and timestamp when you hit submit. But don't sign on mainspace articles. # '''Use the preview button'''; it prevents edit conflicts. It's important to have fun... but try to make sure those around you have fun too! {{Wikipedia|Wikipedia:Simplified Ruleset}} [[Category:GG Wiki administration]]

Wikipedia defines a spoiler as a:
: ''[S]ummary or description of a narrative (or part of a narrative) that relates plot elements not revealed early in the narrative itself. Moreover, because enjoyment of the plot depends on dramatic tension and suspense, this early revelation of plot elements "spoils" the enjoyment that consumers of the narrative would otherwise have experienced.''
Spoilers may pose a problem for many visitors who've yet to view all of the episodes. ''Gilmore Girls'' is to aired all over the world and some countries may not have seen all of the episodes. The policy at the '''Gilmore Girls Wiki''' is that information from any episode that has had it's first airing anywhere in the world is fair game for inclusion on this site. Currently, this means 8:00 P.M. EST in the United States on Tuesdays, (However, information may be added if the episode airs earlier at a special time, or on a special day that is prior to Tuesday at 8:00 P.M.). Viewers watching the show at later dates or times are cautioned when browsing this site, again, because it will contain spoilers. '''Spoiler warnings are ''NOT'' given for already aired episodes.'''
In general, information from unaired episodes is ''not'' to be included on the '''Gilmore Girls Wiki'''.
[[Category: GG Wiki administration]]

revision.comment: New page: {{sandbox}} <!--COMMENT Please do not make any changes above this line. Feel free to make any changes below. This is the sandbox where ...
revision.text:
{{sandbox}} This page is for any tests. Welcome to the sandbox! Anyone can edit this. ==Simple Editing== To edit a page, click on the "edit" tab, usually near the top of the page. Then, edit the box in the page. Feel free to practice here, on this page. It's here just for you to practice. A blank line indicates a paragraph separation. You can link to another page by putting the name or title of that page in double square brackets. [[Main Page]] becomes [[Main Page]]. ==Simple Formatting== Create headers by putting text inbetween repeated equal (=) signs. The more =, the lower level the heading is. Create a bulleted list by starting each item with an asterick (*) * it's ok to make editing mistakes * you can preview your work before saving it * even after saving it, you or someone else can edit it again to make it even better ==Formatting for Emphasis== Put single quote marks around words or phrases for formatting emphasis. Two single quotes, like ''italics'' will create ''italics''. Three single quotes, like '''bold text''' will create '''bold text'''. ---- Other stuff... If you know HTML or CSS formatting commands, they can also be used in this wiki. One useful HTML command is
which creates a line break. If you want to show what a command looks like, rather than actually implementing the command, surround it with the '''nowiki''' command.

revision.comment: New page: Hey all! I'm Cinds, I run the Gilmore Girls wiki. If you have any questions, comments, concerns, etc., don't hesitate to let me know! You can either use my talk page or send me an email...
revision.text: Hey all! I'm Cinds, I run the Gilmore Girls wiki. If you have any questions, comments, concerns, etc., don't hesitate to let me know! You can either use my talk page or send me an email at 7.deadlycins@gmail.com!

{{Episode | name = Gilmore Girls Only | image = [[Image:7-17.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 17 | date = March 6, 2007 | writer = [[David Babcock]]| director = [[Lee Shallat-Chemel]] | prev = [[Will You Be My Lorelai Gilmore? (for merging)]] | next = }} Lorelai, Rory and Emily take a road trip to North Carolina to attend Mia's wedding, and Lane goes into labor. ==Summary== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] plans a road trip to North Carolina to attend the wedding of [[Mia]], the woman who took in Lorelai and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and served as a surrogate mother/grandmother for many years. Rory has a fight with [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] over his immature reaction to his business disaster, and agrees to go on the trip with Lorelai. [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] invites herself along in an effort to get away from [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]], who is driving her crazy while he recuperates at home. At the wedding, Emily is upset by the close relationship Mia shares with Lorelai and Rory. Lorelai learns that Emily came to see Mia five years earlier to ask for pictures of Lorelai and Rory during the years they were estranged. Logan makes a surprise appearance and asks Rory to forgive him. Meanwhile, [[Lane Kim|Lane]] and [[Zack Van Gerbig|Zack]] ask [[Luke Danes|Luke]] to be the godfather to their twins. Finally, Lane goes into labor and Luke helps get everyone to the hospital. ==Memorable Quotes== ''"Well, I need it to say more than that. I mean I'm hoping to hear from The San Francisco Chronicle, The Seattle Times, The Detroit Free Press." '' : -'''Rory''' ''"Well honey, you can't ask one suit to say so much." '' : -'''Lorelai'''

''"He's just become a pain in the you-know-what." '' : -'''Emily''' ''"Nose? Ear?" '' : -'''Lorelai''' ''"Would it really please you to hear me say 'ass'?" '' : -'''Emily'''

''"Why did they misspell 'happiness?'" '' : -'''Emily''' ==Notes== *[[Paris Gellar|Paris]], [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] and [[Michel Gerard|Michel]] do not appear in this episode. *The role of Mia was originally played by [[Elizabeth Franz]] in the Season 2 episode [[The Ins and Outs of Inns]]. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Todd Lowe]] as [[Zack Van Gerbig]] ===Guest Starring=== *[[Gregg Henry]] as [[Mitchum Huntzberger]] *[[Kathy Baker]] as [[Mia]] *[[James Lashly]] as [[Howard]] ===Uncredited=== *[[Jonathan Walker Spencer]] as [[Bill]] *[[Jacqueline Wright]] as [[Donna]] *[[David Trice]] as [[Ted]] *[[Gerard Karsenty]] as [[Young Male Guest (Gilmore Girls Only)|Young Male Guest]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

page.title: Will You Be My Lorelai Gilmore? (for merging)

revision.text:
{{Episode | name = Will You Be My Lorelai Gilmore?| image = [[Image:7-16.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]]| ep_num = 16| date = February 27, 2007| writer = [[Gina Fattore]] & [[Gayle Abrams]]| director = [[David Paymer]]| prev = [[7.15 I'm A Kayak, Hear Me Roar]]||next = [[7.17 Gilmore Girls Only]]}} Rory has an interview with ''The New York Times'', so Lorelai takes over the planning of Lane's baby shower, and Luke finds his boat in the classified section of the newspaper. ==Summary== While she is in the midst of planning [[Lane Kim|Lane's]] baby shower, [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] gets a long-awaited call from The New York Times offering her an informational interview. [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] takes over the shower-planning duties, and finds herself brokering peace between Lane and [[Mrs. Kim]] over how Lane plans to raise her twins. [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] finally admits his business disaster to Rory, who offers him her full support, but when Logan announces that he is flying to Las Vegas to blow off steam with his old college pals [[Colin McRae|Colin]] and [[Finn]], Rory is disappointed and worried. When [[Luke Danes|Luke]] discovers that [[Liz Danes|Liz]] and [[T.J.]] are trying to sell his boat, he decides to make some changes in his life and take April on a long boat trip over the summer. Finally, Lane is put on bed-rest and must be wheeled through [[Stars Hollow]] in her bed to attend the shower at [[Patricia Lacosta (Miss Patty)|Miss Patty's]]. ==Memorable Quotes== ''"Oh my God! The New York Times is calling me! And not the subscriptions department!" '' : -'''Rory''' ==Notes== *[[Paris Gellar|Paris]], [[Michel Gerard|Michel]], [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] do not appear in this episode. *This is the 13th episode with the name 'Lorelai' in the title. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Sebastian Bach]] as [[Gil]] *[[John Cabrera]] as [[Brian Fuller]] *[[Todd Lowe]] as [[Zack Van Gerbig]] *[[Rose Abdoo]] as [[Gypsy]] *[[Sally Struthers]] as [[Babette Dell|Babette]] *[[Rini Bell]] as [[Lulu]] *[[Emily Kuroda]] as [[Mrs. Kim]] *[[Liz Torres]] as [[Patricia Lacosta (Miss Patty)|Miss Patty]] *[[Michael DeLuise]] as [[T.J.]] *[[Kathleen Wilhoite]] as [[Liz Danes|Liz]] *[[Jackson Douglas]] as [[Jackson Belleville|Jackson]] ===Guest Starring=== *[[Vanessa Marano]] as [[April Nardini]] ===Uncredited=== *[[Jill Tracy]] as [[Jamie (Will You Be My Lorelai Gilmore?)|Jamie]] *[[Gary Riotto]] as [[Diner Customer (Will You Be My Lorelai Gilmore?)|Diner Customer]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

page.title: I'm a Kayak, Hear Me Roar (for merging)

revision.text:
{{Episode | name = I'm a Kayak, Hear Me Roar | image = [[Image:7-15.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 15 | date = February 20, 2007 | writer = [[Rebecca Rand Kirshner]] | director = [[Lee Shallat-Chemel]] | prev = [[Farewell, My Pet]] | next = [[Will You Be My Lorelai Gilmore? (for merging)]] }} Lorelai breaks the news about her marriage to Emily, and Mitchum brings Logan and Rory out for a birthday dinner, after which Logan finds out that his newly acquired company is about to be sued. ==Summary== At Friday night dinner, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] works up the courage to tell her parents about the break-up of her marriage, but is derailed by their argument over the healthy meals and no-alcohol policy [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] has instituted to help [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] recover from his heart attack. Lorelai enlists [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] to bring Richard healthy but delicious meals, then helps Emily organize Richard's business affairs. Over a shared bottle of scotch, Lorelai finally tells her mother about the breakup of her marriage. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] attends an awkward birthday dinner for [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] with [[Mitchum Huntzberger]], who asks her to help him steer Logan in the right direction. Later, Logan receives disturbing news about the online company he purchased. Also, [[Luke Danes|Luke]] shares his home with [[Liz Danes|Liz]], [[T.J.]] and [[Doula|their baby daughter]] while their house is being fumigated. ==Memorable Quotes== ''"I've been 'Huntzbergered.'" '' :- '''Rory''' ==Notes== *[[Michel Gerard|Michel]], and [[Lane Kim|Lane]] do not appear in this episode. *In this episode we learn that Emily attended Smith. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Sally Struthers]] as [[Babette Dell|Babette]] *[[Liz Torres]] as [[Patricia Lacosta (Miss Patty)|Miss Patty]] *[[Michael DeLuise]] as [[T.J.]] *[[Kathleen Wilhoite]] as [[Liz Danes|Liz]] *[[Danny Strong]] as [[Doyle]] ===Guest Starring=== *[[Adetokumboh McCormack]] as [[Phillip]] *[[Gregg Henry]] as [[Mitchum Huntzberger]] *[[Treisa Gary]] as [[Francette]] *[[Alex Ball]] as [[Waiter(I'm a Kayak, Hear Me Roar)|Waiter]] *[[Kristof Konrad]] as [[Stefan]] *[[Braeden Marcott]] as [[Maitre'd (I'm a Kayak, Hear Me Roar)|Maitre'd]] *[[Jocelyn Towne]] as [[Aurora]] ===Uncredited=== *[[Alex Ball]] as [[Waiter(I'm a Kayak, Hear Me Roar)|Waiter]] *[[Kristof Konrad]] as [[Stefan]] *[[Braeden Marcott]] as [[Maitre'd (I'm a Kayak, Hear Me Roar)|Maitre'd]] *[[Jocelyn Towne]] as [[Aurora]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

revision.comment: [[Farewell, My Pet]] moved to [[Farewell, My Pet (for merging)]]
revision.text:
{{Episode | name = Farewell, My Pet | image = [[Image:7-14.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 14 | date = February 13, 2007 | writer = [[Jennie Snyder]] | director = [[Jamie Babbit]] | prev = [[I'd Rather Be in Philadelphia]] | next = [[I'm a Kayak, Hear Me Roar]] }} Rory finds herself crushing on the TA now teaching her economics class, and Lorelai finally sits down with Christopher to discuss their marriage problems. ==Summary== Two days after his by-pass surgery, [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] is on the road to recovery, and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] returns to [[Yale]], where she finds that Richard's economics class is now being taught by an attractive young TA, [[Tucker Culbertson]], who flusters Rory with his charm. While [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] tries to distract herself from the issues in her marriage, she and [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] focus on planning a funeral for one of [[Michel Gerard|Michel's]] beloved dogs. Finally, [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] returns ready to talk, and he and Lorelai discuss the main problem that has haunted their marriage â€“ Lorelai's feelings for [[Luke Danes|Luke]]. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

page.title: I'd Rather Be in Philadelphia (for merging)

revision.comment: [[I'd Rather Be in Philadelphia]] moved to [[I'd Rather Be in Philadelphia (for merging)]]
revision.text:
{{Episode | name = I'd Rather Be in Philadelphia | image = [[Image:7-13.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 13 | date = February 6, 2007 | writer = [[Rebecca Rand Kirshner]] | director = [[Lee Shallat-Chemel]] | prev = [[To Whom It May Concern]] | next = [[Farewell, My Pet]] }} The Gilmore Girls spend the day in the hospital waiting for word on Richard, and while Logan and Luke come to their aid, Lorelai can't get a hold of Christopher. ==Summary== In the hospital waiting room, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]], [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] anxiously await word on [[Richard Gilmore|Richardâ€™s]] condition. When [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] hears what is happening, he borrows a helicopter to be by Roryâ€™s side, but Lorelai is unable to reach [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]], who is still angry over their fight the night before. Upset by Emilyâ€™s attempt to remain calm by dealing with her social calendar, Lorelai is relieved when [[Luke Danes|Luke]] shows up unannounced and volunteers to run errands for Emily. Christopher finally arrives to be with Lorelai, but the scene at the hospital is more than he can take when he sees Lorelai talking to Luke. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

page.title: To Whom It May Concern (for merging)

revision.comment: [[To Whom It May Concern]] moved to [[To Whom It May Concern (for merging)]]
revision.text:
{{Episode | name = To Whom It May Concern | image = [[Image:7-12.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 12 | date = January 30, 2007 | writer = [[David Babcock]] | director = [[Jamie Babbit]] | prev = [[Santa's Secret Stuff]] | next = [[I'd Rather Be in Philadelphia]] }} Sookie finds out she is pregnant for the third time, Christopher finds Lorelai's character reference for Luke, and Rory makes up with Lucy and proceeds to economics class where Richard collapses during his lecture. ==Summary== Noticing [[Sookie St.James|Sookie's]] recent odd behavior, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] forces [[Jackson Belleville|Jackson]] to tell her the reason. [[Luke Danes|Luke]] and [[Anna Nardini|Anna]] attend a hearing to decide their custody battle over [[April Nardini|April]]. With help from [[Paris Gellar|Paris]], Rory finally makes amends with [[Lucy]], who tells her that she and [[Marty]] have broken up. While attending [[Richard Gilmore|Richard's]] economics class at [[Yale]], Rory witnesses a frightening scene. Finally, [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] finds the letter Lorelai wrote for Luke's character reference and confronts Lorelai about whether he was her second choice. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]
Every episode of ''Gilmore Girls'' in alphabetical order and by season. [[Category:The show]]

revision.comment: [[Santa's Secret Stuff]] moved to [[Santa's Secret Stuff (for merging)]]
revision.text:
{{Episode | name = Santa's Secret Stuff | image = [[Image:7-11.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 11 | date = January 23, 2007 | writer = [[Rebecca Rand Kirshner]] | director = [[Lee Shallat-Chemel]] | prev = [[Merry Fisticuffs]] | next = [[To Whom It May Concern]] }} Lorelai and Christopher put the holidays on hold until Rory returns from London; Luke asks Lorelai to write a recommendation letter for his custody battle. ==Summary== Rather than celebrating Christmas while [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] is in London over the holidays, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] decide to put their holidays on hold. Once Rory returns to [[Stars Hollow]], they decorate several Christmas trees, do their shopping and even bake Christmas cookies for the first time as a family. Turning up unexpectedly at the inn, [[Luke Danes|Luke]] asks Lorelai to write a character recommendation letter for his custody battle over [[April Nardini|April]]. Lorelai struggles to write the letter until she and Rory run into Luke and April at the mall and Lorelai suddenly remembers how important Luke has always been in Rory's life. Inspired, Lorelai writes the letter and mails it to Luke's attorney. Rory decides she will write an apology letter to her friend [[Lucy]], explaining why she and [[Marty]] kept their past friendship a secret. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

{{Episode | name = Merry Fisticuffs | image = [[Image:7-10.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 10 | date = December 5, 2006 | writer = [[David S. Rosenthal]] | director = [[Jackson Douglas]] | prev = [[Knit, People, Knit!]] | next = [[Santa's Secret Stuff]] }} Christopher and Lorelai get in a fight over wedding plans, after which Christopher and Luke fight in the middle of Stars Hollow, and Rory's past friendship with Marty is revealed to Lucy. ==Summary== [[Luke Danes|Luke]] and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] share a sweet moment when Luke introduces her to [[Liz Danes|Liz's]] [[Doula|new baby]]. [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] witnesses the scene and it adds to his concern that Lorelai isn't fully committed to their marriage. The next day, Lorelai and Christopher get into a fight over whether they should exchange vows at the elaborate wedding party [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] is throwing for them. Luke contacts a lawyer over his custody troubles with [[Anna Nardini|Anna]], then runs into Christopher and the two have an ugly confrontation in the streets of [[Stars Hollow]]. Meanwhile, when [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] discovers that [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Marty]] have been pretending that they just met, rather than admitting their previous friendship to [[Lucy]], he reveals the truth to Lucy. Finally, Emily gives Lorelai a warning about her marriage. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

{{Episode | name = Knit, People, Knit! | image = [[Image:7-09.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 9 | date = November 28, 2006 | writer = [[David Grae]] | director = [[Kenny Ortega]] | prev = [[Introducing Lorelai Planetarium]] | next = [[Merry Fisticuffs]] }} Lorelai brings Christopher to the town Knit-a-thon and Rory confronts Marty at Lucy's birthday party, while Luke is occupied with the birth of Liz's baby and Anna's announcement that she's moving to New Mexico. ==Summary== When [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] questions [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] about why she has avoided involving him in the daily life of [[Stars Hollow]], she admits her concern that her old friends may not accept him. Christopher makes an effort to bond with the townspeople, and Lorelai brings him to the town knit-a-thon, where his well-intentioned gesture brings the event to an early end. When [[Olivia]] throws a 2002-themed birthday party for [[Lucy]], [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] gets her chance to confront [[Marty]] about his coldness toward her. Finally, [[Luke Danes|Luke]] is touched by the birth of [[Liz Danes|Liz]] and [[T.J.|T.Jâ€™s]] baby, and when he learns that [[Anna Nardini|Anna]] is planning to move to New Mexico with [[April Nardini|April]], he demands equal rights as a parent. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

revision.comment: [[Introducing Lorelai Planetarium]] moved to [[Introducing Lorelai Planetarium (for merging)]]
revision.text:
{{Episode | name = Introducing Lorelai Planetarium | image = [[Image:7-08.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 8 | date = November 21, 2006 | writer = [[Jennie Snyder]] | director = [[Lee Shallat-Chemel]] | prev = [[French Twist]] | next = [[Knit, People, Knit!]] }} Lorelai and Christopher tell Rory that they eloped in Paris, and Luke seeks Lorelai's help when April gets sick. ==Summary== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] invites [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] over to dinner to tell her that she and [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] got married in Paris. Rory pretends to be thrilled while Christopher is in the room, but later tells Lorelai how hurt and angry she really is. [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] surprises Rory with a visit and an announcement that he is relocating to New York to start his new internet company. Meanwhile, when [[April Nardini|April]] faces a medical emergency, a frantic [[Luke Danes|Luke]] turns to Lorelai for help. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

{{Episode | name = French Twist | image = [[Image:7-07.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 7 | date = November 14, 2006 | writer = [[David Babcock]] | director = [[Lee Shallat-Chemel]] | prev = [[Go, Bulldogs!]] | next = [[Introducing Lorelai Planetarium]] }} Lorelai and Christopher bring Gigi to her mother in Paris and end up getting eloped, and Rory finds out that Lucy's boyfriend is actually her old friend Marty. ==Summary== [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] take his daughter [[Gigi]] to visit her mother in Paris. Despite severe jet lag, they manage to have a wonderful, romantic time enjoying the city and each other. Back in Connecticut, [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] comes to the end of her tenure as Editor-in-Chief of the [[Yale Daily News]] and suddenly finds herself unsure of her future. Her new friends [[Olivia]] and [[Lucy]] suggest a trip to [[Stars Hollow]] for a girls' night while Lorelai is out of town. When they return, Rory is surprised to find that Lucy's new boyfriend is her old friend [[Marty]], who pretends not to know Rory. Christopher and Lorelai return home with a surprise for everyone. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

{{Episode | name = Go, Bulldogs! | image = [[Image:7-06.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 6 | date = November 17, 2006 | writer = [[David S. Rosenthal]] & [[Rebecca Rand Kirshner]] | director = [[Wil Shriner]] | prev = [[The Great Stink]] | next = [[French Twist]] }} Lorelai and Christopher attend Yale's Parents Weekend, and Luke goes on a date with April's swimming coach. ==Summary== [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] talks [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] into visiting [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] at [[Yale University|Yale]] during Parents' Weekend, and Lorelai is surprised to find that [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] and [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] are also there. Trying to prove how cool he is, Christopher invites all of Rory's co-workers on the [[Yale Daily News]] to an expensive lunch where they all drink too much, and the meal ends abruptly when Rory insists they leave to cover a breaking story. Meanwhile, [[Luke Danes|Luke]] meets [[April Nardini|April's]] swimming coach, who convinces him to take her adult swimming class. When the coach flirts with him, Luke asks her out on a date. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

{{Episode | name = The Great Stink | image = [[Image:7-05.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 5 | date = October 24, 2006 | writer = [[Gina Fattore]] | director = [[Michael Schultz]] | prev = [['S Wonderful, 'S Marvelous]] | next = [[Go, Bulldogs!]] }} Rory dines out with Logan and his business partners, and Lorelai and Christopher argue over Sherry's letter regarding Gigi. ==Summary== [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] are delighted when [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] attend Friday night dinner together as a couple. Christopher reveals that [[Sherry]] has written him a letter saying she regrets leaving their daughter, [[Gigi]], and asking him to send GiGi to visit her in Paris. Lorelai can't believe that Chris would consider this and they get into an argument over dinner. [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] returns to town on business to acquire an internet company and pays [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] a surprise visit. Rory is thrilled, but during a dinner with Logan's colleagues, she realizes that she has no connection to his new business world, and is especially threatened by one of his beautiful co-workers. Meanwhile, [[Stars Hollow]] is plagued by a terrible odor when a train with a full load of pickles derails, and [[Taylor Doose|Taylor]] refuses to pay for the cleanup. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Great Stink}} [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

revision.comment: [['S Wonderful, 'S Marvelous]] moved to [['S Wonderful, 'S Marvelous (for merging)]]
revision.text:
{{Episode | name = 'S Wonderful, 'S Marvelous | image = [[Image:7-04.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 4 | date = October 17, 2006 | writer = [[Gayle Abrams]] | director = [[Victor Nelli]] | prev = [[Lorelai's First Cotillion]] | next = [[The Great Stink]] }} Christopher and Lorelai's date is interrupted when Emily gets arrested, April spends some time living at Luke's, and Rory makes some new friends. ==Summary== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] have begun to date, and although Lorelai is finding it difficult to fully commit to the relationship, Christopher keeps coming up with romantic dates to win her over. Back at [[Yale]], [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] meets some eccentric new girlfriends at an art exhibit, and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] becomes a guest lecturer. [[April Nardini|April]] comes to stay with [[Luke Danes|Luke]] for a few weeks while [[Anna Nardini|Anna]] is out of town. Finally, [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] gets arrested and Lorelai has to bail her out of jail. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] {{DEFAULTSORT:S Wonderful S Marvelous}} [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

revision.comment: [[Lorelai's First Cotillion]] moved to [[Lorelai's First Cotillion (for merging)]]
revision.text:
{{Episode | name = Lorelai's First Cotillion | image = [[Image:7-03.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 3 | date = October 10, 2006 | writer = [[Rina Mimoun]] | director = [[Lee Shallat-Chemel]] | prev = [[That's What You Get, Folks, for Makin' Whoopee]] | next = [['S Wonderful, 'S Marvelous]] }} Michel makes Lorelai attend Emily's cotillion dance, and Rory goes out to dinner with Christopher. ==Summary== When [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] and [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] have no real reaction to the news of her break up with [[Luke Danes|Luke]], [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] suddenly realizes that most of her emotional life has been based on doing and feeling the opposite of whatever her parents want. Later, when [[Michel Gerard|Michel]] forces Lorelai to attend Emilyâ€™s beautiful cotillion dance, Lorelai discovers that some things her parents wanted for her werenâ€™t really that terrible. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] has a tough time making her long-distance relationship with [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] work. After taking Rory out for a father/daughter dinner, [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] makes a startling confession to Lorelai. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

page.title: That's What You Get, Folks, for Makin' Whoopee (for merging)

revision.comment: [[That's What You Get, Folks, for Makin' Whoopee]] moved to [[That's What You Get, Folks, for Makin' Whoopee (for merging)]]
revision.text:
{{Episode | name = That's What You Get, Folks, for Makin' Whoopee | image = [[Image:7-02.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 2 | date = October 3, 2006 | writer = [[Rebecca Rand Kirshner]] | director = [[Bethany Rooney]] | prev = [[The Long Morrow]] | next = [[Lorelai's First Cotillion]] }} Lorelai decorates the house to the hilt with Asian-themed paraphernalia, and Luke is visibly angry about the way his relationship with Lorelai ended. ==Summary== [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] is upset over [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan's]] absence and the fact that they had to cancel their long-planned trip to Asia. Wanting to cheer Rory up and take her mind off her own sad love life, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] turns her house into an Asian-themed wonderland. [[Lane Kim|Lane]] returns from her disastrous honeymoon. While repairing the damage to the diner, [[Luke Danes|Luke]] tells [[T.J.]] about his break-up with Lorelai, prompting T.J. and [[Liz Danes|Liz]] to insist that Luke come over for dinner and sympathy. When Luke and Lorelai run into each other in town, Luke can't hide his anger over their breakup. Finally, Rory is furious when she learns that Lorelai slept with [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]]. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

revision.comment: [[The Long Morrow]] moved to [[The Long Morrow (for merging)]]
revision.text:
{{Episode | name = The Long Morrow | image = [[Image:7-01.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 7|7]] | ep_num = 1 | date = September 26, 2006 | writer = [[David S. Rosenthal]] | director = [[Lee Shallat-Chemel]] | prev = [[Partings]] | next = [[That's What You Get, Folks, For Makin' Whoopee]] }} Lorelai wakes up in Christopher's bed and must deal with the consequences, and Rory's plan to join Logan in London falls through. ==Summary== Picking up on the day after last season's finale, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] wakes up in bed with [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]]. Confused and mortified, she makes a hasty exit, ignoring Christopher's pleas that she stay. Once at home, Lorelai tries to get rid of everything that reminds her of [[Luke Danes|Luke]] and ends up practically emptying her house. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] receives a toy rocket ship as a parting gift from [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] and is baffled as to its meaning. She decides she should join him in London for the summer, only to learn he has bought her a ticket for a visit at Christmas. [[Kirk Gleason|Kirk]] and [[Taylor Doose|Taylor]] cause a bizarre accident that damages Luke's diner. Finally, Luke shows up at Lorelai's door and asks her to elope. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Long Morrow}} [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

{{Episode | name = Partings | image = [[Image:6-22.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 6|6]] | ep_num = 22 | date = May 9, 2006 | writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] & [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] | director = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] | prev = [[Driving Miss Gilmore]] | next = [[The Long Morrow]] }} Stars Hollow gets a troubadour overdose, Logan graduates, and Lorelai gives Luke an ultimatum about their marriage. ==Summary== [[Stars Hollow]] is suddenly overrun with troubadours when news gets out that the town's regular street performer has been discovered. On the evening of [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan's]] graduation from [[Yale]], [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] throws him a wild party, but the knowledge that he is being forced to leave for London the next day makes their time together bittersweet. Meanwhile, at a Friday night dinner, [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] attempt to set [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] up with an attractive young woman. Finally, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] decides she was wrong to let [[Luke Danes|Luke]] postpone their wedding for so long and delivers a tearful ultimatum. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "A beaver ate my thumb, doctor give me rum, 'cause a beaver ate my thumb.'" '' :- '''Troubador''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Melora Hardin]] as [[Carolyn Bates]]. Currently plays Jan Levinson on The Office U.S. ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]]. ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

revision.comment: [[Driving Miss Gilmore]] moved to [[Driving Miss Gilmore (for merging)]]
revision.text:
{{Episode | name = Driving Miss Gilmore | image = [[Image:6-21.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 6|6]] | ep_num = 21 | date = May 2, 2006 | writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] & [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] | director = [[Jamie Babbit]] | prev = [[Super Cool Party People]] | next = [[Partings]] }} Rory takes care of Logan after he leaves the hospital, Lorelai drives Emily around town after she has LASIK surgery, and Jackson finds that an employee planted marijuana in his fields. ==Summary== [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] comes home from the hospital and is cared for by an overprotective [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]; [[Liz Danes|Liz]] has big news for [[Luke Danes|Luke]]; [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] has LASIK eye surgery, so [[Lorelai Gilmore]] has to serve as her chauffeur; Rory is upset by a statement Logan's [[Mitchum Huntzberger|dad]] made about her in an interview in the Wall Street Journal; [[Jackson Belleville|Jackson]] discovers that former employees planted marijuana in one of his fields, and he and [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] try to dispose of it. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.

revision.comment: [[Super Cool Party People]] moved to [[Super Cool Party People (for merging)]]
revision.text:
{{Episode | name = Super Cool Party People | image = [[Image:6-20.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 6|6]] | ep_num = 20 | date = April 25, 2006 | writer = [[David S. Rosenthal]] | director = [[Ken Whittingham]] | prev = [[I Get a Sidekick Out of You]] | next = [[Driving Miss Gilmore]] }} Luke enlists Lorelai's help with April's birthday party, and Logan gets hurt in a Life and Death Brigade stunt. ==Summary== [[Luke Danes|Luke]] decides to give [[April Nardini|April]] a birthday party at the diner. [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] volunteers to help, and is hurt when Luke explains that he still thinks itâ€™s too soon for April and Lorelai to meet. However, Luke changes his mind when the party is a disaster, giving Lorelai a chance to bond with April while turning the party into a huge success. Meanwhile, [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] rushes to be with [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] at the hospital after he is seriously injured during a stunt with the [[Life and Death Brigade]]. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.

revision.comment: [[I Get a Sidekick Out of You]] moved to [[I Get a Sidekick Out of You (for merging)]]
revision.text:
{{Episode | name = I Get a Sidekick Out of You | image = [[Image:6-19.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 6|6]] | ep_num = 19 | date = April 18, 2006 | writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] | director = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] | prev = [[The Real Paul Anka]] | next = [[Super Cool Party People]] }} Lane and Zack get married, and Lorelai takes the stage with an alcohol-induced speech, after which Christopher takes care of her. ==Summary== [[Lane Kim|Lane]] and [[Zack Van Gerbig|Zack's]] wedding is coming up and since [[Luke Danes|Luke]] is busy, [[Michel Gerard|Michel]] is [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai's]] first choice as a date, but he gets Celine Dion tickets and bails. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] suggests that [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] go as Lorelai's date and Chris is totally psyched to do it. [[Grandma Kim]] is a Buddhist and doesn't know that [[Mrs. Kim]] is a Seventh Day Adventist. At Lane's wedding, Lorelai collapses and Christopher is there to take care of her. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

{{Episode | name = The Real Paul Anka | image = [[Image:6-18.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 6|6]] | ep_num = 18 | date = April 11, 2006 | writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] | director = [[Daniel Palladino]] | prev = [[I'm OK, You're OK]] | next = [[I Get A Sidekick Out of You]] }} Rory goes to Philadelphia to attend an open house at Jess' new book store, and runs into Luke who is in the city on a field trip with April. ==Summary== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] has a bizarre dream in which singer/songwriter [[Paul Anka]] has a cameo role. Meanwhile, although [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] are back together, Logan is miserable knowing that Rory hasnâ€™t really forgiven him, and he takes off with his friends for another stunt with the Life and Death Brigade. Rory accepts [[Jess Mariano|Jess]]' invitation to attend an open house at his new book store/art gallery/publishing house in Philadelphia. While there, she is surprised to run into [[Luke Danes|Luke]], who is accompanying his daughter [[April Nardini|April]] on an academic field trip. Back in [[Stars Hollow]], Lorelai is horrified to find that [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] and [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] have been looking at real estate in her town. ==Memorable Quotes== ''"Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
'' If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Real Paul Anka}} [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

revision.comment: [[I'm OK, You're OK]] moved to [[I'm OK, You're OK (for merging)]]
revision.text:
{{Episode | name = I'm OK, You're OK | image = [[Image:6-17.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 6|6]] | ep_num = 17 | date = April 4, 2006 | writer = [[Keith Eisner]] | director = [[Lee Shallat-Chemel]] | prev = [[Bridesmaids Revisited]] | next = [[The Real Paul Anka]] }} Rory visits Lorelai in Stars Hollow and goes to spy on April's mother, while Zack asks for permission to marry Lane from Mrs. Kim. ==Summary== [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] forgives [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]], then needs some time for herself, so she pays a visit to [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] in [[Stars Hollow]]. Although Lorelai refuses to admit that she is upset, Rory can tell that she is bothered by the news that [[Luke Danes|Luke]] will be gone for a few days on a field trip with his daughter, [[April Nardini|April]]. Against Lorelai's wishes, Rory pays a visit to the store owned by April's mother, [[Anna Nardini|Anna]], to spy on her. Meanwhile, when [[Zack Van Gerbig|Zack]] finally works up the courage to ask [[Mrs. Kim]] for permission to marry [[Lane Kim|Lane]], he is surprised at the deal she makes with him. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Episodes for merging]]

{{Episode | name = Bridesmaids Revisited | image = [[Image:6-16.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 6|6]] | ep_num = 16 | date = February 28, 2006 | writer = [[Rebecca Rand Kirshner]] | director = [[Linda Mendoza]] | prev = [[A Vineyard Valentine]] | next = [[I'm OK, You're OK]] }} Lorelai babysits for Gigi, and Rory finds out how Logan spent his time during their breakup. ==Summary== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] offers to help [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] out by babysitting his 3-year-old daughter, [[Gigi]] and is horrified by the toddler's terrible behavior. The next day, [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] attend the wedding of Logan's sister, [[Honor Huntzberger|Honor]]. While helping the bride and her three bridesmaids get ready, Rory is devastated to learn how Logan spent his time during their recent breakup. Heartbroken [[Lane Kim|Lane]] gets a surprise from [[Zack Van Gerbig|Zack]] at the diner. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.

revision.comment: [[A Vineyard Valentine]] moved to [[A Vineyard Valentine (for merging)]]
revision.text:
{{Episode | name = A Vineyard Valentine | image = [[Image:6-15.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 6|6]] | ep_num = 15 | date = February 14, 2006 | writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] | director = [[Daniel Palladino]] | prev = [[You've Been Gilmored]] | next = [[Bridesmaids Revisited]] }} Rory, Logan, Lorelai and Luke spend Valentine's Day weekend at Logan's family's house on Martha's Vineyard. ==Summary== As Valentine's Day approaches, [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] invite [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Luke Danes|Luke]] to spend a weekend with them at Logan's family's house on Martha's Vineyard. Lorelai is upset by Luke's unfriendly attitude toward Logan. Luke's attitude changes when he realizes he forgot to buy Lorelai a Valentine gift, and Logan saves the day. When Lorelai finally confesses to Luke that she is worried the wedding will never take place, he reassures her that they will get married soon. The weekend ends in an ugly scene when Logan's father, [[Mitchum Huntzberger]] arrives. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.

revision.comment: [[You've Been Gilmored]] moved to [[You've Been Gilmored (for merging)]]
revision.text:
{{Episode | name = You've Been Gilmored | image = [[Image:6-14.png|270px]]
| season = [[Season 6|6]] | ep_num = 14 | date = February 7, 2006 | writer = [[Jordon Nardino]] | director = [[Stephen Clancy]] | prev = [[Friday Night's Alright For Fighting]] | next = [[A Vineyard Valentine]] }} Rory is kicked out her apartment and moves in with Logan, and Emily invites Luke to Friday night dinner. ==Summary== [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] tells [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] that she'd like to get to know her future son-in-law better and asks her to invite [[Luke Danes|Luke]] over for dinner - Lorelai purposely fails to mention that the wedding has been postponed... The [[Yale Daily News]] staff finally fires [[Paris Gellar|Paris]] and chooses [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] to be the new editor. A furious Paris kicks Rory out of the apartment, [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] subsequently convinces her to move into his place. [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] tells Lorelai about Rory's new living arrangement. ==Memorable Quotes== '' "Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *Interesting notes about the episode should go here *in bullet form like this. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
