'''{{Template:Episode |name = Rory's Birthday Parties |image = [[File:106.jpg|280px]] |season = 1 |ep_num = 6 |date = November 9, 2000 |writer = Amy Sherman-Palladino |director = Sarah Pia Anderson |prev = [[Cinnamon's Wake]] |next = [[Kiss and Tell]]}}'''Rory's Birthday Parties''' is the sixth episode in season oneÂ of Gilmore Girls.Â ''' ==Summary== [[Emily]] throws a Friday night birthday party for [[Rory]] and students from Chilton attend. Emily, [[Lorelai]] and Rory confront each other in front of the guests. On Saturday, Lorelai hosts a birthday party for Rory which her grandparents reluctantly attend leading Emily to a shocking realization; she missed out on Lorelai's life.Â  ==PlotÂ == Rory Gilmore is about to turn sixteen years old. But the idea of having a low-key birthday party quickly turns sour when Emily insists on throwing her granddaughter a "proper" party. This all occurs during the weekly Friday night dinner that the girls have with Rory's grandparents. After eating, Lorelai and Rory must put dibs on certain items they want in the swank house. Emily needs to know exactly what the girls want when she and Richard "kick the bucket." After looking at different antiques in the house, Lorelai tries her best to put the kibosh on Emily's posh birthday party. (After all, she throws Rory a great bash every year). As usual, Emily's mind is made up and can't be change, so now two parties will be thrown in Rory's honor. Later on, Lorelai gets a call from Emily; she wants to go shopping for a special present for Rory and needs help. Lorelai agrees because it seems that her mom is actually trying to make an effort to open up. As the two browse through the mall, Emily keeps picking out equally garish gifts, from pearls to hats that belong on the head of the Queen of England. Emily is clearly shopping for her imaginary granddaughter while Lorelai gets increasing annoyed because her suggestions are ignored over and over again. Emily finally finds some bracelets that say "Rory," but complains that they are only $12, not enough to spend on a present. When Lorelai insists the bracelets fine, Emily makes the purchase and it looks like mother and daughter are really making some headway. Meanwhile, at school Tristan wishes Rory a happy birthday and reveals that he has an invitation to attend Rory's party. It turns out that Rory's grandmother has given invitation to almost everyone that attends Chilton. The situation is beyond Rory's worst nightmare, but she cannot bring herself to tell Lorelai after seeing her mom so happy about the progress she is making with Emily. She complains to her best friend Lane who offers some warm sympathy while they chow down at the local diner. Next, comes walking in for some java to go. He smiles at Rory and mouths "Happy Birthday," and we can see Rory swooning inside. At exactly 4:03am, Lorelai wakes Rory up to wish her a happy birthday. She crawls into bed for with Rory for a sweet mother daughter talk. "I think you're a great kid and the best friend a girl could have," says Lorelai. Friday night arrives, and disaster is in the air. Emily is being a psycho host to her hired help, determined to make everything as perfect and possibly. Rory is having a horrible time, forced to mingle with classmates she hates (particularly her arch nemesis Paris) and eat food that smells funny. Tristan arrives to mock her with faux professions of undying love. The one good thing that comes out of this party is that Rory gets a lot of fat envelopes filled with money from stuffy old friends of her grandfather. But when Emily tells Rory to make a speech in front of everyone, she freaks out and makes a fool of Emily. This of course does not sit well with Grandma and Lorelai does not have a clue why Rory is acting totally bizarre. Emily calls Rory the rudest girl in the world and tells Lorelai she ought to be ashamed of herself for being such a bad mother. Rory hides in Lorelai's old room and then confesses the whole Chilton invitations to her mom. When Lorelai hears Emily invited the snotty classmates on her own accord without consulting Rory, she feels really, really bad. And she feels even worse that Rory kept the news from her so that Lorelai's truce with Emily would not be ruined. As Rory and Lorelai prepare to leave, it has dropped 50 degrees at the elder Gilmore residence. In other words, Emily is as cold as ice and even refuses Rory's invite to her other party the following evening. Now Lorelai is furious at Emily for treating Rory so poorly. They fight like screaming alley cats while Rory waits in the car. Next morning, Rory is going to a college fair in town so she can pick up another Harvard brochure. While there she meets Paris, who is super annoyed that Rory is at the Harvard table because this means that they both might end up going to school there. The two decide that Harvard is a big campus, so it should be big enough for the both of them. All of a sudden, Paris asks Rory if she is dating Tristan. Due to the fact that Rory practically despises Tristan, she replies with a big, "No." This makes Paris quite pleased. Pleased enough to tell Rory she had a nice party. Saturday night arrives and Rory is having a blast with her buds. She gets an iMac from Mom and starts cutting her Sookie-made cake when the doorbell rings. Surprise, it is Emily and Richard! Turns out they have never even set foot in Lorelai's home. Emily feels out of place almost immediately and gets some private time in Lorelai's room. When she spots of picture of Lorelai with her leg in a cast, she makes the sad realization that she doesn't know her daughter at all. She never knew Lorelai broker her leg and it happened three years ago. Before they leave, Rory gets another big check from Grandpa and is generally happy that they came to her party. As Emily and Richard drive off, there's major sadness hanging all around Emily and it is too strong not to notice, even by her absent-minded husband. At the end of the night, Lorelai looks out the window and sees to her complete surprise, Rory and a boy. It's Dean, and he's giving her a gift, a bracelet that he made for her. He puts the bracelet on her wrist, puts his hand in hers, and Rory is smitten like a kitten. But Lorelai is a different story.Â  ==Music== * "Happy Birthday" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Altered_Images Altered Images] * "This Old House" by Brian Setzer Orchestra * "What A Wonderful World" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_Armstrong Louis Armstrong] * "Why Does It Always Rain On Me?" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Travis_(band) Travis] * "The Lathe of Heaven" by Scott Abels, Aaron Owens, Matthew W. Parker, David Fuentes, and Brian Dixon ==References== ===Movies=== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Fly_%281958_film%29 The Fly] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freaky_friday Freaky Friday] ===''â€‹''Pop Culture=== '''Emily''': My daughter, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henny_Youngman Henny Youngman].
'''Lorelai''': So, how'd you like two parties this year?
'''Rory''': You couldn't get her to cave.
'''Lorelai''': No, but she did agree to make the string quartet learn [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Like_a_Virgin_%28song%29 "Like A Virgin."] '''Rory''': So, is this party grandma's having going to be a big deal?
'''Lorelai''': Not really. The government will close that day. Flags will fly at half-mast. [http://www.barbrastreisand.com/ Barbara Streisand] will give her final concert... again. Now, the Pope has previous plans, but he's trying to get out of them. However, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elvis Elvis] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jim_morrison Jim Morrison] are coming, and they're bringing chips.
'''Sookie''': it's too bad you couldn't get your mom to relinquish Friday.
'''Lorelai''': No, she has her [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vulcan_nerve_pinch Vulcan death grip] on that one.
'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I_Love_Lucy Lucy, I'm home!] '''Lorelai''': "And [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justin_Timberlake#Personal_life Justin] is just so dreamy. He can't marry Britney. I'll just cry and cry and cry."
'''Lorelai''': You're shopping for your imaginary granddaughter, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barbara_Hutton Barbara Hutton].
'''Emily''': You wanted me to get her a Filofax and a mermaid eraser. Oh yes, and there was the T-shirt with the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Farrah_Fawcett Farrah Fawcett] face.
'''Lorelai''': A hero to many who aspire to the perfect feather flip.
'''Rory''': I wonder if [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Waltons the Waltons] ever did this.
'''Emily''': Well, what do you think?
'''Lorelai''': I think [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edith_Wharton Edith Wharton] would've been proud, and busy taking notes.

'''Lorelai''': Here.
'''Rory''': What is it?
'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shirley_Temple Shirley Temple].
'''Rory''': What are you drinking?
'''Lorelai''': A Shirley Temple Black. I got your'' [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/On_the_Good_Ship_Lollipop Good Ship Lollipop] ''right here, mister. ==Memorable Quotes== ==Trivia== [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 1 episodes]]

revision.text:
'''{{Template:Episode |name = Kiss and Tell |season = 1 |ep_num = 7 |date = November 16, 2000 |writer = Jenji Kohan |director = Rodman Flender |prev = [[Rory's Birthday Parties]] |next = [[Love and War and Snow]]|image = [[File:Kiss and tell.jpg|280px]]}}'''Kiss and Tell''' is the seventh episode in season oneÂ of Gilmore Girls.Â ''' ==Summary== [[Rory]] has her first kiss with [[Dean]]. [[Lorelai]] is upset Rory didn't tell her about it. Dean attends movie night with the Gilmore Girls.Â  ==PlotÂ == The Autumn Festival has hit Stars Hollow; the leaves are changing, the town is decorating, and Rory is about to experience her first kiss. It happens in public, at the grocery store where Dean works. After school, Rory goes to see her boyfriend and while they stand in an aisle, he holds a soda behind his back and goes in for the lip lock. All Rory can say is "thank you" before bolting from the store and heading straight to her best friend Lane so she can spill every single juicy detail. When she gets home that day, a super crabby Lorelai is dealing with a broken refrigerator, and Rory decides it is not the best time to talk about "the kiss." Not to mention the fact that the last time Dean was discussed, Rory almost ditched Chilton for him. When Lorelai goes to pick up a rocking chair from the antique store run by Lane's mom, she finds out about the whole sordid kiss. Lane's mom overheard the girls talking and believes Rory is a bad influence on her daughter. She lectures Lorelai who is more concerned with the fact that Rory did not tell her about any of it. Meanwhile, Lane is obsessed with the kiss and demands to hear the story over and over again. She is living vicariously through Rory and thanks to Dean's best bud, Todd; Lane does have some dirt on Dean. Namely that he had a girlfriend named Beth back in the Windy City, where Dean is from. But they split up before he left after dating for a year. Besides, now she is dating his cousin, which Dean does not feel weird about because he never really loved her. The best part of it all is that Dean has not been able to talk about anything but Rory for weeks. Lorelai is totally bummed about being shut out by Rory. Luke tries to stay close in order to comfort her, but she just blows him off. When she does talk to Rory, she cannot even bring herself to talk straight, instead going for some random and vague General Hospital analogy. Needless to say, Rory does not pick up on the hint, leaving Lorelai to resort to spying. Luke busts her big time and tells her that Rory's growing up and that there are some things she is not going to share with her mom. What is really disturbing to Lorelai, is that Dean kind of looks like Christopher, Rory's dad. And if Rory does not talk about the guy with her mom, then it is too much like the relationship Lorelai has with her own mother. The only thing left to do is confronting Rory and be really cool about it. So Lorelai ambushes Rory and makes like it is no big deal, but Rory doesn't believe her. Later, Rory and Lorelai go shopping for their Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory night, which you cannot watch without massive amounts of junk food. Rory's stressed out because they are shopping at the store where Dean works. When Lorelai first sees Dean, her impression? "Boy he's tall, that must have been a back bender, that kiss. Make sure you warm up next time." They go to check out and with an awkward introduction; Dean bags their junk food. All goes well until Rory and Lorelai leave the store. Rory runs to rent the videos while Lorelai is about to grab a cup of java. But Dean comes out to give them something they forgot, and Lorelai invites him over to watch the movies. The problem is that Rory does not know he is getting the invite. And when she does find out, she freaks. They have not even had a real date and now their first date will include Lorelai. Rory is humiliated and Lorelai does not get it. What is the big deal? Rory reminds her mom that she is still her mother, not her best friend. Lorelai gets upset and offers to uninvited him. No, that will not work either! How about Lorelai just leaves them alone? No, then it will seem like Rory had her mom arrange the date. It's a lose, lose situation and they are stuck with it. At home, Rory is upset because she does not know what to wear. The night was supposed to be casual and now she has to be pretty. She looks to Lorelai for advice and of course Lorelai knows exactly what to do. When Dean is late, Rory is about to have a major meltdown. Turns out, he has been held captive by their chatty neighbors. Lorelai quickly rescues him and the date begins. First, he gets a tour of the house and the broken refrigerator. He then takes a look at Rory's very clean room, but she cannot even bring herself to go through the doorway. He senses she is uncomfortable but she claims she is just fine with him looking around her personal, private space. Then, Sookie brings over some dessert, but it is just an excuse to get a little peak at Dean. Lorelai refuses to let Sookie inside, things are bad enough already. But Sookie does indeed make her way into the house, and things just continue on a downward spiral. Rory suggest that Lorelai broadcast the date over the Internet. Rory, Dean, and Lorelai settle down to watch the movie and talk about other flicks. Then Lorelai goes to get popcorn and decides not to come back, leaving them alone so they can get cozy. Rory cannot handle being alone with Dean. Why? Because he is perfect and smells really good, that is why! She just does not know what to do. It is clear she really likes him, so Lorelai agrees to come back in and help out. But they cannot go back at the same time, that would be too obvious. So Lorelai goes in first and takes the opportunity to have a little one on one with Dean. And she is pretty blunt about it: "That girl in there is beloved around here, you hurt her, there's not a place within a hundred mile you can hide." Lorelai lays down the law, but Dean has got some backbone of his own and tells Lorelai that he is not going away any time soon. In fact, he really needs Lorelai to like him because if she hates him then he does not have a chance in hell with Rory. Lorelai agrees to try and like him, implying that he has not succeeded in winning her over just yet. At the end of the night, Rory and Dean are on the porch, and he kisses her again. This one is a little longer and a little sweeter than last time and this time he is the one who says thank you. Inside, Rory knows something is up with her mom. Lorelai is still a little hurt over not hearing about the first kiss and even though it is a little late and after the fact, Rory spills every little detail.Â  ==Music== *"This Old House" by Brian Setzer Orchestra ==References== ===Music=== * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nick_Drake Nick Drake] * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liz_Phair Liz Phair] * [http://www.sugarplastic.com The Sugarplastic] === Movies=== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shaft_%281971_film%29 Shaft] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Invasion_of_the_Body_Snatchers Invasion of the Body Snatchers] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/9_1/2_Weeks 9 1/2 Weeks] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Willy_Wonka_%26_the_Chocolate_Factory Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cinderella_%281950_film%29 Cinderella] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sleeping_Beauty_%281959_film%29 Sleeping Beauty] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ice_Castles Ice Castles] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Way_We_Were The Way We Were] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boogie_Nights Boogie Nights] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnolia_%28film%29 Magnolia] ===Pop Culture=== '''Lorelai''': I was watching ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_Hospital General Hospital]'' the other day, and, you know, they have a new [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucky_Spencer Lucky ]because the old Lucky went to go play something where he could have a real name. *The real Lucky ([http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jonathan_Jackson_%28actor%29 Jonathan Jackson]) whereas the 'New' Lucky was [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacob_Young Jacob Young]. '''Lorelai''' (to Luke): Not gonna talk about how good you'd look dressed as one of the guys from [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Crucible The Crucible]. '''Rory''' (to Lorelai): No [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Dean James Dean] jokes. No father-with-a-shotgun stares. No [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nancy_Walker Nancy Walker] impressions. '''Rory''' (to Lorelai): You're like a crazy [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elsa_Klensch Elsa Klensch]. '''Babette '''(about Dean): Oh, is he cute! And that [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlton_Heston Chuck Heston] chin of his! '''Dean''' (to Rory): How much does it suck that they used [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BIOW9fLT9eY "Pink Moon" in a Volkswagen commercial]? '''Dean''': So at what point does the outsider get to suggest a movie for movie night?
'''Rory''': That depends. What movie are you thinking of?
'''Dean''': I don't know -- Boogie Nights, maybe?
'''Rory''': You'll never get it past Lorelai.
'''Dean''': Not a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_Wahlberg Marky Mark] fan?
==Memorable Quotes== ==Trivia== *When Dean kisses Rory for the first time, his head is tilted to the right, but in the next shot his head is tilted to the left. *When talking about Rory being in love with Prince Charming, Dean says "Because he can dance...I've got sisters" He uses the plural form, yet later in the series we find out he only has one, Clara. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 1 episodes]]

revision.text:
'''{{Template:Episode |name = Love and War and Snow |season = 1 |ep_num = 8 |date = December 14, 2000 |writer = Joan Binder Weiss |director = Alan Myerson |prev = [[Kiss and Tell]] |next = [[Rory's Dance]]|image = [[File:Love and war and snow.jpg|280px]]}}'''Love and War and Snow''' is the eighth episode in season oneÂ of Gilmore Girls.Â ''' ==Summary== The first snowfall prompts [[Lorelai]] and [[Max]]'s first date while [[Rory]] is stuck in Hartford with [[Richard]] and [[Emily]]. [[Lane]]Â is upset with Rory for being distracted with Chilton and [[Dean]].Â  ==PlotÂ == The people of Stars Hollow are about to be walking in a winter wonderland, but first we find Lorelai and Rory at a town meeting, where everyone seems to be arguing over petty matters that the Gilmore girls find highly amusing. The mayor is admonishing the Stars Hollow residents about leash laws before he talks about the anniversary of the legendary Stars Hollow battle. Apparently, the town even has a reenactment of the battle. The whole announcement just infuriates Luke who demands that the whole charade stop. He says that the battle never happened, they are glorifying a war they never fought to keep land that they originally stole anyway. It is not surprising that the mayor is not pleased with Luke's comments. That night, Lorelai wakes up because she can smell the season's first snowfall in the air. There also happens to be a surprise message on the answering machine. It's from Max, Rory's English teacher at Chilton, and he wants to know if Lorelai and himself are ever going to go on a date. Lorelai is clearly smitten and plays back the message again and again to hear Max's voice. In the morning, Lane is telling Rory about meeting her soul mate at school. Lane is dressed in her jazz band uniform and is looking pretty. Rory doesn't hear a word coming out of Lane's mouth; she is too distracted, thinking about her boyfriend Dean. She stops by the Inn to grab Sookie's homemade rocky road cookies before jetting off to the bus stop. Lane follows, but then bails when the lovebirds get all mushy. Lane is feeling left out because she is the third wheel. Meanwhile, it is Friday night and the snowstorm is brewing. It is already hitting Stanford, where Emily and Richard live, so Lorelai is going to have to skip the weekly dinner. Rory arrives at her grandparent's house right after school and finds she is stuck solo without her Mom. No big deal though, Rory will just have to make the best of it. As for Lorelai, she is walking through town digging the first snowfall of the year. She finds Luke, who is still cranky over the battle reenactment. The old men of the town gather in the cold with their muskets while the schools' band sets up to provide a little music. Lane is mesmerized by Mitch, her crush, and then does the unthinkable. She stares at his hair and actually runs her fingers through it! Mitch gives her a look like, "What are you doing?!" and then Lane bolts the scene in total humiliation. To her surprise and delight, Lorelai runs into Max, whose car has broken down right in Stars Hollow. With Rory away for the night, the two can finally get to have their very first date. Over at the grandparent's house, Emily is in a tizzy because Florence the cook cannot make it to work. Now, what are they going to do? Rory offers to check the refrigerator and whip something up. (Emily's never whipped up anything in her life.) Rory strikes gold when she spots a frozen pizza putting her grandmother in shock. Emily then declares that the pizza must belong to the maid. After all, that is what you eat at a carnival or a Turkish prison, according to Emily. Rory decides to play chef and banishes the grandparents from the kitchen. Then, while the pizza cooks, a curious Rory goes up to her Mom's old room and does a little snooping. She finds a strip of pictures of her Mom and Dad kissing, from 1983. You can tell Rory gets a bit bummed out seeing her folks at a time when they were totally in love. Rory decides to call home, but it is Lane who answers the phone. Lane ran to Rory's house after the "Mitch incident" and now she is freaking out. She lays into Rory about what a bad friend she has been. Rory apologizes but it is a day late and a dollar short. Then, the phone goes dead. Leaving Lane high and dry, and Rory feeling like a total jerk. Meanwhile, Lorelai and Max walk and talk in the snow, flirting and generally charming the pants off each other. Lorelai brings Max to a cozy cafÃ© where they show old horror flicks, and it is right there on the couch where they share their first kiss. When the pizza is ready, Emily and Richard dig in, and thanks to a little doctoring with some fresh Parmesan cheese, it is a big hit. After dinner, they all look at some old photos and find Lorelai dressed up in a debutante gown. The conversation immediately gets awkward because Lorelai never got to be an actual debutante because she got pregnant with Rory. Back in Stars Hollow, Luke feels bad and brings the freezing men some hot coffee while they wait out their reenactment. His good deed backfires when he has to witness Lorelai and Max who are walking back to the Gilmore house looking all chummy. He even spots a lip lock, and the look on Luke's face says it all. When Lorelai and Max get back to the house, Lorelai does not want to let Max in. She has never brought a man home before out of respect for Rory. And she does not necessarily want to start now. But it is snowing so hard, and Rory is away for the night, so Lorelai breaks her own rule, letting Max over the threshold. They are barely in the house for like two seconds when they start making out like teenagers and then start making their way up the stairs. Their hot and heavy session is interrupted, when Lane appears out of nowhere. She apologizes, then bolts back into Rory's room and blasts some loud music. That is a big signal for help, so Lorelai sends Max into the kitchen and lends an ear to Lane. Lane gives the lowdown to Lorelai, who gives her best advice. She basically says it is not a big deal, everyone screws up in high school, it is how you handle the experience that matters. Lane feels better after the pep talk, and Lorelai goes back to Max. Lane is now spending the night, so any hoochie coochie between the two is off limits. Max stays the night too, although he does so on the couch and must settle for a kiss goodnight. The next morning, Rory comes home from her grandparent's house early. Lorelai heads her off at the door and comes clean fast. Rory is definitely weirded out by the situation and asks her Mom if she is in love with Max. Lorelai says she likes Max a lot, but it has only been one date so she cannot tell. But Rory is quick to point out that Lorelai has never had a man in the house before. Lorelai admits she had a great time with Max and only time can tell if he is the right one. Next, Lane comes out of Rory's room, and Rory apologizes for being an awful friend. Rory swears that Lane is not a third wheel and announces that Dean will just have to deal with the fact that Lane came first. They plan for coffee later and then Lane bolts, leaving Rory with her Mom and Max. She is about to join them in the living room, but sees they are sipping coffee and decides to hang solo in the kitchen. As the show ends, Rory pulls out the pictures of her Mom and Dad and looks at them one more time.Â  ==Music== * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pictures_of_You "Pictures of You"], by [http://www.thecure.com The Cure] * "Someone to Watch Over Me", by [http://www.rickieleejones.com Rickie Lee Jones] ==References== ===Books=== * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jane_austen Jane Austen] * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hunter_Thompson Hunter Thompson] * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlotte_Bronte Charlotte Bronte] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judy_Blume Judy Blume] ===Movies=== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_on_Haunted_Hill The House on Haunted Hill] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Top_Gun Top Gun] ===Pop Culture=== '''Lorelai''': ''(to Rory)'' Hey babe, ''(to Lane, nods)'' [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sergeant_Pepper Sergeant Pepper]. '''Emily''': A bad storm is heading your way. Itâ€™s already hitting us here.
'''Lorelai''': Well, donâ€™t panic. Iâ€™ll get the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noah%27s_Ark ark], you get the animals. '''Lorelai''': Well, uh, gee, Mom, I don't know. Let me seeâ€¦ black ice, treacherous roads. I'll just put on my [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wonder_woman red, white, and blue leotard, grab my golden lasso, and fly the invisible plane] on over? '''Lorelai''': All right, honey, tell Grandma you arrived there not a member of the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Junior_League Junior League], I'd like you to leave there the same way. '''Max''': A match made in Heaven.
'''Lorelai''': ...Or in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bellevue_Hospital Bellevue]. '''Richard''': You also knew that you wanted to marry [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Errol_Flynn Errol Flynn]. ==Memorable Quotes== ==Trivia== [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 1 episodes]]

revision.text: This is a list of all pages marked as a stub. Please consider extending them.

=News Archive= ====16.03.2007==== Today, the lovely and talented [[Lauren Graham]] turns a well rounded 40 years old! Happy birthday! ====10.12.2006==== Well we have had some nice contributions, and once again I would like to thank all the editors.
As you can see, we still need much more love though. Come on loyal fans, get to work. Just a line here and there, or a stub is a valuable contribution. ====23.11.2006==== I have added a rough draft with some info on how to find things to do on Gilmorepedia: [[Gilmorepedia:Help]]. Check it out and feel free to add to it! Big thanks to the people who have contributed so far! I hope you are having fun. I have added some templates to give the character and episode pages a consistent look, feel free to check out the page source and copy away. Also feel free to upload more pictures and use them. Again, don't be afraid to edit/add things. Nothing can be broken, and there is plenty of storage to use. Thanks again for stopping by. ====18.11.2006==== Well, [[Gilmorepedia:About|it is here]], almost empty, editable by all and sundry.
Except the main page, that is. If you have suggestions on how to improve the main page, or the site for that matter, [http://gilmorepedia.com/index.php?title=Special:Emailuser/Admin let me know].
Check out the [[Help:Contents|Help section]] for some information on how to edit a wiki.
Don't be afraid of using that edit button. You can't break anything.

page.title: Gilmore Girls Wiki talk:Old Main Page

revision.text:
'''Please use [[User_Talk:Admin|this page]] for further comments/suggestions''' - [[User:Admin|Admin]] 11:01, 10 December 2006 (PST) ---- Please leave a message here if you would like to discuss anything related to the site
- The Admin What can we do to the episodes pages? * Add the actors and his character in the show? * Add Spoilers? * Add "Curiosities"?
- inyia I think the structure should grow organically as people add new information. Just start somewhere and things will come together :)
- Admin ---- Do we need an "actors" category/Portal? - inyia You can add new portals [[Portal:List|here]] at any time ("All Portals" from the main page goes there), the page is unprotected. Thanks - Admin I have listed Actors in there, I am going to do the page right now, but it doesn't appear at the "Main Page" and it '''is''' protected, so I can't change it - inyia Yes, the main page remains protected. I will pull over the Actors portal to the main page soon - Admin ---- Can we change the pictures to the season 7 boxes. That photos are from season 2. Can we update them? I'm asking because I wanted to make sure it was okay with whoever is putting the boxes to the pages.[[User:Imherestill|Imherestill]] 07:19, November 24, 2011 (UTC) == Kirk's job == How do you feel about the idea of having a list of the jobs that Kirk took on? They were never the same in every episode. I'm just not sure if that should be its own page, or attached to Kirk or have a spot for it on the episodes he appears in. What you do all think?

{{Epnav | prev=Love, Daisies and Troubadours | up=Season 2 | next=Hammers and Veils}} {{Infobox episode |name = Sadie, Sadie... |Image = 201.jpg |season_num = [[Season 2|2]] |ep_num = 1 |air_date = October 09, 2001 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] }} ==Synopsis== Lorelai accepts Max's proposal, but when Emily hears about the upcoming wedding from Sookie, she is hurt and angry that Lorelai didn't bother to tell her. Meanwhile, Rory brings Dean to dinner at her grandparents' house and Richard's obvious disapproval of Dean leads to the first fight between Rory and her grandfather. ==Plot outline== [[Lane Kim|Lane]] freaks out when her parents buy her a one-way ticket to Korea for the summer. [[Luke Danes|Luke]] gives [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] a lot to think about when she tells him about [[Max Medina|Max]]'s proposal. Lorelai finally says "yes" to Max and tells everyone except her parents. When [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] brings [[Dean Forester|Dean]] to a special dinner at her grandparents' house to celebrate making it into the top 3% at [[Chilton Preparatory School|Chilton]] and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] attacks Dean for not meeting Gilmore standards of excellence, Rory springs to Dean's defense and creates a rift between Richard and his granddaughter. [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] is heartbroken when she finds out about the wedding from [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] instead of Lorelai. ==Music== *"I'll Be Your Mirror" by The Velvet Underground and Nico *"I Found Love" by The Free Design *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Sinatra Frank Sinatra] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cujo Cujo ]by Stephen King *[http://www.amazon.com/Mencken-Chrestomathy-Selection-Choicest-Writing/dp/0394752090 A Mencken Chrestomathy] by H. L. Mencken ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Not_Without_My_Daughter Not Without My Daughter] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Funny_Girl_%28film%29 Funny Girl] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fame_%281980_film%29 Fame] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Ugh, I'll take any other subject in the world for two hundred, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alex_Trebek Alex].

'''Lorelai''': You know how on ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All_in_the_Family All in the Family]'' when Edith would be yapping about something and Archie would pretend to make a noose and hang himself or shoot himself in the head?

'''Bootsy''': ''(reading a gossipy magazine)'' So, apparently they shoot a gland from a pig's head into [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivana_Trump Ivana Trump]'s rear end twice a month to keep her looking young.

'''Lorelai''': ''(referring to Emily)'' Oh yeah, Dad, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover J. Edgar Hoover] over here was just telling us.

'''Sookie''': Who's catering?
'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bobby_Flay Bobby Flay].

'''Dean''': ''(about breaking up)'' I'm sure some people like it.
'''Rory''': Oh, sure. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cher#Marriages_and_relationships Cher, Gregg Allman], bet they'd give it a big thumbs up.

'''Lorelai''': Supposedly ripped off [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zelda_Fitzgerald Zelda Fitzgerald]'s cold, dead hand.

'''Dean''': I'm not great in math.
'''Lorelai''': Yeah except who is really? Except mathematicians or blackjack dealers or I guess [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_Hawking Stephen Hawking] doesn't suck. ==Trivia== * Starting with this episode, Jared Padalecki (Dean) is now part of the main list of stars on the show. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Sadie, Sadie... | up=Season 2 | next=Red Light on the Wedding Night}} {{Infobox episode |name = Hammers and Veils |Image = 202.jpg |season_num = [[Season 2|2]] |ep_num = 2 |air_date = October 09, 2001 |writer = [[Michael Katleman]] |director = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] }} ==Synopsis== Lorelai avoids telling her parents about her engagement to Max. Rory suddenly becomes obsessed with finding enough extracurricular activities. ==Plot outline== After building a house with [[Paris]], [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] stresses out about being too far behind on extracurriculars, which puts a strain on her relationship with [[Dean Forester|Dean]]. [[Henry Cho|Henry]] expresses an interest in dating [[Lane Kim|Lane]], but she is getting ready to leave for Korea for the summer. [[Richard |Richard]] and Rory patch up their differences. Hurt over being the last to know, [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] gives [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] a frigid reception when her daughter finally tells her the good news. All of [[Stars Hollow]] turns out for Lorelai's and [[Max Medina|Max]]'s engagement party. In the middle of the planning of the party,[[Jackson| Jackson]] reveals to [[Sookie]] that he is not ready to get married but he is willing to move in with her. ==Music== *"Spring Released" by Grant Lee Phillips *"Love Will Keep Us Together" by Captain & Tennille *"One Fine Day" by The Chiffons *"Until The Real Thing Comes Along" by Dean Martin *"Love Is Everywhere I Go" by Sam Phillips *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Sinatra Frank Sinatra], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Damned_%28band%29 The Damned] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thelma_%26_Louise Thelma & Louise] *A C ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': ''(about her veil)'' And then there's the full on [http://www.cbsnews.com/video/watch/?id=1847530n&tag=related;photovideo Diana].

'''Paris:''' You have to go to college.
'''Louise:''' [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grace_Kelly Princess Grace] didn't go to college.

'''Paris''': Thank you for the history lesson, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A.J._Benza A.J. Benza].

'''Rory''': Why don't you go on inside and you and my mother can continue the 'Rory's building a house' routine and when that gets boring you can move on over to ''[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sShMA85pv8M Who's on First]?''

'''Rory''': Funny, I never pictured you as a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Vila Bob Vila] kind of girl.

'''Rory''': Paris has been accumulating these things since she could walk. I mean, she has a list of good deeds that could bump [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mother_Teresa Mother Teresa] off the Harvard list.

'''Michel''': If I eat that, I cannot have my [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boca_Burger Boca Burger] later.

'''Lorelai''': These are women from countries that have dictatorships and civil wars and death squads and all of that they survived, but 5 minutes working for Emily Gilmore and people are begging for [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fidel_Castro Castro]. ==Quotes== '''Luke:''' Yep, there's nothing like a wedding to screw up a family. '''Lorelai:''' Or, in my case, there's nothing like a family to screw up a family. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]]

page.title: Red Light on the Wedding Night

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=Hammers and Veils | up=Season 2 | next=Road Trip to Harvard}} {{Infobox episode | | Image=Ep02x03_1.jpg | name=Red Light on the Wedding Night | season_num=[[Season 2|2]] | ep_num=3 | air_date=October 16, 2001 | writer=[[Daniel Palladino]] | director=[[Gail Mancuso]] | guests= }} ==Synopsis== During a wild bachelorette party thrown by Sookie, Lorelai makes an impulsive phone call to Rory's dad Christopher and realizes that Max is not the man for her. ==Plot outline== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]], [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]], [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]], [[Michel Gerard|Michel]], and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] go to a drag club for Lorelai's bachelorette party. Emily regales the group with stories about the week before her wedding, some of which give Lorelai pause about her own feelings about marriage. When everyone else leaves to call their sweeties, Lorelai calls [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] instead of [[Max Medina|Max]]. Later that evening at home, Lorelai announces to Rory that she's calling the wedding off because she's realized that Max isn't the one for her. Mother and daughter decide to take a road trip to avoid the sympathies of all of [[Stars Hollow]]. ==Music== *"Get Happy" by Judy Garland *"True" by Spandau Ballet *"Church Of The Poison Mind" by Culture Club *"Spring Released" by Grant-Lee Philips *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nsync 'N Sync] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Jack Billy Jack] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Them! Them!] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturday_Night_Fever Saturday Night Fever] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A.I._Artificial_Intelligence A.I. Artificial Intelligence] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Well, it ain't [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guy_Fawkes_Night Guy Fawkes Day].

'''Lorelai''': Okay. Umâ€¦ "What is love? It is the morning and the evening star." Ugh.
'''Rory''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinclair_Lewis Sinclair Lewis]. '''Lorelai:''' Sinclair "Sappy" Lewis.

'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_and_Lewis Byron and Lewis], together again.

'''Lorelai''': "We have buried the putrid corpse of liberty." Perfect!
'''Rory''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mussolini Mussolini ]it is.

'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%28If_Loving_You_Is_Wrong%29_I_Don%27t_Want_to_Be_Right If eating cake is wrong, I don't want to be right].

'''Lorelai''': Take me upstairs and see if you can get me into [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mensa_International Mensa].

'''Lorelai''': Well, we are [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electra_Woman_and_Dyna_Girl Electra Woman and Dyna Girl].

'''Max''': He's the middle child.
'''Lorelai''': Poor [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jan_Brady#Jan_Brady Jan]!

'''Miss Patty''': Well, Sinjin was a let-down the second time, but he was my [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Burton Burton ]and I was his [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elizabeth_Taylor Taylor]. Just wish I could've found a little [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Todd Mike Todd] there in the middle.

'''Christopher''': So is he worthy?
'''Lorelai''': Is anyone?
'''Christopher''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bono Bono], maybe? [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brian_Ferry Brian Ferry]?

'''Sookie''': ''(describing her hangover)'' Like a baseball the size of a cantaloupe in your head.
'''Lorelai''': Good one.
'''Sookie''': What?
'''Lorelai''': 'Cause a baseball can only be one size, so it's a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yogi_Berra#Quotes Yogi Berra] type thing.

'''Lorelai''': And people can evolve together don't you think?
'''Luke''': Maybe.
'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoko_Ono#Life_with_John_Lennon Yoko and John Lennon] did. They got closer and closer as the years went by. At the end they even had the same face. ==Quotes== '''Lorelai:''' Hey, sir, make way for Rory. That's it, one name. Internationally-known international supermodel. '''Sookie:''' She's very big in Germany. '''Lorelai:''' ''Ja, ja'', with the ''Lederhosen'' and such. '''Michel:''' I feel like crap on toast. Rory: So, are we almost there? Lorelai: We're almost there, and no where near it. All that matters is we're going. Rory: We're practically there already! Lorelai: Look out, world! ==Trivia== * When they convince the bouncer at the bar to let Rory in, they say she was a world famous model. In real life, Alexis Bledel was a model when she was still in high school, and ended up traveling to Tokyo, Milan, New York and Los Angeles. {{Epnav | prev=Red Light on the Wedding Night | up=Season 2 | next=Nick & Nora/Sid & Nancy}} {{Infobox episode |name = Road Trip to Harvard |Image = 204.jpg |season_num = [[Season 2|2]] |ep_num = 4 |air_date = October 23, 2001 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Jamie Babbit]] }} ==Synopsis== The Gilmore Girl's road trip takes them to a most unusual bed and breakfast and more importantly to tour Harvard and Rory's possible future. Meanwhile Lorelai decides to move forward with her dream of opening an inn. ==Plot outline== To escape everyone's reaction to the news of the broken engagement, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] hit the road, and stumble upon the bed and breakfast from hell before eventually arriving at Harvard, where Rory gets a taste of college life and Lorelai muses over what might have been. [[Lane Kim|Lane]] comes home loaded with bootlegs from Seoul. Lorelai breaks into tears when she sees the chuppah that [[Luke Danes|Luke]] made for her. Luke commiserates with Lorelai even though he's secretly overjoyed to hear that the wedding's off. Lorelai decides to get serious about making her dream of opening an inn a reality. ==Music== *"Perfect Situation For A Fool" by Jai Josefs, Roy Brown *"L-O-V-E (Bo Tuesday)" by Irving *"Gypsies, Tramps And Thieves" by Cher *"How To Dream" by Sam Phillips *"Anarchy in the U.K." by the Sex Pistols *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AC/DC AC/DC], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hootie_and_the_Blowfish Hootie and the Blowfish], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elvis_Costello Elvis Costello], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nico Nico], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iggy_Pop Iggy Pop], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Bowie David Bowie] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alice_in_Wonderland Alice in Wonderland ]by Lewis Carroll *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tuesdays_with_Morrie Tuesdays with Morrie] by Mitch Albom *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Who_Moved_My_Cheese%3F Who Moved My Cheese?] by Spencer Johnson ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinatown_%28film%29 Chinatown] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midnight_Express_%28film%29 Midnight Express] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grease_%28film%29 Grease] ==Pop Culture References== '''Rory''': ''(to Lorelai)'' Wow, your ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Behind_the_Music Behind the Music]'' is gonna be really wild.

'''Lorelai''': To figure out exactly what happened, you'd have to dig up [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freud Freud ]himself and have him work on me full time.

'''Lorelai''': Okay, I think we just found the first room in the history of the world that would've made [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liberace Liberace ]say, "Whoa, step back. No one's that gay".

'''Lorelai''': Rory, stop it. We are not going to have this fight in a flowery bedroom with dentists singing ''Gypsies, Tramps and Thieves'' in the background. It's too [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Lynch David Lynch]!

'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W._E._B._Du_Bois W.E.B. Du Bois], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yo-Yo_Ma Yo-Yo Ma]. Oh cool! [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_Gwynne Fred Gwynne].

'''Rory''': ''(to Lorelai)'' You do realize that all of your college kid jargon comes from ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Happy_Days Happy Days]'' and the ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Valley_Girl_%28song%29 Valley Girls]'' song.

'''Lorelai''': I may never get married. I may be a free spirit my whole life, or fall in love with a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katherine_Hepburn#Hepburn_and_Tracy separated Catholic guy] like Katherine Hepburn did and then not get to go to his funeral when he dies. ==Quotes== '''Rory:''' What did that sign say? It said, "Don't" or "Death" on it! '''Lorelai''': Did you hear? I used 'existentialist' in a sentence. '''Rory''': I heard. '''Lorelai''': I've always wanted to do that '''Rory''': It was very impressive. '''Rory:''' (about the guest book) Wait, you weren't writing in this, were you? '''Lorelai:''' Maybe just a few random thoughts. '''Rory:''' (reading) "Satanic forces are at work here." Mom! '''Lorelai:''' What? '''Rory:''' What? We can't write that in here, that's what. Here... "Sat and forever am at work here." '''Lorelai:''' That doesn't make any sense. '''Rory:''' It doesn't involve the Dark Prince, so I think it's good. '''Rory:''' I've been frittering away my life! '''Lorelai:''' You don't fritter. '''Rory:''' Did I mention I suck? '''Lorelai:''' Yes. '''Rory:''' Well, I do. '''Lorelai:''' No. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]]

'''Alexis Bledel''' plays [[Rory Gilmore]] on Gilmore Girls. {| cellspacing="5" class="infobox biography vcard" style="width: 22em;" ! colspan="2" style="text-align: center; font-size: 125%; font-weight: bold;"|Alexis Bledel |- | colspan="2" style="text-align: center;"|[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:AlexisBledelSept11TIFF.jpg ] Bledel at the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2011_Toronto_International_Film_Festival 2011 Toronto International Film Festival] |- ! scope="row" style="text-align: left;"|Born |Kimberly Alexis Bledel (1981-09-16) September 16, 1981 (age 30) [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houston Houston], Texas, U.S. |- ! scope="row" style="text-align: left;"|Occupation | class="role"|Actress, model |- ! scope="row" style="text-align: left;"|Years active |1996â€“present |} ==Early Life== Bledel was born '''Kimberly Alexis Bledel''' in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houston Houston], Texas, the daughter of Nanette (nÃ©e Dozier) and Martin Bledel. Her father is from Argentina, and has Danish ancestry.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-ref091-0 [1]][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-1 [2]] Her mother had been raised in Mexico from a young age.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-altinmayy-2 [3]][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-3 [4]] Of her parents' upbringing in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latin_America Latin America], Bledel has stated "It's the only culture my mom knows from life, and my father as well, and they made the decision to raise their children within the context they had been raised in".[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-altinmayy-2 [3]] Bledel was raised in a Spanish-speaking household, and did not learn English until she began school.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-4 [5]] She has a younger brother, Eric. Bledel attended Catholic [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saint_Agnes_Academy_(Texas) St. Agnes Academy] in Houston, as well as Baptist and Lutheran schools.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-name-5 [6]] Her mother encouraged her to try [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Community_theater community theater] to overcome her shyness.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-tt-6 [7]] As a child, Bledel appeared in local productions of ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Our_Town Our Town]'' and ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wonderful_Wizard_of_Oz The Wizard of Oz]''.[''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed citation needed]''] She was scouted at a local shopping mall and given work as a fashion model. She went to Page Parkes Center for Modeling and Acting and attended [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NYU NYU]'s [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tisch_School_of_the_Arts Tisch School of the Arts] for one year.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-limelife.com-7 [8]] ==Career== Bledel made her television debut co-starring in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_WB_Television_Network The WB] series ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilmore_Girls Gilmore Girls]'' in 2000. She portrayed [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rory_Gilmore Rory Gilmore], the daughter of single mother [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lorelai_Gilmore Lorelai Gilmore]. Initially, Rory was a high school student at an exclusive private academy, living with her mother in a small town in Connecticut, but later moved on to college at [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yale_University Yale University], where she, among other things, worked as the editor of the ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yale_Daily_News Yale Daily News]''. Bledel made her film debut in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tuck_Everlasting_(2002_film) Tuck Everlasting]'', released in 2002, though she had worked as an extra in the 1998 film ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rushmore_(film) Rushmore]''.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-8 [9]] In 2005, she starred in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sisterhood_of_the_Traveling_Pants_(film) The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants]'' based on the book by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ann_Brashares Ann Brashares]. She played [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lena_Kaligaris Lena Kaligaris], an artist on a journey with three friends, linked over the summer by a pair of "magical" jeans. In 2005 Bledel portrayed Becky, a prostitute, in the movie ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sin_City_(film) Sin City]''. "She's a very professional prostitute. She carries a gun and she kicks ass," said Bledel of Becky.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-wb-9 [10]] In 2006 Bledel co-starred in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I%27m_Reed_Fish I'm Reed Fish]'', in the role of Reed Fish's fiance. Bledel reprised her role of Lena Kaligaris from ''The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants'' in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sisterhood_of_the_Traveling_Pants_2 the film's sequel], released in August 2008. Bledel next appeared in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Post_Grad Post Grad]'', which opened on August 21, 2009, alongside [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jane_Lynch Jane Lynch], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Keaton Michael Keaton], and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carol_Burnett Carol Burnett]. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Alexis_Bledel_2008.jpg][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Alexis_Bledel_2008.jpg]Bledel in June 2008Bledel appeared opposite [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Porter Scott Porter] in the film ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Good_Guy The Good Guy]'', which premiered at [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tribeca_Film_Festival Tribeca Film Festival] April 26, 2009. "The Good Guy" (Porter's role) is a Wall Street businessman whose life falls apart when he helps out a new salesman. Bledel played Beth, Porter's girlfriend. She was also a guest star on the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/And_in_the_End two-hour series finale] of ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ER_(TV_series) ER]'', playing new intern Dr. Julia Wise.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-10 [11]] In May 2009 Bledel signed a contract with the modeling division of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IMG_(company) IMG].[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-limelife.com-7 [8]] Bledel appeared in the historical drama ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Conspirator The Conspirator]'' directed by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Redford Robert Redford]. She plays the girlfriend of Frederick Aiken ([http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_McAvoy James McAvoy]), the lawyer who defended [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Surratt Mary Surratt], the first woman to be hanged in the United States, played by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robin_Wright_(actress) Robin Wright]. The film premiered at the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toronto_International_Film_Festival Toronto International Film Festival] and was released in the United States on 15 April 2011.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-11 [12]] Also in 2010, Bledel completed work as the lead actress in the independent Canadian film ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Kate_Logan_Affair The Kate Logan Affair]''. The film was presented at Montreal's [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Festival_du_Nouveau_Cin%C3%A9ma Festival du Nouveau CinÃ©ma] 2010.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-Festival_du_Nouveau_Cin.C3.A9ma_Program-12 [13]][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-Line-Up_of_Canadian_Films_at_the_Festival_du_nouveau_cin.C3.A9ma-13 [14]] Bledel performed in a theatre profchduction by the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manhattan_Theatre_Club Manhattan Theatre Club] called ''Regrets'', staged at the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City_Center New York City Center].[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-14 [15]] ==Personal life== Bledel dated her ''Gilmore Girls'' co-star [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milo_Ventimiglia Milo Ventimiglia] from December 2002 to July 2006 Filmography {| class="wikitable sortable jquery-tablesorter" ! class="headerSort" title="Sort ascending"|Year ! class="headerSort" title="Sort ascending"|Title ! class="headerSort" title="Sort ascending"|Role ! class="unsortable"|Notes |- |1998 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rushmore_(film) Rushmore]'' |Student |Uncredited |- |2000â€“2007 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilmore_Girls Gilmore Girls]'' |[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rory_Gilmore Rory Gilmore] |Lead role
Nominated-[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satellite_Award_for_Best_Actress_%E2%80%93_Television_Series_Musical_or_Comedy Satellite Award for Best Actress â€“ Television Series Musical or Comedy] |- |2002 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tuck_Everlasting_(2002_film) Tuck Everlasting]'' |Winnie Foster | |- |2004 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DysEnchanted DysEnchanted]'' |Goldilocks |Short film |- |2004 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bride_and_Prejudice Bride and Prejudice]'' |Georgina 'Georgie' Darcy | |- |2005 |''Orphan King, TheThe Orphan King'' |Dylan | |- |2005 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sin_City_(film) Sin City]'' |Becky | |- |2005 |''Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants, The[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sisterhood_of_the_Traveling_Pants_(film) The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants]'' |[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lena_Kaligaris Lena Kaligaris] | |- |2006 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I%27m_Reed_Fish I'm Reed Fish]'' |Kate | |- |2006 |''Life Is Short'' |Charlotte |Short film |- |2008 |''Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2, The[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sisterhood_of_the_Traveling_Pants_2 The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2]'' |Lena Kaligaris | |- |2009 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ER_(TV_series) ER]'' |Dr. Julia Wise |"[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/And_in_the_End... And in the End...]" (season 15: episode 22) |- |2009 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Good_Guy_(film) The Good Guy]'' |Beth Vest | |- |2009 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Post_Grad Post Grad]'' |Ryden Malby | |- |2009 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Ballad_of_G.I._Joe The Ballad of G.I. Joe]'' |[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lady_Jaye Lady Jaye] |Video short |- |2010 |''Conspirator, The[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Conspirator The Conspirator]'' |Sarah Weston |Premiered at the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toronto_International_Film_Festival Toronto International Film Festival] |- |2010 |''Kate Logan Affair, The[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Kate_Logan_Affair The Kate Logan Affair]'' |Kate Logan |Premiered at the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Festival_du_Nouveau_Cin%C3%A9ma Festival du Nouveau CinÃ©ma] 2010 |- |2011 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Girl_Walks_Into_a_Bar Girl Walks Into a Bar]''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-16 [17]] |Kim |Released on [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Youtube Youtube] March 11, 2011[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-17 [18]] |- |2011 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Violet_%26_Daisy Violet & Daisy]''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Bledel#cite_note-Indie_lures_Bledel_in_for_kill-18 [19]] |Violet | |- |2012 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mad_Men_(season_5) Mad Men]'' |Beth |Episodes 8, 9 and 13 of Season 5 (06 May; 13 May; 10 June 2012) |} ==Alexis Bledel Fast Facts== * Her first language is Spanish; she didn't learn English until she started school. * Her mother is Mexican; her father, Argentinian. * Took acting classes when she was 8 as a way to overcome her shyness. * Began modeling at age 14, traveling to Milan and Tokyo for shows. ==Family and spouses== * Martin Bledel - Father * Nanette - Mother * Eric David Bledel - Brother * Milo Ventimiglia - Ex-significant Other ==Education== * Attended New York University, New York, NY [[Category:Cast|Bledel, Alexis]] [[Category:Main cast|Bledel, Alexis]]

{{Infobox character |Title = Lane Kim |Actor = Keiko Agena |Image = Gg02-0721 595 slogo.jpg|250px |First = [[Pilot (Episode 1.01)|Pilot]] |Last = [[7.22 Bon Voyage|Bon Voyage]] |Name = Lane Kim |Age = 16-22 (S1-S7) |Family = [[Mrs. Kim]] (mother)
[[Mr. Kim]] (father)
[[Zack Van Gerbig]] (husband)
Steve Van Gerbig (son)
Kwan Van Gerbig (son) }} '''Lane Van Gerbig (nÃ©e Kim) '''is [[Rory Gilmore]]'s best friend (next to Lorelai) in Star's Hollow, a friendship that continued over the course of seven seasons, even after Rory moved on to [[Chilton Preparatory School|Chilton]] and then to [[Yale]]. They have been best friends since age four or five. Lane was raised by a strict Korean mother, [[Mrs. Kim]], who was disapproving of her love for rock music and desire to be a drummer and drove Lane to hide all her rock CDs and forbidden clothing under floorboards and under the mattress in her bedroom. On a rebellious impulse, Lane once dyed her hair purple, but later panicked over what her mother would think of it and dyed it black again ([[One's Got Class and the Other One Dyes|3.04]]). She kept a polaroid photo of her with purple hair, however, which was taken by Rory. The presence of a Mr Kim is something that is debated amongst fans, with Lane often referring to "her parents", especially in the earlier seasons, but Mr Kim is never featured in the show. Lane had a number of romance relationships over the course of the show, the first Henry Cho (Eddie Shin) which ended when he grew tired of hiding their relationship from Mrs. Kim. Lanes next relationship was with with [[Dave Rygalski]] ([[Adam Brody]]). He came into her life after Lane posted a Drummer seeks Band notice, eventually forming Hep Alien with Dave, [[Zack Van Gerbig|Zack]] and [[Brian]]. The relationship had to remain a secret from Mrs Kim, as Dave was not a desirable match, not being Korean or a Doctor. Mrs Kim had repeatedly tried to set Lane up with potential young Korean doctors in the hope of one sticking, so to speak. Eventually, Lane became frustrated with her mother's latest set-up and had her first alcoholic drink at their band's first gig at a teenage party. She makes a drunken phone call to her mother and confesses that she is a drummer in a band and indeed dating Dave Rygalski. Dave was Lane's first kiss (Bible, Kiss, Bible) and the relationship ended after Dave went to college in California. After Dave left, Lane attended 7th Day Adventist College, at her mother's request, until Lane and her band (Dave now replaced in the band by Gil) had a gig at a club in New York and two in the morning. Unable to come up with an alibi acceptable to Mrs. Kim, Lane instead snuck out of the house. Mrs. Kim realized Lane was gone and later led to the inevitable confrontation between Lane and her mother once Mrs. Kim had ransacked Lane's bedroom and found all the hidden clothes, CDs and make up. Lane then chose to move out. After a few weeks of playing house keeper for Rory and her Yale dorm mates in exchange for accommodation, Lane decided to move into a rental house with her band mates, Zack and Brian. While living with the two of them she continued to work as a waitress at [[Luke Danes|Luke]]'s. She didn't return to 7th Day Adventist College. Lane's third and final relationship began while she was living in the rental house and she started to develop feelings for Zack. In spite of some initial reservations concerning Zack's reputation as a womanizer and the effect any potential relationship might have on the band, Lane took a chance and confessed her feelings for him and the two began dating. Once more, Lane's relationship was met with disapproval from Mrs. Kim. The couple encountered other obstacles, such as Lane's realization that she wanted to wait until she got married to have sex and Zack sabotaging the band's opportunity with a label by adding a member and changing the set list right before an important gig out of jealousy; he thought Brian had a thing for Lane. Zack soon realized his mistake, however, and proposed to Lane while she was at work at Luke's. Lane got married to her band-mate [[Zack Van Gerbig|Zack]] in a three part wedding. When Lane's grandmother showed up from Korea, Lane's mother insisted Lane and Zack stage a traditional Buddhist wedding. Once the grandmother left after the Buddhist ceremony, they held a traditional Seventh Day Adventist wedding ceremony to please Lane's mother. Following the ceremony, Lane's mother went home and Lane and Zack had their reception which was a huge bash in the town square with music and drinks and all their friends. Lane's honeymoon was not very pleasant as she and Zack both got sick, but she came home with a major souvenir - she had become pregnant with twins. Throughout the final season, Lane continued to work at Luke's and attempted to keep the band rehearsing, which started to fall apart as she got closer to her due date. Brian also continued to live with Lane and Zack. Lane gave birth to twin boys, Steve and Kwan, at the end of season 7. ==Appearances== ===Season 1=== [[Pilot|1.01]] â€¢ [[The Lorelais' First Day at Chilton|1.02]] â€¢ [[The Deer Hunters|1.04]] â€¢ [[Cinnamon's Wake|1.05]] â€¢ [[Rory's Birthday Parties|1.06]] â€¢ [[Kiss and Tell|1.07]] â€¢ [[Love and War and Snow|1.08]] â€¢ [[Rory's Dance|1.09]] â€¢ [[Forgiveness and Stuff|1.10]] â€¢ [[Double Date|1.12]] â€¢ [[Concert Interruptus|1.13]] â€¢ [[That Damn Donna Reed|1.14]] â€¢ [[Star-Crossed Lovers and Other Strangers|1.16]] â€¢ [[The Breakup, Part 2|1.17]] â€¢ [[Emily In Wonderland|1.19]] â€¢ [[P.S. Lorelai?|7.20]] â€¢ [[7.22 Bon Voyage|7.22]] ==Trivia== *The first appearance of Lane's psychedelic closet is in [[The Deer Hunters (Episode 1.04)|S1E4 "The Deerhunters" ]] when Rory calls her. *Lane's music collection, hidden underneath floorboards, is first shown in [[That Damn Donna Reed (Episode 1.14)|S1E14 "That Damn Donna Reed."]] '''Accordingly, she classifies her cds in genres:''' classic rock/progressive rock/pretty boy rock, punk/new wave/german metal bands/broadway soundtracks, jazz/jazz vocals/classical/country/rockabilly/Frank Sinatra (The Capitol Years), and then last section, miscellanous. *Lane's first boyfriend and bandmate was [[Dave Rygalski]], where they bonded over having mutual music tastes as shown from the drummer ad Lane creates in S1E3 "Application Anxiety." In this episode as well, Lane is wearing a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dead_Kennedys Dead Kennedys ] shirt when she meets Dave. *She has an aunt, whose name is Joon, and a cousin, whose name is Christine. *She has an uncle who is around her age. This led to Zack thinking that Mrs.Kim had set her up with him. *When she went to Adventist college, there were two parks (one for each gender). They also allowed makeup as long as it matched one's skin tone exactly. She considered her life to be over. *At one point, she became a cheerleader. This was after Rory moved to Chilton, thus leaving her alone. *She was in the school band. According to her, her band uniform looked like something out of Sergeant Pepper's band. *Rory became her friend in kindergarten when they decided to share crayons. *Her godmother to her two children is Rory, a decision she made after seeing how Lorelai smoothed out spats between her and her mother. *She has a huge CD collection, which is hidden under her bedroom's floorboards. Lane is also knowledgable and opinionated about music, with rock and roll being a particular favorite. *Her mom was constantly on a health kick, and would make extremely healthy and unappetizing meals; Rory would supply her with junk food because of this. *Cleverly creates complex ruses to subvert her Mother's overly strict rules; making it possible for her to see her friends, boyfriends, watch TV, own and listen to music, play in the band, dress like a normal teenager, wear makeup and eat junk food. *Her parents tried to set her up with multiple boys throughout the show. The potential suitors include a future proctologist, pediatrician, minister, and chiropractor. *Her first crush was Henry Cho, a boy at Chilton who she met at Louise's party. He was everything her parents wanted for her (Korean, respectful, counselor at Vacation Bible School, future pediatrician), and because of that she was hesitant to act on her feelings [[The Breakup, Part 2 (Episode 1.17)|[shown in S1E17 "The Breakup...Part 2"].]] *Lane serves as a parallel of Lorelai. They have controlling mothers and distant fathers; also, their parents' visions for their lives don't turn out as expected. They have children young (Lorelai at 16, Lane at 22), and are a treasured part of Stars Hollow. *Her Korean name is Hyung-Hyung [[Sadie, Sadie...|[shown in S2E1 "Sadie, Sadie"]]] . *She had a high aptitude for sales according to a high school career placement test. *Her family has Sing-Your-Favorite-Hymn nights [[Kiss and Tell (Episode 1.07)|[shown in S1E7 "Kiss and Tell"]]] . *The house she grew up in is located on Elm (Street) in Stars Hollow [[Category:Characters|Kim, Lane]] [[Category:Hep Alien|Kim, Lane]] [[Category:Kim family|Kim, Lane]] [[Category:Luke's Diner|Kim, Lane]] [[Category:Stars Hollow Residents|Kim, Lane]] [[Category:Stars Hollow|Kim, Lane]] [[Category:Stars Hollow High School]]

{{Infobox character |Title = Christopher "Chris" Hayden |Image = Lor14.jpg|250px |Actor = David Sutcliffe (I) |First = [[That Damn Donna Reed]] |Last = [[Unto the Breach]] |Name = Christopher Hayden |Age = 32-39 (S1-S7) |Family = [[Straub Hayden]]â€  (father)
[[Francine Hayden]] (mother)
[[Rory Gilmore]] (daughter)
[[Georgia Hayden]] (daughter)
[[Sherry Tinsdale]] (ex-wife)
[[Lorelai Gilmore]] (ex-wife)}}'''Christopher "Chris" Hayden''' is [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]'s father and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]]'s high school boyfriend. They started a relationship in Season 7 and got married spontaneously during a trip to Paris, but they separated only a few months later. He is also the ex-husband of [[Sherry]] and they have one child together, their daughter [[Gigi]]. ==Early History== Christopher and Lorelai have known each other since age six. They were best friends growing up. Like Lorelai, he came from a privileged family but was unhappy with the life his parents had planned for him. Rather than go to Princeton as his parents wanted, Christopher wanted to travel through Europe with Lorelai after high school. When Lorelai became pregnant, Christopher agreed to get married and work for [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]]'s company, as their parents wanted; however, Lorelai refused. Lorelai raised Rory alone, and Christopher had limited contact with his daughter. ==Storylines== In Season 1, Christopher comes to Stars Hollow for the first time ([[That Damn Donna Reed|1.14]]). He stays with Lorelai and Rory, and he asks Lorelai to marry him, but she refuses ([[Christopher Returns|1.15]]). Although both his father and Richard brag about Christopher's business success in California, he confesses to Lorelai that his business is in serious financial trouble. In Season 2, he returns to Stars Hollow to present Rory at her debutante ball ([[Presenting Lorelai Gilmore|2.06]]). He is now living in Boston with his girlfriend [[Sherry Tinsdale]] and has a good job. At the end of Season 2, he is unhappy with Sherry, and he and Lorelai sleep together at Sookie's wedding. Also when Rory and [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] crashes Rory's car ([[Teach Me Tonight|2.19]]), causing the accident that fractures her wrist, Christopher is the person Lorelai calls after seeing Rory's damaged car, and he stays with them for a couple days. However, when he learns Sherry is pregnant, he goes back to her ([[I Can't Get Started|2.22]]). In Season 3, Sherry gives birth to their daughter [[Georgia Hayden|Georgia]], nicknamed Gigi ([[Dear Emily and Richard|3.13]]). 2 years later Sherry leaves him and Gigi to take a job in Paris ([[Norman Mailer, I'm Pregnant!|5.06]]). Christopher repeatedly turns to Lorelai for help with his daughter. Christopher's presence in Lorelai's life puts strain on her relationship with [[Luke Danes]]. Lorelai stays over at Christopher's house the night she and Rory find out from Richard and Emily that Christopher's father, Straub Hayden, has died, and the both of them drink tequilla all night long, but have no sexual interaction whatsoever ([[Women Of Questionable Morals|5.11]]). At [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]]'s urging, Christopher attends Emily and Richard's wedding vow renewal and begs her to get back together with him ([[Wedding Bell Blues|5.13]]). Lorelai is furious with both her mother and Christopher, and they don't speak for several months. They get back in touch when Christopher wants to financially provide for Lorelai and Rory, and they agree he'll take over paying Rory's tuition at Yale ([[He's Slippin' 'Em Bread... Dig?|6.10]]). After Lorelai and Luke break up at the end of Season 6, Lorelai spends the night with Christopher, and they begin a relationship in Season 7. After accompanying Gigi to France to see her mother, Christopher and Lorelai spontaneously get married, and Christopher moves into Lorelai's house in Stars Hollow. However, Christopher continues to be very jealous of Luke. After he finds a letter that Lorelai wrote for Luke's custody battle, Christopher questions whether Lorelai really loves him ([[To Whom It May Concern|7.12]]). When Lorelai's father has a heart attack, Christopher is upset to see Luke at the hospital ([[I'd Rather Be In Philadelphia|7.13]]). Lorelai considers cutting Luke out of her life completely to save her marriage, but a conversation with Sookie makes Lorelai realize that their relationship isn't right ([[Farewell, My Pet|7.14]]). ==Appearances== ===Season 1=== [[That Damn Donna Reed|1.14]] â€¢ [[Christopher Returns|1.15]] ===Season 2=== [[Red Light on the Wedding Night|2.03]] â€¢ [[Presenting Lorelai Gilmore|2.06]] â€¢ [[The Bracebridge Dinner|2.10]] â€¢ [[It Should've Been Lorelai|2.14]] â€¢ [[Teach Me Tonight|2.19]] â€¢ [[Lorelai's Graduation Day|2.21]] â€¢ [[I Can't Get Started|2.22]] ===Season 3=== [[Haunted Leg|3.02]] â€¢ [[Dear Emily and Richard|3.13]] ===Season 5=== [[Norman Mailer, I'm Pregnant!|5.06]] â€¢ [[Emily Says Hello|5.09]] â€¢ [[Women Of Questionable Morals|5.11]] â€¢ [[Come Home|5.12]] â€¢ [[Wedding Bell Blues|5.13]] ===Season 6=== [[The Prodigal Daughter Returns|6.09]] â€¢ [[He's Slippin' 'Em Bread... Dig?|6.10]] â€¢ [[You've Been Gilmored|6.14]] â€¢ [[Bridesmaids Revisited|6.16]] â€¢ [[I Get A Sidekick Out of You|6.19]] â€¢ [[Partings|6.22]] ===Season 7=== [[The Long Morrow|7.01]] â€¢ [[That's What You Get, Folks, For Makin' Whoopee|7.02]] â€¢ [[Lorelai's First Cotillion|7.03]] â€¢ [['S Wonderful, 'S Marvelous|7.04]] â€¢ [[The Great Stink|7.05]] â€¢ [[Go, Bulldogs!|7.06]] â€¢ [[French Twist|7.07]] â€¢ [[Introducing Lorelai Planetarium|7.08]] â€¢ [[Knit, People, Knit|7.09]] â€¢ [[Merry Fisticuffs|7.10]] â€¢ [[Merry Fisticuffs|7.11]] â€¢[[To Whom It May Concern|7.12]] â€¢ [[I'd Rather Be In Philadelphia|7.13]] â€¢ [[Farewell, My Pet|7.14]] â€¢ [[7.21 Unto the Breach|7.21]] ==Trivia== *The Offspring is his favorite band. [[Christopher Returns]] *He's known Lorelai since they were both six. *He is the only one who calls Lorelai "Lor". *[[Jackson Belleville]] thinks he looks more like George Clooney than Brad Pitt, and [[Andrew]] thinks he looks like Billy Crudup. [[Christopher Returns]] *He can play the opening lick to ''Smoke on the Water'' and ''Jumpin' Jack Flash'' on guitar. [[Christopher Returns]] *He owns/owned a red 2000 Indian motorcycle.
