{{Infobox character |Title = Lucas "Luke" Danes |Actor = Scott Patterson |Image = luke 01.jpg |First = [[1.01|Pilot]] |Last = [[7.22 Bon Voyage|Bon Voyage]] |Name = Luke Danes |Age = N/A |Family = [[Nicole Leahy]] (ex-wife)
[[Liz Danes]] (sister)
[[T.J.]] (brother-in-law)
[[April Nardini]] (daughter)
[[Jess Mariano]] (nephew)
[[Dula]] (niece)
Louie(uncle, deceased) }} '''Lucas "Luke" Danes''' is [[Stars Hollow]]'s local diner owner. He is hinted at being a few years older than Lorelai. ==Character Description== He has lived in Stars Hollow his entire life, and his dad's hardware store (William's Hardware, in the middle of town) became his diner after his dad passed away. While his father was heavily involved in town events, Luke has resisted all of them, including most Town Meetings and the War Re-enactments. Luke attended Stars Hollow High where he Lettered in Track (hurdles), a successful team that went to the State Finals more than once, and won twice. After his father died, Luke moved into the office above the diner and converted it to an apartment. He lived there alone until his nephew [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] was sent by his mother to live with Luke. Luke has an ongoing animosity towards Stars Hollow's unofficial leader, [[Taylor Doose]], who continually harasses Luke. Taylor opens an Old Fashioned Ice Cream shop next door, installing a viewing window between the two shops, without asking Luke's permission. Taylor also destroys the shop front of the Diner in [[Season 7]] by causing a car to crash though the front window. The focal point of much of the show, however is Luke's long term love interest, Lorelai Gilmore. Since Lorelai doesn't cook, Luke feeds [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]. Luke's Diner is included in every episode. It is is a big part of their life. But their relationship runs deeper than that. From episode one, Luke and Lorelai have a chemistry that show writers acted on, although it took four seasons for this relationship to eventuate. In season one, Luke's past flame, Rachel (who is "Elle McPherson pretty") returns to Luke's life. While happy to see her, he is apprehensive about what this reappearance means, as Rachel is an photographer and was never happy being in Stars Hollow, and left without a word previously. At the end of Season 1, Rachel leaves, citing another woman, Lorelai, as her reason. She says that she could see that Luke loves her even if he has never acted on it. However, Lorelai is engaged at the time and Luke doesn't act. When Lorelai tells Luke that the marriage fell apart, he is joyful and gives everyone free coffee that morning. In Season 3, Luke dates Taylor's lawyer, Nicole; eventually marrying her while on a cruise. This marriage turns out to be a mistake and they divorce when Luke discovers Nicole is seeing another man. This discovery also results in Luke's arrest for beating up "the other man's" car. At the end of season 4, after a flippant remark about self help books by Lorelai, Luke buys a book that makes him realize he is in love with Lorelai ("[[Luke Can See Her Face]]"). After taking Lorelai to his sister's wedding, Luke kisses Lorelai on the opening night of the Dragonfly Inn. In season 5, he takes her out on their first official date and tells her that he has saved a horoscope she gave him on the first day they met in his wallet. He has been pining for her ever since he met her ("[[Written in the Stars]]"). At the end of season 5, Lorelai proposes to Luke, and he quickly accepts. However, their relationship becomes more and more strained throughout season 6 as Luke pushes away his commitment to Lorelai to deal with the confusion caused due to his daughter, [[April Nardini|April]], who appears in his life as a 12 year old. April is a daughter of Anna Nardini, and old girlfriend of Luke's. He discovers his paternity when April conducts a science fair experiment to discover which of three men are her father. The inclusion of Anna into Luke's life causes much confusion for Luke who is unsure of how to combine his relationship with Lorelai with his blossoming relationship with his daughter. In the season 6 finale, Lorelai gives Luke an ultimatum - marry her now or never. Luke panics, and cannot commit, and Lorelai walks away. In the last scene of Season 6, we find Lorelai waking up in bed with [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]], Rory's father.Â  In Season 7, Lorelai starts dating Christopher as an adult and eventually gets married to him. The relationship between Luke and Lorelai is initially sour, especially after Lorelai tells Luke that she slept with Christopher, in a pivotal scene at the end of [[The Long Morrow|7.01]].Â In the scene, Luke drives to Lorelai's house, his truck full of supplies for their elopement, and tells her he is ready, before she tells him what happened. Eventually, a reconciliation occurs, Lorelai ends her marriage with Christopher and begins to rebuild her relationship with Luke. This relationship takes a massive step forward when Lorelai needs Luke's help with purchasing a new car and he goes to great lengths to help her. Audiences see a glimmer of hope in episode "[[7.20 Lorelai? Lorelai?|Lorelai? Lorelai?]]" where Luke returns to his signature blue baseball hat (a gift from Lorelai in [[season 1|season one]]) and a drunk Lorelai serenades Luke with "I Will Always Love You" at a karaoke party. The series ends with a kiss between Lorelai and Luke, after he worked all night to throw a goodbye party for Rory. What happens after that, we will never know, but it is strongly implied that Lorelai and Luke end the series romantically involved. You can imagine the bright future of Luke and Lorelai together. ==Trivia== *When he was younger he was a 'Trekkie'. ([[The Ins and Outs of Inns|2.08]]). *Has an uncle who was involved in the town. ([[Dead Uncles and Vegetables|2.17]]) *He lives in an apartment above the diner that used to be his father's old office. *He has a rule that Sookie cannot be behind the counter. However, that rule was broken when the inn caught fire and she had to cook for all of the displaced vacationers. *No cell phones are allowed in his diner, a rule that Lorelai flouts constantly. *He constantly fixes up things for Lorelai, a sign of his feelings towards her. *He doesn't like champagne. [[Written in the Stars]] *He was a record holder in track in high school. *His nickname was Butch in high school. *In high school he may or may not have made out with [[Carrie Duncan|Crazy Carrie]] under the bleachers during a football game. *Father William Danes died on the 30th November ===Character Quirks=== *Presented as a health nut concerned about Rory and Lorelai's unhealthy food habits, although this is toned down in later episodes. *Has adverse reactions to hospitals. ([[Forgiveness and Stuff|1.10]]) *Kept his father's hardware shop as it was externally, but turned it into a diner. *Hates town events but attends town meetings. *Always wears flannel or plaid shirts, jeans and a blue backwards baseball cap. *He wore a brown baseball cap at the start of the show, but after Lorelai gives him a blue baseball cap as a present (1.10) he wears the same blue cap for the rest of the show. The only exception was when he wore a black baseball cap after he and Lorelai's engagement broke off. *Has broken his nose at least twice, the first time as a kid during his "hockey phase". ([[Women Of Questionable Morals|5.11]]) *Gets frustrated a lot and has regular tiffs with [[Taylor Doose]]. *Once a year on the anniversary of his Dad's death Luke has a "dark day ", he closes the diner and isolates himself *Hates both coffee and champagne *Often goes to bed early because he has to get up early to run the diner *Is almost as devoted to Rory as he is to Lorelai, certainly he is more protective *Becomes Godfather to Lane and Zach 's twin baby boys *Luke can dance - which impresses Lorelai ! *Likes to camp and go fishing ==Relationships== ===Rachel=== High school sweethearts ===Anna Nardini=== Ex-Girlfriend; Mother of Luke's daughter April Nardini ===Nicole Leahy=== Ex-wife ===Lorelai Gilmore=== Former-Fiance; Current girlfriend ==References== [[Category:Characters|Danes, Luke]] [[Category:Danes family|Danes, Luke]] [[Category:Stars Hollow|Danes, Luke]] [[Category:Stars Hollow Residents|Danes, Luke]] [[Category:Luke's Diner|Danes, Luke]] [[Category:Lorelai's Romantic Interests|Danes, Luke]]

{{Infobox character | Title=Paris Geller | Image=Paris1.jpg | First=[[The Lorelais' First Day at Chilton]] | Last=[[7.21 Unto the Breach]] | Name=Paris Geller | Age=16-22 | Actor=Liza Weil | Family=}} [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] meets '''Paris Eustace Geller''' (portrayed by [[Liza Weil]]) on her first day at [[Chilton]]. From the beginning, Paris is a very driven person, putting anything that will get her into her dream school, Harvard, above all else. Throughout high school she seeks out every position she can hold, becoming both editor of the school paper, the [[Franklin]], and president of the student council.
[[Madeline Lynn]] and [[Louise Grant]] are her two oldest friends in high school, though they are very different people. Madeline and Louise care more about boys and fashion then they seem to care about school.
Rory and Paris have an interesting relationship throughout the series. They start out as rivals, as if Paris feels threatened by Rory. She doesn't want to lose her top of the class standing, and feels that Rory could be the one to knock her out of the top. They become friends over Rory's three years at Chilton, though they have several road blocks in their friendship. At the end of their junior year of high school, Paris asks Rory to become her vice-presidential candidate for student council. Over the next year, their "professional" relationship doesn't even keep them friends, as [[Francie Jarvis]] manipulates Paris into thinking that Rory broke her trust by telling about her boyfriend, [[Jamie]], who she meet over the summer in Washington D.C. at the leadership camp she attended for student government.
After Paris is rejected by Harvard at the end of her senior year in Chilton, she later surprises Rory on her first day of [[Yale]] as her new roommate. Paris had arranged it after her life coach, [[Terrance]], told her that her "journey" with Rory wasn't quite over. In her freshman year at Yale, Paris joins the [[Yale Daily News]] and ends up breaking up with her boyfriend Jamie for an older man, who is a professor. She begins dating Professor [[Asher Flemming]], and ends up traveling with him to England, where he dies during one of his classes. She spends the beginning of her sophomore year grieving for him and also set up a wake.
It is also said during season 4 that Paris thinks Richard Gilmore (Rory's Grandfather) is good looking! Rory tries to ignore this comment.
During her sophomore year, she begins dating [[Doyle]], the editor of the Yale Daily News, and at the beginning of her Junior year (season 6) she is made editor of the Daily News. She becomes power crazy and won't let anything go to print without it being perfect by her standards, which drives the rest of the staff of the paper to oust her. She is replaced with Rory, which results in her being kicked out of their apartment. Rory has no other option but to move in with her boyfriend, [[Logan Huntzberger]]. Rory and Paris become roommates again (along with her boyfriend Doyle) (in season 7), this time with a binding lease so that Paris can't move every item of Rory's out into the hall again.
In preparation for graduation, Paris institutes "Operation Finish Line," with Rory, an obsessive program designed to maximize their choices after graduation. This succeeds beyond her dreams, and she is accepted to multiple law schools and medical schools. Paris is immediately distressed about finally having to make a choice that will have such a profound effect on the remainder of her life. To this end, in order to think rationally and clear her plate of any undue influence, she breaks up with Doyle. Doyle however, will not accept her breakup and vows to follow her wherever she goes.
Paris then decides that she would be going to medical school as she had always dreamed to be a doctor.

==Trivia==
*Paris is left-handed. *Paris has mentioned that she is Jewish. *Paris knows some Portugese through her nanny. *Near the end of her stay at Yale, she could speak Chinese, Farsi, and a smattering of ancient Aramaic. *Before working Rory's DAR event, she had never had any job experience. *She keeps a smattering of anti-anxiety pills in the bottom of her purse. *Her trust fund doesn't kick in until she turns 25. *Her Bat Mitzah dress had menorahs sewn on the collar. *Her cousin took her to Chilton's winter formal during her sophomore year; her mother had to ask him, and Paris had to give him gas money to make him actually do it. *She had a huge crush on Tristan. *She has read the Iliad at least three times. *She plays Monopoly with her nanny when her parents are out of town; she always beats her. *She lost her virginity to her first boyfriend, Jamie, who was a Princeton man. *Five generations of her family have been accepted into Harvard. *Her mother was a top student at Harvard. [[Category:Characters|Geller, Paris]] [[Category:Chilton|Geller, Paris]] [[Category:Yale|Geller, Paris]] [[Category:Yale Daily News|Geller, Paris]]

[[Image:Stars_Hollow_sign.jpg|250px|right]] '''Stars Hollow''' is the small town [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] live in.
The show Gilmore Girls takes place in a make-believe town, that Amy Sherman-Palladino created, called Stars Hollow. Lorelai came from a wealthy family with everything open to her, but ended up in the small town in Conneticut. Through out the show you learn about how Stars Hollow was founded and how it was named. The Revolutionary War plays a frequent role in the town's past. But what really makes this town so special are the people living there and the businesses that are so very popular. Click to picture of the gazebo below to learn more about each place in Stars Hollow. =='''Notable inhabitants'''== [[Lorelai Gilmore]]

{{Infobox character |Title = April Nardini |Actor = Vanessa Marano |Image = April.jpg |First = [[The Prodigal Daughter Returns]] |Last = [[Lorelai? Lorelai?]] |Name = April Nardini |Age = 13 |Family = [[Anna Nardini]] (mother)
[[Luke Danes]] (father)
[[Liz Danes]] (aunt)
[[Jess Mariano]] (cousin)
[[Dula]] (cousin)}}'''April Nardini''' discovered she was the daughter of [[Luke Danes]] after testing the DNA of three different men who were with her mother [[Anna Nardini]] at the time of her conception ([[The Prodigal Daughter Returns]]). ==Background== Anna had no inclination to tell Luke that he had a daughter. April only did the DNA test to win a science fair. Luke, after the slightly strange confrontation with April, decided to go down to the science fair and find out the results. Luke and April have grown to know each other at Luke's insistence and she has endeavored to introduce Luke to new things, like Target stores. April and Lukes relationship gets better and better after Lukes goes on class tour to philaldelphia with April. They start doing a lot of stuff together, but Luke does not want Lorelai to get involved with April, because he is afraid that she will like Lorelai better than him. But when Luke decides to throw April a bithday party, and everyone is really bored, Lorelai comes to help out. Everything goes fine until Anna finds out that Luke left Lorelai alone with the kids all night. She doesn't want that and after that April becomes a breaking point in Luke's and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]]'s relationship, whereby Lorelai forces Luke to make a decision about their planned wedding, despite the additional complications posed by April, that Luke became overwhelmed with. Luke refuses to make a decision, which leads to a breakup at the end of [[Season 6]]. In Season 7, Anna's mother gets very sick and Anna goes to live with her for a few months. In the meantime, April lives with Luke in Stars Hollow and goes back and forth to her school. Anna returns and tells Luke that she is going to move to New Mexico to be with her mother, taking April away from Luke. Luke gives Anna a proposal, of how often he would like to see April. But, Anna declines it, telling him that since she is her mother, that leaves all decisions up to her. Luke goes and yells at Anna and tells her it is not fair what she is doing to him, since she didn't even tell him that April existed. After that, Anna prohibits him from seeing her at all. Luke sues Anna for joint custody, and with a big help to Lorelai's character reference wins the case. With that, he gains custody to have April for either Christmas or Thanksgiving, spring break, and a month of the summer. She returns to Stars Hollow a couple of times in the rest of the series after Anna and her move away.[[File:Screen_shot_2012-07-30_at_11.30.53_PM.png|thumb]] ==Appearances== [[The Prodigal Daughter Returns|6.9]] [[Just Like Gwen and Gavin|6.12]] [[Friday Night's Alright For Fighting|6.13]] [[The Real Paul Anka|6.18]] [[Super Cool Party People|6.20]] [['S Wonderful, 'S Marvelous|7.4]] [[Go, Bulldogs!|7.6]] [[Introducing Lorelai Planetarium|7.8]] [[Knit, People, Knit|7.9]] [[Santa's Secret Stuff|7.11]] [[Will You Be My Lorelai Gilmore? (for merging)|7.16]] [[Hay Bale Maze|7.18]] [[7.20 Lorelai? Lorelai?|7.20]] ==Trivia== *She goes to school year-round. *She was on her school's swim team in both Connecticut and New Mexico. *After a bout of appendicitis, she had to get her appendix removed. *She went through a Deenie stage, in which she decided to wear a back brace. *Her uncle (Anna's brother) is a scientist who helped April with her science fair project. '''{{Template:Episode |name = Rory's Dance |image = [[File:109.jpg|280px]] |season = 1 |ep_num = 9 |date = December 20, 2000 |writer = Amy Sherman-Palladino |director = Lesli linka Glatter |prev = [[Love and War and Snow]] |next = [[Forgiveness and Stuff]]}}'''Rory's Dance''' is the nineth episode in season oneÂ of Gilmore Girls.Â ''' ==Summary== Chilton hosts a dance which [[Rory]] and [[Dean]] attend, confirming they are "boyfriend-girlfriend." [[Emily]] sleeps over at [[Lorelai]]'s to take care of Lorelai's injured back. Rory and Dean fall asleep accidentally, causing Rory to arrive home at 5 a.m., which pushes Emily to think they had sex. This causes another blow up between Lorelai and her mother.Â  ==PlotÂ == Richard is away in Prague, so it's just the girls on Friday night, and Emily knows from the Chilton newsletter that there's a formal coming up. But Rory doesn't think she'll go. Emily just can't understand why, so she blames Lorelai who clearly must have encouraged Rory to develop disdain for formals. Lorelai ignores the accusations, but in the car home, Lorelai wants to know why Rory's not going. After all, she's never been to one and is probably basing her opinion on one viewing of Sixteen Candles. Lorelai just doesn't want Rory not to go because she's afraid. Does Rory not join in on stuff because she really doesn't want to or because she's really just shy? Maybe Rory is just shy, so that means she might be going to her very first dance. And that means asking Dean to go with her. But what if he says no? Lane says there's no point in having a boyfriend if he won't go to a dance with you. Rory isn't really sure if he's her boyfriend or she's his girlfriend. Maybe it's time to have a talk with him? Lane wants Rory to ask Dean right then and there while he's bagging groceries. (Her mom took away the TV after she caught Lane watching VIP so she needs some form of entertainment.) Rory agrees to take the plunge and ask her "boyfriend" to the Chilton formal. While Dean puts the new green-bean shipment on the shelf, Rory does her best to ask Dean out, but he's not a joiner and doesn't really "do" dances. However, he can tell Rory really wants to go, even though she tries to play it cool. Dean agrees to the dance, even though he has to wear a coat and tie. Rory is so excited that she plants a kiss right on him in the vegetable aisle. Later, Lorelai goes to work on a fancy dress for Rory, and Emily, for one, is thrilled about Rory's attendance, although she's not that happy about the homemade duds. Her only request is that Lorelai take lots of pictures so she can mark this once in a lifetime event. After all, Emily won't be there to see it. In the end, her whining gets her an invite on Saturday to watch Rory go to the dance. Rory gets in line to buy dance tickets at school, and Tristan is desperate to know whom she's taking. He claims he wanted to ask her himself. Rory doesn't buy it; why would she want to go anywhere with Tristan, ever? Paris overhears her and refuses to believe that Rory might bring someone better than Tristan. Saturday night arrives, and Rory looks like a dancing queen, hairspray, heels and all. Emily arrives with her camera and thinks Lorelai actually bought the dress because it looks so good. When Rory tries to run out, Emily refuses to let her go; Dean must come to the door, it's the proper thing to do. He honks and honks (this was the agreed upon plan) and honks until finally he comes to the door and gets ambushed by Emily. After brief introductions, Rory and Dean bail quickly, leaving Emily to grill Lorelai about the merits or lack thereof in regards to Dean. Then, to the horror of Lorelai, Emily insists on staying the night because Lorelai is having a back spasm and can't move off the couch. On the way to the dance, Rory starts having second thoughts, maybe they shouldn't go. Dean is agreeable to whatever she wants. But when he tells her that she looks amazing, Rory suddenly feels like the night won't be so bad after all. When they get there, the place looks pretty amazing too, and Dean suggests that they dance (just a little) before they bail on the event. Dean catches that attention of some Chilton girls, Louise and Natalie, particularly nasty girls who flirt shamelessly with Dean until he puts his arm around Rory and makes it very clear that he's taken. Then Rory and Dean slow dance, and Dean kisses her while Tristan watches from afar. Looks like he's got a little longing in his eyes. While Dean gets punch, Paris's date, Jacob, tries to ask out Rory. Turns out Jacob is Paris's cousin, which makes Rory smile, but that doesn't mean she's at all interested. He doesn't hold a candle to Dean. Meanwhile, Lorelai and Emily are actually having a nice time together. Emily even compliments Lorelai on the job she did with the dress and with Rory. After a little time at the dance, Dean suggests leaving, getting a cup of coffee, and hanging, just the two of them. Rory's down with that; and while he gets their coats, Paris demands to know how many people know that she brought her cousin to the dance. Paris freaks out, starts yelling and essentially spills her own beans to the whole Chilton class. Tristan meanwhile confronts Dean, gets up in his face, and starts to cause trouble. Dean gives just as good as he gets, but Tristan keeps the insults flying; he's clearly trying to start a fight. Rory tries to stop it, but Tristan then gets up in her face. Dean pushes him aside and then, boom, it's a little fight. "You will not come near her ever again," are Dean's final words to Tristan. Back at the Gilmore house, Lorelai falls asleep on the couch, and Emily tucks her in. It's a sweet mother/daughter moment, especially when a sleepy Lorelai whispers, "Thank you, Mommy." The look on Emily's face almost breaks your heart. Meanwhile, Rory and Dean sip coffee and talk about the night's events. Rory doesn't know how to feel, having her boyfriend defend her honor. Boyfriend? Rory backs up and starts rambling, she doesn't think Dean is her boyfriend. But, then has to ask, is he her boyfriend? Dean says he is if she wants him to be. She does, so he is. As they walk in town, they pass Miss Patty's dance studio, which has been left unlocked. They take a little tour. Then, Dean gets a feel for Rory's purse, which is pretty heavy because there's a book inside. A book? Well, it's just a habit of Rory's, she takes one wherever she goes. And tonight, she's got The Portable Dorothy Parker. They spend the rest of the night reading and smooching and then fall asleep right there. In the morning, Miss Patty and her dancers find them conked out and wake them up. Rory bails alone even though Dean begs to go with her so he can explain the situation to her Mom. Rory refuses to let him go; all she knows is that she has to get home now! As for Lorelai and Emily, they are having a meltdown of course, until Miss Patty calls to give them the details. So what really happened? Before Rory gets there to explain the details, Emily assumes the worst but Lorelai isn't ready to judge her daughter. And any closeness these two had goes right out the window. Basically, if Emily can't see the good that Lorelai has done, the life she's built and the beautiful daughter she has, then Emily shouldn't be in this house. Emily walks out as Rory comes home. Despite her daughter's apologies, Lorelai freaks out on Rory, big time. How could she do this, especially when Emily was there to witness it? So, is this about Emily or Rory? Lorelai tells Rory she should go on the pill, but that's crazy talk and Rory knows it. Lorelai knows it deep down too. Rory admits she made a mistake and fell asleep, but that's all it was and she shouldn't have to take crap from Lorelai because of a huge fight with Emily. Rory heads to her room, clearly upset about her mom's lack of trust, and this is one fight that won't be resolved right away. Â  ==Music== *"We're All Light" by The Churchills *"Mixed Bizness" by Beck *"Sometimes Always" by Jesus and Mary Chain *"Thirteen" by Big Star *"Fade Into You" by Mazzy Star ==References== ===Music=== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/98_Degrees 98 Degrees], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_waits Tom Waits] ===Books=== *[http://www.amazon.com/Portable-Dorothy-Parker-Viking-Library/dp/0140150749 The Portable Dorothy Parker] by Dorothy Parker and Brendan Gill *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Group_%28novel%29 The Group] by Mary McCarthy ===Movies=== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midnight_Express_%28film%29 Midnight Express] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sixteen_candles Sixteen Candles] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fried_Green_Tomatoes_%28film%29 Fried Green Tomatoes] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Streetcar_Named_Desire_%281951_film%29 A Streetcar Named Desire] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Outsiders_%28film%29 The Outsiders] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gone_with_the_Wind_%28film%29 Gone with the Wind] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Double_Indemnity_%28film%29 Double Indemnity] ===Pop Culture=== '''Lane''': No, you have to do this now.
'''Rory''': Why?
'''Lane''': Because I have to go home soon and my mom threw out our TV after she caught me watching [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V.I.P._%28TV_series%29 V.I.P.] '''Lorelai''': Become a crazy [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oscar_Levant Oscar Levant] kind of celebrity, go on talk shows, heckle Regis. '''Tristan''': The guy's supposed to buy the tickets.
'''Rory''': Really? Does [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Susan_Faludi Susan Faludi] know about this? '''Tristan''': Look, I'll confess something to you. I don't have a date.
'''Rory''': I hear [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Squeaky_Fromme Squeaky Fromme] is up for parole soon. '''Lorelai''': Wow, Mom, look at you. You'd think [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ann_Taylor_%28clothing_retailer%29 Ann Taylor] was having a sale or something. '''Lorelai''': Hey, Dean, meet my mother, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emily_Post Emily Post]. '''Lorelai''': You know, Mom, you have a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barbara_Stanwyck Barbara Stanwyck]-y voice.
'''Emily''': Oh, I do not.
'''Lorelai''': I mean it. You could have gotten [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_MacMurray Fred MacMurray] to off Dad if you'd really wanted to. '''Dean''' (to Tristan): Get out of my way, [http://www.dristan.com/ Dristan]. ==Memorable Quotes== ==Trivia== [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 1 episodes]]

{{BackLink|Portal:Main Characters}} {{Infobox character |Title=Logan Huntzberger |Image=Logan1.jpg |First=[[Written in the Stars|5.03]] |Last=[[7.21 Unto the Breach|7.21]] |Name=Logan Huntzberger |Age=25 |Actor=Matt Czuchry |Family=[[Shira Huntzberger]] (mother)
[[Mitchum Huntzberger]] (father)
[[Honor Huntzberger]] (sister)
[[Elias Huntzberger]] (grandfather) }} '''Logan Huntzberger''' was [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]'s third serious boyfriend. ==Character description== Logan is the son of [[Mitchum Huntzberger]], a successful newspaper magnate. Logan attended a variety of boarding schools in Massachusetts such as Groton, Rivers, Exeter, and Andover where it is presumed that he graduated. The Huntzberger family is what can be described as "old money". It is shown that his father loves Logan but at times treats him more like an heir than his son. His mother [[Shira Huntzberger|Shira]] tends to be snobby even though she doesn't come from "old money" herself. Logan and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] met while attending [[Yale]] through Rory's friend [[Marty]]. Both Rory and Logan worked at the [[Yale Daily News]], although Logan's appearance in the news room was uncommon and annoyed [[Doyle McCaster|Doyle]], the editor of the Yale Daily News every time he did bother to show up. Logan often refers to Rory as "Ace" because she wants to be a reporter. The nickname becomes a sweet term of endearment. Rory enlists Logan's help on a article for a secret society Logan was in called the [[Life and Death Brigade]]. Logan takes her to a secret event party in the woods ([[You Jump, I Jump, Jack|5.07]]). Through that event, Rory becomes fascinated with the club and with Logan. She is convinced to take a dangerous jump with Logan. After this, Logan and Rory's paths cross more developing a tentative friendship with Logan comforting Rory at a party her grandparents threw for her where [[Dean Forester|Dean]] broke up with her. Logan causes a fake fight for Rory as a prank but Rory gets him back by enlisting her grandfather to trick them into an engagement. Rory soon develops a crush on Logan and admits it at her grandparents vow renewal. Logan admits he likes her back but is not a commitment guy. Therefore, Rory and Logan agree to a no-strings relationship that lasts until mid S5 when Rory realizes that she can't do it and wants to be friends again. However, Logan takes it as a ultimatum and the two of them start dating. Rory is Logan's first serious girlfriend, except for when he was ten and claimed actress Alyssa Milano held the position, as revealed by his sister Honor. Rory and Logan's relationship survives many hurdles first his mother's and grandfather's disapproval of Rory because she wants to work instead of staying home and planning parties. However, Logan does not pay heed to what his family says and still stays with Rory. Logan also comforts Rory when his father says that Rory is not cut out to be a journalist. Logan supports Rory when she decides to take a break from Yale even though he believes that she will eventually come back to Yale. Logan suffered a grievous injury during a trip with The Life and Death Brigade. Logan has been strongly encouraged, even forced, by his father to enter the family business. At the end of season six, Logan moves to London to join his family business. Surprisingly, after the conflict he suffers with his father earlier, he takes his new responsibilities seriously, and does his job well. Unfortunately, after he loses money after a badly thought-out investment in a new media company (the company violated another person's patent rights, and the third company waited until a larger company with deeper pockets bought it to sue for infringement), Logan regresses and acts irresponsibly once more by taking a trip to Vegas with Life and Death Brigade colleagues, Colin and Finn. He finally tells his father that he won't be part of the family business anymore, and starts to straighten out again. After he gets an offer for a new job in California, Logan proposes to Rory. She considers, but turns him down, feeling she wants to accomplish other things first. She asks if they can continue their relationship in a long distance form but Logan decides that it would be too hard for him to continue seeing Rory after the proposal and after moving, he gives her an ultimatum, all or nothing. {{Infobox cast |Title = Lauren Helen Graham |Character = Lorelai Gilmore |Image = Lauren_Graham.jpg |First = [[Pilot]] |Last = [[7.22 Bon Voyage|Bon Voyage]] |BirthDate = March 16, 1967 |Age = 46 }} __TOC__ =Biography= Early life Graham was born in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Honolulu Honolulu], Hawaii, the daughter of Donna Grant, a fashion buyer, and Lawrence Graham, a candy industry lobbyist[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-0 [1]] who is the current president for [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Confectioners_Association National Confectioners Association]. Graham is Irish Catholic.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-1 [2]] Graham's parents were divorced when she was only five years old, and Graham moved to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington,_D.C. Washington, D.C.], where her father became a congressional staffer.[''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed citation needed]''] As a girl, Graham rode horses competitively, but soon switched to acting,[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-parade-2 [3]] honing her talent at [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Langley_High_School_(Fairfax_County,_Virginia) Langley High School], where she took part in the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drill_team drill team].[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-3 [4]] She earned her actor's equity card in 1988 after two years in summer stock at the Barn Theatre in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Augusta,_Michigan Augusta, Michigan].[''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed citation needed]''] Graham graduated from [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barnard_College Barnard College] in 1988 with a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bachelor_of_Arts Bachelor of Arts] degree in English.[''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed citation needed]''] After moving to Texas in 1992, she earned a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Master_of_Fine_Arts Master of Fine Arts] in Acting Performance from [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southern_Methodist_University Southern Methodist University].[''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed citation needed]''] ==[[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lauren_Graham&action=edit§ion=2&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro edit]] Career== After completing her education, Graham moved back to New York City where she became a waitress and aspiring actress, including her first paid work doing publicity appearances wearing the costume of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_mascot Striker], the dog [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mascot mascot] of the US-based [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1994_FIFA_World_Cup 1994 FIFA World Cup].[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-4 [5]] In 1995, she relocated to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hollywood,_California Hollywood, California]. She appeared in various commercials for products such as [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dimetapp Dimetapp] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lean_Cuisine Lean Cuisine] and hosted [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_preview free preview] weekends on [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Movie_Channel The Movie Channel].[''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed citation needed]''] In addition to her many guest starring and co-starring roles on prime-time television, Graham starred in three failed sitcoms, including ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Townies Townies]'' (with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Molly_Ringwald Molly Ringwald] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jenna_Elfman Jenna Elfman]) and the short-lived sitcom ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lush_Life_(TV_series) Lush Life]'' (with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lori_Petty Lori Petty] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karyn_Parsons Karyn Parsons]).[''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed citation needed]''] Between 1996 and 1997, Graham became a regular guest star on several hit NBC shows. She played a graduate student who caught the eye of Dick on ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/3rd_Rock_from_the_Sun 3rd Rock from the Sun],'' Richard's dim-witted girlfriend on ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caroline_in_the_City Caroline in the City],'' and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerry_Seinfeld_(character) Jerry]'s speed-dial ranking girlfriend on ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seinfeld Seinfeld].'' She played a Hollywood producer who had a love interest in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rey_Curtis Rey Curtis] in a three-part episode of ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_%26_Order Law & Order],'' where she acted opposite [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Cohen_(actor) Scott Cohen], who would later play one of Graham's love interests, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Max_Medina Max Medina], on ''Gilmore Girls''. She also portrayed a villainous [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Efficiency_expert efficiency expert] on ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newsradio Newsradio].'' In 2000, Graham landed her breakthrough role as [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lorelai_Gilmore Lorelai Gilmore] on ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilmore_Girls Gilmore Girls]''. For her work she received a nomination for Best Actress in a Television Series (Drama) at the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2001_Golden_Globe_Awards 2001 Golden Globe Awards]. Beginning with Season 7 episode "To Whom It May Concern" and continuing throughout the rest of the season, Graham served as a producer on ''Gilmore Girls.'' ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TV_Guide TV Guide]'' reported that she received the position in an attempt to persuade her to sign for an eighth season.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-TVGuide-5 [6]][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-Zap2it-6 [7]] Graham returned to her guest-starring roots when she portrayed herself in two episodes of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NBC NBC]'s ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Studio_60_on_the_Sunset_Strip Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip]''. Graham has also appeared on [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bravo_(US_TV_channel) Bravo]'s ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Celebrity_Poker_Showdown Celebrity Poker Showdown],'' co-hosted by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dave_Foley Dave Foley] of ''Newsradio''. After winning her preliminary match, she came in second to another former ''Newsradio'' star, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maura_Tierney Maura Tierney], in the championship game.[''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed citation needed]''] Graham's film roles encompass several [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_University NYU] student films and multiple major studio releases, including ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sweet_November_(2001_film) Sweet November]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bad_Santa Bad Santa]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Pacifier The Pacifier]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Because_I_Said_So_(film) Because I Said So]'', and ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evan_Almighty Evan Almighty]''. Graham has said that she enjoys playing in short films, and acting in the Williamstown Theatre Festival.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-7 [8]] She has performed in numerous short films, including the 15-minute long ''Gnome''. In 2007, Graham signed a seven-figure development deal with NBC in one of the year's richest TV talent pacts.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-8 [9]] Graham has also worked as the voice-over announcer in national advertising for [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kellogg%27s Kellogg's] various [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special_K Special K] products, and in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Express American Express] ads introducing the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Express_Plum_Card Plum Card], which is targeted towards [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_business small] and growing businesses.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-9 [10]] Graham made her [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Broadway_theatre Broadway] debut as Miss Adelaide in the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Revival_(theatre) revival] of ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guys_and_Dolls_(musical) Guys and Dolls]'', which began preview performances at the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nederlander_Theatre Nederlander Theatre] on February 5, 2009 and opened on March 1, 2009. Initial reviews for this performance have been mixed, but generally regard her fresh take on the character as a success. The production closed June 14, playing 113 shows and 28 previews.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-10 [11]][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-11 [12]] It was announced in January 2009 that Graham would star in the comedy pilot, ''The Bridget Show'' (previously ''Let It Go'') for [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Broadcasting_Company ABC] playing a talk show host and self-help guru who fails to follow her own advice during a breakup. However, the pilot was not given a series order.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-12 [13]][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-letitgo-13 [14]] On October 9, 2009, it was announced that Graham would replace [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maura_Tierney Maura Tierney] in the television series ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parenthood_(2010_TV_series) Parenthood]'' as single mother Sarah Braverman. Tierney left the show to seek treatment for cancer.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-14 [15]] The series debuted on NBC the following year, and was later renewed for a second season.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-15 [16]] In June 2010, it was confirmed that Graham would star in the upcoming ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scream_4 Scream 4]'',[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-Scream-16 [17]] but she left the project on June 30, 2010.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-Scream-cut-17 [18]] ==[[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lauren_Graham&action=edit§ion=3&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro edit]] Personal life== Graham is currently dating her Parenthood co-star Peter Krause[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham#cite_note-okmagazine-18 19]] =Filmography= * Birds of America (2008) * Evan Almighty (2007) * Because I Said So (2007) * The Moguls (2005) * The Pacifier (2005) * The Life Coach (2005) * Lucky 13 (2005/I) * Seeing Other People (2004) * Bad Santa (2003) * The Third Wheel (2002) (uncredited) * Chasing Destiny (2001) * Sweet November (2001) * Dill Scallion (1999) * One True Thing (1998) * Confessions of a Sexist Pig (1998) =External Links= [http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0334179/ IMDB]
[http://www.becauseisaidsomovie.com/ Because I Said So]

{{Infobox character |Title=Miss Patty |Image=Liztorres2.jpg |First=[[Pilot]] |Last=[[7.22 Bon Voyage|Bon Voyage]] |Name=Patricia LaCosta |Age= |Actor=Liz Torres |Family=None mentioned but she has been married several times }} '''Miss Patty''' runs a dance studio in [[Stars Hollow]] and had a career in show business as a dancer. She is notorious gossip who frequently shares information with [[Babette Dell]] among others. Soft-married, oft-divorced dance instructor. She often makes name-dropping references to her past as a dancer and singer; how much of it is true is unknown. She's usually seen lusting after young men and wishing she could marry again. She and Babette know most of the gossip of the town, though Babette mentions that Patty normally gets the town gossip before her because her phone intercepts other people's phone calls. After (or perhaps even before) Taylor, she seems to be the most influential citizen of Stars Hollow. Her dance studio is used for town meetings, among other community events.

{{BackLink|Portal:Supporting Characters}} {{Infobox character |Title = Sookie St. James |Actor = Melissa McCarthy |Image = Sookie1.jpg |First = [[Pilot (Episode 1.01)|Pilot]] |Last = [[7.22|Bon Voyage]] |Name = Sookie St. James |Age = N/A |Family = [[Jackson Melville]] (husband)
Davey (son)
Martha (daughter) }} '''Sookie St. James''' (portrayed by [[Melissa McCarthy]]) is, next to [[Rory]], the best friend of [[Lorelai]]. We get to know her as the chef of the [[Independence Inn]] and she eventually co-owns the [[Dragonfly Inn]] with Lorelai. Sookie is a quirky, fun-loving person who is always bubbly and upbeat. However, she is often overly perfectionist with her food creations, and tends to create havoc in the kitchen when she is in top form. In season one Sookie goes on a date with the Inn's produce man, Jackson Belleville. The two get into fights over food orders and other small things as they did before they began dating. Their first date begins awkwardly as a double date with Lorelai who is set up with Jackson's cousin Rune, but leads to a relationship between the two. They fall in love and get married in season two. During the show Sookie and her husband have two children, and another along the way at the end of season seven. ==Appearances== [[File:Screen_shot_2012-07-31_at_12.01.43_AM.png|thumb]] ===Season 1=== Biography Matt Czuchry was born on May 20 1977 and is an American actor. Czuchry was born in Manchester, New Hampshire but grew up in Johnson City, Tennessee. He attended College of Charleston. Czuchry won the Mr. College of Charleston pageant in 1998 and graduated with honors in 1999 with a Bachelor of Arts degree in History and Political Science. He got into college with a tennis scholarship, was captain of the mens tennis team and was a ranked player in the NCAA ranked player in the Southern Conference. During his role on The WB's "Young Americans" he met Kate Bosworth whom he dated from 2000 to 2002.
=Filmography= Eight Legged Freaks (2002)- Bret
Slap Her... She's French (otherwise known as) She Gets What She Wants (2002)- Kyle Fuller
A Midsummer Night's Rave (2002)- Evan
Advantage Hart (2003)- October
Hooked (2003)- Scotty
I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell (2009) - Tucker Max

{{BackLink|Portal:Supporting Characters}} {{Infobox character | Title=Jackson Belleville | Image=http://30.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_l173xfz2AK1qzxaojo1_400.jpg | First = [[Pilot]] | Last = [[7.22|Bon Voyage]] | Name=Jackson Belleville | Age=N/A | Actor=Jackson Douglas | Family=[[Sookie St. James]] (wife)
[[Davey]] (son)
[[Martha]] (daughter)
[[Rune]] (cousin)|ImageSize = /Users/paws234/Desktop/tumblr_l173xfz2AK1qzxaojo1_400.jpg}} '''Jackson Belleville''' is a farmer and the produce supplier for the [[Independence Inn]] and later on the Dragonfly Inn. He would frequently get into fights about the quality of the vegetables with [[Sookie]]. Sookie asks him out on a date in [[1.11]]. Their first date is an awkward double date with [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and Jackson's cousin [[Rune]], but once they ditch Rune and Lorelai, they have a good time together ([[Double Date|1.12]]). Jackson proposes to Sookie during the "[[A Tisket, A Tasket|Stars Hollow Bid on a Basket Fundraiser]]", and they get married at the Independence Inn in the [[I Can't Get Started|Season 2 finale]]. They have two children, Davey (born in Season 4) and Martha (born in Season 5/6), and during Season 7 Sookie is pregnant with their third child. In Season 5, Jackson defeats [[Taylor Doose]] to become Town Selectman ([[Tippecanoe and Taylor, Too|5.04]]). However, he dislikes being Town Selectman, and eventually Taylor takes over the position. ==Appearances== ===Season 1=== [[Pilot|1.01]] â€¢ [[1.02]] â€¢ [[1.03]] â€¢ [[1.04]] â€¢ [[1.06]] â€¢ [[1.11]] â€¢ [[Double Date|1.12]] â€¢ [[Christopher Returns|1.15]] â€¢ [[1.16]] â€¢ [[1.17]] â€¢ [[1.19]] ===Season 2=== [[2.01]] â€¢ [[2.02]] â€¢ [[2.05]] â€¢ [[2.10]] â€¢ [[2.11]] â€¢ [[2.13]] â€¢ [[2.17]] â€¢ [[Lorelai's Graduation Day|2.21]] â€¢ [[2.22]] ===Season 3=== [[3.01]] â€¢ [[3.03]] â€¢ [[3.06]] â€¢ [[3.07]] â€¢ [[3.09]] â€¢ [[3.11]] â€¢ [[3.14]] â€¢ [[3.16]] â€¢ [[3.18]] â€¢ [[3.22]] ===Season 4=== [[4.01]] â€¢ [[4.03]] â€¢ [[4.07]] â€¢ [[4.18]] â€¢ [[4.20]] â€¢ [[4.21]] â€¢ [[4.22]] ===Season 5=== [[5.01]] â€¢ [[Tippecanoe and Taylor, Too|5.04]] â€¢ [[5.05]] â€¢ [[5.09]] â€¢ [[5.12]] â€¢ [[5.19]] â€¢ [[5.21]] ===Season 6=== [[6.04]] â€¢ [[6.05]] â€¢ [[6.09]] â€¢ [[6.19]] â€¢ [[6.21]] â€¢ [[6.22]] ===Season 7=== [[7.06]] â€¢ [[7.09]] â€¢ [[7.12]] â€¢ [[7.16 Will You Be My Lorelai Gilmore?|7.16]] â€¢ [[Hay Bale Maze|7.18]] â€¢ [[7.19 It's Just Like Riding a Bike|7.19]] â€¢ [[7.20 Lorelai? {{BackLink|Portal:Supporting Characters}}{{Infobox character | Title=Michel Gerard | Image=Michel1.jpg | First=[[Pilot]] | Last=[[7.22 Bon Voyage|Bon Voyage]] | Name=Michel Gerard | Age=N/A | Actor=Yanic Truesdale | Family=[[Giselle]] (mother) }} '''Michel Gerard''' is the hilarious concierge of the [[Independence Inn]] and later the [[Dragonfly Inn]]. He is often grumpy, sometimes unpleasant, a militant health nut, but always manages to remain lovable somehow. He finds other French people odious, fears that his suits will be a deduction when the inn has to cut down on spending.... in short, you can't live with him, can't live without him. He accompanies [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] through all of their business adventures. As Lorelai once put it: "We are addicted to you". He also has two dogs, Paw-Paw and Chin Chin. Chin Chin passed away in the 7th season. He is French. He and Sookie don't really get along well.

==Trivia== *Michel loves Celine Dion and has seen her in concert six times. *He hates children, but volunteered to look after Davey due to paranoid feelings about Tobin. *Michel lived in France until he was 17, after which he left for unknown reasons. *A ballerina and an ensemble performed at his graduation. *He and his mother are very close-they always go shopping together, watch movies, and gossip whenever she's in town. *A notorious health freak, he's known to reject omelets if they aren't made from egg whites. He'll count the blueberries in his pancakes as well. One time, he weighed what he was going to eat due to hearing that it would help extend a rat's life and thus his. Also, he freaked out once upon hearing that his fat free creamer was actually two percent, and ran in place to try and burn off the excess calories. *He loves to dance, but he is terrible at it. [[Category:Characters|Gerard, Michel]] [[Category:Independence Inn]] [[Category:Dragonfly Inn]]

revision.text:
{{BackLink|Portal:Supporting Characters}} {{Infobox character | Title = Max Medina | Actor = Scott Cohen | Image = Max_Medina.jpg | First = [[The Deer Hunters]] | Last = [[Keg! Max!]] | Name = Max Arturo Medina | Age = N/A | Family= unnamed brother
[[Lorelai Gilmore]] (ex-fiancee) }} '''Max Medina''' is [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]'s English teacher at [[Chilton]] and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]]'s ex-fiancee. Rory is in Max's English class during her sophomore year, and she gets a D on her first paper for his class. When Rory misses a Shakespeare test due to tardiness, Max offers to let her do extra credit to make up for the missed test ([[1.04]]). Max asks Lorelai on a date at the Chilton bake sale ([[1.05]]), and the two begin a relationship. Lorelai ends things when she realizes how much she and Rory like having Max in their lives. Max is extremely hurt, but after the headmaster threatens to fire him for having a relationship with a Chilton parent, he decides they shouldn't be together ([[1.11]]). Several months later, Lorelai shows up at his apartment late one night, and they start seeing each other again ([[1.17]]). Max proposes to Lorelai in the [[1.21|Season 1 finale]], and she accepts several days later ([[2.01]]). They plan a wedding for the end of the summer, but Lorelai calls off the wedding only a few days before the wedding after realizing that she doesn't love Max ([[2.03]]). When school starts, Max and Rory are very awkward around each other; when Rory is assigned to interview Max for the school paper, they both express their regret that the wedding didn't happen. At some point, Max goes to California to teach a class at Stanford, where he dates a woman named Diane. He returns to Hartford for the Chilton bicentennial, and he runs into Lorelai several times. Although he tells her that he is fine with how things ended, he kisses her, then admits he isn't over it ([[3.16]]). His last appearance is in ([[3.19]]), where he is on the parents' committee for the Chilton graduation party with Lorelai. She seems interested in starting a relationship again, but he insists that he wants her to stay away from him. ==Appearances== ===Season 1=== [[1.04]] â€¢ [[1.05]] â€¢ [[1.08]] â€¢ [[1.11]] â€¢ [[1.17]] â€¢ [[1.20]] â€¢ [[1.21]] ===Season 2=== [[2.01]] â€¢ [[2.02]] â€¢ [[2.03]] â€¢ [[2.05]] ===Season 3=== [[3.16]] â€¢ [[3.19]] [[Category:Characters|Medina, Max]] [[Category:Chilton]] [[Category:Chilton teachers|Medina, Max]] [[Category:Hartford|Medina, Max]] [[Category:Hartford Residents|Medina, Max]] [[Category:Lorelai's Romantic Interests|Medina, Max]]

{{BackLink|Portal:Supporting Characters}} {{Infobox character |Title = Dean Forester |Actor = Jared Padalecki |Image = Dean.jpg |First = [[Pilot (Episode 1.01)|Pilot]] |Last = [[To Live and Let Diorama]] |Name = Dean Forester |Age = 24 |Family = [[Lindsay Lister]] (ex-wife)
[[Clara Forester]] (sister) }} '''Dean Forester''' was [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]'s first boyfriend and plays a recurring role in her life. == Biography == Dean first appeared in the [[Pilot]] where he was the new boy at [[Stars Hollow High School]] to which he had come from Chicago with his family. We discover that he had been watching Rory and was impressed by her concentration while reading. Before Rory went to Chilton, she and Dean met and it was like shy love. Rory even debated not going to [[Chilton]] so she could stay with Dean at [[Stars Hollow High School|Stars Hollow High]]. They had a quiet flirtation, and he gave Rory a bracelet for her birthday which he made out of a coin. Rory and Dean shared their first kiss at [[Doose's Market]] where Dean worked. Dean initiated this kiss by offering Rory free "pop" where he made her guess which one was behind her back and then kissed her ([[Kiss and Tell]]). During [[Rory's Dance]] it is decided that they are officially boyfriend and girlfriend. In the same episode, Dean and Rory's (in her opinion) rude and annoying classmate,[http://gilmoregirls.wikia.com/wiki/Tristan_DuGrey Tristan DuGrey], who "has a thing" for Rory.Â Â Despite this, they continue to date happily until the episode [[Star-Crossed Lovers and Other Strangers]] when Dean reveals that he is building Rory a car for her anniversary and tells her that he loves her. Rory reacts badly to this, stating that she needs time and this is a big step to take. In the [[The Breakup, Part 2|following episode]] Rory reveals that Dean broke up with her because she didn't respond with "I love you too". This break, however, doesn't last long, in the [[Love, Daisies and Troubadours|final episode]] Rory drops significant hints (like at the town meeting) that she misses Dean and really does love him, resulting him turning up at Chilton where Rory tells him that she loves him and they get back together. Their relationship goes well until the arrival of Luke's nephew, [[Jess Mariano]], whom Rory finds more and more attractive. They both share the same interests in both literature and music. Rory feels confused about him at first since she knew he was trouble, but she still ends up being good friends with him. This causes Dean to become very possessive of Rory, until Lorelai tells him to back off and calm down - he does so but in the [[Back_in_the_Saddle_Again|18th episode]], Lorelai finds him on their porch where he simply states that "She likes Jess, doesn't she?" In [[Season 3]], Dean breaks up with Rory at a town dance after her insistent attention to Jess over him and he calls out on Rory how he knows how she feels and claims he's "out". Rory later climbs a tree to knock on Dean's window, attempting to apologize for her behaviour and claims that she really did love him: a tearful Dean accepts her apology and closes the window on her. However, Dean soon befriends Rory again and the two seem to be all right. It is revealed that Dean is seeing a girl named [[Lindsay Lister]] and Dean proposes to her at the end of season 3 - a few days after a fistfight with Jess who treated Rory poorly at a party. Â Dean marries Lindsay in [[Season 4]], and while their marriage is a happy one at first, cracks begin to show and Rory and Dean seem to grow closer as time goes by. Lindsay may not be the one for Dean, but she certainly tried very hard to be a good wife and felt hurt when Dean brushed her efforts aside and yelled at her for answering her husband's cellphone. She overhears Rory hating on her, saying that she doesn't know what's good for Dean, and tells him to stay away from Rory. It finally culminates in Dean cheating on Lindsay with Rory - Dean claims he's leaving her, but while Rory is in Europe, he stays with his wife until she finds a letter written by Rory - she promptly throws his stuff out of their apartment and they file for divorce. Dean and Rory begin dating but the tension and time apart has clearly taken its toll and the couple find themselves unable to go on dates as Dean works three jobs and Rory has school. They find the time however on the same evening Rory's grandparents throw her a party, but as a slightly tipsy and bejewelled Rory arrives late for her pickup, Dean simply states that he doesn't belong here anymore, having realized that their lives are too different and heading in different directions, and Rory only answers with a sympathetic "Dean...": this breakup is the final one the couple have. His final appearance is in [[To Live and Let Diorama]] where he relates his faulty relationship with Rory to Luke's with Lorelai, saying that ultimately, Luke would hold Lorelai back from whatever potential she may have. With this statement, Dean is never heard from again. ''For more detail, see'': [[Rory_Gilmore#Dean_Forester|Rory's relationship with Dean]] == Trivia == *He and Lorelai share a friendly relationship and Lorelai has on many occasions called him "the perfect boyfriend" and considers him a pal, and has shown clear preference of him over Rory's other boyfriends. *He is frequently referred to as "gorgeous" by the women who encounter him. *Jared Padalecki's height is a recurring theme to the character, as both Lorelai, Miss Patty, Louise and others comment on it and make jokes about it. *In [[Christopher Returns|1.15]], he mentions having a Suzuki motorcycle. In the same episode he and Luke played softball. *His father sells stereo systems, and his mother transcripts medical documents part time. *He has a younger sister named [[Clara Forester|Clara]] who rides horses, and he has mentioned that he has an older sister as well. *He was a hockey player on his high school team. *Before Rory, he had a serious girlfriend named Beth. They parted on amicable terms when he moved to Stars Hollow. *He went to Southern Connecticut State before dropping out. *Mother's name is MayÂ  ==Appearances== ===Season 1=== [[Pilot|1.01]] â€¢ [[Cinnamon's Wake|1.05]] â€¢ [[Rory's Birthday Parties|1.06]] â€¢ [[Kiss and Tell|1.07]] â€¢ [[Love and War and Snow|1.08]] â€¢ [[Rory's Dance|1.09]] â€¢ [[Forgiveness and Stuff|1.10]] â€¢ [[Double Date|1.12]] â€¢ [[That Damn Donna Reed|1.14]] â€¢ [[Christopher Returns|1.15]] â€¢ [[Star-Crossed Lovers and Other Strangers|1.16]] â€¢ [[The Breakup, Part 2|1.17]] â€¢ [[P.S. I Lo...|1.20]] â€¢ [[Love, Daisies and Troubadours|1.21]] ===Season 2=== [[Sadie, Sadie...|2.01]] â€¢ [[Hammers and Veils|2.02]] â€¢ [[Red Light on the Wedding Night|2.03]] â€¢ [[Presenting Lorelai Gilmore|2.06]] â€¢ [[The Ins and Outs of Inns|2.08]] â€¢ [[Run Away, Little Boy|2.09]] â€¢ [[The Bracebridge Dinner|2.10]] â€¢ [[Secrets and Loans|2.11]] â€¢ [[Richard in Stars Hollow|2.12]] â€¢ [[A Tisket, A Tasket|2.13]] â€¢ [[Lost and Found|2.15]] â€¢ [http://gilmoregirls.wikia.com/wiki/There%27s_The_Rub 2.16] â€¢ [[Back in the Saddle Again |2.18]] â€¢ [[Help Wanted|2.20]] â€¢ [[Lorelai's Graduation Day|2.21]] â€¢ [[I Can't Get Started|2.22]] ===Season 3=== [[Those Lazy-Hazy-Crazy Days|3.01]] â€¢ [[Haunted Leg|3.02]] â€¢ [[Application Anxiety|3.03]] â€¢ [[They Shoot Gilmores, Don't They?|3.07]] â€¢ [[Let the Games Begin|3.08]] â€¢ [[A Deep-Fried Korean Thanksgiving|3.09]] â€¢ [[That'll Do, Pig|3.10]] â€¢ [[Dear Emily and Richard|3.13]] â€¢ [[Swan Song|3.14]] â€¢ [[Face-Off|3.15]] â€¢ [[The Big One|3.16]] â€¢ [[A Tale of Poes and Fire|3.17]] â€¢ [[Happy Birthday, Baby|3.18]] â€¢ [[Keg! Max!|3.19]] â€¢ [[Say Goodnight, Gracie|3.20]] â€¢ [[Those Are Strings, Pinocchio|3.22]] ===Season 4=== [[Chicken or Beef?|4.04]] â€¢ [[The Incredible Shrinking Lorelais|4.14]] â€¢ [[Scene in a Mall|4.15]] â€¢ [[Girls in Bikinis, Boys Doin' the Twist|4.17]] â€¢ [[Tick, Tick, Tick, Boom!|4.18]] â€¢ [[Luke Can See Her Face|4.20]] â€¢ [[Last Week Fights, This Week Tights|4.21]] â€¢ [[Raincoats and Recipes|4.22]] ===Season 5=== [[Say Goodbye to Daisy Miller|5.01]] â€¢ [[A Messenger, Nothing More|5.02]] â€¢ [[Tippecanoe and Taylor, Too|5.04]] â€¢ [[We Got Us a Pippi Virgin!|5.05]] â€¢ [[Norman Mailer, I'm Pregnant!|5.06]] â€¢ [[The Party's Over|5.08]] â€¢ [[To Live and Let Diorama|5.18]] [[Category:Characters|Forester, Dean]] [[Category:Forester family|Forester, Dean]] [[Category:Stars Hollow|Forester, Dean]] [[Category:Stars Hollow Residents|Forester, Dean]] [[Category:Rory's Romantic Interests|Forester, Dean]] [[Category:Stars Hollow High School|Forester, Dean]]

revision.text:
'''Jared Tristan Padalecki''' (born July 19, 1982) is an American actor. He grew up in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Texas Texas] and came to fame in the early 2000s after appearing on the television series ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilmore_Girls Gilmore Girls]'' as well as in several Hollywood films, including ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_Minute_(film) New York Minute]'' and ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Wax_(2005_film) House of Wax]''. Padalecki plays [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sam_Winchester Sam Winchester] on the CW television series ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supernatural_(TV_series) Supernatural]''. {| class="toc" id="toc" | |} ==Early life== Padalecki was born in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Antonio,_Texas San Antonio, Texas].[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-TVG-0 [1]][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-1 [2]] He is of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polish_American Polish] ancestry on his father's side.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-ancestry-2 [3]][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-3 [4]] He has an older brother, Jeff, and a younger sister, Megan. He started taking acting classes at the age of 12. ===Education=== He attended James Madison High School in San Antonio and was named a candidate for the 2000 [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidential_Scholars_Program Presidential Scholars Program]. In 1998, Padalecki and his partner Chris Cardenas won the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Forensic_League National Forensic League] national championship in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duo_Interpretation Duo Interpretation].[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-4 [5]] Padalecki won [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fox_Broadcasting_Company FOX]'s 1999 "Claim to Fame Contest"; he subsequently appeared at the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teen_Choice_Awards Teen Choice Awards], where he met his current manager. After graduating from high school in 2000, he moved to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Los_Angeles,_California Los Angeles, California] to pursue an acting career, although he had originally planned to attend the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Texas_at_Austin University of Texas].[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-TVG-0 [1]] ==Career== Padalecki's first credit was a minor role in the 1999 film ''A Little Inside''. In 2000, he was cast as [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Gilmore_Girls_characters#Dean_Forester Dean Forester] on the television series ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilmore_Girls Gilmore Girls]'', a role he played until 2005. Throughout the early 2000s, he also appeared in several made-for-television films, including ''Silent Witness'', ''Close to Home'', and the Disney Channel Original Movie ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Ring_of_Endless_Light_(film) A Ring of Endless Light]''. Padalecki had an uncredited part as a high school bully in 2003's comedy ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cheaper_by_the_Dozen_(2003_film) Cheaper by the Dozen]'', which he played after being asked by fellow actor and friend [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Welling Tom Welling], who played the part of Charlie Baker, and the director of the movie, who wanted someone bigger than Charlie to pick on him. Padalecki originally auditioned for Welling's role, but gave it up in order to film a pilot titled ''Young [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MacGyver MacGyver]'' which was never picked up.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-5 [6]] In 2004, he appeared in the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary-Kate_and_Ashley_Olsen Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen] comedy ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_Minute_(film) New York Minute]'' as Trey Lipton a cute boy who the Olson's characters are attracted to. He also landed a short role in the thriller ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flight_of_the_Phoenix_(2004_film) Flight of the Phoenix]'' alongside [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dennis_Quaid Dennis Quaid] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_Laurie Hugh Laurie]. In 2005, Padalecki starred opposite [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elisha_Cuthbert Elisha Cuthbert], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chad_Michael_Murray Chad Michael Murray] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris_Hilton Paris Hilton] in the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horror_film horror film] ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Wax_(2005_film) House of Wax]'' in which he plays Wade, one of 5 teens who are slashed and killed. In the same year, Padalecki appeared in yet another horror film, ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cry_Wolf Cry Wolf]'' in which he played Tom.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-6 [7]] The same year, Padalecki was cast as [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sam_Winchester Sam Winchester] on the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_WB_Television_Network WB] series, ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supernatural_(TV_series) Supernatural]''. Sam and his brother Dean ([http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jensen_Ackles Jensen Ackles]) drive throughout the United States hunting paranormal predators, sometimes with their father ([http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeffrey_Dean_Morgan Jeffrey Dean Morgan]). The seventh season began broadcast on September 23, 2011 on the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_CW_Television_Network CW]. The show is filmed in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vancouver,_British_Columbia Vancouver], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Columbia British Columbia], Canada. Padalecki also served as the host of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MTV MTV]'s horror reality series, ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Room_401 Room 401]'' which was discontinued after only 8 episodes due to poor ratings.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-7 [8]] He had the lead role in 2008's ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Christmas_Cottage The Christmas Cottage]'', in which he played [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Kinkade Thomas Kinkade]. Padalecki also had the lead role in the horror remake ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friday_the_13th_(2009_film) Friday the 13th]'' film alongside [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danielle_Panabaker Danielle Panabaker], which opened on Friday, February 13, 2009. He plays Clay Miller, a character who heads out to the doomed Camp Crystal Lake in search of his sister who has gone missing.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-8 [9]] ==Personal life== Padalecki married his former ''Supernatural'' co-star [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genevieve_Cortese Genevieve Cortese] on February 27, 2010. He and his wife are currently residing in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vancouver Vancouver], British Columbia, Canada.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-9 [10]][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-10 [11]] On October 10, 2011, he announced they were expecting their first child.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-11 [12]] [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-12 [13]] The couple's son was born on March 19, 2012.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-tvg120320-13 [14]][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Padalecki#cite_note-14 [15]] ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable jquery-tablesorter" ! class="headerSort" title="Sort ascending"|Year ! class="headerSort" title="Sort ascending"|Title ! class="headerSort" title="Sort ascending"|Role ! class="unsortable"|Notes |- |1999 |''Little Inside, AA Little Inside'' |Matt Nelson | |- |2000 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Do_Not_Disturb_(1999_film) Do Not Disturb]'' |Sam |TV movie |- |2000â€“2005 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilmore_Girls Gilmore Girls]'' |[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Gilmore_Girls_characters#Dean_Forester Dean Forester] |63 episodes
Recurring; [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilmore_Girls_(season_1) Seasons 1], 4, & 5
Main Cast; Seasons 2â€“3 |- |2001 |''Close to Home'' | |TV movie |- |2001 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ER_(TV_series) ER]'' |Paul Harris |Episode: "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ER_(season_7)#Episodes Piece of Mind]" |- |2002 |''Ring of Endless Light, A[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Ring_of_Endless_Light_(film) A Ring of Endless Light]'' |Zachery Gray |TV movie |- |2003 |''Young MacGyver'' |Clay MacGyver |Pilot |- |2003 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cheaper_by_the_Dozen_(2003_film) Cheaper by the Dozen]'' |High School Bully (uncredited) | |- |2004 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_Minute_(film) New York Minute]'' |Trey Lipton | |- |2004 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flight_of_the_Phoenix_(2004_film) Flight of the Phoenix]'' |John Davis | |- |2005 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Wax_(2005_film) House of Wax]'' |Wade | |- |2005 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cry_Wolf_(2005_film) Cry Wolf]'' |Tom | |- |2005â€“present |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supernatural_(TV_series) Supernatural]'' |[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sam_Winchester Sam Winchester] |Main role |- |2007 |''House of Fears'' |J.P. (uncredited) | |- |2007 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Room_401 Room 401]'' |Himself |Cancelled after 8 episodes |- |2008 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Kinkade%27s_Home_for_Christmas Christmas Cottage]'' |[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Kinkade Thomas Kinkade] | |- |2009 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friday_the_13th_(2009_film) Friday the 13th]'' |Clay Miller | |- |2011 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supernatural_(TV_series)#Supernatural:_The_Anime_Series Supernatural: The Anime Series]'' |Sam Winchester |Voice role, 22 episodes |} [[Category:Cast|Padalecki, Jared]] [[Category:Supporting cast|Padalecki, Jared]]
