{{Epnav | prev=Road Trip to Harvard | up=Season 2 | next=Presenting Lorelai Gilmore}} {{Infobox episode |name = Nick & Nora/Sid & Nancy |Image = 205.jpg |season_num = [[Season 2|2]] |ep_num = 5 |air_date = October 30, 2001 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Michael Katleman]] }} ==Synopsis== Lorelai's well-intentioned advice falls on deaf ears when Luke reluctantly takes in his wild 17-year-old nephew Jess, while Rory finds herself attracted to the town's newest resident. ==Plot outline== [[Luke Danes|Luke]]'s sister [[Liz Danes|Liz]], afraid that her 17-year-old son [[Jess Mariano]] is headed for trouble, puts him on a bus to [[Stars Hollow]] to live with Luke. [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] finds out and offers Luke some guidance on the care and feeding of a teenager, but is rebuffed. Undaunted, she hosts a dinner party for Jess, who is sullen and angry with everyone except [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]. Luke realizes that he needs Lorelai's help after pushing Jess into the lake. [[Paris Gellar|Paris]] is intent on making Rory's life miserable, so she sabotages her participation on [[The Franklin]]. Her plan is frustrated when the faculty advisor singles out Rory's article for praise. ==Music== #"This Is Hell" by Elvis Costello #"Girl From Mars" by Ash #Also referenced: The Doors, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Mingus Charles Mingus], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sonics The Sonics], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MC5 MC5], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fairport_Convention Fairport Convention], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bee_Gees The Bee Gees], [http://www.amazon.com/Unwritten-Works-Geoffrey-Etc-Vinyl/dp/B000GWBR9U Whistler, Chaucer, Detroit & Greenhill] The Beatles, The Who, Bruce Springsteen, Tom Petty, John Lennon, Nirvana, Pink Floyd, Led Zeppelin, Bob Dylan, U2, The Rolling Stones, Sonic Youth, Jimi Hendrix, Guns N' Roses, B.B. King, & The Kinks ==Book References== #[http://www.amazon.com/Selected-Letters-Dawn-Powell-1913-1965/dp/0805065059 Selected Letters of Dawn Powell] by Dawn Powell #[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oliver_Twist Oliver Twist] by Charles Dickens #[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howl_and_Other_Poems Howl and Other Poems] by Allen Ginsberg (the book Jess "borrows" from Rory) Stephen king, Jim morrison #[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Thin_Man The Thin Man]Â by Dashiell Hammett - Â first appearance of episode's titular renowned playful bickerers, Nick and Nora Charles #In the beginning of the episode, Lane comes in and asks Rory to go to the record store for several albums she wants. Lane then pulls out [http://www.amazon.com/The-Mojo-Collection-Greatest-Albums/dp/184195067X/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1374407189&sr=8-1&keywords=the+mojo+collection The Mojo Collection: The Greatest Albums of All Time] , a book published by the music magazine [http://www.mojo4music.com/blog/ MOJO]Â . [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]] ==Movie References== #[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Breakfast_Club The Breakfast Club] #[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Godfather The Godfather] #[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Thin_Man_%28film%29 The Thin Man] #[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sid_and_Nancy Sid and Nancy] #[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Side_Story_%28film%29 West Side Story] #[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_adaptations_of_works_by_Stephen_King Stephen King movies] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Sookie will cook, Rory will be there. It'll be a little 'Hey, welcome to Stars Hollow and see, everyone here's not straight out of a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federico_Fellini Fellini ]film' kind of an evening.

'''Jess''': Wow, aren't we [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hooked_on_Phonics hooked on Phonics]!

'''Jess''': You don't know anything about me, or my life, or my mom, or Luke, so why don't you [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laura_Schlessinger Doctor Laura] someone else? '''Luke:''' The weekends are for chores and selected pre-approved outings, i.e. Kabbalah studies, freeway beautification projects, [http://www.colormemine.com Color Me Mine] pottery painting, all discussible options. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]] ==Quotes== '''Lorelai:''' What is a Danish without coffee? '''Rory:''' The eternal question springs up again. '''Lorelai:''' Sad Danish. Lonely Danish. Step-Danish. ==Trivia== * Luke says that Jess's mom and dad broke up two years ago. But later says his dad left after Jess was born. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Nick & Nora/Sid & Nancy | up=Season 2 | next=Like Mother, Like Daughter}} {{Infobox episode |name = Presenting Lorelai Gilmore |Image = 206.jpg |season_num = [[Season 2|2]] |ep_num = 6 |air_date = November 6, 2001 |writer = [[Sheila R. Lawrence]] |director = [[Chris Long]] |transcript = http://www.crazy-internet-people.com/site/gilmoregirls/pages/s2/s2s/27.html}} ==Synopsis== Rory surprises everyone by agreeing to Emily's request that she make her debut at a Debutante Ball. ==Plot outline== At the urging of her friends, [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] decides that [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]'s making her debut at a society ball will be just the thing to get [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] back into the social swing. To [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]]'s amazement, Rory willingly agrees and Emily goes into high gear shopping in preparation. [[Christopher |Christopher]] agrees to escort Rory, and Lorelai becomes entranced by his new responsible side, but gets a shock when she learns about his new relationship. ==Music== *"The Way You Look Tonight" by Frank Sinatra *"Thank Heaven For Little Girls" by Maurice Chevalier *"Jubilee" by Grant Lee Buffalo *"Du Hast" by Rammstein *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metallica Metallica], [[wikipedia:en:neil young|Neil Young]], [[Wikipedia:en:Rapture (song)|Rapture (Blondie song)]] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oxford_English_Dictionary#Compact_editions The Compact Oxford English Dictionary] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moment_by_Moment Moment by Moment] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dirty_Dancing Dirty Dancing] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/This_is_Spinal_Tap This is Spinal Tap] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Endless_Love_%28film%29 Endless Love] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cinderella_%281950_film%29 Cinderella ] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sound_of_Music_%28film%29 The Sound of Music] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': I think [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Who%27s_Afraid_of_Virginia_Woolf%3F George and Martha] are joining us for dinner. '''Lorelai''': We didn't know we were walking in on [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lion_King_(musical) The Lion King] without the puppet heads. '''Lorelai''': Does [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrence_McNally Terrence McNally] know about you too? '''Lorelai''': I'm still convinced she had something to do with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lily_Tomlin Lily Tomlin] doing [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moment_by_Moment that movie] with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Travolta John Travolta] .

'''Christopher''': Well, did you tell her about [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barbara_Hutton Barbara Hutton], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doris_Duke Doris Duke], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gloria_Vanderbilt Gloria Vanderbilt]?
'''Lorelai''': Yes, and she's perfectly willing to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barbara_Hutton#Cary_Grant marry Cary Grant], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doris_Duke#Trusts_and_wills get offed by her crazy butler] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gloria_Vanderbilt#Professional_career start designing blue jeans] as soon as the ball ends. '''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Lucas George Lucas] wishes he had this sound system. '''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dirty_dancing Nobody puts baby in the corner]. '''Rory''': Remember that I'll be watching ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BattleBots BattleBots]'' with you for a month. '''Rory''': Could be a real [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cirque_du_Soleil Cirque du Soleil] kind of night. '''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neil_Young Neil Young] has got nothing on you. '''Lorelai''': Oh [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shecky_Greene Shecky], you kill me. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Presenting Lorelai Gilmore | up=Season 2 | next=The Ins and Outs of Inns}} {{Infobox episode |name = Like Mother, Like Daughter |Image = 207.jpg |season_num = [[Season 2|2]] |ep_num = 7 |air_date = November 13, 2001 |writer = [[Joan Binder Weiss]] |director = [[Dennis Erdman]] }} ==Synopsis== Chilton's headmaster Charleston thinks Rory isn't properly socializing, and when Lorelai disagrees, he tells her Rory may be taking after her mom.'' '' ==Plot outline== [[Headmaster Charleston]] decrees that both Gilmore girls need to improve their socialization skills at [[Chilton Preparatory School|Chilton]] if they want him to write a glowing recommendation for [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]'s Harvard application. Rory's first attempt to socialize leads her to ask a group of girls at lunch if she could join them. Little does she know that they are Chilton's most powerful secret sorority. After being chided by [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] for her lack of participation, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] joins the Booster Club and offers to host a fundraising fashion show at the Inn. To her dismay, she discovers that the Booster Club mothers are the models. Not wanting to be mortified by herself, and to exact a little payback for being chided, she signs Emily up to model as well. ==Music== *"Know Your Onion" by The Shins *"Girls Just Want To Have Fun" by Cyndi Lauper *"It's Alright, Baby" by Komeda *"Looks Like We Made It" by Barry Manilow ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sound_and_the_Fury The Sound and the Fury] by William Faulkner *[http://www.amazon.com/Last-Empire-Essays-1992-2000/dp/037572639X The Last Empire: Essays 1992 - 2000] by Gore Vidal *[http://www.amazon.com/Savage-Beauty-Life-Vincent-Millay/dp/039457589X Savage Beauty: The Life of Edna St. Vincent Millay] by Nancy Milford *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Collected_Stories_of_Eudora_Welty The Collected Stores of Eudora Welty] by Eudora Welty ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rain_Man Rain Man] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freaky_Friday_%281976_film%29 Freaky Friday] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coming_Home Coming Home] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wizard_of_Oz_%281939_film%29 The Wizard of Oz] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Matrix The Matrix] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Maybe he has a secret life -- Maybe he's got a little chippie stowed away in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mount_Pilot Mount Pilot]!

'''Rory''': Suddenly I'm living with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zsa_Zsa_Gabor Zsa Zsa Gabor].

'''Lorelai''': Yeah, look [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fat_Albert_and_the_Cosby_Kids#Educational_lessons_and_songs Fat Albert]. Get me a soda.

'''Rory''': Paris, it's not the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosa_Nostra Cosa Nostra].

'''Rory''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sandra_Day_O%27Connor Sandra Day O'Connor] was a Puff?

'''Francie''': Well, no one has proof. It's just folklore.
'''Ivy''': Like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snow-White_and_Rose-Red Snow-White and Rose-Red].
'''Francie''': Or Mariah Carey's crackup.

'''Rory''': I tell ya, she's a regular [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gary_Mule_Deer Gary Mule Deer].

'''Rory''': ''(about the Puffs' oath)'' [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anne_Sexton Anne Sexton], right? '''Francie''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gypsy:_A_Musical_Fable Sing out Lousie!]

'''Rory''': I end up here with the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Divine_Secrets_of_the_Ya-Ya_Sisterhood Ya-Ya Sisterhood]. In this episode, when Lorelai tells Rory to put on her cake pajamas, they are the [http://coolspotters.com/characters/rory-gilmore/and/clothing/nick-and-nora-sweet-dreams-full-length-pajamas#medium-206338 Nick & Nora Sweet Dreams Full Length Pajamas.] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]]

page.title: The Ins and Outs of Inns

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=Like Mother, Like Daughter | up=Season 2 | next=Run Away, Little Boy}} {{Infobox episode |name = The Ins and Outs of Inns |Image = 208.jpg |season_num = [[Season 2|2]] |ep_num = 8 |air_date = November 20, 2001 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Michael Katleman]] }} ==Synopsis== Lorelai and Sookie have the first fight of their long friendship when, upon hearing that the Independence Inn may be sold, Lorelai panics and decides that their shared dream of opening an inn together is doomed to failure. ==Plot outline== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] gear up their plans to open an inn, but encounter a roadblock when the owner of their dream location refuses to sell the property. The unexpected arrival of [[Mia]], the absentee owner of the [[Independence Inn]], complicates matters even further when Lorelai begins to experience pangs of guilt at leaving Mia with the responsibility of running the Inn again. Lorelai's emotional turmoil culminates with having her first ever argument with Sookie. [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] decides to meet Mia, the woman who was such an important part of their lives then. Mia explains that she took them in to give them a place to feel safe, while Emily explains that she wanted Mia to send them home. Also, someone has planted a fake murder scene at the front of [[Doose's Market]], complete with police tape and the chalk outline of a body. Naturally, this gets [[Taylor Doose|Taylor]] in a dither; after doing some investigation, he confronts [[Luke Danes|Luke]] about [[Jess Mariano|Jess]]. ==Music== *"Spring Released" by Grant Lee Phillips *"Nothing Is For Sure" by Grant Lee Phillips *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Idol Billy Idol], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keith_Richards Keith Richards] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Catcher_in_the_Rye The Catcher in the Rye] by J. D. Salinger *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/To_Kill_a_Mockingbird To Kill a Mockingbird] by Harper Lee ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glitter_%28film%29 Glitter] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danger,_Will_Robinson Danger, Will Robinson, danger!]

'''Lorelai''': Hey, it didn't hurt [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vincent_van_Gogh Van Gogh], the guy should thank me.

'''Lorelai''': When we first bought our house, Rory and I wanted to name it, you know, like Jefferson named his place [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monticello Monticello]. '''Sookie''': How about something historical like "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Revere The Paul Revere] "?

'''Lorelai''': Oh, how very [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Birch_Society John Birch Society] of you.

'''Lorelai''': Yeah, the town's too dull to work up a real murder.
'''Rory''': But you're one '[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beam_me_up,_Scotty Beam me up, Scotty]' reference away from being the victim of one.

'''Emily''': Oh, now you have a problem with swans and thrones.
'''Lorelai''': Because swans and thrones scream one thing Mom, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siegfried_%26_Roy Siegfried and Roy].

'''Lorelai''': Yeah, boy, I was lucky you had your [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_weapons_in_Star_Trek#Phasers phasers on stun], huh?

'''Lorelai''': Ooh! Think hard, was he dressed like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hikaru_Sulu Sulu]?

'''Lorelai''': It's great Mom, it's fabulous. It's just a notch below [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rembrandt Rembrandt]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=The Ins and Outs of Inns | up=Season 2 | next=The Bracebridge Dinner}} {{Infobox episode |name = Run Away, Little Boy |Image = 209.jpg |season_num = [[Season 2|2]] |ep_num = 9 |air_date = November 27, 2001 |writer = [[John Stephens]] |director = [[Danny Leiner]] }} ==Synopsis== When Rory and Tristan are cast as Romeo and Juliet in a school play, a jealous Dean insists on attending every rehearsal. Lorelai has to put up with Luke's teasing after she dates a much younger guy. ==Plot outline== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] receives a late wedding present without a card attached, and insists that it be returned. [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] sees to what great lengths Lorelai is going to find out who sent it, and tells Lorelai to move forward in life to get some closure on her relationship with [[Max Medina|Max]]. Lorelai takes her advice and accepts a dinner date with Paul, one of the other students in her business class. When Paul stops by the diner, both the town and [[Luke Danes|Luke]] react to Lorelai's dating decision. The town finds a lot to be amused by as Paul arrived at the diner with his parents and wearing a backwards baseball cap making him look much younger. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]], [[Paris Gellar|Paris]], [[Madeline Lynn|Madeline]], and [[Louise Grant|Louise]] are assigned to present the death scene from "Romeo and Juliet" as part of their class participation in the [[Chilton Preparatory School|Chilton]] Shakespearean Festival. Paris takes over as director and assigns Rory the role of Juliet. [[Tristan DuGrey|Tristan]] returns to school with Duncan and Bowman after their suspension, and is cast as Romeo against Rory's wishes. Throughout rehearsals Rory is trying her best to keep Dean from attending them and finding out that Tristan is Romeo to her Juliet. While watching her other classmates perform, Rory learns that Tristan is going to military school in North Carolina for breaking into Bomer's father's safe and being caught when the silent alarm went off. ==Music== *Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Destiny%27s_Child Destiny's Child] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/On_the_Town_%28film%29 On the Town] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_River_Wild The River Wild] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mystic_Pizza Mystic Pizza] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cocoon_%28film%29 Cocoon] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Butch_Cassidy_and_the_Sundance_Kid Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid] ==Pop Culture References== '''Sookie''': A [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benito_Mussolini Musso Lussino] 480!
'''Lorelai''': Somebody sent me a fascist ice cream maker?

'''Lorelai''': Okay, once again, I bring up the fact that this is a wedding present, and as I am not getting married, neither God's law nor [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emily_Post Emily Post's] allows me to keep this.

'''Sookie''': It's true. I saw it on ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martha_Stewart Martha Stewart]''.

'''Paris''': Why don't they just sew our sides together and rename us [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chang_and_Eng_Bunker Chang and Eng]?

'''Lorelai''': So, um, judging by your [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Graham Billy Graham] impression, I am guessing that you didn't send me an ice cream maker.

'''Paul''': ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Twilight_Zone The Twilight Zone]'' marathon was on all week.

'''Rory''': Hey.
'''Madeline''': Hey.
'''Louise''': [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZWea5rB7XlY We're the Monkees].

'''Paris''': Okay. Now I want everyone to read the chapters on acting. I photocopied out of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Houseman Houseman]'s memoirs tonight.

'''Lorelai''': Have you seen my bag with the beads and the fur, kind of looks like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Stalin Stalin]'s head?

'''Lorelai''': Okay, you know what [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vanna_White Vanna]? I'm gonna need a few more vowels here.

'''Lorelai''': ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inside_the_Actors_Studio#About_the_program The Actor's Studio]'' will go nuts. You'll have James Lipton asking you what your favorite swear word is.

'''Lorelai''': He's never seen ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Absolutely_Fabulous Ab Fab].''

'''Tristan''': Yeah, I think somehow I'll recover from the great romance between you and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theodore_Cleaver the Beave].

'''Lorelai''': I mean it. Today is the day we finally spring for ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Powerpuff_Girls The Powerpuff Girls ]''shotglasses.

'''Luke''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doogie_Howser,_M.D. Doogie Howser] was a doctor at sixteen.
'''Lorelai''': Doogie Howser was not real.

'''Lorelai''': This is incredible. I go on one stupid date and suddenly I'm the female [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerry_Lee_Lewis#Family Jerry Lee Lewis]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Run Away, Little Boy | up=Season 2 | next=Secrets and Loans}} {{Infobox episode |name = The Bracebridge Dinner |Image = 210.jpg |season_num = [[Season 2|2]] |ep_num = 10 |air_date = December 11, 2001 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Chris Long]] }} ==Synopsis== Lorelai invites most of the citizens of Stars Hollow to an elaborate feast complete with Elizabethan costumes and horse-drawn sleigh rides. ==Plot outline== A blizzard prevents a group from attending the historical dinner that [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] has painstakingly prepared at their request, so she and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] decide to invite all their friends in [[Stars Hollow]] to enjoy the feast at the [[Independence Inn|Inn]], as everything has already been paid for. At [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]'s urging, Lorelai also invites [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] and [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]], in an attempt to boost Richard's spirits. During dinner, Emily is hurt and angered when Richard reveals that he has quit his job without consulting her. [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] tries to get between Rory and [[Dean Forester|Dean]] when Dean is distracted by his little sister. ==Music== *"Human Behaviour" by Bjork *"Hotel California" by The Eagles *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pixies Pixies], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bjork Bjork] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Joy_Luck_Club The Joy Luck Club] by Amy Tan ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Godfather_Part_III The Godfather Part III] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Thomas_Crown_Affair_%281999_film%29 The Thomas Crown Affair] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Shining_%28film%29 The Shining] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ben-Hur_%281959_film%29 Ben Hur] ==Pop Culture References== '''Rory''': We're competing against the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michelangelo Michelangelo ]of snow.
'''Lorelai''': And we're [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernest_P._Worrell Ernest] Builds a Snowman.

'''Lorelai''': We're beyond crazy. We are '[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anne_Heche#Psychological_problems Anne Heche speaking her secret language to God and looking for the spaceship in Fresno]' crazy.

'''Rory''': Nice looking lady.
'''Lorelai''': Hmm, like a young [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tammy_Faye_Messner Tammy Faye Bakker].

'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woody_Allen#Soon-Yi_Previn Woody and Soon-Yi]?

'''Lorelai''': I'll send him a ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Def_Comedy_Jam Def Jam Comedy]'' tape.

'''Morey''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Parker Charlie Parker] was late to everything.

'''Rory''': Hello there. Hey Clara. Nice, is that a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stella_McCartney Stella McCartney]?

'''Sookie''': No! It tastes too 20th century guys. It's gotta shout [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington_Irving Washington Irving], not Irving my accountant. It needs something, help me. What is it?

'''Lorelai''': Giddy up. ''(the sleigh starts moving)'' Uh! The horses heard me, I speak horse language! I'm [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dr._Dolittle Dr. Dolittle]!

'''Rune''': Hey [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chuck_Mangione Chuck Mangione], you wanna back up a step?

'''Lorelai''': They're the Old England [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abbot_and_Costello Abbot and Costello].

'''Richard''': I stood beside them and their boombox and I hummed Mozart's ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symphony_No._38_%28Mozart%29 Prague Symphony]'' as loud as I could.
'''Lorelai''': A bizarro ''Battle of the Bands''.

Lorelai: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Days_of_our_Lives#Opening_title_sequences_and_theme_song Like sands through the hourglass, so are the Gilmores of our lives]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]]

revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Alexmighty|Alexmighty]] ([[User talk:Alexmighty|talk]] | [[Special:Block/Alexmighty|block]]) to last version by [[User:Sulfur|Sulfur]]
revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=The Bracebridge Dinner | up=Season 2 | next=Richard in Stars Hollow}} {{Infobox episode |name = Secrets and Loans |Image = 211.jpg |season_num = [[Season 2|2]] |ep_num = 11 |air_date = January 22, 2002 |writer = [[Linda Louiselle Guzik]] |director = [[Nicole Holofcener]] }} ==Synopsis== Lorelai's concern over the fact that she can't afford to repair her home's extensive termite damage turns to anger when Rory tells Emily about their problem and Emily again offers Lorelai a loan. ==Plot outline== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] have a major falling out after Rory goes against her mother's wishes and asks her grandparents to lend Lorelai the money she needs to repair termite damage to their house. [[Lane Kim|Lane]]'s desire to become a cheerleader causes a strain in her relationship with Rory. After an exhaustive and unproductive attempt to raise the funds she needs based on her own credit rating, Lorelai is forced to ask [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] to cosign a loan. Rory drives [[Paris Gellar|Paris]] crazy when she refuses to reveal her PSAT scores. ==Music== *"Que Sera Sera" by Doris Day *"Be True to Your School" by Grant Lee Phillips *"One Step Beyond" by Madness *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nico Nico], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exene_Cervenka Exene] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coyote_Ugly_%28film%29 Coyote Ugly] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rocky_Horror_Picture_Show The Rocky Horror Picture Show] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silkwood Silkwood] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gone_with_the_Wind_%28film%29 Gone with the Wind] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Purple_Rain_%28film%29 Purple Rain] ==Pop Culture References== '''Madeline''': Boys, a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nancy_Drew Nancy Drew] mystery.

'''Lorelai''': Aw honey, it's not the amount of places that turns you down that matters, it's the quality of the place that turns you down that matters. And when you've got Jacko's Loans and Stuff not wanting your business, you know it's time to hang out with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Two_Coreys the Coreys].

'''Lorelai''': Oh, you think I don't know that? You think I sit around all day swapping witticisms with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Benchley Robert Benchley] at the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Algonquin Algonquin]?

'''Lorelai''': Cause I'm [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_Soprano Tony Soprano]?

'''Lorelai''': You will say nothing, you will do nothing, you will sit in the corner and offer no opinions and pull a full-on [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clarence_Thomas Clarence Thomas].

'''Lorelai''': ''(to Emily)'' [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Honeymooners I swear, one of these days, Alice. Pow! Right to the moon!]

'''Rory''': I liked it. Very [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Waters_%28filmmaker%29 John Waters]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Secrets and Loans | up=Season 2 | next=A-Tisket, A-Tasket}} {{Infobox episode | | Image=Ep02x12_1.jpg | name=Richard in Stars Hollow | season_num=[[Season 2|2]] | ep_num=12 | air_date=January 29, 2002 | director=[[Steve Gomer]] | writer=[[Frank Lombardi]] }} ==Synopsis== Lorelai is coerced by her mother into taking her father for a day in Stars Hollow, where he proceeds to drive her batty while criticizing every aspect of her life. ==Plot outline== [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] visits [[Stars Hollow]], and drives [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] crazy by passing judgment on every aspect of her life, from her eating habits to how she conducts her work. Elsewhere (to her mother's dismay), [[Rory]] ends up having to help [[Paris Gellar|Paris]] when she visits Stars Hollow searching for a "seedy underbelly" for the front story of [[The Franklin]]. There, Rory gains unexpected praise when she accidentally encourages censorship in the [[Stars Hollow Video|Stars Hollow Video Store]]. Dean finishes building Rory's car and surprises her with it, but Richard insists that he gets the car checked to make sure its safe. After returning to Lorelai's house, he says that Rory may accept the car and everything is fine. Lorelai gets very angry at him for making Dean take the car to Gypsy's to get checked, and states that she is the parent and she will decide about what is best for Rory, not him. ==Music== *"A Foggy Day in London Town" by George & Ira Gershwin *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Judds The Judds] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legally_Blonde Legally Blonde] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grease_%28film%29 Grease] ==Pop Culture References== '''Richard''': A first edition [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gustave_Flaubert Flaubert], mint condition, shoved behind several of my [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winston_Churchill Churchill] biographies.

'''Lorelai''': Mom, when Dad was talking about the vase, you were pulling a full-on [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bewitched Tabitha].

'''Lorelai''': It's going to be a bad, depressing Lifetime movie, and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nancy_McKeon Nancy McKeon] will be playing me. I am [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_The_Facts_of_Life_characters#Jo_Polniaczek Jo].

'''Lorelai''': Hmm, do the Florida people know about you? Because [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anita_Bryant Anita Bryant] left this huge gap that's yet to be filled.

'''Luke''': ''(referring to Paris)'' Who's your friend?
'''Rory''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder,_She_Wrote Angela Lansbury].

'''Paris''': Nothing, not even a cigarette butt on the ground, I can't believe it. This town would make [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Capra Frank Capra] wanna throw up.

'''Lorelai''': Nothing that came out of your mouth today might, in any universe visited by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_Trek Kirk or Spock], be construed as constructive.

'''Lorelai''': Rory's my kid and I make the rules, so if she comes home one day and says, 'Hey, uh, I'm gonna spend the weekend with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patricia_Krenwinkel Patricia Krenwinkel]' I say, 'Okay, grab a sweater,' you just have to deal. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Richard in Stars Hollow | up=Season 2 | next=It Should've Been Lorelai}} {{Infobox episode |name = A-Tisket, A-Tasket |Image = 213.jpg |season_num = [[Season 2|2]] |ep_num = 13 |air_date = February 5, 2002 |writer = [[Robert Berlinger]] |director = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] }} ==Synopsis== Stars Hollow holds their yearly charity picnic basket auction. ==Plot outline== The annual [[Stars Hollow]] charity picnic basket lunch auction sparks controversies among couples throughout town. [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] outbids [[Dean Forester|Dean]] for [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]'s basket, causing Dean and Rory to quarrel when Rory abides by tradition and shares the lunch with Jess. [[Jackson Belleville|Jackson]] refuses to bid on [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]]'s basket after she leads him to believe that she doesn't want to move in together. [[Luke Danes|Luke]] comes to [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]]'s rescue, bids on her basket, and feeds them both at the diner after [[Miss Patty]] sets Lorelai up with a trio of unsuitable bidders. [[Henry Cho|Henry]] tires of the end runs around [[Mrs. Kim]], and calls it quits with [[Lane Kim|Lane]]. Rory and Jess hit it off at lunch and Jess leaves with a secret souvenir -- the bracelet that Dean gave Rory, which he picks it up and holds on to after Rory drops it. Sookie and Jackson work things out so well that he proposes and she accepts. Lorelai and Rory quarrel when Rory finds out that her mother lent a sympathetic ear to Dean's concerns about Jess. After [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] agrees with her daughter's distrust of Jess, Lorelai realizes that they're both wrong, and apologizes to her daughter. ==Book References== *[http://www.amazon.com/Childrens-Hour-Lillian-Hellman/dp/0822202050 The Children's Hour] by Lillian Hellman *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Fountainhead The Fountainhead] by Ayn Rand *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernest_Hemingway Ernest Hemingway] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Boy_in_the_Plastic_Bubble The Boy in the Plastic Bubble] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/From_Here_to_Eternity From Here to Eternity] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunset_Boulevard_%281950_film%29 Sunset Boulevard] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sabrina_%281954_film%29 Sabrina] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stalag_17 Stalag 17] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ghostbusters Ghostbusters] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julia_%281977_film%29 Julia] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': So, I've decided I'm saving myself for [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Holden William Holden].

'''Lorelai''': Ugh, every great relationship has its obstacles. You'd know that if you weren't dating [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andy_Hardy Andy Hardy].

'''Lorelai''': I have to go call Patty and stop the forced mating process. I feel like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ling_Ling_%28giant_panda%29 Ling-Ling] the panda bear.

'''Jess''': Well, it's no [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Bruce Lenny Bruce] routine but it has its moments.

'''Jess''': Excuse me, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edgar_Bergen Edgar Bergen], I'd like Charlie McCarthy to answer now.

'''Dean''': Sorry, I'd do a silly walk, but I'm not feeling very [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Ministry_of_Silly_Walks John Cleese] now.

'''Luke''': You do. One with a couch and a deep knowledge of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sigmund_Freud Freud].

'''Lorelai''': I'm totally into [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons Dungeons & Dragons].

'''Jess''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayn_Rand Ayn Rand] is a political nut.

'''Lorelai''': I'm not taking sides. I'm [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Switzerland#Foreign_relations_and_international_institutions Swiss], babe.

'''Lorelai''': He seems cool because heâ€™s got this dangerous vibe and this problem with authority and heâ€™s seen a lot of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sylvester_Stallone Sylvester Stallone] movies. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=A-Tisket, A-Tasket | up=Season 2 | next=Lost and Found}} {{Infobox episode |name = It Should've Been Lorelai |Image = 214.jpg |season_num = [[Season 2|2]] |ep_num = 14 |air_date = February 12, 2002 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Lesli Linka Glatter]] }} ==Synopsis== Christopher and his girlfriend Sherry visit Stars Hollow. ==Plot outline== [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] comes to town on a business trip with his girlfriend [[Sherry Tinsdale]] in tow. Since Sherry and Christopher's relationship is getting serious, Sherry wants to begin bonding with [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] -- on Friday night. Without consulting [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]], [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] excuses Rory from the Gilmore [[Friday night dinner]], and takes Christopher with her instead. When Emily finds out about Sherry over cocktails, she has a meltdown and rushes off to the kitchen. Lorelai follows her there and finds out that Emily always envisioned that Lorelai and Christopher would end up together. Now that she sees that this isn't going to happen, Emily blames Lorelai for always keeping him, and everyone else, at arms length. After mulling over her mother's words, the next morning Lorelai tells Christopher that she believes she's always thought that they would get back together, too, and that's one reason why she's never had a relationship that lasted, including the one with [[Max]]. Christopher gets very angry, refusing to accept the responsibility for the way Lorelai's romantic life has turned out. Lorelai immediately apologizes, saying she didn't mean it blamefully, but more as self-realization, but Christopher is too angry to listen. ==Music== *"Legal Man" by Belle and Sebastian *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Willie_Nelson Willie Nelson] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fatal_Attraction Fatal Attraction] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Godfather The Godfather] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harvey_%28film%29 Harvey] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ferris_Bueller%27s_Day_Off Ferris Bueller's Day Off] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': How was it that suddenly everyone in the world was saying "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_mourning_bride#Famous_lines music has charm to sooth the savage] beast" when it was written "breast"? '''Lorelai''': This whole morning has been a little ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Twilight_Zone Twilight Zone]-y''.
'''Luke''': Or ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Outer_Limits_%281963_TV_series%29 Outer Limits]''-y.

'''Lane''': My mom's done everything but slap a Dr. Dre [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_arrest#United_States ankle bracelet] on me.

'''Lorelai''': Schmitty's over the hill. He's washed up. Put him in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cooperstown,_New_York Cooperstown].

'''Rory''': Not the ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two_Fat_Ladies Two Fat Ladies]'' again.

'''Rory''': No two people know more about assisted suicide than the two of us. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Kevorkian Kevorkian ]called today for a couple of tips.

'''Paris''': Let's not harbor any [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harold_Pinter Pinteresque ]fantasies.

'''Christopher''': I hear you're the greatest chef after [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alain_Ducasse Alain Ducasse].

'''Rory''': Well, having company is about making sacrifices.
'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martha_Stewart Martha Stewart]?
'''Rory''': I paraphrased [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marcel_Proust Proust].

'''Lorelai''': You, me, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_Sheen#Political_activism Martin Sheen] all chained to the same tree.

'''Rory''': I feel like I'm on ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ricki_Lake_%28talk_show%29 The Ricki Lake Show]''.

'''Rory''': But I also pictured you with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pee-wee_Herman Pee-Wee Herman]. We lived in his [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pee-wee%27s_Playhouse playhouse] and we'd be talking to Chairy and Captain Carl would be walking by.

'''Rory''': Oh, and later I pictured you marrying [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matthew_Broderick Matthew Broderick], and we lived in New York in this great apartment in the village and we would talk about his Ferris Bueller days.

'''Lorelai''': Ah yes, the Gilmore family players rival [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barrymore_family the Barrymores] for their sophisticated, dramatic productions. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=It Should've Been Lorelai | up=Season 2 | next=There's The Rub}} {{Infobox episode | | Image=Ep02x15_1.jpg | name=Lost and Found | season_num=[[Season 2|2]] | ep_num=15 | air_date=February 26, 2002 | writer=[[Gail Mancuso]] | director=[[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] }} ==Synopsis== Rory panics when she suddenly realizes that she lost the bracelet Dean made for her, and when a suspicious Lorelai catches Jess in Rory's room, she accuses him of stealing the bracelet. ==Plot outline== [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] embarks upon a campaign to improve [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]]'s relationship with [[Jess Mariano|Jess]], and convinces her to let him clean out their gutters so he can make some extra money. [[Luke Danes|Luke]], annoyed by his cramped living quarters, goes apartment hunting. With the help of Lorelai, Luke is able to find a great place, but is shocked when he finds out who owns the building. Meanwhile, [[Dean Forester|Dean]] notices that Rory isn't wearing the bracelet that he made for her. Rory makes up an excuse, but later flips into panic mode when she can't find the bracelet. ==Music== *"Price Yeah!" by Pavement *"What A Wonderful World" by Joey Ramone *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Shaggs The Shaggs] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inherit_the_Wind_%28play%29 Inherit the Wind] by Jermore Lawerence and Robert E. {{Epnav | prev=There's The Rub | up=Season 2 | next=Back in the Saddle Again}} {{Infobox episode | | Image=Ep02x17_1.jpg | name=Dead Uncles and Vegetables | season_num=[[Season 2|2]] | ep_num=17 | air_date=April 16, 2002 | writer=[[Jamie Babbit]] | director=[[Daniel Palladino]] }} ==Synopsis== Lorelai and Rory help out at the diner while Luke is left to plan his unpleasant uncle's funeral. ==Plot outline== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] pitch in at the diner while [[Luke Danes|Luke]] plans his Uncle Louie's funeral. [[Taylor Doose|Taylor]] is unhinged when a farmer's market opens in the town square and puts a damper on his business. [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] goes completely overboard in helping [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] plan her wedding. Rory prods [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] into being more of a help. Luke is upset when family and friends cite Louie's unpleasant personality as a reason for not attending his funeral, but is comforted when [[Stars Hollow]] comes through for both him and his uncle in the end. ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_and_Lisa David and Lisa] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Money_Pit The Money Pit] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': ''(to Luke)'' But your re-enactment of Jerry Lewis and the Diner Guy is gonna wow the critics.

{{Epnav | prev=Dead Uncles and Vegetables | up=Season 2 | next=Teach Me Tonight}} {{Infobox episode |name = Back in the Saddle Again |Image = 218.jpg |season_num = [[Season 2|2]] |ep_num = 18 |air_date = April 23, 2002 |writer = [[Linda Louiselle Guzik]] |director = [[Kevin Dowling]] }} ==Synopsis== After helping Rory out with her business project for the annual Chilton Business Fair, Richard realizes retirement isn't for him. ==Plot outline== [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] asks [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] for help in creating and marketing a first-aid kit for [[Chilton Preparatory School|Chilton]]'s annual Business Fair, which leads him to realize that he is unhappy in retirement and wants to start a second career. Fresh from having underbid on Rory's lunch basket and the loss of the bracelet he made for her, [[Dean Forester|Dean]] goes overboard in trying to be close to Rory, afraid that she is losing interest in him, and finally becomes resigned to her affection for [[Jess Mariano|Jess]]. At first, [[Michel Gerard|Michel]] is ecstatic when his flamboyant mother [[Giselle]] visits, but after [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] causes problems for him when she reveals to Giselle that Michel has been holding back from his mother, Michel quickly is driven crazy by his mother's incessant questioning. ==Book References== *[http://www.amazon.com/Motley-Crue-Seamus-Craic/dp/1905382235 Motley Crue]by Seamus Craic *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Candide Candide ]by Voltaire *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adventures_of_Huckleberry_Finn Adventures of Huckleberry Finn] by Mark Twain ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Odd_Couple_%28film%29 The Odd Couple] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Untouchables_%28film%29 The Untouchables] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Forever! {{Epnav | prev=Back in the Saddle Again | up=Season 2 | next=Help Wanted}} {{Infobox episode | |Image=Ep02x19_1.jpg |name=Teach Me Tonight |season_num=[[Season 2|2]] |ep_num=19 |air_date=April 30, 2002 |director=[[Steve Robman]] |writer=[[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] }} ==Synopsis== Luke asks Rory to tutor Jess who is close to failing, but Jess uses it to get closer to Rory. ==Plot outline== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]]'s complaint about [[Taylor Doose|Taylor]]'s choice for "Movie in the Square Night" lands her the responsibility for picking the evening's entertainment, but her enthusiasm for the task is quickly dampened when Taylor informs her that she must make a choice from a list of free movies which doesn't include any masterpieces. Against her better judgment, Lorelai agrees to [[Luke Danes|Luke]]'s request that [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] tutor an about-to-flunk-out [[Jess Mariano|Jess]]. Rory and Jess decide to take a break from studying to get some ice cream, and with Jess behind the wheel, they get into a car accident which leaves Rory with a fractured wrist and a totaled car. A distraught Lorelai blames Luke for the accident, creating a serious rift in their relationship. [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] arrives in the middle of the night ready to go after Jess, but he's already left [[Stars Hollow]] to return home. [[Kirk Gleason|Kirk]]'s short film premieres at Movie Night. ==Music== *"White Lines" by Grandmaster and Melle Mel *"Car Song" by Elastica *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Clash The Clash], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coldplay Coldplay] ==Book References== *[http://www.amazon.com/Please-Kill-Me-Uncensored-History/dp/0140266909 Please Kill Me] by Legs McNeil and Gillian McCain ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cocktail_%28film%29 Cocktail] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Yearling_%28film%29 The Yearling] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wizard_of_Oz_%281939_film%29 The Wizard of Oz] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sting The Sting] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rocky Rocky] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crimes_and_Misdemeanors Crimes and Misdemeanors] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_%28film%29 Arthur] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sophie%27s_Choice_%28film%29 Sophie's Choice] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cabin_Boy Cabin Boy] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desperately_Seeking_Susan Desperately Seeking Susan] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snow_Dogs Snow Dogs] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seven_Samurai Seven Samurai] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All_About_Eve All About Eve] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/What_Ever_Happened_to_Baby_Jane%3F_%28film%29 Whatever Happened to Baby Jane?] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Princess_Bride_%28film%29 The Princess Bride] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Taylor's ladder mysteriously disappears, suddenly making Dean invaluable, no matter what fancy tricks [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lon_Chaney,_Jr. Lon Chaney Jr.] over there pulls.

{{Epnav | prev=Teach Me Tonight | up=Season 2 | next=Lorelai's Graduation Day}} {{Infobox episode | | Image=Ep02x20_1.jpg | name=Help Wanted | season_num=[[Season 2|2]] | ep_num=20 | air_date=May 7, 2002 | director=[[Chris Long]] | writer=[[Allan Heinberg]] }} ==Synopsis== Lorelai helps her dad open his new office, but when Richard gets too attached to Lorelai she is given the cold shoulder when she reminds him that she already has a job and cannot be his full time employee. ==Plot outline== [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] opens a new office and hires a secretary with [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]]'s help. [[Dean Forester|Dean]] comes home. [[Lane Kim|Lane]] falls in love with a drum set at [[Stars Hollow]]'s new music shop and discovers that becoming a rock drummer is her new dream in life. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] is dismayed to discover that everyone blames [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] for the accident despite her protestations. {{Epnav | prev=Lorelai's Graduation Day | up=Season 2 | next=Those Lazy-Hazy-Crazy Days}} {{Infobox episode |name = I Can't Get Started |Image = 222.jpg |season_num = [[Season 2|2]] |ep_num = 22 |air_date = May 14, 2002 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]]
[[John Stephens]] |director = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] }} ==Synopsis== Sookie and Jackson get married, while Lorelai and Christopher go through some changes in their relationship. ==Plot outline== [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]]'s wedding draws near, while [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] finally relents and goes into the diner, where she apologizes profusely to [[Luke Danes|Luke]]. [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] comes to town for the removal of [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]'s cast and decides to stay for Sookie's wedding. While Lorelai and Chris seem to be getting along, [[Sherry Tinsdale|Sherry]] drops a bomb. Meanwhile, [[Paris Gellar|Paris]] is running for student body president, and employs Rory as vice-president. Also, [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] returns to [[Stars Hollow]] and asks Luke if he can stay. But when worse come to worst, Rory must choose between Jess and [[Dean Forester|Dean]]. ==Music== *"You're Just in Love" by Call Me Madam *"Walking After Midnight" by Patsy Cline *"I Can't Get Started" by Ella Fitzgerald *"Mamma Mia" by ABBA *"Seasons in the Sun" by Terry Jacks *"Cat's in the Cradle" by Harry Chapin *"Don't Cry Out Loud" by Melissa Manchester ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Girl,_Interrupted Girl, Interrupted] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rebecca_of_Sunnybrook_Farm_%281938_film%29 Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_Instinct Basic Instinct] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cinderella_%281950_film%29 Cinderella] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Anybody not hanging out with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anne_Sullivan_Macy Annie Sullivan] by the water fountain.

{{Epnav | prev=Help Wanted | up=Season 2 | next=I Can't Get Started}} {{Infobox episode | | Image=Ep02x21_1.jpg | name=Lorelai's Graduation Day | season_num=[[Season 2|2]] | ep_num=21 | air_date=May 14, 2002 | director=[[Jamie Babbit]] | writer=[[Daniel Palladino]] }} ==Synopsis== Rory invites her grandparents to her mom's graduation, but misses it herself after cutting school to meet Jess in New York. ==Plot outline== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] have breakfast at [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]]'s in an effort to avoid [[Luke]]'s, but Lorelai can't avoid an awkward encounter with him at [[Doose's Market]], where he fails to pick up on her hints to patch things up. In an effort to help Lorelai through final exam stress, Rory gets her excited about attending her college graduation ceremony and secretly invites [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] and [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]], despite Lorelai's assertion that they'd never agree to attend. After a late night phone call from [[Jess Mariano|Jess]], Rory impulsively cuts school the next day and visits him in Manhattan. [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] sends Lorelai a graduation gift basket filled with fun goodies and an expensive necklace. Lorelai is shocked to see Emily, Richard and a film crew accompanying them to her graduation, and must contend with an obnoxious classmate with an attitude about the rich. Rory is furious with herself when her bus home is delayed and she misses her mother's graduation. When Rory finally arrives home, Lorelai forgives her when she realizes that the trip to New York may indicate that her daughter has fallen in love with Jess, despite her protests to the contrary. ==Music== *"52 Girls" by The B-52's *"Dance This Mess Around" by The B-52's *"O'oh" by Yoko Ono *"Monkey Gone to Heaven" by Pixies *"Ramble On" by Led Zeppelin *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Go-Go%27s The Go-Go's], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Bangles The Bangles], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beatles The Beatles], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slint Slint]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/What_Color_is_Your_Parachute%3F What Color Is Your Parachute?] by Richard Nelson Bolles ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annie_Hall Annie Hall] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_Fidelity_%28film%29 High Fidelity] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Celebrated_Jumping_Frog_of_Calaveras_County Didn't they feed lead to our jumping frog] or something?
'''Rory''': Oh yeah, right after [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lottery they stoned the woman who won the lottery].

'''Lorelai''': Oh look it's [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Landon Michael Landon].

'''Lorelai''': Now say, [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VFKifpMtlNs&feature=related I can't believe I ate the whole thing].

'''Lorelai''': Unless I turn into [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Forbes_Nash,_Jr. John Nash] and start drooling on people.

'''Lorelai''': I ended up in a career that apparently [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jessica_Hahn Jessica Hahn] would think was beneath her.

'''Jess''': It's where [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Lee_Roth David Lee Roth] got busted.

'''Lorelai''': Hey, try to seat us next to a celebrity on the Concorde, like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sting_%28musician%29 Sting ]or [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_%22Screech%22_Powers Screech ]or someone.

'''Lorelai''': You drank some [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boone%27s_Farm Boone's Farm] out of a bota bag and knocked a beach ball around.

'''Rory''': And bought a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hummel_figurines Hummel] at the curio store in Stars Hollow.

'''Lorelai''': I never leave home without all the essentials: mirror, make-up, picture of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shaun_Cassidy Shaun Cassidy].

'''Lorelai''': You look very ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GQ GQ]''.
'''Jackson''': Oh, thanks to my best new friend: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ermenegildo_Zegna Ermenegildo Zegna].

'''Zach''': It's like a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baz_Luhrmann Baz Luhrmann] movie out there.

'''Lorelai''': Thanks for coming, Sook, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marcus_Schenkenberg Marcus Schenkenberg]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 2 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=I Can't Get Started | up=Season 3 | next=Haunted Leg}} {{Infobox episode |name = Those Lazy-Hazy-Crazy Days |Image = 301.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 1 |air_date = September 24, 2002 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] }} ==Synopsis== Back from a summer internship in DC, Rory finds Dean waiting for her - and Jess giving a blonde some serious mouth-to-mouth. Lorelai tells her parents that Christopher's [[Sherry Tinsdale|girlfriend]] is pregnant. ==Plot outline== While coping with her sadness about [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]], [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] has an intriguing dream about [[Luke Danes|Luke]]. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] returns from Washington to realize that she still may have feelings for [[Jess Mariano|Jess]]. At a chance encounter at the First Annual Stars Hollow End of Summer Madness Festival Rory sees that Jess may have moved on. Relationship quarrels abound. [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] and [[Jackson Belleville|Jackson]] fight over decorating their house, Lorelai and Rory argue over Rory's treatment of [[Dean Forester|Dean]], and [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] argue over Lorelai and Christopher. ==Music== *"Those Lazy, Hazy, Crazy Days of Summer" by Foster and Allen *Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peaches_and_Herb Peaches and Herb] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sid_and_Nancy Sid and Nancy] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reversal_of_Fortune Reversal of Fortune] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nell_%28film%29 Nell] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Divine_Secrets_of_the_Ya-Ya_Sisterhood_%28film%29 Divine Secrets of the Ya-Ya Sisterhood] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Hmm, cotton balls, world peace, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Connie_Chung Connie Chung]'s original face back.

'''Luke''': ''(to Lorelai's belly)'' Goodbye, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sid_and_Nancy Sid and Nancy].
'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leopold_and_Loeb Leopold and Loeb]. I changed my mind, don't tell Rory.

'''Rory''': You had another dream?
'''Lorelai''': Yes
'''Rory''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucy_van_Pelt#Psychiatric_booth The doctor is in].

'''Paris''': ''(talking in her sleep)'' [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Woodward Woodward]... [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Bernstein Bernstein]... [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Thomason Harry Thomason]...

'''Lorelai''': Cool. See if you can steal me something off of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Daschle Tom Daschle]'s fruit plate.

'''Paris''': ''(talking in her sleep) ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I_did_not_have_sexual_relations_with_that_woman I did not have sexual relations with that woman].

'''Jackson''': ''(To Sookie)'' [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judy_Garland Judy], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vincente_Minnelli Vincente ]has to go to work now.

'''Paris''': Do you really think it looks good to have the American secretary of the treasury traveling around with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bono Bono]? I mean, why not just send [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carson_Daly Carson Daly] over to the Middle East next time [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dick_Cheney Cheney] goes, huh? Or hey, hook up [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freddie_Prinze_Jr. Freddie Prinze Jr.] with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colin_Powell Colin Powell] next time he meets with NATO.

'''Rory''': I got to see [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Archie_Bunker Archie Bunker]'s chair at the Smithsonian Museum...

'''Paris''': They give up careers and become alcoholics, and if you're [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunny_von_B%C3%BClow Sunny von BÃ¼low], wind up in a coma, completely incapable of stopping [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glenn_Close Glenn Close] from playing you in a movie.

'''Sookie''': ''(holding up a frilly lamp)'' What do you think? Manly?
'''Lorelai''': In an [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oscar_Wilde Oscar Wilde] sort of way, absolutely.

'''Lorelai''': You're not seriously telling me the future of your marriage depends on [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leon_Trotsky Leon Troutsky] over there. ''(gestures at a mounted trout trophy)''

'''Richard''': Did you really have pictures of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norman_Rockwell Norman Rockwell] family Christmases dancing in your head?

'''Lorelai''': Maybe we could really be a family, in the stupid, traditional '[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dan_Quayle Dan Quayle], golden retriever, grow old together, wear matching jogging suits' kind of way.

'''Rory''': Ladies and gentlemen, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Williams_Sisters_rivalry the Williams sisters] take center stage at Wimbledon once again. ==Trivia== * This is the first time [[Sean Gunn]] (Kirk) appears in the opening credits. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Those Lazy-Hazy-Crazy Days | up=Season 3 | next=Application Anxiety}} {{Infobox episode |name = Haunted Leg |Image = 302.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 2 |air_date = October 1, 2002 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Chris Long]] }} ==Synopsis== A night at the fights, Rory has it out with Jess, and Lorelai goes a rhetorical round or two with Christopher. But Lorelai has another chance at swept-off-her-feet romance: Kirk asks her out on a date. ==Plot outline== To Lorelai's horror, Kirk asks her out on a date after being encouraged by Luke. Emily's lunch with Lorelai at Luke's ends badly. Christopher shows up uninvited at Friday night dinner and quarrels with both Lorelai and Rory before Emily asks him to leave. Rory runs into Jess and they each betray their hurt feelings -- Rory about Shane and Jess about not hearing from Rory all summer. Francie targets Paris and Rory for a world of trouble if Rory doesn't stop Paris from running the student council like a dictatorship. ==Music== *"We Are Family" by Sister Sledge *"Love is in the Air" by John Paul Young *"Bird is the Word" by Peter Griffin ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freaky_Friday_%281976_film%29 Freaky Friday] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shane_%28film%29 Shane] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Godfather The Godfather] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Legend_of_Bagger_Vance The Legend of Bagger Vance] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': And apparently a big [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annie_Oakley Annie Oakley] fan.

'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kathleen_Soliah I'll join a local community theater and I'll drive you to soccer]. It'll work for many years, until the FBI comes to get me, and by that time you're on your own.

'''Rory''': I have something to tell you.
'''Lorelai''': Is it about [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vince_Foster Vince Foster]?

'''Sookie''': You don't dictate to an artist, you don't tell him what to do. I mean, no one ever walked up to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Degas Degas ]and said, "Hey,pal, easy with the dancers, enough already. Draw a nice fruit bowl once in awhile, will ya?"

'''Lorelai''': Rule number two - no [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pageboy pageboy haircuts].
'''Francie''': You're obviously the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meyer_Lansky Meyer Lansky] behind this organization.

'''Rory''': What are we, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2002_Olympic_Winter_Games_figure_skating_scandal French skating judges]?

'''Francie''': This is politics. If you've got a problem, tell it to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noam_Chomsky Noam Chomsky].

'''Emily''': How is your Caesar salad dressing prepared?
'''Luke''': I'd have to call [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Newman#Philanthropy Paul Newman] and ask him.

'''Louise''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helmut_Newton Helmut Newton] is my godfather. '''Paris: '''But the next genius that comes up with a brilliant plan to put an [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elizabeth_Arden,_Inc. Elizabeth Arden] in the chemistry class can bite my ass. '''Jess''': Plus the two of you walking around the other day like some damn [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andy_Hardy Andy Hardy] movie. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]] ==Trivia== *The book that [[Jess]] is reading in the diner is "A Confederacy of Dunces" by John Kennedy Toole. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Haunted Leg | up=Season 3 | next=One's Got Class and the Other One Dyes}} {{Infobox episode |name = Application Anxiety |Image = 303.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 3 |air_date = October 8, 2002 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Gail Mancuso]] }} ==Synopsis== Hackneyed, perfunctory, run-of-the-mill - that's Rory. When her Harvard application arrives, her confidence disappears. And soon three generations of Gilmore girls share one giant anxiety attack. ==Plot outline== Rory's application for Harvard arrives, plunging Rory, Lorelai and Emily into a frenzy. A Chilton seminar on college applications only adds to Rory's anxiety and sends Paris into a tizzy. Taylor steamrollers Luke into opening a soda shop next to the diner. Lane places an ad in the paper for a band and finds a musical soulmate. Lorelai and Rory have dinner with a Harvard alumni and his family which may assure her chances of acceptance. Dean has a talk with Rory about their future after she goes to Harvard. ==Music== *"Tiny Cities Made of Ashes" by Modest Mouse *"I Wanna Be Sedated" by The Ramones *"Big in Japan" by Tom Waits *"Smile" by Grant Lee Phillips *"Istanbul (Not Constantinople)" by They Might Be Giants *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Last_Falling The Accelerators], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Adolescents The Adolescents], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Adverts The Adverts], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agent_Orange_%28band%29 Agent Orange], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Angelic_Upstarts The Angelic Upstarts], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agnostic_Front The Agnostic Front], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ash_%28band%29 Ash], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AC/DC AC/DC], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Animals The Animals], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A-Ha a-ha], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Bowie David Bowie], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jackson_Browne Jackson Browne], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nico Nico], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Ramones The Ramones], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yes_band Yes], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jethro_Tull_%28band%29 Jethro Tull], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Jam The Jam], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nirvana_band Nirvana], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bananarama Bananarama], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Pixies The Pixies], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Breeders The Breeders], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dead_Kennedys Dead Kennedys], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wu-Tang_Clan Wu-Tang Clan], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Butthole_Surfers Butthole Surfers], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Clash The Clash], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Kinks The Kinks,] [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruce_Springsteen Bruce Springsteen] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dead_Souls Dead Souls] by Nikolai Gogol *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Manticore The Manticore] by Robertson Davies ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiddler_on_the_Roof_%28film%29 Fiddler on the Roof] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Karate_Kid Karate Kid] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Side_Story_%28film%29 West Side Story] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sid_and_Nancy Sid and Nancy] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Potter_%28film_series%29 Harry Potter] ==Television References== *[[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Family_Matters|Family Matters]] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malcolm_in_the_middle Malcolm in the Middle] ==Pop Culture References== [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Brady_Bunch_Variety_Hour The Brady Bunch Variety Hour]

''(about the TV show they're watching)''
'''Rory''': It's on my top fifty best.
'''Lorelai''': Yeah, right after'' [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holmes_and_Yoyo Holmes & Yo-Yo]'' and ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hee_Haw Hee Haw Honeys]''.

'''Rory''': Sylvia Plath?
'''Lorelai''': Might send the wrong message.
'''Rory''': The "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sylvia_Plath#Death sticking her head in the oven]" thing?

'''Lorelai''': How about the one of us sticking our heads through the carved out holes of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnny_Bravo Johnny Bravo] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SpongeBob_Squarepants SpongeBob Squarepants]?

'''Rory''': So, what are you doing Saturday?
'''Dean''': Just my usual chores.
'''Rory''': Your usual chores, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Waltons#John_.22John-Boy.22_Walton.2C_Jr. John Boy]? '''Paris''': I wanted [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Rose Charlie Rose]. '''Paris''': And all Mr. Hunter said is, Paris, this isn't [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beatles%27_1965_U.S._tour#The_Shea_Stadium_show The Beatles at Shea Stadium].

'''Emily''': And now it's the in thing for young Hollywood celebrities to go to universities. What do they call themselves, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brat_Pack_%28actors%29 the Brat Pack]? '''Lorelai''': We could call it Tangerinorama or [[wikipedia:en:The Name Game|Banafana-fofanna]]-rama or something.
'''Taylor''': I am telling you Luke, if we don't quickly furnish these skateboarding Z-boys with a moral distraction they are going to turn Starshollow into [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dogtown_and_Z-Boys Dogtown].

'''Luke''': And when I die, I'm gonna have them freeze me next to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ted_Williams#Death Ted Williams].

'''Rory''': You're no [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danny_Gans Danny Gans]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]]

page.title: One's Got Class and the Other One Dyes

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=Application Anxiety | up=Season 3 | next=Eight O'Clock at the Oasis}} {{Infobox episode |name = One's Got Class and the Other One Dyes |Image = 304.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 4 |air_date = October 15, 2002 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Steve Robman]] }} ==Synopsis== Bring your briefcase, your notes, and your scarlet "A." Lorelai plans to give an inspiring business talk at Stars Hollow High School's career day, but all the kids want to discuss is her teenage pregnancy. ==Plot outline== Lorelai's stint in the Stars Hollow High School local business success speakers forum gets derailed by some controversial personal questions, much to the delight of Luke and the consternation of some PTA mothers. Luke and Jess argue about the women in and out of their lives (and their closets). Lane alleviates her frustration about the strictures of her household and the future of her band through a colorful, if temporary, display of independence. Rory runs into Shane one too many times and succumbs to a severe bout of snarkiness. ==Music== *"London Calling" by The Clash *"Funky Days are Back Again" by Cornershop *"Naima" by John Coltrane *"Hello Dolly" by Louis Armstrong *"Love Burns" by Black Rebel Motorcycle Club *"Cities in Dust" by Siouxsie and the Banshees *"I Don't Mind" by Slumber Party *"Bohemian Rhapsody" by Queen *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U2 U2], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimmy_Buffett Jimmy Buffett] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wizard_of_Oz_%281939_film%29 The Wizard of Oz] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_Noon High Noon] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ace_Ventura:_Pet_Detective Ace Ventura] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': My whole face spins around a bunch of times and winds up at the back of my head like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daffy_Duck Daffy Duck]. '''Zach''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lawrence_Welk Lawrence Welk] cranked louder than this.

'''Dave''': There's no way you're gonna become our [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pete_Best Pete Best].

'''Lorelai''': I'm a success, who'd have thought?
'''Rory''': I suspected you had it in you.
'''Lorelai''': From rags to riches, I wonder why [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Larry_King Larry King] hasn't called.

'''Lorelai''': My friend the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hassanal_Bolkiah Sultan of Brunei] is so hard to pin down. '''Lane''': What do you think, pink? Or is that too [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pink_%28singer%29 Pink] the singer, and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kelly_Osbourne Kelly Osbourne], and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gwen_Stefani Gwen Stefani]?

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vin_Diesel Vin Diesel] '''Luke''': Yeah, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zip-a-Dee-Doo-Dah zip-a-dee-doo-dah]. '''Lane''': Brian's got a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snoopy Snoopy].

Lane: This is the most radical thing a Kim has done since my cousin got caught reading [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maxim_%28magazine%29 Maxim] at summer camp. '''Lorelai''': It wasn't funny.
'''Luke''': Not from your angle. From mine it was ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/An_Evening_at_the_Improv An Evening at the Improv]''.

'''Lorelai''': Usually I like to meet up at [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sardi%27s Sardi's] after a performance, wait for the reviews. I hope the ''Times'' liked me.

'''Jess''': Hey, if you're going to go all [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ward_Cleaver Ward Cleaver] on me, I gotta go call [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eddie_Haskell Eddie ]and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clarence_Rutherford Lumpy ]and tell 'em I'm gonna be late. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]] ==Trivia== * Actress Riki Lindhome plays a girl in the classroom who asks Lorelei personal questions while Lorelei is giving her speech. Lindhome also plays Juliet in 4 episodes in 2005-2006. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]]

revision.comment: The book listed as the one Jess is reading when Rory bumps into him was incorrect.
revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=One's Got Class and the Other One Dyes | up=Season 3 | next=Take the Deviled Eggs...}} {{Infobox episode |name = Eight O'Clock at the Oasis |Image = 305.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 5 |air_date = October 22, 2002 |writer = [[Justin Tanner]] |director = [[Joe Ann Fogle]] }} ==Synopsis== Lorelai sees something she likes at an auction: a man. Only Emily knows his identity. Should Lorelai break her stay-out-of-my-love-life rule, just once? A broken sprinkler brings Rory and Jess together. ==Plot outline== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] attends [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]]'s society auction where she meets a very handsome man but neglects to get his number, forcing her to ask her mother for it. After a disastrous first date, Lorelai turns down an invitation to another, not realizing that Emily and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] have a lot invested in her dating this son of their friends. After Lorelai and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] agree to water their new neighbor's lawn while he's out of town, [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] comes to Rory's rescue when the lawn's sprinkler system malfunctions. ==Music== *"Midnight at the Oasis" by Maria Muldaur *"Space Odity" by David Bowie *"Escape (The PiÃ±a Colada Song)" by Rupert Holmes ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psycho_%281960_film%29 Psycho] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blue_Crush Blue Crush] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marathon_Man_%28film%29 Marathon Man] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': No one asked for the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norton_Critical_Edition Norton Critical Edition].

'''Lorelai''': Apparently, Dwight's last home was [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oz_%28TV_series%29 Oz], and not as in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wizard_of_Oz_%281939_film%29 The Wizard of]''.

'''Rory''': How come we don't have a tiki bar?
'''Lorelai''': We are not [http://www.hulu.com/watch/19591/saturday-night-live-the-festrunk-brothers two wild and crazy guys].

'''Doris''': I should call [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erin_Brockovich Erin Brockovich] to bring a lawsuit against your parents, you steaming lump of toxic waste! ==Trivia== *While on the phone with Payton Sanders, a voice-over has [[Lorelai]] saying that his jet just got back "from Maui," while her lips appear to say "from Bali." This episode aired ten days after a car bomb attack in Bali left 202 dead and 209 injured. *The book that [[Jess]] is reading when [[Rory]] runs into him is "Visions of Cody" by Jack Kerouac. (1993 Penguin edition.) [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Eight O'Clock at the Oasis | up=Season 3 | next=They Shoot Gilmores, Don't They?}} {{Infobox episode |name = Take the Deviled Eggs... |Image = 306.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 6 |air_date = November 5, 2002 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Jamie Babbit]] }} ==Synopsis== The most uncomfortable person at the baby shower for Christopher's girlfriend Sherry isn't the very pregnant guest of honor. It's Lorelai, pressured to attend...with a big fat fake smile on her face. ==Plot outline== Lorelai chauffeurs Rory to Sherry's baby shower in Boston and finds herself dragged into the festivities against her will. Miss Patty gets a new beau. Jess comes home with a car and Luke tries to find out where he got the money to pay for it. One of Stars Hollow's more eccentric citizens requests a permit to mount a demonstration in the town square. ==Music== *"Everybody Have Fun Tonight" by Wang Chung *"Baby Face" by Bennie Davis and Harry Akst *"Who's That Girl?" by White and Schogger *"Fingersnap" by Chucho Merchan *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jan_and_Dean Jan and Dean], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wang_Chung_%28band%29 Wang Chung], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Joel Billy Joel] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/To_Kill_a_Mockingbird To Kill a Mockingbird] by Harper Lee *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deenie Deenie ]by Judy Blume ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/For_Keeps_%28film%29 For Keeps] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annie_Hall Annie Hall] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': I once told the store that my name was Squeegy Beckinheim just to see how many catalogs they'd sell my name to. {{Epnav | prev=Take the Deviled Eggs... | up=Season 3 | next=Let the Games Begin}} {{Infobox episode |name = They Shoot Gilmores, Don't They? |Image = 307.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 7 |air_date = November 12, 2002 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Kenny Ortega]] }} ==Synopsis== Lorelai and Rory partner for a 24-hour dance marathon. Couples, couples everywhere: dancing, arguing, holding each other up, shooting each other down...and changing partners. ==Plot outline== Lorelai is determined to win the Stars Hollow Dance Marathon and wrest the trophy from four-time champion Kirk, but has trouble getting a partner until she finally convinces Rory to help her dance her way to victory. Dean sits on the sidelines to cheer his girl on, and is soon joined by Jess and Shane, who spend their time making out while Jess keeps his eye on Rory. Lorelai breaks her heel, and Dean takes her place while Luke plays shoe repairman. On the dance floor, Dean realizes that Rory is attracted to Jess and breaks up with her. Rory tearfully runs off, followed closely by Jess, and Kirk is declared the winner once again. ==Music== *"In The Mood" by Glenn Miller *"Sing Sing Sing (With a Swing)" by Louis Prima *"Walkin' My Baby Back Home" by the Swingin Deacons-Band *"I Can't Give You Anything But Love" by the Swingin Deacons-Band *"By the Beautiful Sea" by the Swingin Deacons-Band *"String of Pearls" by Glenn Miller *"These Foolish Things" by the Swingin Deacons-Band *"Gonna Fly Now" (Theme from Rocky) ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Fountainhead The Fountainhead] by Ayn Rand *They Shoot Horses, Don't They? byÂ Horace McCoy ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fast_Times_at_Ridgemont_High Fast Times at Ridgemont High] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boxing_Helena Boxing Helena] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturday_Night_Fever Saturday Night Fever] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blue_Velvet_%28film%29 Blue Velvet] ==Pop Culture References== '''Luke''': Oh, hey, look.
