{{Epnav | prev=They Shoot Gilmores, Don't They? | up=Season 3 | next=A Deep-Fried Korean Thanksgiving}} {{Infobox episode |name = Let the Games Begin |Image = 308.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 8 |air_date = November 19, 2002 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]]
[[Sheila R. Lawrence]] |director = [[Steve Robman]] }} ==Synopsis== Richard has the Bulldog spirit when he, Emily, Lorelai, and Rory tour Yale. Â Rory goes through with the tour to please her grandparents. Richard even arranges an admission interview for Rory, although he knows she has her heart set on Harvard. Rory and Jess renew their romance. ==Plot outline== In the aftermath of the Dance Marathon, Kirk parades around Stars Hollow with the trophy until someone steals it, while Lorelai and Rory painfully inch their way towards Luke's. After Lorelai tells Luke about Rory and Jess, he breaks up their first kiss as a couple and then lays down some ground rules with Jess about dating Rory. Lorelai and Rory reluctantly agree to accept Richard's invitation to accompany him and Emily to his Whiffenpoof reunion at Yale, where he springs quite an unwelcome surprise on all three women. Back from New Haven, Lorelai and Rory head for Luke's, and Jess and Rory finally get to have those first kisses. Rory visits Dean to apologize and tell him that she misses his friendship. Late at night, Lorelai and Rory each curl up with some bedtime reading -- the Yale brochure. ==Music== *"Then She Appeared" by XTC *"Money for Nothing" by Dire Straits *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perry_Como Perry Como], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Whiffenpoofs The Whiffenpoofs], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beatles The Beatles], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gloria_Estefan Gloria Estefan] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Love_Story_%281970_film%29 Love Story] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wizard_of_Oz_(1939_film) The Wizard of Oz] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': We're lucky it wasn't snowing. {{Epnav | prev=Let the Games Begin | up=Season 3 | next=That'll Do, Pig}} {{Infobox episode |name = A Deep-Fried Korean Thanksgiving |Image = 309.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 9 |air_date = November 26, 2002 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Kenny Ortega]] }} ==Synopsis== Lorelai's parents expect the girls for Thanksgiving dinner...and so do Lane, Luke, and Sookie. How to handle four enormous dinners? Skip the rolls. Kirk adopts a cat with an attitude. ==Plot outline== It's Thanksgiving, and Lorelai and Rory have dinner at four different places: the Kim's, where Lane has managed to get Dave invited and Lorelai is forced to eat tofurkey; Luke's, where Luke and Jess make it a foursome with Lorelai and Rory; Sookie's, where Jackson and his family have deep-fried the turkey, the lawn, and just about everything else; and Emily and Richard's, where, to Lorelai's horror, Rory reveals that she has applied to Yale. Kirk gets a cat, with disastrous results. Dave asks Lane out, and then kisses her. Paris is afraid her difficulty getting into a shelter will impact her acceptance to Harvard. Dean faces off with Jess and lets him know that it's no more "Mr. Nice Guy" for Mr. Forester. ==Music== *"Man Who Sold the World" by David Bowie *"Free Bird" by Lynyrd Skynyrd *"Lady Marmalade" by Lil Kim *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurt_Cobain Kurt Cobain] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/How_the_Grinch_Stole_Christmas! {{Epnav | prev=A Deep-Fried Korean Thanksgiving | up=Season 3 | next=I Solemnly Swear}} {{Infobox episode |name = That'll Do, Pig |Image = 310.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 10 |air_date = January 14, 2003 |writer = [[Sheila R. Lawrence]] |director = [[Jamie Babbit]] }} ==Synopsis== Has the world turned upside down? Paris zones out in class, daydreaming about her new boyfriend. And Emily takes Lorelai's advice about how to coexist with a difficult woman: Richard's imperious mother. ==Plot outline== Lorelai's grandmother arrives in Hartford unexpectedly on Richard's birthday. She announces that she's moving back, throwing Emily into a tizzy. Rory declares war on Francie after she pulls a runaround on Paris with the Student Council. Paris is in love. Rory and Dean are friends again much to Jess' chagrin. Jess gets Dean alone at the carnival and lets him know that he's wise to his plans to get Rory back. ==Music== *"Fillmore Blues" by Chuck Berry *"Louie Louie" by Richard Berry *"Without a Net" by Ken Hiatt, Charles Blaker *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korn Korn], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weezer Weezer] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Art_of_War The Art of War] by Sun Tzu ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annie_Hall Annie Hall] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Breakfast_at_Tiffany%27s_%28film%29 Breakfast at Tiffany's] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Babe_%28film%29 Babe] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rain_Man Rain Man] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Especially if I slip him a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quaalude Quaalude], he'll like whatever I get him.

{{Epnav | prev=That'll Do, Pig | up=Season 3 | next=Lorelai Out of Water}} {{Infobox episode |name = I Solemnly Swear |Image = 311.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 11 |air_date = January 21, 2003 |writer = [[John Stephens]] |director = [[Carla McCloskey]] }} ==Synopsis== Rory Gilmore, snake in the grass. Machiavellian politics have broken out at school, and Paris believes (unjustly, of course) that Rory is Chilton's chief dirty trickster. The whole mess results in a duel...literally. ==Plot outline== Lorelai and Sookie attend a seminar on operating an inn where Sookie bumps into an old friend and Lorelai meets a handsome new friend. Lorelai unsuccessfully resists being deposed when her mother is sued. Sookie's friend, ask her out on a date. Francie causes trouble between Rory and Paris. ==Music== *"Bad Moon Rising" by Creedence Clearwater Revival ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Great_Gatsby The Great Gatsby] by F. Scott Fitzgerald ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xanadu_%28film%29 Xanadu] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All_the_President%27s_Men_%28film%29 All the President's Men] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ben-Hur_%281959_film%29 Ben Hur] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Godfather The Godfather] ==Pop Culture References== '''Emily''': ''(about her German maid Gertha)'' Every time she went to the pantry, I thought she was [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Invasion_of_Poland marching on Poland].

{{Epnav | prev=I Solemnly Swear | up=Season 3 | next=Dear Emily and Richard}} {{Infobox episode |name = Lorelai Out of Water |Image = 312.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 12 |air_date = January 28, 2003 |writer = [[Janet Leahy]] |director = [[Jamie Babbit]] }} ==Synopsis== Alex invites Lorelai on a fishing trip. Sounds like fun...except Lorelai doesn't know which end of the pole to hold. Enter Luke, the Izaak Walton of Stars Hollow. Paris tries to impeach Rory. ==Plot outline== [[Luke Danes|Luke]] is opposed to having Taylor's attorney [[Nicole Leahy|Nicole]] oversee the paperwork for the construction of the new soda shop until he meets the attractive redhead. [[Lane Kim|Lane]]'s clever scheme to get her mother's permission to attend the prom horribly backfires. [[Luke Danes|Luke]] offers to teach [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] the fine art of angling after [[Alex Lesman|Alex]] invites her to go fishing. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and Lorelai clear out their garage for [[Hep Alien|Lane's band]]. [[Paris Gellar|Paris]] calls for Rory's impeachment by the student council. ==Music== *"Ave Maria" by Franz Schubert *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smashing_Pumpkins Smashing Pumpkins ] ==Book References== * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macbeth Macbeth], by William Shakespeare ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': You stood by calmly like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dr._Dolittle Dr. Dolittle] chatting with the bat.

{{Epnav | prev=Lorelai Out of Water | up=Season 3 | next=Swan Song}} {{Infobox episode |name = Dear Emily and Richard |Image = 313.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 13 |air_date = February 4, 2003 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Gail Mancuso]] }} ==Synopsis== Sherry goes into labor, and that sets Lorelai reminiscing about Rory's birth. Did you know that Lorelai went to the hospital alone? Or about the coming-out dress? Here's your chance to find out. ==Plot outline== [[Luke Danes|Luke]] and [[Nicole Leahy|Nicole]] have a successful first date. [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] and [[Dean Forester|Dean]] trade verbal blows. [[Sherry Tinsdale|Sherry]] goes into labor with only [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] for company until the final moments, while [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] has flash backs about her teen romance with [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]], her pregnancy and Rory's birth. [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] and [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] decry Lorelai's and Rory's plans to backpack through Europe, which it turns out she and [[Christopher |Christopher]] had toyed with doing as teens. The war between [[Paris Gellar|Paris]] and Rory continues when Paris picks a yearbook photo of the "Franklin" staff that has the worst possible shot of Rory. The episode concludes with Lorelai surprising Emily with a touching gift, inspired by her regrets at the way she hurt her parents when she left home after Rory's birth. ==Music== *"99 Luftballons" by Nena *"Easter Parade" by Judy Garland ==Book References== * Europe Through the Backdoor by Rick Steves * The Rough Guide to Europe by Various Authors * Moby Dick by Herman Melville ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/My_Fair_Lady_%28film%29 My Fair Lady] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holiday_Inn_%28film%29 Holiday Inn] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Singin%27_in_the_Rain Singin' in the Rain] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Funny_Girl_%28film%29 Funny Girl] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Easter_Parade_%28film%29 Easter Parade] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/An_American_in_Paris_%28film%29 An American in Paris] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Urban_Cowboy Urban Cowboy] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturday_Night_Fever Saturday Night Fever] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grease_%28film%29 Grease] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Footloose_%281984_film%29 Footloose] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flashdance Flashdance] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Oh no, it's raining in Spain! '''Sherry''':Maureen told me that [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_stern Howard Stern] said that if you squatt it makes the baby come out faster.
'''Lorelai''': Okay, as long as you have a sane reason from a reliable source. '''Young Lorelai:''' ''Can I ... use the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epilady Epilady ]on you or something?'' [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Dear Emily and Richard| up=Season 3 | next=Face-Off}} {{Infobox episode |name = Swan Song |Image = 314.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 14 |air_date = February 11, 2003 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Chris Long]] }} ==Synopsis== Lorelai takes Manhattan with Alex, Sookie, and Jackson. But she's concerned about leaving Rory and Jess alone. Not to worry. After the young lovers have a major blowout at Emily's, Jess walks out. ==Plot outline== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] goes off with her new boyfriend for a weekend in New York, but worries about leaving [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] alone together. Meanwhile, when [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] shows up for dinner with [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and her grandmother, [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]], and refuses to explain his black eye, [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] accuses [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] of fighting with [[Dean Forester|Dean]]. [[Lane Kim|Lane]] hatches a plan in order to hang out with her new beau. ==Music== *"In a Young Man's Mind" by the Mooney Suzuki *"One For My Baby" by Frank Sinatra *"[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baba_O%27Riley Baba O'Riley]" by The Who *"New York Mining Disaster" by The Bee Gees *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Creed_%28band%29 Creed], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amy_Grant Amy Grant] ==Book References== *[http://www.amazon.com/Holy-Barbarians-Lawrence-Lipton/dp/B000S993FQ The Holy Barbarians] by Lawrence Lipton ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Easter_Parade_%28film%29 Easter Parade] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lord_of_the_Rings_film_trilogy Lord of the Rings] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Footloose_%281984_film%29 Footloose] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Little_Rascals_%28film%29 The Little Rascals] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monty_Python_and_the_Holy_Grail Monty Python and the Holy Grail] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gone_with_the_Wind_%28film%29 Gone with the Wind] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Hey, you know what Gran needs?
'''Emily''': What?
'''Lorelai''': A fella.
'''Rory''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Easter_Parade_%28film%29 With or without an umbrella]. '''Lorelai''': It's like a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dean_Martin Dean Martin] roast.
'''Rory''': Those are never funny to me.
'''Lorelai''': Yeah. They're mean.
'''Rory''': Except for [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don_Rickles Don Rickles]. '''Lorelai''': You and Dean have mutual friends in common that Rory and I don't? Who would that be? The Talbots, or that senior partner at [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deloitte Deloitte & Touche]? '''Jess''': Find somebody who vaguely resembles me, take him. Just don't kiss him goodnight.
'''Rory''': That's not going to work.
'''Jess''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andy_Warhol Andy Warhol] did it all the time. '''Miss Patty''': Kind of like what [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elaine_Stritch Elaine Stritch] did on Broadway, but without the bitterness. '''Miss Patty''': Did you know that I once met the great [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bette_Davis Bette Davis]? I was a chorus girl in a bus-and-truck tour of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guys_and_Dolls Guys and Dolls]. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beantown Beantown]. I love that town. '''Luke''': Saw [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hairspray_%28musical%29 Hairspray ]last week.
'''Lorelai''': I cannot picture you watching Hairspray.
'''Luke''': It was okay. I liked [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Producers_%28musical%29 The Producers] better.
'''Lorelai''': Aren't we just a Broadway baby? '''Lorelai''': I came up here for a book. It's one of Luke's.
'''Jess''': Well, if it doesn't have [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Encyclopedia_Brown Encyclopedia Brown] in the title, that narrows it down a lot. '''Luke''': Rory and Jess?
'''Lorelai''': No. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ben_Affleck#Personal_life Ben and J. Lo.] '''Lorelai''': I knew each piece of clothing I had to bring, down to the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spice_Girls Spice Girls] necklace I plan to wear Saturday morning for breakfast because we agreed to keep it a little whimsical.
'''Rory''': So, not your [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jonas_Salk Jonas Salk] necklace. '''Lorelai''': Then after, he and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paulie_Walnuts Paulie ]are hitting the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bada_Bing Bada Bing]. '''Rory''': Your stretchy jeans and your [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bunny_Ranch Bunny Ranch] T-shirt. '''Lorelai''': You're guaranteed a great [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norma_Desmond Norma Desmond]-style breakfast the next morning. '''Alex''': I saw [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moose_Murders Moose Murders]. This stinks worse. '''Jess''': Get a clue, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Columbo_%28TV_series%29 Columbo]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Swan Song | up=Season 3 | next=The Big One}} {{Infobox episode |name = Face-Off |Image = 315.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 15 |air_date = February 18, 2003 |writer = [[John Stephens]] |director = [[Kenny Ortega]] }} ==Synopsis== What do you do when your guy doesn't call? Go to a hockey game. And if you're Rory, that's where you'll see your old boyfriend with his new girlfriend. Emily catches Gran kissing a strange man. ==Plot outline== Tired of waiting for [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] to call and make plans for the weekend, [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] goes to a hockey game with [[Lane Kim|Lane]] where she runs into [[Dean Forester|Dean]] and his new girlfriend, [[Lindsay Lister|Lindsay]]. [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] confronts Jess about his poor treatment of Rory. Meanwhile, [[Lorelai "Trix" Gilmore|Gran]] comes to stay with the Gilmores for a few days and [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] is shocked to find her mother-in-law kissing a man. ==Music== *"A Mighty Fortress is Our God" by Martin Luthor *"The Star-Spangled Banner" by Francis Scott Key *"Amazing Grace" by John Newton *"I Get Around" by The Beach Boys *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Distillers The Distillers] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Othello Othello] by William Shakespeare ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoosiers Hoosiers] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Full_Metal_Jacket Full Metal Jacket] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Love_in_the_Afternoon_%281957_film%29 Love in the Afternoon] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Good plan. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bay_of_Pigs_Invasion Bay of Pigs], was that yours too?

'''Lorelai''': Where do you think the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Susan_Faludi Susan Faludi]'s of the world came from?

'''Lorelai''': You don't get breaks? Do you get food? Water? Should I get [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Moore Michael Moore] on the phone?

'''Emily''': I sound like a spoiled high-school girl.
'''Lorelai''': Not quite. You still haven't asked for the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gloria_Vanderbilt Gloria Vanderbilt] jeans and the convertible [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Convertible Rabbit].

'''Lorelai''': What would [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/judith_Martin Miss Manners] do?

'''Richard''': It's like a play by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MoliÃ¨re MoliÃ¨re]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Face-Off | up=Season 3 | next=A Tale of Poes and Fire}} {{Infobox episode |name = The Big One |Image = 316.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 16 |air_date = February 25, 2003 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Jamie Babbit]] }} ==Synopsis== Surprise, surprise! Rory and Paris finally hear from Harvard...with surprising results. Lorelai and Max meet again...with surprising consequences. And Sookie's taste buds misfire...for a surprising reason. ==Plot outline== While nervously waiting for their college acceptance letters to arrive, [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Paris Gellar|Paris]] find themselves competing to give a speech at [[Chilton Preparatory School|Chilton]]'s bi-centennial, where Paris makes a startling admission. When [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] runs into her former fiance, [[Max Medina]] and they share a passionate kiss, she is left to wonder if ending the engagement was the right decision. [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]]'s strange behavior has a surprising explanation. ==Music== *Prologue from ''Into the Woods'' *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cobain Cobain], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tears_for_Fears Tears for Fears] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I%27m_with_the_Band I'm with the Band] by Pamela Des Barres ==Pop Culture References== '''Rory''': Guess I've got time to tie my shoes.
'''Lorelai''': Yes, well, cobble yourself a new pair, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_Day-Lewis Daniel Day-Lewis].
'''Lorelai''': I had made little doodles with my name hidden in them on each one of the old menus, just like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Hirschfeld Hirschfeld].
'''Teacher''': And we welcome back Brad, who's fresh from Broadway after a successful year's run of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Into_the_Woods Into the Woods]!
'''Paris''': Sit down, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Martin Mary Martin].
'''Brad''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nathan_Lane Nathan Lane] is a very bitter man.
'''Madeline''': Unless he was in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Les_Miz Les Miz]''.
'''Louise''': Yeah. Or ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cats_%28musical%29 Cats]''.
'''Paris''': I'm thrilled to hear it, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chita_Rivera Chita Rivera].
'''Paris''': I'm only saying it won't be a totally satisfying victory just beating [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerome_Robbins Jerome Robbins] and the rest of the losers here. I'd really like to take you down also. '''Sookie''': "You haven't lived until you've eaten their food," says [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruth_Reichl Ruth Reichl]. '''Lorelai''': Well, look who's suddenly decided to become [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kofi_Annan Kofi Annan]. '''Paris''': Even if I was the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Carter Billy Carter] of the family, the name was supposed to carry some weight. '''Max''': I must say, I've been a teacher for 10 years now, and it wasn't until today I realized it must be really hard to be a girl.
'''Lorelai''': And with the invention of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sephora Sephora], really expensive, too. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]]

page.title: A Tale of Poes and Fire

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=The Big One | up=Season 3 | next=Happy Birthday, Baby}} {{Infobox episode |name = A Tale of Poes and Fire |Image = 317.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 17 |air_date = April 15, 2003 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Chris Long]] }} ==Synopsis== During a meeting of the Poe Society, a fire empties the inn, guests move into Lorelai's house...and Lorelai ends up bunking with Luke and Jess. Rory juggles acceptances from Harvard, Yale, and Princeton. ==Plot outline== When a meeting of the Edgar Allan Poe Society at the [[Independence Inn]] is interrupted by a fire, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] must find rooms for the guests at various homes around town. Forced to give up her own room, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] spends the night at [[Luke Danes|Luke]]'s. Trying to decide among Harvard, [[Yale]] and Princeton, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] make an extensive list of pros and cons for each school. [[Luke Danes|Luke]] worries that [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] may be skipping school when he learns that [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] has been working a surprising number of hours at Wal-Mart. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] visits a humiliated and hibernating [[Paris Gellar|Paris]] to deliver school assignments and a pep talk. ==Music== *Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justin_Timberlake Justin Timberlake] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Tell-Tale_Heart The Tell-Tale Heart] by Edgar Allan Poe *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_raven The Raven] by Edgar Allan Poe *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/In_Search_of_Lost_Time In Search of Lost Time] by Marcel Proust *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicholas_Nickleby Nicholas Nickleby] by Charles Dickens ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ed_Wood_%28film%29 Ed Wood] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': There will be a complementary [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Cask_of_Amontillado cask of amontillado] on the table in your room. And if you're expecting your friends [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_System_of_Doctor_Tarr_and_Professor_Fether Dr. Tarr and Prof. Fether], I'll send up another one.
''*silence*''
'''Lorelai''': You said you were with the Poe Society.
'''Larson''': Yeah, but it's just a hobby, we're not [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trekkies Trekkies].

'''Rory''': Try to make it home in time for ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Rose_%28talk_show%29 Charlie Rose]''. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_joel Billy Joel]'s on, and he might cry or something.

'''Lorelai''': Hey, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shari_Lewis Shari Lewis], how's the show going?

'''Miss Patty''': I was [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ricardo_Montalban Ricardo Montalban]'s receptionist for six months, and he never complained.

'''Lorelai''': You checked the Cheshire Cat, the Maiden's Teacup, the Cookie House, the Sugar Bear Inn?
'''Michel''': Every place that sounds like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glinda_the_Good_Witch Glinda the Good Witch] threw up? Yes, all booked.

'''Paris''': I've been totally [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_Hughes#Mental_illness_and_physical_decline Howard-Hughes]ing it.

'''Paris''': I'll get an apartment in Cambridge, buy a Harvard sweatshirt, talk about [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mira_Sorvino Mira Sorvino] a lot.

'''Paris''': I was flipping through Harvard class schedules when you were still delighting to the adventures of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gumby Gumby and Pokey].
'''Rory''': I was more a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pee_Wee_Herman Pee Wee Herman] kind of Gal.

'''Lorelai''': I'm a nomad. I am the lonely wanderer. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hank_Williams Hank Williams] would be too sad to write a song about me.

'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Streetcar_Named_Desire_%281951_film%29 Stella]!

'''Jess''': What else did she think I did? Start the fire? Put [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phil_Spector Phil Spector] up to it?

'''Jess''': As they say on the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Family_Feud Family Feud], "Good answer." [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=A Tale of Poes and Fire | up=Season 3 | next=Keg! Max!}} {{Infobox episode |name = Happy Birthday, Baby |Image = 318.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 18 |air_date = April 22, 2003 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Gail Mancuso]] }} ==Synopsis== Mama mia! Rory plans to honor her birthday-girl mother with a big party and an even bigger pizza. Richard has a greater surprise: an investment he made for Lorelai at her birth just paid off. ==Plot outline== While [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] deals with the rebuilding of the fire-damaged [[Independence Inn|Inn]], [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] schemes to give her mom a great birthday party, complete with a gigantic pizza. [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] surprises [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] with a large check from an investment he made when she was born, and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] uses part of the money to repay her parents for [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]'s education, a gesture which does not please [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]]. Meanwhile, [[Luke Danes|Luke]] confirms his fear that [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] has been skipping school to work extra shifts at Wal-Mart. [[Luke Danes|Luke]] agrees to meet [[Nicole Leahy|Nicole]]'s parents. [[Paris Gellar|Paris]] returns to school a changed person. ==Music== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macarena_%28song%29 Macarena ]by Los del RÃ­o Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Hot_Chili_Peppers Red Hot Chili Peppers] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Almost_Famous Almost Famous] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ed_Wood_%28film%29 Ed Wood] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturday_Night_Fever Saturday Night Fever] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gangs_of_New_York Gangs of New York] ==Pop Culture References== '''Tobin''': I know [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_Randall Tony Randall] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ren%C3%A9e_Estevez RenÃ©e Estevez]. I'd be happy to put in a call.

'''Rory''': Luke cannot sweep out chimney.
'''Lorelai''': Why not?
'''Rory''': Because you need to be a chimney sweep to sweep a chimney.
'''Rory''': Please. If [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Poppins_%28film%29#Bert Dick Van Dyke] can do it, so can Luke.

'''Paris''': My parents return tomorrow, I think my mom is bringing home a new face.
'''Rory''': Really?
'''Paris''': There's a doctor in France who injects some kind of gel into your head and molds it to give you better cheekbones.
'''Rory''': You are kidding me!
'''Paris''': She needs to sleep on her back for a month otherwise her face will flatten like a crepe.
'''Rory''': Oh my God, it's [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil_%28film%29 Brazil]!

'''Lorelai''': Put [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3P2dbwrT_fQ Mrs. Ha-Wiggins] on the phone, have her tell me.

'''Luke''': Yeah, you could send over a couple [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oompa-Loompas Oompa-Loompas] to kick the crap out of Aunt Tillie.

'''Lorelai''': $75,000 -- oh my God, that's 150 pairs of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimmy_choos Jimmy Choos].

'''Jess''': The cleaned up version of the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eminem_Show Eminem Show] seems to be selling pretty well.

'''Tobin''': That is the jacket that [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Strummer Joe Strummer] wore during the 1979 Pearl Harbor tour.

'''Rory''': This is not "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gangs_of_new_york Gangs of New York], now with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cameron_Diaz Cameron Diaz]"! This is ''Gangs of New York'' twenty years ago with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meryl_Streep Meryl Streep], as [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scorsese Scorsese ]originally imagined it!

'''Lorelai''': I've got [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polonius Polonius ]and the entire banking system on my side. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Happy Birthday, Baby | up=Season 3 | next=Say Goodnight, Gracie}} {{Infobox episode |name = Keg! Max! |Image = 319.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 19 |air_date = April 29, 2003 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Chris Long]] }} ==Synopsis== It looks like Lane's band is on the stairway to stardom: They get a gig playing at a party that attracts every teen in town - and one 21-year-old, who brings a beer keg. Soon everybody's tapping into trouble. ==Plot outline== With graduation approaching, [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] is happily looking forward to attending the [[Stars Hollow High School]] prom with [[Jess Mariano|Jess]], but he gets some surprising news from Principal Merten. [[Hep Alien|Lane's band]] makes its debut at a big party, but the evening ends on an ugly note when the long-standing animosity between Jess and [[Dean Forester|Dean]] finally erupts into a fist fight. Meanwhile, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] gets roped into serving on the parents' committee for the [[Chilton Preparatory School|Chilton]] graduation party, putting her back in contact with a very uncomfortable [[Max Medina]]. ==Music== *"Magic Moments" by Perry Como *"La La" by Shark Quest *"Fell in Love with a Girl" by The White Stripes *"White Riot" by The Clash *"Calling All Enthusiasts" by Radio 4 *"Saccharine" by Sunday's Best *"Why" by North Green *"Dance to the Underground" by Radio 4 *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michelle_Branch Michelle Branch], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matchbox_Twenty Matchbox Twenty], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Clash The Clash], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rage_Against_The_Machine Rage Against The Machine], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nirvana_%28band%29 Nirvana] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spinal_Tap_%28movie%29 This Is SpÄ±nÌˆal Tap] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fame_%281980_film%29 Fame] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lord_of_the_Rings_film_trilogy Lord of the Rings] ==Pop Culture References== '''Rory''': No it just drives me crazy. It's like if you do ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shave_and_a_Haircut Shave and a Haircut]'' without the last part, ya know?

'''Rory''': The Gilmore house is partying like it's [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1999_%28song%29 1999].
'''Lorelai''': And here, it's at home with ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_700_Club The 700 Club]''.

'''Lorelai''': You've been getting some sleep, brother? 'Cause that's [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Casey_%28rock_%26_roll_guitarist%29 forty miles of bad road].

'''Lane''': Kyle's parents are going to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marriage_Encounter Marriage Encounter] for the weekend.

'''Zach''': We vetoed the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Potter Harry Potter]s.

'''Jess''': Tuxes are also [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Bond James Bond], that's not geeky.

'''Lorelai''': It's getting very [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cinemax#Max_After_Dark Cinemax ]at night in here.

'''Sookie''': You were both [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Dean James Dean]ing it, trying to keep it professional.

'''Lorelai''': It was not an illusion, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doug_Henning Doug Henning].

'''Sookie''': When I was like, 10, I was sooo into [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leif_Garrett Leif Garrett].

'''Dave''': It sounds a little too [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milli_Vanilli Milli Vanilli], Zach.

'''Rory''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spinal_Tap_%28movie%29 Hello Cleveland].

'''Rory''': You and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Springsteen Springsteen]: The working-man's hero.

'''Zach''': Don't forget that the hair and fingernails on [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Entwistle John Entwistle]'s body were still growing when they brought in his replacement.

'''Paris''': Who decided to do a half hour tribute to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenny_G Kenny G].

'''Lorelai''': With Lorelai Gilmore, it's [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trust_but_verify trust but verify].

'''Lorelai''': You mean, you weren't living like a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trappists Trappist monk] while you were over there? [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Keg! Max! | up=Season 3 | next=Here Comes the Son}} {{Infobox episode |name = Say Goodnight, Gracie |Image = 320.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 20 |air_date = May 6, 2003 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Jamie Babbit]] }} ==Synopsis== The Great Party Brawl of 2003 is over, but so much else is just beginning: Jess's loser father shows up, Dean and Lindsay are engaged, and Fran the bakery lady dies, which means the Dragonfly may be for sale. ==Plot outline== Both [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] avoid one another when they find it difficult to deal with their emotions after the fight at the party. When [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] learn that the owner of the [[Dragonfly Inn]] has passed away, they see their chance to buy the inn of their dreams. Much to [[Jess Mariano|Jess]]' surprise his long-lost father, [[Jimmy Mariano|Jimmy]], shows up in [[Stars Hollow]] and introduces himself to [[Jess Mariano|Jess]], then suddenly leaves town. [[Luke ]]is furious when he learns [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] has flunked out of high school and gives him an ultimatum to repeat his senior year or leave. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] finds out that [[Dean Forester|Dean]] is engaged to be married. [[Lanes Kim|Lane]]'s beau, [[Dave Rygalski|Dave]], pleads his case to a stoic [[Mrs. Kim]]. ==Music== *"Wind Beneath My Wings" by Bette Midler *"The Candy Man" from Willy Wonka *"Semper Fidelis" by John Phillip Sousa *"Suffragette City" by David Bowie *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Monkees The Monkees], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bono Bono] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stepford The Stepford Wives] by Ira Levin *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_VI,_part_1 Henry VI] by William Shakespeare ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_and_the_Chocolate_Factory_%28film%29 Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Animal_House National Lampoon's Animal House] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cinderella_%281950_film%29 Cinderella] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cinderella_%281950_film%29Footloose Footloose] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Graduate The Graduate] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scream_2 Scream 2] (when Dave mentions video games turning people into serial killers) ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Are you sure she's gonna want that back? It's been left alone all night at a keg party. There's no getting it over that. That backpack is permanently scarred. That backpack is [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zelda_Fitzgerald Zelda Fitzgerald].

'''Lorelai''': Did they bring the paddy wagon?
'''Rory''': Yeah, but then we snuck out the back of the speakeasy and headed straight for the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algonquin_Hotel Algonquin].
'''Lorelai''': How was [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Benchley Benchley]?
'''Rory''': Drunk again.

'''Lane''': After I finished with my [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Farrelly_Brothers Farrelly Brothers] audition in the bushes.

'''Lane''': It was more [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stepford Stepford] than cold -- very calm, very serene.

'''Taylor''': The day we all thought would never get here has arrived.
'''Kirk''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arbor_Day Arbor Day]?
'''Taylor''': No.
'''Kirk''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Last_Judgment The day of reckoning]?
'''Taylor''': No.
'''Kirk''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_day_the_music_died The day the music died]?

'''Jess''': Where the hell have you been? The place is a freaking zoo. Every table's full and I've got [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Candy_Man Sammy Davis Jr.] here thinking it's the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desert_Inn Desert Inn].

'''Lorelai''': If we're meant to have the Dragonfly Inn, then we're meant to have it.
'''Sookie''': Right. Like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doris_Day Doris Day]
'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Que_sera Que sera]....
'''Sookie''': ...sera. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Say Goodnight, Gracie| up=Season 3 | next=Those Are Strings, Pinocchio}} {{Infobox episode |name = Here Comes the Son |Image = 321.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 21 |air_date = May 13, 2003 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] }} ==Synopsis== Sand in the gears, Jess heads for Venice Beach to crash at his father's place. But Jimmy doesn't make him welcome and neither does Jimmy's girlfriend. Rory stresses out as graduation nears. ==Plot outline== After the blow-up with [[Luke Danes|Luke]], [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] leaves [[Stars Hollow]] for Venice, California, to stay with [[Jimmy Mariano|Jimmy]], the father he knows almost nothing about. [[Jimmy Mariano|Jimmy]] admits he isn't capable of being a father, but promises to ask his live-in girlfriend [[Sasha]] to let Jess stay. Back in [[Stars Hollow]], at the same time [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] is wondering how to tell [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] that Jess is gone, she learns that the money [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] gave her will make Rory ineligible for financial aid at [[Yale]]. Feeling stressed out about everything, Rory unexpectedly confronts [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] over her treatment of Lorelai. ==Music== *"Pipeline" by The Chantays *"Catch A Wave" by The Beach Boys *"Mockingbirds" by Grant Lee Buffalo *"Los Angeles" by X *"One way or Another" by Blondie *"Here Comes the Sun" by The Beatles *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rolling_Stones The Rolling Stones], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motown Motown], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_bowie David Bowie] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naked_Lunch Naked Lunch] by William S. Burroughs ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wizard_of_Oz_%281939_film%29 The Wizard of Oz] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sabrina_%281954_film%29 Sabrina] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Broadcast_News_%28film%29 Broadcast News] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': When we're in Spain, we need to know how to say, "Does [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antonio_Banderas Antonio Banderas] live near here?" In France, "Does [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnny_Depp Johnny Depp] live near here?"
'''Rory''': When in Rome, "Does [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gore_Vidal Gore Vidal] live near here?"

'''Lorelai''': Looked like the Academy Award audience during [http://www.dailymotion.com/video/xhbzq_michael-moore-oscar-speech_music Michael Moore's speech].

'''Lorelai''': Does that sexy guy in the Peugeot ad who had a bit part in Armageddon live near here?

'''Lorelai''': Did you have a bad dream? The one where you finally meet [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christiane_Amanpour Christiane Amanpour] and she's really stupid?

'''Lorelai''': Through the walls? No. I put [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kryptonite kryptonite] in her waffles this morning, I think were fine.

'''Sasha''': This is Angus, Chowder, Rufus, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legolas Legolas], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caligula Caligula], Mudball, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_E._Lee General Lee], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimmy_Jam Jimmy Jam], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimmy_Jam Terry Lewis], and Spot.

'''Miss Celine''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ginger_Rogers Ginger Rogers] always insisted her dresses move just like that.

'''Miss Celine''': Yes, I had that exact suit made in mint for Mrs. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Cronkite Walter Cronkite] just last week.

'''Miss Celine''': Yes, I had that exact shirt on [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimmy_Stewart Jimmy Stewart] the night before his colonoscopy.

'''Paris''': Suddenly, I'm [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Felicity_%28TV_series%29 Felicity ]without the hair issues.

'''Miss Celine''': Look, Sabrina, it's [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natalie_Wood Natalie Wood].

'''Miss Celine''': I tried to retire once. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivia_de_Havilland Olivia de Havilland] wouldn't hear of it.

'''Lorelai''': I'm here, and if you served dinner, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miss_Manners Miss Manners] would insist that you invite me to stay.

'''Lorelai''': What book?
'''Emily''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lovely_Bones Lovely Bones].
'''Lorelai''': Did you like it?
'''Emily''': It's not my taste but I respect the attempt.

'''Jess''': It's a little late to throw me a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teenage_Mutant_Ninja_Turtles Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles] birthday party. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Here Comes the Son | up=Season 3 | next=Ballrooms and Biscotti}} {{Infobox episode |name = Those Are Strings, Pinocchio |Image = 322.jpg |season_num = [[Season 3|3]] |ep_num = 22 |air_date = May 20, 2003 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Jamie Babbit]] }} ==Synopsis== Rory graduates from Chilton and the Independence Inn closes. But there's much to look forward to: Yale, the summer backpack trek through Europe, and Lorelai and Sookie's dream of opening their own inn. ==Plot outline== As [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]'s graduation day approaches, the Gilmore girls plan their long-awaited summer backpacking trip across Europe, even as [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] faces the possibility that the recent fire will force the owners of the [[Independence Inn]] to sell the building. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] takes matters into her own hands when she discovers that [[Lorelai |Lorelai]] is making a great personal sacrifice to pay for the [[Yale]] tuition. [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] and [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] present [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] with a lavish graduation gift, and everyone is touched by [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]'s moving valedictory speech. Meanwhile, [[Luke Danes|Luke]] has second thoughts about a summer cruise with his [[Nicole Leahy|new girlfriend]]. ==Music== *"Peace Train" by Cat Stevens *"Mexican Shuffle" by Herb Alpert and the Tijuana Brass *"Pomp and Circumstance" by Edward Elgar *"Cherish" by The Association *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Creedence_Clearwater_Revival Creedence Clearwater Revival], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Huey_Lewis_%26_the_News Huey Lewis & the News], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patti_smith Patti Smith], ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moby-Dick Moby-Dick] by Herman Melville *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adventures_of_Huckleberry_Finn Adventures of Huckleberry Finn] by Mark Twain *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ignatius_J._Reilly A Confederacy of Dunces] by John Kennedy Toole *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anna_Karenina Anna Karenina] by Leo Tolstoy *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swann%27s_Way In Search of Lost Time] by Marcel Proust *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Faulkner William Faulkner], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jane_austen Jane Austen], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eudora_Welty Eudora Welty], ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Money_Pit The Money Pit] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Love_Boat The Love Boat].
'''Luke''': I have no plans to propose.
'''Lorelai''': You don't now but after you've had dinner at Captain Stubing's table, and Isaac's served you up a couple of mojitos...

'''Kirk''': I did tell you about the dangers of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ed_McMahon#Health_problems mold and Ed McMahon's dog], right?

'''Sookie''': Tell it to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deney_Terrio Deney Terrio] here. "I should've been a dancer."

'''Lorelai''': Look, if you need to work as a low-paid intern for a magazine or a stringer for some small-town newspaper or [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Brokaw Tom Brokaw]'s toupee comber-outer before you make real money, then that's what you'll do.

'''Lorelai''': If you wear it with a moody look on your face like you're thinking of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bolsheviks Bolsheviks], they'll mistake you for [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simone_de_Beauvoir Simone de Beauvoir].

'''Lorelai''': We're the Chilton equivalent of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/50_Cent 50 Cent]'s posse.

'''Rory''': I don't want you to [http://www.cswnet.com/~menamc/langston.htm defer your dream].

'''Sookie''': I've been depressed for days. I couldn't watch ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Dating_Game The Dating Game]'' anymore.

'''Brad''': Though my time here was briefly interrupted by my period spent on Broadway hanging out with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_Sondheim Stephen Sondheim]...

'''Rory''': This marble is two hundred years old. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harriet_Beecher_Stowe Harriet Beecher Stowe] walked on this marble.
'''Lorelai''': Oh, the banister.
'''Rory''': Was donated by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Frost Robert Frost].
'''Lorelai''': The sconce.
'''Rory''': Was ceremoniously lit for the first time by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Edison Thomas Edison]. ==Memorable Quotes== '''Rory''': Headmaster Charleston, faculty members, fellow students, family and friends, welcome. We never thought this day would come. We prayed for its quick delivery, crossed days off our calendars, counted hours, minutes and seconds and now that it's here, I'm sorry it is, because it means leaving friends who inspire me and teachers who've been my mentors, so many people who've shaped my life, and my fellow students lives impermeably and forever. I live in two worlds. One is a world of books. I've been a resident of Faulkner's Yoknapatawpha County, hunted the white whale aboard the Pequod, fought alongside Napoleon, sailed a raft with Huck and Jim, committed absurdities with Ignatius J. Reilly, rode a sad train with Anna Karenina and strolled down Swann's Way. It's a rewarding world, but my second one is by far superior. My second one is populated with characters slightly less eccentric, but supremely real, made of flesh and bone, full of love, who are my ultimate inspiration for everything. Richard and Emily Gilmore are kind, decent, unfailingly generous people. They are my twin pillars, without whom I could not stand. I am proud to be their grandchild. But my ultimate inspiration comes from my best friend, the dazzling woman from whom I received my name and my life's blood, Lorelai Gilmore. My mother never gave me any idea that I couldn't do whatever I wanted to do or be whomever I wanted to be. She filled our house with love and fun and books and music unflagging in her efforts to give me role models from Jane Austen to Eudora Welty to Patti Smith. As she guided me through these incredible eighteen years, I don't know if she ever realized that the person I most wanted to be was her. Thank you Mom, you are my guidepost for everything. ==Mistakes== In the scene where Lorelai is telling Rory about the money issue her shirt only shows "PEAC" because her sweater is covering the "E" but in the next shot "PEACE" is showing. ==Trivia== In the episide [[Swan Song]], Emily makes mention that Gran will be at graduation when trying to scare Roryn into meeting Jess, pointing out that she, Richard and Gran will get to meet him at the same time during that moment. However, Gran does not show up, nor is there any mention of her absence. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 3 episodes]]

{{stub}} '''Henry Cho''' is a [[Chilton Preparatory School|Chilton]] student whom [[Lane Kim|Lane]] secretly dates in season 1 and 2. Lane meets him in the episode [[Rory's Dance]]. Henry is a "potential Korean doctor".
Trivia He calls Lane 13 times, but hangs up when Mrs. Kim picks up the phone. He says he is from National Geographic. [[Category:Characters|Cho, Henry]] [[Category:Chilton|Cho, Henry]] [[Category:Lane's Love Interests|Cho, Henry]]

'''Dave Rygalski''' is [[Lane Kim]]'s first real boyfriend. He comes into her life when she joins his band after she posted an ad for bands seeking drummers. They begin dating and he pretends to be a Christian guitarist to gain her mother's approval, he does not, however, gain it until late in the season as he is not Korean. He is later replaced by [[Gil]] in the band, after he moves to California for college. Dave is mentioned a few more times as a long distance boyfriend but the relationship between Lane and Dave ends after a fight over the marriage jug - the last mention of him. He does not appear again in the show.[[File:AdamDaveRygalski.jpg|thumb]]
==Trivia== Dave is named after [[Helen Pai]]'s [[Dave Rygalski (Helen Pai's Husband)|real-life husband]]. Helen told [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] stories about their dating which inspired scenes for the show.
Adam Brody left the show to star in The O.C. ==Appearances==
===Season 3=== [[Application Anxiety|3.03]] â€¢ [[One's Got Class and the Other One Dyes|3.04]] â€¢ [[They Shoot Gilmores, Don't They?|3.07]] â€¢ [[A Deep-Fried Korean Thanksgiving|3.09]] â€¢ [[Lorelai Out of Water|3.12]] â€¢ [[Swan Song|3.14]] â€¢ [[Face-Off|3.15]] â€¢ [[Keg! Max!|3.19]] â€¢ [[Say Goodnight, Gracie|3.20]] [[Category:Characters|Rygalski, Dave]] [[Category:Hep Alien|Rygalski, Dave]] [[Category:Lane's Love Interests|Rygalski, Dave]] [[Category:Stars Hollow|Rygalski, Dave]]

'''[[File:Gilmore-girls-tippecanoe-09.jpg|thumb]]Gil''' is the guitarist for the band, [[Hep Alien]], and is portrayed by [[Sebastian Bach]], the former lead singer of metal band Skid Row.
After [[Dave Rygalski|Dave]]'s departure, Hep Alien is short of a guitar player. After some time of placing ads and explaining rock history to failing candidates on the phone, [[Lane Kim]] invites '''Gil''' to play with them in [[Lorelai Gilmore]]'s garage. At first the band members (especially [[Zack Van Gerbig]]) voice some reservations about his age (they reckon Gil is in his late thirties or even early forties), but eventually Lane decides unilaterally to let Gil join the band. Gil remains an integral part of Hep Alien. He has a history as a legitimate rock-and-roll musician, and the others in the band often get their cues about what it means to be "rock and roll" from him. For instance, he was able to convince them his bandmates that the proposed tour of Seventh Day Adventists churches was "totally rock and roll."
He has a day job as an owner of a submarine sandwich shop and often comes to practices in his uniform.
He is married with children. His wife has appeared briefly on-camera, but did not have a speaking role. When she's on camera she is usually making out with Gil.
==Appearances==
*[[The Festival of Living Art|4.07]] *[[In the Clamor and the Clangor|4.11]] *[[Afterboom|4.19]] *[[Say Goodbye to Daisy Miller|5.01]] *[[Tippecanoe and Taylor, Too|5.04]] *[[Come Home|5.12]] *[http://gilmoregirls.wikia.com/wiki/A_House_Is_Not_a_Home 5.22] *[[The UnGraduate|6.03]] *[[He's Slippin' 'Em Bread... Dig?|6.10]] *[[Bridesmaids Revisited|6.16]] - performs "Hollaback Girl" at Bat Mitzvah *[[I Get A Sidekick Out of You |6.19]] *[[Santa's Secret Stuff|7.11]] *[[7.16 Will You Be My Lorelai Gilmore?|7.16]] [[Category:Hep Alien]] [[Category:Characters]]

{{stub}} '''Hep Alien''' is [[Lane Kim]]'s band. Originally it was formed with [[Dave Rygalski]] (guitar), [[Brian]] (bass), [[Zack]] (guitar), and Lane (drums). Later, when Dave leaves for college in California, [[Gil]] is chosen as his replacement. The band's first gig is at a house party, where they play cover tunes. Though the band breaks up when Lane and Zack break up, they get back together a few months later, and pursue their steady climb to minor success, with a profitable tour (of Seventh Day Adventists churches) to its credit.
The band name is an anagram of [[Helen Pai]], who is show producer [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]]'s best friend. [[Category:Hep Alien]]

'''[[File:Brian---Zach-gilmore-girls-140005_533_400.jpg|thumb]][[File:Cabrera.jpg|thumb]]Brian Fuller''', portrayed by [[John Cabrera]], plays bass guitar in [[Hep Alien]], and was roommates with [[Zack]] and [[Lane]] after Lane moved out of her [[Mrs. Kim|mother]]'s house. He and Zack had a bunk bed in the living room.
His character is the arguably the least-defined of the group, however we know some of his quirks. For instance, he has a collection of Futurama figurines, and likes playing videogames. We know that he at least occassionally writes songs with Zack, but Zack feels he gives in too easily. He suffers from a number of ailments, including asthma, hypoglycemia, deviated septum, and rosacea. He wears glasses.
In one storyline, Brian wrote a song called "Lane," while Zack and Lane were dating, though he never showed any romantic interest in Lane. He was however interested in Kyon (played by Susane Lee), a foreign exchange student taken in by Mrs. Kim after Lane moves out. She and Brian are seen flirting multiple times throughout the last seasons. ==Appearances== *[[One's Got Class and the Other One Dyes|3.04]] *[[Lorelai Out of Water|3.12]] *[[Swan Song|3.14]] *[[Face-Off|3.15]] *[[Keg! Max!|3.19]] *[[Chicken or Beef?|4.04]] *[[The Festival of Living Art|4.07]] *[[In the Clamor and the Clangor|4.11]] *[[Scene in a Mall|4.15]] *[[Afterboom|4.19]] *[[Last Week Fights, This Week Tights|4.21]] *[[Say Goodbye to Daisy Miller|5.01]] *[[A Messenger, Nothing More|5.02]] *[[Tippecanoe and Taylor, Too|5.04]] *[[We Got Us a Pippi Virgin!|5.05]] *[[You Jump, I Jump, Jack|5.07]] *[[Come Home|5.12]] *[[A House Is Not a Home|5.22]] *[[The UnGraduate|6.03]] *[[Always a Godmother, Never a God|6.04]] *[[The Prodigal Daughter Returns|6.09]] *[[He's Slippin 'Em Bread... Dig?|6.10]] *[[Bridesmaids Revisited|6.16]] *[[I'm OK, You're OK|6.17]] *[[I Get A Sidekick Out of You|6.19]] *[[That's What You Get, Folks, For Makin' Whoopee|7.02]] *[[Lorelai's First Cotillion|7.03]] *[[French Twist|7.07]] *[[Santa's Secret Stuff|7.11]] *[[7.16 Will You Be My Lorelai Gilmore?|7.16]] *[[7.20 Lorelai? Lorelai?|7.20]] *[[7.22 Bon Voyage|7.22]] [[Category:Hep Alien]] [[Category:Characters]]
