{{Epnav | prev=Those Are Strings, Pinocchio | up=Season 4 | next=The Lorelais' First Day at Yale}} {{Infobox episode |name = Ballrooms and Biscotti |Image = 401.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 1 |air_date = September 23, 2003 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] }} ==Synopsis== Warp speed. The Gilmore girls cram one-and-a-half weeks of activites into three days so Rory can attend Yale orientation. But Luke wins the Road Runner contest. He got married during a summer cruise - and now he's getting divorced. ==Plot Outline== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] return from their whirlwind tour of Europe. [[Taylor Doose|Taylor]] doesn't take it well when Rory declines the privilege of being the [[Stars Hollow]] Ice Cream Queen. Lorelai and Rory get caught up in a flurry of activity after Rory realizes that she wrote down the wrong date for freshman orientation, and she only has two days to get ready for [[Yale]], instead of the week she was planning on. [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] is upset when Lorelai misses Friday night dinner and retaliates by turning it into a four hour extravaganza, complete with ballroom dancing videos before the souffle course. Lorelai is shocked when [[Luke Danes|Luke]] finally tells her what happened on his cruise with [[Nicole Leahy|Nicole]]. ==Music== *"When You Tell Me That You Love Me" by Diana Ross *"The Girl From Ipanema" by Fantastic Strings *"That's a Plenty" by Hisao Sudou & New Downbeats Orchestra *"Tell Her What She Wants To Know" by Sam Phillips *"Sk8er Boi" by Avril Lavigne *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U2 U2], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bono Bono], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jim_morrison Jim Morrison] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wizard_of_Oz_%281939_film%29 The Wizard of Oz] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midnight_Express_%28film%29 Midnight Express] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brokedown_Palace Brokedown Palace] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Poppins_%28film%29 Mary Poppins] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Godfather_trilogy The Godfather trilogy] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alice_in_Wonderland_%281951_film%29 Alice in Wonderland] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Mambo_Kings The Mambo Kings] ==Pop Culture References== '''Babette''': I thought you'd been kidnapped by some crazy [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sandinistas Sandinistas ]or something.

'''Rory''': Everything you buy here has a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hello_Kitty Hello Kitty] stamp on the bottom.

'''Sookie''': Oh, was it warm? [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2003_European_heat_wave I read it was warm].

'''Jackson''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ricky_Ricardo Ricky Ricardo] didn't know. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dick_Van_Dyke Dick Van Dyke] didn't know.

'''Rory''': Hear about that whole [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sputnik Sputnik ]thing?

'''Luke''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Que_sera Que sera].

'''Taylor''': Or have one of those high class naked parties with that [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barbara_Pierce_Bush Bush girl].

'''Rory''': I don't wanna change. I don't wanna be the anti-town girl. I'm not [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daria Daria].

'''Lorelai''': I'm so wiped. I shouldn't have taken that third Excedrin PM last night.
'''Rory''': Third? Why'd you take three?
'''Lorelai''': Oh, well, uh, originally I took two, then somewhere around four in the morning, I woke up and had a major [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marilyn_Monroe Marilyn ]moment.

'''Lorelai''': You better walk really fast, like "Warp speed, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mr._Sulu Mr. Sulu]" kind of fast.

'''Rory''': This is [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran_hostage_crisis Iran in '79] and you are [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimmy_Carter Jimmy Carter].

'''Emily''': That's [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corky_Ballas Corky] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shirley_Ballas Shirley Ballas]. I love them. They are so talented.

'''Lorelai''': Mom, she's been here for hours. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patty_Hearst Patty Hearst] had a shorter incarceration [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

page.title: The Lorelais' First Day at Yale

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=Ballrooms and Biscotti | up=Season 4 | next=The Hobbit, the Sofa, and Digger Stiles}} {{Infobox episode |name = The Lorelais' First Day at Yale |Image = 402.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 2 |air_date = September 30, 2003 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Chris Long]] }} ==Synopsis== You look familiar. One of Rory's suitemates at Yale is...Paris Geller? But that's not the only surprise college brings. Rory is stunned to discover she's not quite ready to let go of Lorelai. ==Plot Outline== While [[Luke Danes|Luke]] is willing to lend [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] his truck to help [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] move into her dorm, he's not too thrilled when the project turns out to take all day and all night. Rory's roommates turn out to be a jock, a 15-year-old prodigy sorely lacking in socialization skills, and to her astonishment, [[Paris Geller|her old nemesis from Chilton]]. [[Nicole Leahy|Nicole]]'s partners descend on the diner and threaten to ensnare [[Luke Danes|Luke]] in a morass of paperwork. ==Music== *"Tell Her What She Wants To Know" by Sam Phillips *"Bright Future In Sales" by Fountains of Wayne *"You Can't Hurry Love" by The Supremes *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evanescence Evanescence], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motown Motown] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Little_Rascals_%28film%29 The Little Rascals] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Matrix The Matrix] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casablanca_%28film%29 Casablanca] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monty_Python_%26_the_Holy_Grail Monty Python and the Holy Grail] ==Pop Culture References== '''Rory''': You're having serious [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annie_Leibovitz Annie Leibovitz] delusions here.

'''Lorelai''': I'll put it on the computer and then superimpose an important person standing next to you, seeing you off, like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kissinger Kissinger ]or [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lady_Bird_Johnson Lady Bird Johnson] or [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pat_Summerall Pat Summerall].
'''Rory''': Pat Summerall?
'''Lorelai''': You think of somebody better.
'''Rory''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orson_Welles Orson Welles].

'''Luke''': His name is Don Dewey. He is from the firm [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dewey,_Cheatem,_and_Howe Dewey, Cheatem, & Howe].

'''Lorelai''': Tanna, how old are you?
'''Tanna''': Sixteen.
'''Rory''': Sixteen?
'''Tanna''': On Tuesday.
'''Lorelai''': Happy birthday, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doogie_Howser,_M.D. Doogie].

'''Lorelai''': I could show you his place upstairs. You half expect [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hare_krishnas Hare Krishnas] to jump out of the bathroom banging tambourines.

'''Lorelai''': That's the Yale-supplied mattress that has microbes in it that date back to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Box_Brown Henry Box Brown].

Luke: We've been here before.
Lorelai: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waiting_for_Godot I recognize that tree].

'''Rory''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I_Love_Lucy My nose, it feels like clay].

'''Lorelai''': He's probably busy taping his [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carmen_Electra Carmen Electra] poster up on the ceiling above his bed.

'''Lorelai''': You cannot host your much-anticipated "Salute to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barry_White Barry White]" night without a disco ball.

'''Rory''': I look like Keith Richards at [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Altamont_Free_Concert Altamont]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

page.title: The Hobbit, the Sofa, and Digger Stiles

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=The Lorelais' First Day at Yale | up=Season 4 | next=Chicken or Beef?}} {{Infobox episode |name = The Hobbit, the Sofa, and Digger Stiles |Image = 403.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 3 |air_date = October 7, 2003 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Matthew Diamond]] }} ==Synopsis== The good ship partnership: Lorelai and Sookie team up to cater a children's ''Lord of the Rings'' birthday party, twins trap Rory at her first Yale party, and Richard goes into business with the son of his former associate. ==Plot Outline== To help meet the expenses of opening the inn, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] decide to become caterers on the side, with their first assignment being a ''Lord of the Rings'' theme party. At [[Yale]], [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] returns from class to find that [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] has redecorated their common room. Meanwhile, [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] ponders a proposal to take on a new business partner. ==Music== *Don't Mug Yourself" by The Streets *"I Do The Rock" by Tim Curry *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pink_Floyd Pink Floyd], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mariah_carey Mariah Carey] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atonement_%28novel%29 Atonement] by Ian McEwan ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lord_of_the_Rings_trilogy Lord of the Rings trilogy] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mommie_Dearest_%28film%29 Mommie Dearest] ==Pop Culture References== '''Rory''': I feel like I'm at [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uday_Hussein Uday]'s house.

'''Paris''': There's a party and if you open your door you get to be part of it, but Rory won't open the door because she's too busy being [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heidi Heidi]'s grandfather!

'''Rory''': I'm rooming with a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_King Stephen King] novel.

'''Lorelai''': These kids not [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romanovs the Romanov kids].

'''Louise''': Right now, he's totally freaked that ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Simpsons The Simpsons]'' are gonna be off the air by the time he graduates.

'''Paris''': I know. What's with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Gabor_sisters the Gabor sisters]?

'''Paris''':Tanna's a freak, so she'll be in the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Forbes_Nash,_Jr. John Nash] group. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=The Hobbit, the Sofa, and Digger Stiles | up=Season 4 | next=The Fundamental Things Apply}} {{Infobox episode |name = Chicken or Beef? |Image = 404.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 4 |air_date = October 14, 2003 |writer = [[Jane Espenson]] |director = [[Chris Long]] }} ==Synopsis== After jumping through Taylor Doose's hoops, Lorelai begins renovating the Dragonfly. Another new start: Dean gets married, despite his boozy, post-bachelor-party confession to Luke that he still cares for Rory. ==Plot Outline== Back home for the weekend, [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] has an uncomfortable encounter with [[Dean Forester|Dean]], her ex, and ends up getting invited to his wedding the next day. Meanwhile, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] visit [[Michel Gerard|Michel]] at his trendy new workplace, but run into problems getting the permit they need to begin construction on the inn. ==Music== *"The Weakest Shade of Blue" by The Pernice Brothers *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mick_Jagger Mick Jagger], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Offspring The Offspring], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Flag_%28band%29 Black Flag], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bad_Religion Bad Religion], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weezer Weezer], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janet_Jackson Janet Jackson] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northanger_Abbey Northanger Abbey] by Jane Austen ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G.I._Jane G.I. Jane] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wizard_of_Oz_%281939_film%29 The Wizard of Oz] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Glenn_Miller_Story The Glen Miller Story] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Godfather The Godfather] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wall_Street_%281987_film%29 Wall Street] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': To the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Braille_Institute Braille Institute], it's just a trim.

'''Lorelai''': And what are your plans today, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persis_Khambatta Persis Khambatta]?

'''Rory''': Well, how are we supposed to get out of our house?
(Lorelai [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I_Dream_of_Jeannie crosses her arms, nods her head and blinks])

'''Rory''': It looks like heaven or a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victoria%27s_Secret Victoria's Secret] commercial which, to some people, is basically the same thing.

'''Lorelai''': We know where all those [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calvin_Klein Calvin Klein] ads went to die.

'''Sookie''': I missed the beginning of ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queer_Eye_for_the_Straight_Guy Queer Eye for the Straight Guy]'', and by the time I got back, they were all gay.

'''Luke''':[http://www.buzznews.net/music/music-news/item/506-elvis-presley-michael-jackson-and-jim-morrison-what-really-happened Jim Morrison is not hanging out with Elvis]. [http://www.marilyn-monroe.net/ The Kennedys did not kill Marilyn].

'''Lorelai''': Come on, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Augustus_Gloop Augustus Gloop].

'''Taylor''': "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Big_Yellow_Taxi Pave paradise and put up a parking lot]."

'''Taylor''': So it'll be a party spot? Catering to that crowd, hip-hoppers, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Manson_family#Rise_of_the_Family the Manson family]?

'''Lorelai''': It's a 23-year-old porch. Unless you think [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kate_Hudson Kate Hudson] is historical, it's not historical.

'''Kirk''': My family tree dates back to a 12th-century knight.
'''Lorelai''': Wow.
'''Kirk''': As a kid, I thought that meant we were related to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ted_Knight Ted Knight]. I wrote him a lot of letters. He never responded. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Chicken or Beef? | up=Season 4 | next=An Affair to Remember}} {{Infobox episode |name = The Fundamental Things Apply |Image = 405.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 5 |air_date = October 21, 2003 |writer = [[John Stephens]] |director = [[Neema Barnette]] }} ==Synopsis== What do you say when there's nothing to talk about? Rory's first college date is a dud. Meanwhile, Lorelai asks Luke to take Rory's place in a Gilmore tradition: Movie Night. ==Plot Outline== [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] accepts a [[Trevor|classmate]]'s invitation to go out on her first date since breaking up with [[Jess Mariano|Jess]], while her roommates engage in a war of wills. Meanwhile, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] invites [[Luke Danes|Luke]] over to share the traditional Gilmore movie night she used to have with Rory, although she is somewhat disturbed after discovering that the designer she just hired to decorate the inn used to work for her [[Emily Gilmore|mother]]. ==Music== *"Shadow Dancing" by Andy Gibb *"Rusholme Ruffians" by The Smiths *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belle_and_Sebastian Belle & Sebastian], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hootie_%26_the_Blowfish Hootie & the Blowfish] ==Book References== *The Sun Also Rises, by Ernest Hemingway *The Snows of Kilimanjaro, by Ernest Hemingway *Tender Is The Night, by F. Scott Fitzgerald ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casablanca_%28film%29 Casablanca] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinatown_%28film%29 Chinatown] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bonnie_and_Clyde_%28film%29 Bonnie and Clyde] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/It_Happened_One_Night It Happened One Night] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/His_Girl_Friday His Girl Friday] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Treasure_of_the_Sierra_Madre_%28film%29 Treasure of the Sierra Madre] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diner_%28film%29 Diner] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mr._and_Mrs._Bridge Mr. and Mrs. Bridge] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Poseidon_Adventure_%281972_film%29 The Poseidon Adventure] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hardbodies Hardbodies] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grey_Gardens Grey Gardens] ==Pop Culture References== '''Paris''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viet_Cong Charlie ]tried the same tricks on our boys at [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khe_Sanh Khe Sanh], and let me tell you, if she keeps this up, I am not gonna be responsible for what happens.

'''Trevor''': Rory's right. The book's about a guy who can't sleep with the woman he loves. It's not some [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woody_Guthrie Woody Guthrie] song.

'''Lorelai''': I've always loved horses, ever since I was a little girl, and now I finally have a grown-up excuse to buy a pony.
'''Luke''': Great. Listen, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Velvet National Velvet], you have to move this stuff out of here.

'''Lorelai''': He's trying to steal "The World's Grumpiest Diner Guy" title from [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alice_%28TV_series%29 Mel].

'''Natalie''': Small world, isn't it?
'''Lorelai''': Yes, yes. Really small. About the same square footage as that box they threw [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_McCain#Prisoner_of_war McCain ]in.

'''Luke''': Look out, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freddy_vs._Jason Jason and Freddy]!

'''Lorelai''': Days. You've been stomping around, barking at people for days.
'''Luke''': I have not.
'''Lorelai''': Yes, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cujo Cujo], you have.
'''Luke''': I always talk to people like that.
'''Lorelai''': No, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benji Benji], you don't.
'''Luke''': I'll be fine tomorrow.
'''Lorelai''': Really, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lassie Lassie]? Why is that?

'''Emily''': You will not dress her up in one of your ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_and_the_City Sex and the City ]''ensembles.

'''Sookie''': I love [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_House_on_the_Prairie_%28TV_series%29 Little House on the Prarie]. Jack the dog. Where is [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lindsay_Sidney_Greenbush Lindsay Sidney Greenbush]?

'''Lorelai''': Okay, just one more warning. When they showed the first motion picture over a hundred years ago, it featured a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/L%27Arriv%C3%A9e_d%27un_train_en_gare_de_La_Ciotat train rushing toward the camera], and, um, people were so sure the train was going to burst off the screen and crush them, that they ran away in terror. Now, Luke, the train is not going to leave the screen. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=The Fundamental Things Apply | up=Season 4 | next=The Festival of Living Art}} {{Infobox episode |name = An Affair to Remember |Image = 406.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 6 |air_date = October 28, 2003 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Matthew Diamond]] }} ==Synopsis== Emily plans a launch party for Richard's new business and hires Lorelai and Sookie to be the caterers for the party. And Kirk prepares...extensively...for a date. But neither affair goes quite as expected. ==Plot Outline== [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] offers [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] the job of catering the party to launch [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]]'s new business venture, then runs them ragged with demands. Meanwhile, at school, [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] finds that her roommates' activities are preventing her from studying. ==Music== *Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_%28musician%29 Prince], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rolling_Stones The Rolling Stones] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Citizen_Kane Citizen Kane] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pinocchio_%281940_film%29 Pinocchio] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pretty_in_Pink Pretty in Pink] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/An_Affair_to_Remember An Affair to Remember] ==Pop Culture References== '''Emily''': Find out what Jason's going to wear. I don't want the two of you showing up looking like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Bobbsey_Twins the Bobbsey twins].

'''Tom''': Well, the roof's about to cave in so I can stay within our budget, but then I'd just call 'em all [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trigger_%28horse%29 Trigger].

'''Lorelai''': Is that [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Condoleeza_Rice Condoleeza Rice]?

'''Paris''': You'd think he was already President. I don't want to be [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hillary_Rodham_Clinton Hillary].

'''Lorelai''': That's a good story. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hans_Christian_Andersen Hans Christian Andersen]?

'''Emily''': Shame on you for swearing there's a flier. That's the worst possible thing you could do.
'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liv_Tyler Liv Tyler] grew up her entire life thinking [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Todd_Rundgren Todd Rundgren] was her real father. You think that might knock this out of first place?

'''Rory''': My dorm room has turned into a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Stooges Three Stooges] movie.

'''Kirk''': Say I was [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_cruise Tom Cruise]. Where would you seat me?
'''Luke''': In an acting class.

'''Rory''': It's quiet but not [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unabomber UnaBomber].

'''Lorelai''':Every family has a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fredo_Corleone Fredo]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=An Affair to Remember | up=Season 4 | next=Die, Jerk}} {{Infobox episode |name = The Festival of Living Art |Image = 407.jpg |season_num = 4 |ep_num = 7 |air_date = November 04, 2003 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Chris Long]] }} ==Synopsis== The whole town gets involved posing as famed artwork for a festival. While the show goes on, Luke's about-to-be ex shows up - and Sookie's baby is a no-show, days after the due date. ==Plot Outline== [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] and [[Jackson Belleville|Jackson]] decide to have a home birth and enlist the services of a formidable midwife. When [[Stars Hollow]] mounts a festival of living pictures, [[Kirk Gleason|Kirk]] goes way overboard in getting into character for his role as Jesus in "The Last Supper", while [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] has a bad case of stage fright. Meanwhile, [[Lane Kim|Lane]], [[Zack Van Gerbig|Zack]], and [[Brian]] finally find an awesome guitarist to replace [[Dave Rygalski|Dave]], but wonder if he isn't too old to join the band. [[Nicole Leahy|Nicole]] asks [[Luke Danes|Luke]] if they can postpone the divorce and start dating again. ==Music== *"The Entertainer" by Scott Joplin *"99 Luftballoons" by Nena *"Smells Like Teen Spirit" by Nirvana *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pink_Floyd Pink Floyd], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R.E.M. R.E.M.], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thompson_Twins Thompson Twins], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bananarama Bananarama], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quiet_Riot Quiet Riot], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skid_Row_%28American_band%29 Skid Row], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stevie_Wonder Stevie Wonder] ==Book References== *The Bible *1984, by George Orwell ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Godfather The Godfather] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monty_Python%27s_Meaning_of_Life Monty Python's The Meaning of Life] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Matrix The Matrix] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunset_Boulevard_%28film%29 Sunset Boulevard] ==Pop Culture References== '''Sookie''': Leave [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oscar_Wilde Oscar Wilde ]here to his reading.

'''Lane''': I've already figured out that our spin cover should be against a blood-red backdrop with a skull hovering over us.
'''Lorelai''': Well, very [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norman_Rockwell Norman Rockwell].

'''Lorelai''': You better do what [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Ashcroft John Ashcroft] says or they may just follow us home.

'''Lane''': We could dress him up like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angus_Young Angus Young] in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AC/DC AC/DC], that school boy outfit.
'''Brian''': He could have seen AC/DC with their [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bon_Scott original lead singer].
'''Zack''': And 1980 is when that guy choked on his own vomit.

'''Lorelai''': The magazine I was reading that night with a special feature on who's hotter [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_McCarthy Andrew McCarthy] or [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emilio_Estevez Emilio Estevez].

'''Lorelai''': You might want to check that [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gumby Gumby-Pokey] watch, Kirk.

'''Taylor''': ... of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_%E2%80%93_United_States_relations#Iraq_War_and_Mideast_conflict our former ally France]

'''Rory''': You ready for your close-up, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norma_Desmond Miss Desmond]?

'''Lorelai''': I'm a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weeble Weeble], and Weebles wobble.

'''Rory''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lie_back_and_think_of_England Close your eyes and think of England]. ==Paintings== '''''Portrait of a Young Girl Named Anthea'' by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parmigianino Girolamo Parmigianino]''' [[File:Anthea1.jpg|thumb|left|96px]] '''''The Last Supper'' by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonardo_da_Vinci Leonardo da Vinci]''' [[File:Supper1.jpg|thumb|left|150px]] '''''The Reaper'' by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicolas_Poussin Nicolas Poussin]''' [[File:Reaper1.jpg|thumb|left|96px]] '''''Dance at Bougival'' by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pierre-Auguste_Renoir Pierre-Auguste Renoir]''' [[File:Renoir1.jpg|thumb|left|96px]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=The Festival of Living Art | up=Season 4 | next=Ted Koppel's Big Night Out}} {{Infobox episode |name = Die, Jerk |Image = 408.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 8 |air_date = November 11, 2003 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Tom Moore]] }} ==Synopsis== En pointe and in print. To get a story published in the school newspaper, Rory blasts the Yale ballet...and earns the lead ballerina's wrath. Jason finagles an invitation to the Gilmore's Friday dinner. ==Plot Outline== [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] and [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] hold widely differing points of view on the success of their business trip to Atlantic City. Spurred on by her editor, [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] writes a strongly opinionated dance review that leads to a dining hall confrontation with the ballerina. Even though she continues to resist his interest in her, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] can't help but be impressed by [[Jason Stiles|Jason]]'s smooth moves. [[Lane Kim|Lane]] and [[Dave]] have a long distance argument over pottery. When [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] learns that [[Nicole Leahy|Nicole]] and [[Luke Danes|Luke]] have put their divorce on hold, she has a strong reaction. ==Music== *Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avril_Lavigne Avril Lavigne] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wizard_of_Oz_(1939_film) The Wizard of Oz]:
Tana Schrink: What about you?
Rory Gilmore: Me?
Janet Billings: Made anyone mad lately?
Paris Geller: Oh, please. That would be like Dorothy pissing of the Tin-Man. It's impossible. *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/8_Mile_(film) 8 Mile]:
Rory Gilmore: Did you know that she studied Dance for fourteen years and has preformed in Miami? Miami! That's pretty big. Miami
Doyle McMaster: It's boring.
Rory Gilmore: Well, she almost got into Juliard.
Doyle McMaster: That's not interesting either.
Rory Gilmore: Well no, but, these are simply background facts of a fascinating personal journey. A personal journey, of an artist struggling against the indifference of an indifferent society and just dancing as fast as she can and and. It's 8 Mile meets Fame. *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fame_(1980_film) Fame]:
See ''8 Mile'' reference. ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Well, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siskel Siskel]'s chimed in. What about you?
'''Emily''': I'm refraining.
'''Richard''': It's a bit of a sore subject.
Lorelai: We'll talk about something else.
'''Emily''': The garishness, the garishness.
'''Lorelai''': Thus spake [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roger_Ebert Ebert].

'''Doyle''': Coffee mint? I'm addicted to these things. So is [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Woodward Bob Woodward].

'''Doyle''': Remember the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_New_Zoo_Revue New Zoo Revue]?

'''Lorelai''': If [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vincent_Gallo Vincent Gallo] could just see this, he'd feel a whole lot better about [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brown_bunny Brown Bunny].

'''Lane''': I'm guessing it means she's reserving a hall and ordering that "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stations_of_the_cross Stations of the Cross]" ice sculpure.

'''Paris''': We need to rev up the gunships and retaliate before the next strike. We gotta go full-out [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ariel_Sharon Sharon].

'''Paris''': I got my [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crime_in_New_York_City#20th_century East Side 860] partners on it. Now let's move.

'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capone Capone]? They got him for tax evasion.

'''Lorelai''': That's so strum your sitar, dig the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maharishi_Mahesh_Yogi maharishi], pass the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Owsley_Stanley Owsley], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summer_of_Love Summer of Love], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flower_power flower power], hippie-dippie. I can't stand it.

'''Lorelai''': I thought it was [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jason_Priestley Jason Priestley].

'''Jason''': It's nice to meet you. And I don't really go by Digger anymore.
'''Lorelai''': What is it, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/P._diddy P. Digger] now?

'''Rory''': I was harangued by an incensed ballerina.
'''Lorelai''': That is [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salvador_Dali Salvador Dali ]surreal.

'''Richard''': So, which camp was it where you two met?
'''Lorelai''': Hm, it had a funny name and canoes.
'''Jason''': They all have funny names and canoes. Was it [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bug_juice Camp Waziyatha]? [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Die, Jerk | up=Season 4 | next=The Nanny and the Professor}} {{Infobox episode |name = Ted Koppel's Big Night Out |Image = 409.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 9 |air_date = November 18, 2003 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Jamie Babbit]] }} ==Synopsis== The Harvard-Yale game leads to a rift between Emily and Richard and a dinner date for Jason and Lorelai. Luke's new employee drives everyone away from the diner. ==Plot Outline== [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Paris Gellar|Paris]] have lunch at [[Yale]] with [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]], who introduces them to his friend, [[Asher Flemming|Professor Asher Flemming]]. During Friday night dinner [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] asks for an invitation to the Yale-Harvard game. The Gilmores tailgate in style. [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] is upset when Richard's college girlfriend shows up. Lorelai takes [[Jason Stiles|Jason]] up on his invitation to dinner. Rory walks back to the dorm after the game and is shocked to see there is a new man in Paris' life. ==Music== *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Whiffenpoofs The Whiffenpoofs] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Breakfast_Club The Breakfast Club] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kill_Bill Kill Bill] ==Pop Culture References== '''Rory''': It seems a little wrong that [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jessica_Simpson Jessica Simpson] is alive and well and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siegfried_&_Roy#Roy.27s_tiger_injury Roy] got eaten by his tiger.

'''Marty''': Thank you, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Obi-Wan Obi-Wan].

'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ted_Koppel Ted Koppel]'s here. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Ted Koppel's Big Night Out| up=Season 4 | next=In the Clamor and the Clangor}} {{Infobox episode |name = The Nanny and the Professor |Image = 410.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 10 |air_date = January 20, 2004 |writer = [[Scott Kaufer]] |director = [[Peter Lauer]] }} ==Synopsis== The nanny is Michel's old rival, who has child-phobic Michel so paranoid he offers to play Mary Poppins to baby Davey. The professor is a famed academic who's dating a woman 40 years his junior: Paris. ==Plot outline== Luke becomes overwhelmed by Lane's work ethic when he hires her to work at the diner. Rory is less than thrilled with the new man in Paris' life, especially when she learns that he's teaching her contemporary political fiction class. Lorelai asks Jason to keep their relationship a secret from her parents. Richard becomes intensely irritated when a walking tour benefiting the Historical Society visits the Gilmore home. ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wuthering_Heights Wuthering Heights] by Emily Bronte *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dolls Valley of the Dolls] by Jacqueline Susann ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casablanca_%28film%29 Casablanca] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fast_Times_at_Ridgemont_High Fast Times at Ridgemont High] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sound_of_Music_%28film%29 The Sound of Music] ==Pop Culture References== '''Michel''': I'm being [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Punk%27d Punk'd]. I know I'm being Punk'd.

'''Lorelai''': I'm sorry, it's just...now I know who [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woody_Allen Woody Allen]'s next leading lady's gonna be.

'''Jason''': Cyrus was actually trained by the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Skete monks of New Skete].

'''Lorelai''': So, how beautiful was she? Are we talking [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catherine_Zeta-Jones Catherine Zeta-Jones] or the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicky_Hilton weird-looking Hilton sister]?

'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fonzie Fonzie ]used the bathroom as his office. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

page.title: In the Clamor and the Clangor

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=The Nanny and the Professor | up=Season 4 | next=A Family Matter}} {{Infobox episode |name = In the Clamor and the Clangor |Image = 411.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 11 |air_date = January 27, 2004 |writer = [[Sheila R. Lawrence]]
[[Janet Leahy]] |director = [[Michael Grossman]] }} ==Synopsis== Hear the tintinnabulation. New church bells set everyone on edge. More edginess: When Lorelai discovers Luke has moved, she freaks. When Mrs. Kim discovers Lane's secret rock-'n'-roll life, she throws her out of the house. ==Plot outline== Lane sneaks out of the house when Gil gets the band a 1:00 a.m. gig at CBGB's. Luke and Lorelai take matters into their own hands when newly restored church bells turn out to be less welcome than originally anticipated. Rory gets personal with William during a political discussion when she suspects that he's been spreading embarrassing stories about her. Lorelai is initially distressed when she learns that Luke has moved to Litchfield to live with Nicole, but a visit to his apartment over the diner dispels her worries. Lane and her mother have a long-overdue talk with life-changing consequences after Mrs. Kim discovers her daughter's secret life. ==Music== *Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nsync *NSYNC], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simon_%26_Garfunkel Simon & Garfunkel], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fleetwood_Mac Fleetwood Mac], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sarah_McLachlan Sarah McLachlan], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rolling_Stones Rolling Stones], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kraftwerk Kraftwerk], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Ramones The Ramones], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blondie_%28band%29 Blondie], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sonic_Youth Sonic Youth], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Television_%28band%29 Television], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talking_Heads Talking Heads], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_New_Pornographers The New Pornographers] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Witches_of_Eastwick The Witches of Eastwick] by John Updike ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': And then take the craziest mother-daughter title from [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judy_Garland Judy ]and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liza_Minnelli Liza].

'''Lane''': You know, it's people like you who are destroying the music industry!
'''Rory''': Oh, now. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Britney_Spears Britney]'s gotta shoulder some of the blame.

'''Kirk''': Yes, he said I have tinnitus. I looked it up on the web at "Celebrities Who Share Your Disease" and found that [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Shatner William Shatner] is likewise afflicted.
'''Lorelai''': Really, Kirk and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain_Kirk Captain Kirk]?
'''Kirk''': The irony wasn't lost on me.

'''Lorelai''': All those years of watching [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hart_to_Hart Hart to Hart] are about to pay off.

'''Lorelai''': Okay, I'm out. What's your plan, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clyde_Barrow Clyde]?

'''William''': Hey, it's [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madeleine_Albright Madeleine Albright]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=In the Clamor and the Clangor| up=Season 4 | next=Nag Hammadi Is Where They Found the Gnostic Gospels}} {{Infobox episode |name = A Family Matter |Image = 412.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 12 |air_date = February 3, 2004 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Kenny Ortega]] }} ==Synopsis== You can choose your friends. Luke is wary when his flaky sister Liz unexpectedly visits. Then the other shoe drops: Jess is back in Stars Hollow. And Paris dumps boyfriend Jamie in favor of Prof. Flemming. ==Plot outline== [[Luke Danes|Luke]] has his hands full as family members return to [[Stars Hollow]]. [[Lane Kim|Lane]] busies herself at [[Yale]] by being the suite's Helpful Hannah. [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] agrees to accompany [[Jason Stiles|Jason]] on an office furniture shopping trip on his morning off. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] becomes concerned that her mother is having financial problems. Lorelai and Rory discover [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] sleeping in his car in the freezing cold. ==Music== *"Shy Boy" by Bananarama *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Doobie_Brothers The Doobie Brothers] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anna_Karenina Anna Karenina] by Leo Tolstoy ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Good_Morning_Vietnam Good Morning, Vietnam] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Court_Jester The Court Jester] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Graduate The Graduate] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': I love that shirt.
'''Kirk''': It's an [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arnold_Palmer Arnold Palmer].

'''Lorelai''': Yeah. It's not "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donner_Pass Donner Pass]", we have cheese.

'''Lorelai''': Well, it's freezing out here. He could die, he must not know.
'''Rory''': Or doesn't care.
'''Lorelai''': Do you think [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Blaine#Frozen_in_Time David Blaine] put him up to this?

'''Lorelai''': So, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danger,_Will_Robinson danger, Will Robinson]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

page.title: Nag Hammadi Is Where They Found the Gnostic Gospels

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=A Family Matter | up=Season 4 | next=The Incredible Shrinking Lorelais}} {{Infobox episode |name = Nag Hammadi Is Where They Found the Gnostic Gospels |Image = 413.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 13 |air_date = February 10, 2004 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Chris Long]] }} ==Synopsis== When Luke wants to do something about Liz's latest boyfriend, who seems to be yet another life-sapping loser, Jess accuses him of being a know-it-all buttinski...and Luke takes the criticism to heart. ==Plot outline== [[Jess Mariano|Jess]]' attempts to keep a low profile until [[Gypsy]] completes the repairs are not always successful. [[Taylor Doose|Taylor]] puts[[Kirk Gleason|Kirk]] in charge of the annual [[Firelight Festival]]. [[Lane Kim|Lane]] follows [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] back to [[Stars Hollow]] and a place on the Gilmore couch for the weekend, but isn't quite ready to face her mother. [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] is in a dither about filling a table at a benefit and enlists the help of [[Lorelai |Lorelai]] and [[Jason Stiles|Jason]]. [[Luke Danes|Luke]] is less than impressed by [[Liz Danes|Liz]]'s latest business venture and newly-arrived [[T.J.|boyfriend]]. [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] is suspicious of Jason's father's friendly greeting at the benefit. Jess makes a startling declaration to Rory before he leaves town. ==Music== *"Mona Lisa" by Grant Lee Phillips ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alive_%281993_film%29 Alive] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rocky Rocky] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': We've got a stranger in our house.
'''Rory''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Downey,_Jr.#Substance_abuse Robert Downey, Jr.]?

'''Lorelai''': Did anyone ever think that [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sylvia_Plath#Death Sylvia Plath] wasn't crazy, she was just cold?

'''Lorelai''': So on a wigged-out level of one to ten, Mom is at -
'''Rory''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frances_Farmer Frances Farmer]?

'''Speaker''': Because without it, we would just be stuck rooting around [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nag_Hammadi Nag Hammadi]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Nag Hammadi Is Where They Found the Gnostic Gospels | up=Season 4 | next=Scene in a Mall}} {{Infobox episode |name = The Incredible Shrinking Lorelais |Image = 414.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 14 |air_date = February 17, 2004 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]]
[[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Stephen Clancy]] }} ==Synopsis== Things fall apart. Humiliated when she has trouble keeping up with her course load, Rory leans on Dean for support. Running out of time and money to renovate the Dragonfly, Lorelai turns to Luke. ==Plot outline== When [[Lorelai "Trix" Gilmore|Trix]] returns to town and berates [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] for being financial failures, Richard angrily sets his mother straight, to [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]]'s delight. Lorelai and [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] explore ways to ease their financial crunch and raise money to pay their construction crew, one of whom is now [[Dean Forester|Dean]]. Janet and [[Paris Geller|Paris]] go head-to-head over the constant presence of Janet's boyfriend in the suite. Lorelai and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] play an increasingly frustrating game of telephone tag. After Paris, [[Tanna]], and Janet complain about close quarters in the suite, [[Lane Kim|Lane]] moves out of the dorm and in with Lorelai, and gets her job back at [[Luke's Diner|Luke's]]. Lorelai and Sookie have a heated discussion about sharing the responsibilities of opening their inn. Rory is distraught when one of her professors tells her to drop a class because she can't handle her course load. Lane runs into her mother and receives a frosty reception. At the end of a very long, hard day, Lorelai and Rory still can't manage to connect, and end up taking solace in the arms of the married men in their lives, [[Luke Danes|Luke]] for Lorelai, and Dean for Rory. ==Trivia== *This is the first episode of Gilmore Girls in which Alexis Bledel and Lauren Graham do not appear together. This would not happen again until the sixth season. ==Music== *"Livin' On a Prayer" by Bon Jovi *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Carpenters The Carpenters] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man_%28film%29 Spider-Man] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taxi_Driver Taxi Driver] ==Pop Culture References== '''Paris''': I should just tell her Asher Flemming's my man so she can compare her circa 1972 [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lou_Ferrigno Lou Ferrigno] with him.

'''Paris''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gandalf#The_Fellowship_of_the_Ring Gandalf the Grey] is still falling down it.

'''Lorelai''': I get a phone call from a guy who sounds like a "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kids_in_the_Hall Kids in the Hall]" character telling me I have to get to the inn to okay a sink...

'''Trix''': It makes you look like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adolphe_Menjou Adolphe Menjou].

'''Trix''': Unless your partner is a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rockefeller_family Rockefeller], you are in serious financial trouble. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=The Incredible Shrinking Lorelais | up=Season 4 | next=The Reigning Lorelai}} {{Infobox episode |name = Scene in a Mall |Image = 415.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 15 |air_date = February 24, 2004 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Chris Long]] }} ==Synopsis== Conspicuous consumption. Hurt that Richard spends so much time on business, Emily hits the mall, dragging Lorelai and Rory in her wake. Plus: Lane moves into an apartment with her band mates. ==Plot outline== [[Kirk Gleason|Kirk]] branches out from dog sitting for [[Lulu]] into a new canine-centered career. [[Paris Gellar|Paris]] goes into germ-phobic overdrive when [[Rory gilmore|Rory]] gets a cold. [[Lane Kim|Lane]] gets an apartment with [[Zack Van Gerbig|Zack]] and [[Brian]] and faces a frigid reception from her aunt and [[Mrs. Kim|mother]]. In order to spend some time together, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and Rory decide to play hooky and go window shopping in the mall, where they run into [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] in the middle of a shopping binge meltdown. As always, [[Luke Danes|Luke]] is there to help Lorelai when she needs it. Emily has difficulty connecting with [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]]. ==Music== *Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Village_People The Village People], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_libertines The Libertines], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_White_Stripes The White Stripes], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Led_Zeppelin Led Zeppelin], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joy_Division Joy Division] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Poppins_%28film%29 Mary Poppins] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Don't worry, it's just a working title. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baz_Luhrmann Baz Luhrmann]'s directing.

'''Lorelai''': It's just when I picture letter writing, I picture [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Dickens Charles Dickens].

'''Rory''': How very ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_L-Word The L-Word]''.

'''Lorelai''': No, I didn't, because our once-wonderful relationship -- envy of all the world, more intimate than that of the naked couple in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Love_Is... the "love is..." cartoons] -- has degenerated into e-mail correspondence.

'''Christine''': I love the floorboard thing! It's so ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hogan%27s_Heroes Hogan's Heroes]''.

'''Christine''': I thought my mom was harsh, but your mom makes the guy from Joy Division look like one of the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teletubbies Teletubbies].

'''Lane''': I'm not [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoda Yoda]. So if you're looking for a mentor, call the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dalai_Lama Dalai Lama].

'''Lorelai''': This is the least amount of fun I've ever had, barring the time we went to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mummenschanz Mummenschanz].

'''Lorelai''': "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emily_the_Strange Emily the Strange]" with the black cat and the boots made for kicking.

'''Lorelai''': Me wants them! [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gollum My precious]!! [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Scene in a Mall | up=Season 4 | next=Girls in Bikinis, Boys Doin' the Twist}} {{Infobox episode |name = The Reigning Lorelai |Image = 416.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 16 |air_date = March 2, 2004 |writer = [[Jane Espenson]] |director = [[Marita Grabiak]] }} ==Synopsis== Lorelai goes underwear shopping. For a dead person. She's in charge of funeral arrangements for recently-deceased Gran, now that Emily has found Gran's decades-old letter telling Richard not to marry her. ==Plot outline== The rift between [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] widens when he goes on a golf date with clients instead of accompanying his wife to the funeral of her best friend. [[Doyle McCaster|Doyle]] goes on a theft and plagiarism rant. [[Lorelai "Trix" Gilmore|Trix]] dies suddenly and stricken with grief and guilt, Richard is inconsolable. Emily calls it quits on arranging Trix's funeral and drops everything in her daughter's lap after finding a letter in which her mother-in-law pleads with her son on the eve of his wedding to Emily to marry [[Pennilyn Lott|Pennilyn]] instead. [[Luke Danes|Luke]] and [[Nicole Leahy|Nicole]] have all of [[Stars Hollow]] listening in and reading lips as they quarrel. Worried about her parents and frantic over fulfilling Trix's exacting requirements for her funeral, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] has a meltdown while shopping for Trix's funereal undies. After the service, cousin Marilyn regales family and friends with tales of Lorelai the First. Emily and Richard finally reach out to each other as he defies one of his mother's last wishes for the sake of his wife. ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Crimson_Petal_and_the_White The Crimson Petal and the White] by Michel Faber ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie%27s_Angels:_Full_Throttle Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle] ==Pop Culture References== '''Rory''': Snails?
'''Emily''': Escargot.
'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_rose_by_any_other_name_would_smell_as_sweet A slimy thing by any other name]...

'''Doyle''': Can you say [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_Glass_%28reporter%29 Stephen Glass]?

'''Doyle''': I'd rather not have [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tobey_Maguire Tobey Maguire] playing me in a movie about the Yale Daily News scandal, thank you very much.

'''Doyle''': Breeding ground for the next [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jayson_Blair Jayson Blair]!

'''Lorelai''': Dad had a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winona_Ryder#2001_arrest Winona] in the family? How cool. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

page.title: Girls in Bikinis, Boys Doin' the Twist

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=The Reigning Lorelai | up=Season 4 | next=Tick, Tick, Tick, Boom!}} {{Infobox episode |name = Girls in Bikinis, Boys Doin' the Twist |Image = 417.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 17 |air_date = April 13, 2004 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Jamie Babbit]] }} ==Synopsis== Rory and Paris go south for a rite of passage: spring break! Jason deals with the rite of giving Lorelai his house key. Luke is read his rights after beating up the car that belongs to Nicole's secret boyfriend. ==Plot outline== [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]], [[Paris Gellar|Paris]], [[Janet]] and Glenn escape a Dickensianly cold winter in Connecticut and head to Florida, where they run into [[Madeline Lynn|Madeline]] and [[Louise Grant|Louise]], who show them the spring break ropes. [[Jason Stiles|Jason]] gives [[Lorelai |Lorelai]] the key to his apartment as a symbol of his commitment to their relationship. Lorelai bails [[Luke Danes|Luke]] out of jail after he's arrested for beating up the car belonging to the man he suspects is having an affair with [[Nicole Leahy|Nicole]]. Lorelai and Rory get the dubious honor of the first ride in [[Kirk Gleason|Kirk]]'s latest venture, the [[Stars Hollow]] pedi-cab. ==Music== *"Suspended From Class" by Camera Obscura *"Step Into My Office Baby" by Belle & Sebastian *"So Says I" by The Shins *"Get Yourself Together" by Tahiti 80 *"The Laws Have Changed" by The New Pornographers ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oliver_Twist Oliver Twist] by Charles Dickens ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Power_of_Myth The Power of Myth] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Endless_Summer The Endless Summer] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Top_Gun Top Gun] ==Pop Culture References== '''Rory''': So the person is [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Caruso David Caruso]?

'''Rory''': Man, that's a lot of people stuck in that tiny car.
'''Paris''': They should all be wearing [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ancient_Arabic_Order_of_the_Nobles_of_the_Mystic_Shrine Shriner ]hats.

'''Paris''': Fine, go. I hear melanoma is very in this year. Here, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casper_the_Friendly_Ghost Casper], you better use this.

'''Rory''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Veni,_vidi,_vici He looked, he saw, he changed his mind].

'''Lorelai''': Nice to see [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Caine Michael Caine] working again.

'''Louise''': Well, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anna_Nicole Anna Nicole], look at you.

'''Lorelai''': You know, I'll just tell [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shirley_MacLaine Shirley MacLaine], "Hey, look, back off, Shirl." [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Girls in Bikinis, Boys Doin' the Twist | up=Season 4 | next=Afterboom}} {{Infobox episode |name = Tick, Tick, Tick, Boom! |Image = 418.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 18 |air_date = April 20, 2004 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Daniel Palladino]] }} ==Synopsis== Some things shouldn't stay hidden - such as the unfound Easter eggs rotting in the square. Also out of hiding: the Lorelai-Jason thing. And ex-biz associate Floyd slaps a lawsuit on Richard. ==Plot outline== [[Luke Danes|Luke]] makes a bigger fuss than Davey when [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] and [[Jackson Belleville|Jackson]] bring their son into the diner. All of [[Stars Hollow]] is amused when [[Taylor Doose|Taylor]] returns from his Caribbean cruise with a drastic change in his appearance. [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] and [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] are stunned when [[Floyd Stiles|Floyd]] informs them that [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Jason Stiles|Jason]] have been dating for months. Luke comes to the rescue when [[Kirk Gleason|Kirk]]'s failure to make a map of the Easter eggs he hid in the town square gets Taylor's nose out of joint. Richard and Jason discover that Floyd's peacemaking overtures are a disguise for his plan to ruin Richard financially by suing them for stealing his clients. While shopping with [[Lane Kim|Lane]] in [[Doose's Market|Doose's]], Rory has harsh words about [[Lindsay Lister|Lindsay]] as she relates her quarrel with [[Dean Forester|Dean]] over his plans to drop out of college to earn more money to buy a house, unaware that his wife is listening in the next aisle. Richard resolves his problems with Floyd at Jason's expense. Dean and Rory agree to continue their friendship despite Lindsay's demand that they stop speaking to each other. ==Music== *"Windy" (original by The Association) *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donna_Summer Donna Summer], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nirvana_%28band%29 Nirvana], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruben_Studdard Ruben Studdard], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clay_Aiken Clay Aiken], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kelly_Clarkson Kelly Clarkson] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_III_%28play%29 Richard III] by William Shakespeare *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macbeth Macbeth ]by William Shakespeare ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beach_Party Beach Party] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dorf_on_Golf Dorf on Golf] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grease_%28film%29 Grease] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pulp_Fiction_%28film%29 Pulp Fiction] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Oh, look -- it's [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bilbo_Baggins Bilbo Baloneypuss] just in from the shire.

'''Michel''': That's it! I'm jumping off the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Amistad Amistad].

'''Lorelai''': We've got the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dennis_Kucinich Dennis Kucinich] of bookcases.

'''Lorelai''': Inevitably, the cannon tilted up, shot it in the air, it fell down, and made an anvil-shaped impression on [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wile_E._Coyote Wile E. Coyote]'s head.

'''Richard''': I don't think any of us are going to make [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tiger_Woods Tiger ]shake in his spikes.

'''Kirk''': We won't let you down, Taylor, because not only are we gonna find 20 eggs within the hour, but we're going on to find 25...and then 30...and then 35...and then 40...and then 45 and then 50 until we find all 59 and take back the square! [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KDwODbl3muE Yeeeeeee-ahhhhh]!

'''Lorelai''': You haven't seen them in a while.
'''Jason''': Well, I've seen Mom occasionally, but Floyd and I really haven't spoken since the great schism, not that [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cat%27s_in_the_Cradle Harry Chapin] isn't dying to rise from the grave and write a song about us.

'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_Robbins Tony Robbins] has nothing on you.

'''Kirk''': I've been up for one and a half days straight. I haven't done that since the "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Petticoat_Junction Petticoat Junction]" marathon in '97.

'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marx_Brothers Groucho, Chico, Harpo, and Zeppo] together again. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Tick, Tick, Tick, Boom! | up=Season 4 | next=Luke Can See Her Face}} {{Infobox episode |name = Afterboom |Image = 419.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 19 |air_date = April 27, 2004 |writer = [[Sheila R. Lawrence]] |director = [[Michael Zinberg]] }} ==Synopsis== What happens after an explosion? Everything's in pieces. The breakup of Richard and Jason's business results in two more breakups: the Richard-and-Emily marriage and the Lorelai-and-Jason love affair. ==Plot outline== [[Luke danes|Luke]] finalizes his divorce. [[Hep Alien|The band]]'s latest gig is a big hit, but leaves [[Lane Kim|Lane]] feeling lonely. As the [[Dragonfly Inn]] nears its opening date, [[Michel Gerard|Michel]] gives travel agents the grand tour and [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] is back in the kitchen, if not on her feet. [[Doyle McCaster|Doyle]] clues [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] in on [[Asher Flemming|Asher]]'s reputation as a serial student dater. [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] have it out over his treatment of [[Jason Stiles|Jason]]. Lane is upset to discover that [[Mrs. Kim|her mother]] has taken in a Korean exchange student who could be her double, and confronts the girl when she sees her wearing her old clothes. When Jason decides to sue Richard after discovering his treachery, Lorelai breaks up with him. Afraid that Richard's actions will put a rift in their relationship with Lorelai and Rory, [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] asks her husband to reconsider, but he brushes her off. Asher is displeased when Rory questions whether the "A" he gave her for a paper she thought she did poorly on has any connection to her friendship with Paris. After Richard and Emily act very strangely during Friday night dinner, Lorelai does a little investigating and discovers that her mother has moved out of the house and into a hotel. Lane begins to realize how much she misses her mother. ==Music== *"Time Bomb" by Rancid *"After Dark" by Mower *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matchbox_Twenty Matchbox Twenty] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Trial The Trial] by Franz Kafka ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaslight_%281944_film%29 Gaslight] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai:''' Bewitched? I love [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bewitched Bewitched].

'''Rory:''' That's my little [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kofi_Annan Kofi Annan].

'''Lorelai:''' Of course, I had no idea we were dealing with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dynasty_%28TV_series%29 the Carringtons] . All we needed was a swimming pool and some ball-gowns to really end the evening right.

'''Jason''': Where all the financial wash-ups wash up. It's gonna be me and the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enron_scandal Enron boys], smoking cigars while their ankle cuffs beep quietly in the background.

'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angelina_Jolie Angelina Jolie] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Nicholson Jack Nicholson] just sent us out with a parting gift.

'''Lorelai''': Of course, my scenario also involved my mother finding her inner [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timothy_Leary Timothy Leary] and moving us all out to a commune in Berkeley. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Afterboom | up=Season 4 | next=Last Week Fights, This Week Tights}} {{Infobox episode |name = Luke Can See Her Face |Image = 420.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 20 |air_date = May 4, 2004 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]]
[[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Matthew Diamond]] }} ==Synopsis== The least-likely person to buy self-help tapes buys self-help tapes. And what do you know? They help. Thanks to the voice from the boom box, Luke finally realizes what will make him happy. ==Plot outline== [[Jackson Belleville|Jackson]]'s devotion to [[Sookie St. James|his wife]] and her famous zucchini soup set the stage for the perfect antidote to the stress surrounding the opening of the Inn. [[Luke |Luke]] unwittingly comes to the rescue when Sookie tries to set [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] up with the poultry supplier. [[Liz Danes|Liz]] returns to [[Stars Hollow]] to announce that she's getting married in the town square in a week. [[Paris Gellar|Paris]] and [[Asher Flemming|Asher]] decide to travel to England together during the summer. [[T.J.]] has a tumultuous bachelor party. At Luke's request, [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] changes his mind about attending his mother's wedding and returns to Stars Hollow for the festivities. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] tries to hide her discomfort when Lorelai tells her about overhearing a fight between [[Dean forester|Dean]] and [[Lindsay Lister Forester|Lindsay]]. A self-help tape helps Luke clarify his thinking, and a talk with Jess gets him started on the path to having the relationship he's been looking for all along. ==Music== *Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jethro_Tull_%28band%29 Jethro Tull] ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Camelot_%28film%29 Camelot] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fatso_%281980_film%29 Fatso] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wizard_of_Oz_%281939_film%29 The Wizard of Oz] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lords_of_Flatbush The Lords of Flatbush] ==Pop Culture References== '''Paris:''' You were gonna ask him after class, but Toby from [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Splendor American Splendor] wouldn't stop yapping and you couldn't.

'''Rory:''' Well, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annie_Sullivan Annie Sullivan], look at you go. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

page.title: Last Week Fights, This Week Tights

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=Luke Can See Her Face | up=Season 4 | next=Raincoats and Recipes}} {{Infobox episode |name = Last Week Fights, This Week Tights |Image = 421.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 21 |air_date = May 11, 2004 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Chris Long]] }} ==Synopsis== Wedding day at Stars Hollow - and the ceremony seems to have an effect on Luke and Jess. Meanwhile, Rory and Dean share another rendezvous. ==Plot outline== [[Stars Hollow]] prepares for the Renaissance-themed wedding of [[Liz Danes|Liz]] and [[T.J.]] [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] discovers an equine visitor in the [[Dragonfly Inn]]'s lobby. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]'s suitemates depart for summer vacation. Lorelai unsuccessfully attempts to get [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] to admit to the separation. Rory calls [[Dean Forester|Dean]] to rescue her from the disastrous date. [[Luke Danes|Luke]] and Lorelai share a special moment at the wedding. [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] expresses his gratitude to Luke before saying goodbye. ==Music== *"Reflecting Light" by Sam Phillips *"Relax" by Frankie Goes to Hollywood *"In a Big Country" by Big Country *"Jacqueline" by Franz Ferdinand *"Too Shy" by Kajagoogoo *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blossom_Dearie Blossom Dearie], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Led_Zeppelin Led Zeppelin], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oingo_Boingo Oingo Boingo] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Art_of_War The Art of War] by Sun Tzu ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Passion_of_the_Christ The Passion of the Christ] ==Pop Culture References== '''Miss Patty:''' I've worked with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joan_Crawford Joan Crawford]. This is worse.

'''Kirk:''' But the maypole is an expertise of mine. I re-enacted the dwarf's maypole choreography from [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AjPau5QYtYs "The Safety Dance" video], my junior-high talent show.

'''Sookie:''' That actually felt good. Like getting a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_LaLanne Jack LaLanne] workout.

'''Luke''': Does she remind you of someone?
'''Lorelai''': Can you say [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leslie_Van_Houten Leslie Van Houten]? [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Last Week Fights, This Week Tights | up=Season 4 | next=Say Goodbye to Daisy Miller}} {{Infobox episode |name = Raincoats and Recipes |Image = 422.jpg |season_num = [[Season 4|4]] |ep_num = 22 |air_date = May 18, 2004 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] }} ==Synopsis== The Dragonfly hosts a test-run weekend, and it seems everyone Lorelai knows is there, oohing, aahing, laughing, loving -- clashing, crying, fuming, leaving. ==Plot outline== Momentous changes are in the air as the [[Dragonfly Inn]] approaches opening day. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Dean Forester|Dean]] take a major step forward in their relationship. [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] admit that they're separated. [[Kirk Gleason|Kirk]] decides to let [[Lulu]] in on his secret. [[Jason Stiles|Jason]] appears at the Inn. [[Luke Danes|Luke]] and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] share a very special moment. ==Music== *"Satellite of Love" by Lou Reed *"Lily-a-Passion" by Grant-Lee Phillips ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pretty_in_Pink Pretty in Pink] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heathers Heathers] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai:''' There was no waking you up. You were completely out of it. We're talking [http://www.liveleak.com/view?i=9ed_1234476797 Farrah on "Letterman."]

'''Rory:''' What's your damage, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heathers Heather]?

'''Lorelai:''' Maybe he just needed to get out of the house, and since I'm currently one of the women sitting home, thinking, "If I could only find a man like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aragorn Aragorn]," he picked me.

'''Rory:''' Well, look who died and made you [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hayley_Mills Hayley Mills].

'''Taylor:''' It's the little things -- the details -- that distinguish the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barbra_Streisand Barbra Streisand]s from the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roslyn_Kind#Personal_life Roslyn Kind]s.

'''Lorelai:''' He just showed up here, because, apparently, it's [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blake_Edwards Blake Edwards] night at the Dragonfly. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 4 episodes]]
