{{Epnav | prev=Raincoats and Recipes | up=Season 5 | next=A Messenger, Nothing More}} {{Infobox episode |name = Say Goodbye to Daisy Miller |Image = 501.jpg |season_num = [[Season 5|5]] |ep_num = 1 |air_date = September 21, 2004 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] }} ==Synopsis== Things couldn't be better/worse. The inn's test run is a success. Lorelai and Luke's fledgling romance takes wing. Emily and Richard's marriage is in shreds. Rory and Lorelai aren't talking after Rory's liaison with Dean. ==Plot outline== Things are still tense between [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]. [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] announces that she and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] have separated. [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] is ecstatic to learn that [[Luke Danes|Luke]] and Lorelai kissed. [[Dean Forester|Dean]] provokes an argument with an unsuspecting [[Lindsay Lister|Lindsay]] after his indiscretion with Rory. Emily decides to go to Europe and invites Rory to accompany her. Lorelai and Luke are very tentative with each other the day after until they are able to reassure each other that they're on the right path. Luke heads off to Maine for a week to help [[Liz Danes|Liz]] and [[T.J.]] after an accident. ==Music== *"Candy Man" by Sammy Davis Jr. *"If I Could Write" by Sam Phillips *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Polyphonic_Spree The Polyphonic Spree], [http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m1083/is_9_77/ai_108114349/ Al Gilbert], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metallica Metallica] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/On_the_Road On the Road] by Jack Kerouac *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daisy_Miller Daisy Miller] by Henry James ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bull_Durham Bull Durham] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gigi_%281958_film%29 Gigi] ==Pop Culture References== '''Richard''': Emily, this feud of ours has now reached comical heights that [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Chaplin Charlie Chaplin] himself would find hilarious, and he's dead.

'''Sookie''': Hey! It's a party. What's everybody doing up?
'''Lorelai''': Aw, hey, good timing, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laverne_%26_Shirley Squiggy].

'''Sookie''': Call me [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belinda_Carlisle Belinda], because my lips are sealed!

'''Lorelai''': You scared me.
'''Emily''': Like I'm [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Count_Dracula Dracula]?

'''Emily''': Who else did you tell?
'''Lorelai''': So, you haven't read [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Page_Six#Page_Six Page Six]?

'''Rory''': So, what is this, a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_James Henry James] novel? The young lady acts up, and her family ships her off to Europe?

'''Lorelai''': Well, if it isn't [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/On_the_Road Dean Moriarty].

'''Lorelai''': Very chivalrous of you.
'''Luke''': Yeah, I'm a regular [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lancelot Lancelot]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 5 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Say Goodbye to Daisy Miller | up=Season 5 | next=Written in the Stars}} {{Infobox episode |name = A Messenger, Nothing More |Image = 502.jpg |season_num = [[Season 5|5]] |ep_num = 2 |air_date = September 28, 2004 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Daniel Palladino]] }} ==Synopsis== The pen is mightier...While she tours Europe with Emily, Rory sends Dean a letter, hoping to fix the mess she's created. But the mess gets messier when Dean's wife reads the letter. ==Plot outline== [[T.J.]] is milking his injuries for all he's worth, but [[Luke Danes|Luke]] decides that it's time to go home after seven weeks on the Renaissance Fair circuit. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] calls to apologize and to ask her mother to deliver a letter to [[Dean Forester|Dean]]. [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] decide to decompress with a girls-day-out. [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] and Rory come home exhausted from fending off the attentions of randy European men. [[Lindsay Lister|Lindsay]] finds Rory's letter and confronts Dean. [[Lane Kim|Lane]] realizes that she's falling for [[Zack Van Gerbig|Zack]]. ==Music== *"Fell in Love With a Girl" by the White Stripes *"This Town" by The Go-Go's *"Chimacum Rain" by Linda Perhacs *"Suffragette City" by David Bowie *"Lithium" by Nirvana *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_White_Stripes The White Stripes], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radiohead Radiohead], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pixies Pixies], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Dandy_Warhols The Dandy Warhols], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Velvet_Underground The Velvet Underground], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Men_at_Work Men at Work], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_%28band%29 Chicago], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wings_%28band%29 Wings], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Styx_%28band%29 Styx], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Culture_Club Culture Club], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quarterflash Quarterflash] ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Da_Vinci_Code The Da Vinci Code] by Dan Brown ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apocalypse_Now Apocalypse Now] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Showgirls Showgirls] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Room_with_a_View_%28film%29 A Room With A View] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': I am the Ã¼ber [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump Trump ][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rupert_Murdoch Murdoch ]maximus!

'''Liz''': I was listening to my [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deepak_Chopra Deepak Chopra].

'''Lorelai''': ''(to Luke)'' What's that, [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BTUy_mlpgy4 Lucy], a football for me to kick?

'''Lorelai''': ''(to Luke)'' See you when [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hillary_Rodham_Clinton Hillary]'s president!

'''Zack''': He was purging the "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E!_True_Hollywood_Story E! True Hollywood Story]" part of it for his own benefit.

'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/77_Sunset_Strip Ginchy]! [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 5 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=A Messenger, Nothing More | up=Season 5 | next=Tippecanoe and Taylor, Too}} {{Infobox episode |name = Written in the Stars |Image = 503.jpg |season_num = [[Season 5|5]] |ep_num = 3 |air_date = October 5, 2004 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Kenny Ortega]] }} ==Synopsis== Luke and Lorelai finally go on their first date where Luke tells Lorelai he wants a relationship with her. Back at Yale Rory moves into her new dorm and is worried when Paris isn't already moved in. Paris informs her that Asher has passed away. ==Plot outline== [[Luke Danes|Luke]] and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] go on their official first date at a restaurant owned by old friends of Luke's parents. Luke reminds Lorelai of how they met, shows her a horoscope she gave him for good luck that he's[[File:First_meeting_logan.jpg|thumb|Logan Huntzberger and his friends recognizing Marty.]] kept in his wallet, and assures her that he intends to go the distance with her. Lorelai spends the night at Luke's place. In the morning, she goes down to the diner to get coffee, and the breakfast crowd sees her wearing only Luke's shirt. There's surprisingly little gossip about Luke and Lorelai until the next town meeting, where [[Taylor Doose|Taylor]] uses charts to show how disastrous a breakup between them would be for [[Stars Hollow]]. Meanwhile: [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] meets a rich [[Yale]] student named [[Logan Huntzberger]] and chews him out for being rude to her friend [[Marty]]. [[Paris Gellar|Paris]] holds a wake for [[Asher Flemming|Asher]] that all the guests assume is a keg party with a weird theme. [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] freaks out when she discovers that [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] has a social life she doesn't know about, so she invades Rory's dorm during the wake. ==Music== *"Lily-A-Passion" by Grant-Lee Phillips *"The Best Is Yet To Come" by Tony Bennett *"Delta Dawn" by Tanya Tucker *"The Times They Are a-Changin'" by Bob Dylan *"Crazy" by Patsy Cline ==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Midsummer_Night%27s_Dream A Midsummer Night's Dream] by William Shakespeare ==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lord_of_the_Rings_film_trilogy The Lord of the Rings] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Some_Kind_of_Wonderful_%28film%29 Some Kind of Wonderful] ==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shaken,_not_stirred Shaken, not stirred], please, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeeves Jeeves].

'''Lorelai''': Don't be so puritanical. After all, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heather_Has_Two_Mommies Heather has two mommies].

'''Luke''': Your shoes work well with that shirt.
'''Lorelai''': Gee, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carson_Kressley Carson], thanks.

'''Emily''': The Farthingtons' dogs are apoplectic. Ridiculous choice of animal -- a viscious 3-inch ball of hair and a bow -- a ridiculous pink bow for the vicious killers. "Oh, watch out! [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cecil_Beaton Cecil Beaton] and the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duke_of_Windsor Duke of Windsor] are headed straight for my shoes!"

'''Paris''': He had a heart attack. He was teaching a Shakespeare class -- "A Midsummer Night's Dream." He was doing Puck, and then suddenly he wasn't. And the class was so into his reading, they didn't even get it. They thought he was acting. It was [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dick_Shawn#Death Dick Shawn] all over again.

'''Paris''': It'll be the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carolyn_Adams Mountain Girl] trial all over again.

'''Lorelai''': Did [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Thomas_Anderson Paul Thomas Anderson] write this?

'''Gypsy''': You backed up. You didn't look. You got in, you turned on your car, and then you whipped out of that space like you were [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lizzie_Grubman#2001_SUV_incident Lizzie Grubman].

'''Paris''': ''(about Asher Fleming)'' He's my [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Todd Mike Todd]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 5 episodes]]

revision.comment: Made the synopsis into the plot outline and wrote a short synopsis to be consistent with previous episode formats.
revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=Written in the Stars | up=Season 5 | next=We Got Us a Pippi Virgin!}} {{Infobox episode || Image=Tippecanoe and Taylor Too.jpg | name=Tippecanoe and Taylor, Too | season_num=[[Season 5|5]] | ep_num=4 | air_date=October 12, 2004 | writer=[[Bill Prady]] | director=[[Lee Shallat-Chemel]]}} ==Synopsis== Jackson decides to run against Taylor for town selectman, Rory and Dean try to work out their relationship, Lane tells Zach she likes him. ==Plot Outline==
Lorelai is trying to get a permit for two extra parking spaces for the inn, but Taylor keeps rejecting her applications. Taylor is also going after Jackson for the greenhouse he recently had built because itâ€™s too close to the edge of his property. Jackson goes crazy and decides heâ€™s going to run against Taylor in the upcoming election for town selectman. Itâ€™s kind of a weird thing because nobody ever runs against Taylor. Lorelai and Sookie set up their campaign table at Lukeâ€™s.
Dean and Rory are supposed to hang out, but he calls and says Lindsay has the car and he canâ€™t get there. Rory drives to Stars Hollow to hang out at his house. Itâ€™s nice to see his sister, Clara, again, but Deanâ€™s mom is kind of bitchy and disapproving. She makes Dean leave the door open while he and Rory are in his room and oh man do I not miss hanging out with my high school boyfriends in their rooms at their parentsâ€™ houses. The next time they get together, they make out in Roryâ€™s car, which is problematic for Dean since heâ€™s about ten feet tall. Rory asks Dean to go to Jacksonâ€™s rally with her, but he yells at her for even suggesting such a thing because he doesnâ€™t want to flaunt the relationship all over town and rub Lindsayâ€™s nose in it.
Lorelai asks Laneâ€™s band to play at a rally for Jackson. The voting starts, and Laneâ€™s band is just then given a tape of the song Jackson wants them to play. Theyâ€™ve never heard it before, but theyâ€™re going to go on and play it in like five minutes. Kirk has been polling, and he says everyone in town plans to vote for Jackson. Lorelai is happy, but then she looks through the window in the diner and sees Taylor sitting by himself in the dark in his soda shoppe. She thinks itâ€™s sad.
Jackson gets on stage and says he has no idea why heâ€™s running for selectman. He already has a job and not a lot of time and he doesnâ€™t want to be selectman. The crowd just loves him more for being an honest man and of course he wins. Only ten people vote for Taylor, most of them because Lorelai asked them to.
After the rally, Zack brings a couple of tramps back to the apartment. Lane hasnâ€™t told Zack she likes him because sheâ€™s worried it will break up the band, but she just canâ€™t stand to see him with these girls so she tells him she likes him and then goes to her room. Zack goes outside to think about things.
Dean comes up to Rory at the rally and apologizes for yelling the other night. He says he worked things out with his car and talked to his mom so things are going to be better. Rory asks if Dean would have left Lindsay if she hadnâ€™t found her letter. Dean kind of does that weird grin of his and says yes, of course he would have left her.
==Music== ==Book References== ==Movie References== ==Pop Culture References== [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 5 episodes]]

page.title: We Got Us a Pippi Virgin!

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=Tippecanoe and Taylor, Too | up=Season 5 | next=Norman Mailer, I'm Pregnant!}}{{Infobox episode || Image=Gilmore-girls-pippi-virgin-02.jpg | name=We Got Us a Pippi Virgin! | season_num=[[Season 5|5]] | ep_num=5 | air_date=October 19, 2004 | writer=[[Daniel Palladino]] | director=[[Stephen Clancy]]}} ==Synopsis== A double date between Lorelai and Luke with Rory and Dean goes wrong. Emily and Richard are getting use to living separately but accompanied by a panic room and a glittering vest. ==Plot outline== [[File:Bopit.png|thumb|left|Dean and Luke tugging the Bop-It.]] Dean is still doing some work at the Dragonfly, but is avoiding Lorelai. In an attempt to show Rory that she's okay with her relationship with Dean Lorelai insists that they hang out together, like they use to. Rory thinks itâ€™s going to be weird and Luke isn't happy with the idea after agreeing to a double date. Rory goes to Deanâ€™s new place where he is Kyle's roommate. Deanâ€™s not sure about the double date thing, either, but Rory talks him into it.
The date has an awkwardly polite start with Dean explaining to Luke how to do date night, which includes getting food from Al's Pancake World because the food is already bad to begin with, unlike the food from Luke's diner. The only movie Kirk has available at the theater is Pippi Longstockings. While Dean and Rory get popcorn, Luke complains to Lorelai about Dean and Lorelai insists that he gets on better terms with Dean.
By the time they reach the Gilmore house Luke is still making Dean uncomfortable. Rory tries to remind them of the time they were on a softball team together, but that doesn't make anything better. Lorelai pulls out the Bop-It and the boys end up getting fiercely competitive. Luke wins and starts yelling about Dean being the loser. Dean leaves disgusted and Rory yells at Luke, letting him know that Bop-It is the Gilmores' solution to emergency [[File:Glittervest.png|thumb|Emily asking the girls why Richard would wear such a vest.]]social situations. After she leaves, Luke apologizes and tells Lorelai he doesnâ€™t think Dean is good enough for Rory.
While at Friday night dinner, the girls learn that Emily has purchased a panic room. Emily takes the girls to the pool house ostensibly to get some gin, but really just to snoop since Richard is out of town. Emily finds plenty to shock her such as an abundance of breath mints and a glittering vest in the closet.
Elsewhere Zack hasnâ€™t commented since Lane told him she likes him. Not knowing what she did wrong or what to do, Lane tells him sheâ€™s changed her mind and doesnâ€™t like him anymore. Zach shows up at the diner later and says heâ€™s a little slow and he was just processing. He likes her, too, but heâ€™s going to need some time. ==Trivia== *Luke was a "pippi virgin". [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 5 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=We Got Us a Pippi Virgin! | up=Season 5 | next=You Jump, I Jump, Jack}} {{Infobox episode || Image=Norman Mailer, I'm Pregnant.JPG | name=Norman Mailer, I'm Pregnant! | season_num=[[Season 5|5]] | ep_num=6 | air_date=October 26, 2004 | director=[[Matthew Diamond]] | writer=[[James Berg]]
[[Stan Zimmerman]]}} ==Synopsis== Norman Mailer visits the Dragonfly Inn and is testing Sookie's patience. Rory does research on the Life and Death Brigade for the Yale Daily News, which leads her right back to Logan Huntzberger. ==Plot outline== Everyone at the Yale Daily News spent their summers doing internships and being published in the New York Times and Rory panics in fear she hasnâ€™t done enough for her career. Logan Huntzberger arrives after the assignments have been handed out and when Rory asks Doyle why he is letting Logan get away with not doing anything, Doyle informs her itâ€™s because Logan is the son of Mitchum Huntzberger, the newspaper magnate. Rory is thrilled to have the features beat and decides to write about illegal music downloading. While trying to conduct a ground breaking interview with a fellow Yale student, she realizes itâ€™s a dead end. While in the bathroom a girl walks in wearing a gorilla mask and a ball gown. Rory follows her outside, where the girl shouts in Latin before getting into a black SUV. Rory does some research and finds out the Latin phrase is the motto for a secret society at Yale called the Life and Death Brigade. Doyle tells her that everybody knows the society exists, but nobody knows that it does. Rory decides to change her article to undercover the truth about the club and in the course of late night research she discovers that Loganâ€™s grandfather was in the society. Assuming that membership follows family lineage, Rory questions Logan about the Life and Death Brigade. He denies any knowledge, but instant messages her the next day in the newspaper office to tell her he can get her on the inside to write her article. Back in Stars Hollow, Lorelai receives a desperate phone call from Christopher. Gigi wonâ€™t stop crying, Sherry isnâ€™t home and he doesnâ€™t know what to do. Lorelai races to Boston to help out and after getting Gigi quiet Chris says Sherry took a job in Paris, leaving him with their daughter. He thinks he canâ€™t raise her alone, but Lorelai says he can and he will because he has to. Norman Mailer is at the Dragonfly Inn and is annoying Sookie because he sits for hours without ordering anything but iced tea. Sookie becomes more irritated when the Dragonflyâ€™s financial adviser suggests they drop lunch because itâ€™s not making any money. Lorelai can't figure out what's up with Sookie. The girls arrive for Friday night dinner and the maid says Richard is out of town and Emily is at a function. Lorelai decides they should order pizza and eat it on the floor in the living room. After getting comfy Lorelai tells Rory about Christopher and says she plans to go back and help him with Gigi. Rory goes to Christopherâ€™s a few days later and tells him she doesnâ€™t want him to call Lorelai anymore because sheâ€™s in a relationship now and she doesnâ€™t want him to mess it up. Lorelai finally has to confront Sookie when Luke calls, upset, because Kirk is front of the diner handing out flyers to promote lunch at the Dragonfly. Sookie goes into the dining room and yells at Norman Mailer, telling him itâ€™s all his fault. Lorelai drags her away and Sookie says she doesnâ€™t know why sheâ€™s freaking out. Suddenly, she realizes sheâ€™s pregnant. She runs back out to the dining room and tells Norman Mailer in excitement. At the end of the episode Lorelai goes to the diner and asks Luke why heâ€™s crabby. He nods to a table and complains that a couple of guys are sitting for hours and only ordering iced tea. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 5 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Norman Mailer, I'm Pregnant!| up=Season 5| next=The Party's Over}}{{Infobox episode || Image=youjump.jpg | name=You Jump, I Jump, Jack | season_num=[[Season 5|5]] | ep_num=7 | air_date=November 2, 2004 | director=[[Kenny Ortega]] | writer=[[Daniel Palladino]]}} ==Synopsis== As promised, Logan lets Rory get the scoop on the "Life and Death Brigade". After learning that Lorelai is dating Luke Emily insists on meeting him and later, Richard decides to meet him too. ==Plot outline== [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] has found out that Lorelai is dating [[Luke Danes|Luke]] and insists on re-meeting him. Lorelai pleads with Luke that he doesn't have to attend dinner, but he insists that they get it over with sooner rather than later. Emily is perfectly pleasant at first, but it becomes clear that everything from her offer of beer to her descriptions of what she has heard about diners to his truck being â€œrusticâ€ are all meant to be insults.
Not one to be outdone Richard calls and invites Luke to go golfing with him. Lorelai calls Richard and asks him to cancel, but he says itâ€™s protocol and it needs to be done. When Luke gets to the country club, Richard makes him buy some golf clubs. Luke has no idea how to golf, but heâ€™s a pretty good sport an[[File:Emilyandluke.png|thumb|left|260px|Emily making conversation with Luke.]]d the caddy helps him out a little. Richard tells him he should franchise the diner; heâ€™ll set him up with a banker and a barber for a straight razor shave. That night, Emily yells at Richard for going golfing with Luke because heâ€™s not suitable for Lorelai. Richard says that if the relationship continues, he wants Luke to at least be a respectable person that he wouldnâ€™t be embarrassed to take to the club and he would only be a figurehead for the franchise anyway.
Rory finds an envelope taped to her suite's window. Itâ€™s from the Life and Death Brigade, telling her to be blindfolded and in her vestibule the next day at four. Logan and his friends, Fin and Colin, pick her up and take her somewhere in the woods.
Rory tries to conduct an interview with the members but Logan explains later that they are not welcoming of outsiders and he had twist arms to allow her to take part. He takes away her camera and avoids any questions she asks but gives her rules to follow. The next morning, Logan tells Rory to look under the cot in her tent where she finds a ball gown. The group has moved out of the woods and into an open area where the guys are wearing tuxedos and the girls are in gowns similar to Rory's.
Thereâ€™s a big scaffolding in the field with four people standing on top of it with parasols. Logan says theyâ€™re going to jump, and he and Rory are going to jump with them. The two go back and forth and Logan finally convinces Rory to jump when he tells her about George Plimpton, Hunter Thompson and other journalists who participated before writing their greatest pieces. After jumping off the scaffolding Rory is exhilarated and says it was a once in a lifetime experience and Logan tells her it is only if she wants it to be.
Back in her suite Rory is seen working on her laptop when she hears a knock at her door. [[File:Thejump.jpg|thumb|260px|The famous jump scene.]]When she answers it no one is seen, but a lone gorilla mask, a bottle of wine and Roryâ€™s camera have been laid on her doorstep. She browses the saved pictures and sees a few of her and Logan jumping off the scaffolding.
Back in Stars Hollow, Zack tells Lane heâ€™s ready to date her. They don't have enough money to go out and not knowing what to do, they decide to hang out on the couch in the living room. Brian comes home and sits between them, and Zack explains to him that theyâ€™re on a date. After asking what he's suppose to do then, Lane gives Brian permission to be in her room. When the date is over, Zack picks up a sleeping Brian and carries him to bed. While Brian is on his shoulder, Zack kisses Lane goodnight. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 5 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=You Jump, I Jump, Jack | up=Season 5 | next=Emily Says Hello}}
{{Infobox episode || Image=The Party's Over.JPG | name=The Party's Over | season_num=[[Season 5|5]] | ep_num=8 | air_date=November 9, 2004 | director=[[Eric Laneuville]] | writer=[[Amy Sherman-Palladino]]}} ==Synopsis== Emily and Richard host a party for Yale alumni (and their sons) but Rory is the unknowing guest-of-honor and it ends her relationship with Dean for good. Luke and Lorelai have a complicated dinner date, perhaps because T.J. is there too. ==Plot Outline== Rory mentions that she's dating [[Dean Forester|Dean]] again and her grandparents decide to throw a party to introduce her to more "suitable" young men. [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] shows up at the party, clearly well-acquainted with Rory's grandparents. He and some friends form a less-boring sub-party with Rory in the poolhouse. The guys accompany her to the front door when she goes to meet Dean and Dean decides he doesn't belong with Rory anymore.
Emily is upset with Richard for serving the girls appetizers with their drinks because she doesn't want them to be full before going into the house for dinner. Roryâ€™s cell phone rings during dinner and upon questioning she tells her grandmother that the call was from Dean - they are back together. A few days later Emily and Richard call Rory to invite her over early for dinner on Friday because theyâ€™re throwing a party for their Yale alumni friends.
Dean and Rory havenâ€™t had much luck lately finding time together, so they have lunch in the store room at Dooseâ€™s on Deanâ€™s lunch break on Friday. He says he read her story about the Life and Death Brigade. She asks him what he thought and he says it was good but offers no more specific criticism. Rory tells Dean sheâ€™ll meet him outside her grandparentsâ€™ house at eight-thirty that night, after the party.
When Rory gets to the Gilmore house for the party, Emily sends her upstairs where her hairdresser is waiting for her. Set up with a new hair style, a diamond necklace, earrings and a tiara Rory feels a little silly, but goes down to the party. It doesn't take Rory long before she realizes that all the guests are couples with sons near her age. She asks her grandparents if any of their friends have daughters. They pretend to be baffled at this realization and assure her that they will have another party on another occasion and only invite their friends with daughters.
[[Luke Danes|Luke]]'s sister [[Liz Danes|Liz]] and her husband [[T.J.]] are thinking of buying a house in Star's Hollow. Liz mentions what a great cook Luke is and Lorelai realizes that she's been missing out, so she convinces him to offer her a fabulous dinner. However, before their dinner gets started, T.J. interrupts, upset because of a fight with Liz.
T.J. begs Luke to let him hang out, and then sits on Jessâ€™ bed and cries while telling the couple not to mind his presence. The dinner is further interrupted when Rory calls to tell Lorelai about the party, and even more when Liz comes over to yell at TJ some more. Liz runs into the bathroom and T.J. follows.
Rory tries to have a good time, but gets in the middle of a conversation about cars and it's when a guy begins to flirt with her that Logan arrives at her side, pretending to be her boyfriend. He and Finn grab some bottles of wine and move the party to the pool house. Rory is having a good time with Logan and his friends until Logan reminds her she needs to choose a man - the entire point of the party. She says she has a boyfriend and then realizes sheâ€™s late meeting him. She goes out front to meet Dean and is followed by the guys. She tries to make him feel better by complimenting his new shirt and saying that the party was lame - despite her blushing cheeks and glances back at the front door - Dean tells her he doesn't belong in her world and gets into his truck. She starts crying and Logan tells her itâ€™s going to be okay. He and his friends take her back to the pool house and promises to cheer her up.
After getting home from a disaster date at Luke's Lorelai calls her for organizing the party where it is obvious what their intentions were. Lorelai hears a car pulling up and becomes upset when she looks out the window to see a tipsy, giggling Rory getting out of a limousine with guys. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 5 episodes]]

page.title: But Not as Cute as Pushkin

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=Emily Says Hello | up=Season 5 | next=Women Of Questionable Morals}} {{stub}} {{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode || Image=But Not as Cute as Pushkin.JPG | name=But Not as Cute as Pushkin | season_num=[[Season 5|5]] | ep_num=10 | air_date=November 30, 2004 | director=[[Michael Zinberg]] | writer=[[Amy Sherman-Palladino]]}}

Rory is delighted when the headmaster of her old prep school asks her to play hostess to a young student, Anna, who is thinking of applying to Yale. However, Anna turns out to be more interested in boys than academics and runs off to party, leaving Rory to deal with Logan's elaborate practical jokes. Meanwhile, Lorelai and Luke have their first fight when she accidentally upsets him by buying an old boat that had belonged to his father.

Â  [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 5 episodes]]

[[File:Luke-lorelai-gilmore-girls-13-questionable-morals.jpg|thumb]]Summary [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] falls out of love with snow. [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] find a [[Princess|dog]]. [[Stars Hollow]] reenacts a [[Battle of Stars Hollow|battle]], with [[Kirk Gleason|Kirk]] as the substitute whore. [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]]'s [[Straub Hayden|father]] dies, and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] comfort him. Lorelai hides that fact that she spent all night at Christopher's place from [[Luke Danes|Luke]], despite the fact that nothing had happened that night except heavy drinking and increasingly silly dialogue. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 5 episodes]]
Emily and Richard renew their vows, but trouble erupts at the reception.Â [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 5 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Pulp Friction | up=Season 5 | next=But I'm a Gilmore!}} {{stub}} {{Infobox episode | | Image=5-18.png | name=To Live and Let Diorama | season_num=[[Season 5|5]] | ep_num=18 | air_date=April 19, 2005 | director=[[Jackson Douglas]] | writer=[[Daniel Palladino]] }} Lane, Rory and Paris deal with their love troubles, and Stars Hollow opens a museum in the Twickham house. ==Summary== Old man Twickham dies, declaring through his will that the [[Twickham House|house]] be made into a museum for two months, then disposed of by the Head of the Historical Society, aka [[Taylor Doose|Taylor]]. Much to everyone's surprise, [[Luke Danes|Luke]] volunteers to help with the museum to remain close to the house; [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] is interviewed by a magazine due to her success with the [[Dragonfly Inn|inn]]; [[Lane Kim|Lane]] suspects [[Zack Van Gerbig|Zack]] of cheating on her with [[Sophie Bloom|Sophie]]; [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Paris]] sulk over their recent pitfalls with love, resulting with the both of them in Stars Hollow, getting tipsy with Lane on [[Miss Patty]]'s punch, and all three of them trying to contact their beaus; [[Dean Forester|Dean]] informs Luke that their situations are the same, and that Lorelai will eventually get bored and move on; Lane discovers Zack secretly practicing in a Bluegrass band. ==Memorable Quotes== ''"Quote'" '' :- '''Speaker''' ==Notes== *This episode marks the last appearance of Dean on the show. ==Dramatis Personae== ===Recurring Roles=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as recurring.'' ===Guest Starring=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com as to which roles are classified as guest starring.'' ===Uncredited=== *[[Actor]] as [[Role]] ''Check TV.com for minor, uncredited roles.
'' If the role is cited as 'Man', provide the episode title in the wiki citation, such as [[Actor]] as [[Role (Episode Name)|Role]] [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 5 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=A House Is Not a Home | up=Season 6 | next=Fight Face}} {{Infobox episode |name = New and Improved Lorelai |Image = 601.jpg|250px |season_num = [[Season 6|6]] |ep_num = 1 |air_date = September 13, 2005 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] }}
What's the very best thing for a broken heart? An engagement! With the Gilmore girls not talking (who would have thought!), Luke provides despondent Lorelai with a much-needed happiness boost.
==Plot Outline== Picking up on the same night as last season's finale, [[Lorelai]] and [[Luke |Luke]] begin making plans for their future, but Luke is embarrassed when word spreads that Lorelai was the one who proposed. Still hurt over [[Rory]]'s decision to drop out of Yale and move in with [[Emily |Emily]] and [[Richard]], Lorelai tells her parents that they can take care of Rory from now on. Richard hires an old friend and respected attorney to help Rory get an easy sentence for stealing the yacht, but the judge gives Rory 300 hours of community service. [[Logan |Logan]] throws Rory a "felon" party.
==Music== *"Funkytown" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lipps_Inc Lipps Inc.] *"French Foreign Legion" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Sinatra Frank Sinatra] *Also referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beatles The Beatles]
==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wizard_of_Oz_(1939_film) The Wizard of Oz] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Willy_Wonka_%26_the_Chocolate_Factory Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_%26_Carol_%26_Ted_%26_Alice Bob & Carol & Ted & Alice] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Blue_Lagoon_(1980_film) The Blue Lagoon] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Scissorhands Edward Scissorhands] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Breaking_Away Breaking Away] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paper_Moon_(film) Paper Moon]
==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': Oh, well, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiddler_on_the_Roof wonder of wonders, miracle of miracles], right?
'''Luke''': Nothing. No wine, no beer, no cooking sherry. It's like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dylan_Thomas Dylan Thomas] just blew through town.
'''Luke''': But men aren't supposed to drink [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zima Zima].
'''Emily''': You know your mother, Rory. Everything's the end of the world -- so dramatic. Ladies and gentlemen, Lorelai [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barrymore_family Barrymore]!
'''Emily''': We're just a push button away. Like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_Trek Star Trek].
'''Charlie (the lawyer)''': Los Angeles. Just bought [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ellen_DeGeneres Ellen Degeneres]' house.
'''Kirk''': Old widow Mason. Thought she was [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frida_Kahlo Frida Kahlo] toward the end.
'''Paris''': I need her to be at Yale. Rory has been my only real competition since she showed up at Chilton! She's the only one who has ever challenged me. She's my pace car. She's my [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bj%C3%B6rn_Borg BjÃ¶rn Borg].
'''Rosemary''': It wasn't a tragic harcut. It was apocalyptic highlights. I looked like a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Scissorhands Tim Burton character].
'''Michel''': I am here, and not at the Dragonfly Inn, which I theoretically run when I'm not busy answering doors like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benson_(TV_series) Benson].
'''Emily''': I hope we picked out the right outfit here. It's coming off a little more [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mennonite#Worship.2C_doctrine.2C_and_tradition Mennonite] than I had hoped.
'''Babette''': [http://www.mayoclinic.com/health/phantosmia/AN01684 I smell toast and almonds]! [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=New and Improved Lorelai | up=Season 6 | next=The UnGraduate}} {{Infobox episode |name = Fight Face |Image = 0602.jpg|250px |season_num = [[Season 6|6]] |ep_num = 2 |air_date = September 20, 2005 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Daniel Palladino]] }}
Rory gets community service, complete with vest, trash spear, and big orange bag. Lorelai gets a dog. She also gets major renovations on her house when wannabe contractor T.J. helps out...with a sledgehammer.
==Plot Outline== [[Rory]] sits in the orientation for her community service. [[Lorelai]] adopts a dog, despite [[Miss Patty|Patty]]'s objections. Rory is unable to keep herself occupied and ends up helping the maid, to Emily's horror. [[Luke]] and Lorelai discuss moving into the Twickham house but when Luke mentions selling Lorelai's house, Lorelai tries to think of reasons to keep her house, even though they won't be living in it. The next day, Lorelai comes home to find Luke, George, and Saul evaluating the house for an extension to the upstairs bedroom. Luke tells Lorelai that with an enlarged bedroom and bathroom they can live there and forget about the Twickham house. Rory goes to her community service, picking up garbage. Later that night she goes to visit Luke at the diner. The conversation is awkward and Luke tells her that he and Lorelai are engaged. Rory is very hurt and leaves.
==Music== *"Saddest Quo" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pernice_Brothers The Pernice Brothers] *Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenny_Chesney Kenny Chesney], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burt_Bacharach Burt Bacharach], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korn KoÐ¯n], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iggy_Pop Iggy Pop]
==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_Wars_Episode_III:_Revenge_of_the_Sith Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bewitched_(2005_film) Bewitched] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/March_of_the_Penguins March of the Penguins]
==Pop Culture References==
'''Lorelai''': It's a little on the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palace_of_Versailles Versailles] side. I'm gonna have to keep an eye out for peasants with pitchforks.
'''Sookie''': The eyes will give you away. If you're thinking of bolting, they'll pop out on you like that [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Runaway_bride_case runaway bride]. It's like the eyes are trying to run away first.
'''Luke''': And Jedi powers of mind control, they can move things, so they're telekinetic, and they hover their jet saucers over molten lava, and they jump and fly around like they're in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cirque_du_Soleil Cirque du Soleil].
'''Richard''': My God, we are busier than that [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ann_Coulter Ann Coulter].
'''Richard''': I should tell [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scooter_Libby Scooter Libby] about this. I keep forgetting I know a man on the inside. I'll give him a call. '''Emily''': Before an indictment comes down.
'''Character Name: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Anka Paul Anka]'''
'''Vivian''': This is Rory? '''Nora''': She's made of porcelain. '''Vivian''': Like one of your [http://www.lladro.com/ LladrÃ³s].
'''Lorelai''': Okay, this has officially become the worst first draft of "[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sShMA85pv8M Who's On First]" in history.
'''Luke''': I'm going to be like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Corleone Michael Corleone] dealing with his slimy brother-in-law.
'''Lorelai''': "There's a frisbee on every suburban house in America," no less a luminary than [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Garrison_Keillor Garrison Keillor] says that. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Fight Face | up=Season 6 | next=Always a Godmother, Never a God}} {{Infobox episode |name = The UnGraduate |Image = 603.jpg|250px |season_num = [[Season 6|6]] |ep_num = 3 |air_date = September 27, 2005 |writer = [[David S. Rosenthal]] |director = [[Michael Zinberg]] }}
Sookie creates a S'mores wedding cake, so what more does Lorelai need to set a date? Logan comes home, Lane and the band come home, and Paul Anka eats three pounds of chocolate while under Luke's care.
==Plot Outline== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Luke Danes|Luke]] observe [[T.J.]] working as "contractor" on the extension while [http://gilmoregirls.wikia.com/wiki/Tom Tom] - the actual contractor - follows close behind correcting the orders he gives and attempts to keep up the pretense. [[Paris Gellar|Paris]] and Lorelai have lunch at the [[Dragonfly Inn]]. Afterwards, Lorelai is met with complaints about Paris from [[Michel Gerard|Michel] and [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] 's and concedes that she will have to cut Paris off. Sookie asks about the date of Lorelai's wedding, and Lorelai explains that once the work on her house is finished she will set the date. Later, when T.J. returns from a pointless errand he has been sent on by Tom, he begins suggesting possibilities for Rory's room, causing Lorelai to look increasingly troubled and tell him to leave it alone. At her next lunch with Paris, Lorelai bombards her with questions about Rory's job.
That evening, Lorelai asks Luke to look after [[Paul Anka]] while she calls in at work. T.J. returns having discovered that he is not really the contractor on the job, quits and proceeds to drown his sorrows in milkshakes at [[Luke's Diner|Luke's]]. Luke reassures him about his skills as a craftsman. Upon going upstairs to his apartment Luke finds that Paul Anka has eaten cooking chocolate and immediately rushes him to the house of the town's vet. The next morning Luke explains the eventful night he spent looking after Paul Anka to Lorelai. She tells Luke that she doesn't want to set a wedding date until things are right with Rory, and he agrees.
Meanwhile, over breakfast at the [[The Gilmore House|Gilmore house]], [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] discusses a mutinous member of the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daughters_of_the_American_Revolution D.A.R.] with [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]. Rory agrees to keep an eye on the woman, Constance, while she is at work. By now well into her 300 hours of community service, Rory seems to be flourishing in her litter-picking duty, conversing jovially with the other members of the team and the supervisor. Later, Rory is at work in the D.A.R. office as Emily arrives to see her and Rory shares some gossip about Constance. Rory then receives a call from Paris who tells her that she needs to put down a deposit on their place off-campus. Rory reaffirms that she is not returning to Yale. Rory later supervises a dance class at the old people's home and [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] calls in to visit having returned from a trip to Europe. Later, the two talk at the Pool House and Logan hesitates to mention Yale starting back up again, and Rory tells him that the topic of Yale can never be off limits. They eat breakfast on campus the next day and discuss Rory's experiences in a soup kitchen. Logan leaves for a meeting and Rory watches the Class of 2009 arrive. That afternoon, she is inducted into the Hartford branch of the D.A.R.
[[Hep Alien]] play the last concert of their tour at Whinfield Seventh Day Adventist Church, Massachusetts. The band are buoyed by their performance, with [[Gil]] describing them as 'tighter than the Foo Fighters'. An hour out of Star's Hollow, the band all lament how hungry they are. [[Lane Kim|Lane]] makes a confession to the boys, that she has been hiding their earnings from the tour. They have made over $9,000 - enough to make a record.
==Music== *"Folsom Prison" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnny_Cash Johnny Cash] *"Hanging On the Telephone" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blondie_(band) Blondie] *Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foo_Fighters Foo Fighters], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coldplay Coldplay], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bono Bono], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nirvana_(band) Nirvana]
==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moby-Dick#Ahab Captain Ahab of ''Moby-Dick'']
==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Graduate The Graduate] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Last_of_the_Mohicans_(1992_film) The Last of the Mohicans] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/My_Left_Foot_(film) My Left Foot] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wizard_of_Oz_(1939_film) The Wizard of Oz]
==Pop Culture References==
'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alice_(TV_series) Flo]'s got coffee. Who needs a jolt?
'''Luke''': You should hire [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blake_Edwards Blake Edwards] as your contractor.
'''Rory''': It's not exactly Martin Luther nailing the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Ninety-Five_Theses Ninety-Five Theses] to a door.
'''Michel''': She's [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Rose Tokyo Rose].
'''Michel''': The next thing you know you'll be carrying [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emmanuel_Lewis Emmanuel Lewis] around on your shoulders.
'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maxwell_House#.22Good_to_the_last_drop.22 Good to the last drop].
'''Emily''': My own little [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Valerie_Plame Valerie Plame].
'''Emily''': A cover-up. That's good. That's [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Watergate_scandal what took Nixon down].
'''Paris''': Well, you can believe that if you want to, but if I end up on the front page of the Hartford Courier [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dennis_Rader BTK]'ed to death, you'll know why.
'''Luke''': Hey, you know those guys are here to work. You don't have to put a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Service_Organizations USO] show on for them.
'''Gil''': I've played [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whisky_a_Go_Go the Whiskey] before, man, and it's got a similar vibe. It does.
'''Sookie''': Yeah. And then, of course, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Cruise#Oprah_Winfrey_Show Katie Holmes and Tom Cruise come leaping out of the cake screaming about how amazing it is], so that made the whole thing a little creepy, but up until then.
'''Lorelai''': And then later at the reception, Luke is found in the coat-check room [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/4692139.stm Jude Law]'ing it with one of the bridesmaids.
'''Lorelai''': [http://www.scientificamerican.com/article.cfm?id=the-eagle-has-landed The eagle has landed].
'''Paris''': Sorry I'm late. I was interviewing roommates. And all I can say is, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noah#Noah_in_Genesis build an ark], 'cause it is seriously time for a flood.
'''Logan''': So, you're [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Murray Arthur Murray] now?
'''Logan''': If I show you mine, you have to show me yours. '''Rory''': You saw mine about five minutes ago, mister. '''Logan''': Oh, I hate it when you [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ribaldry#Blue_comedy work blue].
'''Zach''': Every day with him is like being on [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meet_The_Press Meet the Press].
'''Lorelai''': I could drop him off at a kennel for a few hours. I know there's a good one in Woodbridge, 20 miles away. Of course I'd have to leave now and pick up some [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dilithium_(Star_Trek) dilithium crystals] on the way to fix the warp drive in my Jeep.
'''T.J.''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arrivederci_Roma Arrivederci Roma]! [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

page.title: Always a Godmother, Never a God

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=The UnGraduate | up=Season 6 | next=We've Got Magic to Do}}
{{Infobox episode |name = Always a Godmother, Never a God |Image = 604.jpg|250px |season_num = [[Season 6|6]] |ep_num = 4 |air_date = October 4, 2005 |writer = [[Rebecca Rand Kirschner]] |director = [[Robert Berlinger]] }}
Church ladies. Lorelai and Rory don their proper summer dresses and show up at the baptismal font to be godmothers to Sookie's children - a clever ploy on Sookie's part to get the Gilmore girls back together.
==Plot Outline== After months of separation, [[Sookie]] tries to reconcile [[Rory]] and [[Lorelai]] by asking them to be the godmothers of her two children, [[Martha]] and [[Davey]]. However, they both end up fighting when Lorelai realizes that Rory didn't see fit to share her new cell phone number with her. Wanting to escape the pressure he is receiving from his father, [[Logan]] decides to take a trip to New York City with Rory.
==Music== *Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foggy_Mountain_Boys Foggy Mountain Boys], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Smiths The Smiths], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Dandy_Warhols The Dandy Warhols], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Brian_Jonestown_Massacre The Brian Jonestown Massacre]
==Book References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lion,_the_Witch_and_the_Wardrobe The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe]
==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deuce_Bigalow:_Male_Gigolo Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riding_the_Bus_with_My_Sister#Adaptation Riding the Bus with My Sister] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prizzi%27s_Honor Prizzi's Honor] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Risky_Business Risky Business] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cinderella_(1950_film) Cinderella] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mad_Hot_Ballroom Mad Hot Ballroom] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Godfather The Godfather] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lost_Weekend_(film) The Lost Weekend]
==Television References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnum,_P.I. Magnum P.I.] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knots_Landing Knots Landing] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/21_Jump_Street 21 Jump Street] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/America%27s_Castles America's Castles] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Please_Don%27t_Eat_the_Daisies_(TV_series) Please Don't Eat the Daisies]
==Pop Culture References==
'''Lorelai''': The DVDs won't have the commercials on them, the original commercials, which is half the fun. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spuds_MacKenzie Spuds MacKenzie], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clara_Peller Clara Peller], "[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YK2VZgJ4AoM Nothing comes between me and my Calvins]." I mean, they don't make them like that anymore.
'''Lorelai''': Oh, The History of Paper. A documentary by Ted Burns. Distant relative of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ken_Burns Ken Burns].
'''Emily''': I've got that mixer for the girls I'm hosting tomorrow with the curators of the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilbert_Stuart Gilbert Stuart] exhibit.
'''Jackson''': What about the time we had to see your stuttering Cousin Odell in the worst production of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Life_and_Adventures_of_Nicholas_Nickleby_(play) Nicholas Nickleby] known to man? That was like nine hours of pure hell...
'''Rory''': She's the one who insists I look like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clara_Barton Clara Barton], which I'm still not sure is a compliment.
'''Sookie''': I overcompensate and start cracking jokes like I'm [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carrot_Top Carrot Top] and I start doing funny things with props, and I hate prop comedy.
'''Jackson''': Remember my brother Beau? '''Lorelai''': Uh, dark hair, coarse stubble, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jefferson_Davis Jefferson Davis] tattoo?
'''Sookie''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judith_Martin Miss Manners] said you're not really engaged until you have a ring and a date.
'''Sookie''': She's been institutionalized. She shaved her head. She thinks she's [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Susan_Powter Susan Powter].
'''Lorelai''': She played me like a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stradivarius Stradivarius].
'''Zach''': You got to be [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R2-D2 R2-D2] to understand that thing.
'''Lane''': You look good, too. I like the bangs. Very [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marianne_Faithfull#1960s Marianne Faithfull]. '''Rory''': Thanks. I'm hoping Mick Jagger notices.
'''Kirk''': I haven't had much contact with Martha. She seems more reserved, elusive. There's a bit of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greta_Garbo Garbo] in her. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Always a Godmother, Never a God | up=Season 6 | next=Welcome to the Dollhouse}} {{Infobox episode |name = We've Got Magic to Do |Image = 605.jpg|250px |season_num = [[Season 6|6]] |ep_num = 5 |air_date = October 11, 2005 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Michael Zinberg]] }}
Rory's World War II-themed DAR bash is a pipperoo (even when suddenly impoverished Paris joins the proletariat as a server). But the bash goes smash when Richard confronts Mitchum Huntzberger.
==Plot Outline== [[Lorelai]] needs [[Richard]]'s help with her insurance after a small fire at the [[Dragonfly Inn]] and uses the occasion to talk to him about the fact that he didn't manage to get [[Rory]] back into Yale. Although he doesn't appreciate Lorelai's reprimand, Richard has to admit that Rory is not where she should be. Meanwhile, Rory organizes a fabulous DAR party for [[Emily]], but the evening doesn't turn out as planned when Richard confronts [[Mitchum Huntzberger]], [[Logan]]'s father, about his opinion on Rory's journalistic talents. At the same time, Emily has an even uglier confrontation with Logan's [[Shira Huntzberger|mother]] about Rory and Logan's relationship. In addition, [[Miss Patty]]'s 28th annual dance recital is on Thursday night, and Lorelai decides that [[Luke]] should participate in activities he likes, such as camping and fishing, instead of going to things he hates (like dance recitals) with Lorelai. [[Paris]] gets her first job.
==Music== *"Bei Mir Bistu Shein" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Andrews_Sisters The Andrews Sisters] *"Don't Sit Under The Apple Tree" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Andrews_Sisters The Andrews Sisters] *"Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beatles The Beatles] *"I'll Be With You in Apple Blossom Time" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Andrews_Sisters The Andrews Sisters]
==Book References== *''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Molloy_(novel) Molloy]'' by Samuel Beckett
==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gunga_Din_(film) Gunga Din] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gone_with_the_Wind_(film) Gone with the Wind] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dog_Day_Afternoon Dog Day Afternoon] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Working_Girl Working Girl]
==Television References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Just_Shoot_Me! Just Shoot Me!] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M*A*S*H_(TV_series) M*A*S*H]
==Pop Culture References==
'''Title: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magic_to_Do We've Got Magic to Do]'''
'''Sookie''': I saw my whole life pass before my eyes, that's how traumatic it was...not that it's been a bad life, although I could have skipped seeing [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mummenschanz Mummenschanz].
'''Lorelai''': So, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mutt_and_Jeff Mutt and Jeff], what's the prognosis there?
'''Nora''': We're lunching with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grover_Norquist Grover Norquist].
'''Nora''': We need to take a swing here, and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Babe_Ruth Babe Ruth] sits before us.
'''Richard''': Emily, please. It's Rory. What she tackles, she conquers. This girl could name the state capitals at 3, recite the periodic table at 4, discuss [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Schopenhauer Schopenhauer]'s influence on [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friedrich_Nietzsche Nietzsche] when she was 10.
'''Rory''': Now, there must be a color photo of the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hollywood_Canteen Hollywood Canteen].
'''Paris''': I'm a pauper. I'll be playing a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hurdy_gurdy hurdy-gurdy] on street corners and selling pencils out of a tin cup.
'''Lorelai''': You haven't been camping in forever. Be [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_%22Grizzly%22_Adams Grizzly Adams].
'''Richard''': But if you heed the word of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mortimer_J._Adler Mortimer Adler], one needs to read a classic three times to fully comprehend its meaning...I wonder if Mortimer ever read [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euclid%27s_Elements Euclid's geometry] three times.
'''Rory''': Whoa! Treat her gently there, boys. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bette_Davis Bette]'s life was tough enough.
'''Paris''': I'd love a performance review. Come on, be my [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_Star:_INXS Dave Navarro].
'''Paris''': It was [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T._S._Eliot T.S. Eliot] who said, "Criticism is as inevitable as breathing."
'''Richard''': My father was a huge [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benny_Goodman Benny Goodman] fan. Hated [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glenn_Miller Glenn Miller], hated him.
'''Paris''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_Marx Karl Marx] has come alive for me today. I never understood what he was yammering about before, and now it just seems so obviously wrong that those who control capital should make their fortunes off the labor of the working class.
'''Paris''': Wow, you're always so [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desmond_Tutu Desmond Tutu]-ey. This is refreshing.
'''Paris''': I bet you the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shooting_of_the_Romanov_family Romanovs] never RSVP-ed either. They got theirs. Capitalist scum.
'''Vivian''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rumsfield Rumsfeld] himself would probably call her and thank her for the donation she made on the way in. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Improvised_vehicle_armour Hillbilly armor] will be a thing of the past.
'''Lorelai''': So it's the birth of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucille_Ball Lucille Ball]?
'''Richard''': Well, when I said great, I didn't mean she was [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_C._Bradlee Ben Bradlee] yet, but she could be. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=We've Got Magic to Do| up=Season 6 | next=Twenty-One is the Loneliest Number}} {{Infobox episode |name = Welcome to the Dollhouse |Image = Welcome_to_the_Dollhouse.jpg|250px |season_num = [[Season 6|6]] |ep_num = 6 |air_date = October 18, 2005 |writer = [[Keith Eisner]] |director = [[Jackson Douglas]] }}
What's in a name? To boost tourism. Taylor suggests reviving Stars Hollow's original street names. Lorelai thinks that's a charming idea - until she learns what the new Dragonfly Inn address will be.
==Plot Outline== After trying to figure out what [[Rory]]'s future plans are by talking to [[Logan]], [[Richard]] finally admits that he made a mistake by letting Rory drop out of Yale and comes to [[Lorelai]] to find a solution. However, Logan mistakenly thinks that Richard wants to know when they are planning to marry. Also, Rory makes a big declaration to Logan; [[Taylor]] gets busy in [[Stars Hollow]] when he decides to change all the street names back to their historic names. An idea which doesn't please Lorelai when she realizes what used to be the name of the street where the [[Dragonfly Inn]] is located.
==Music== *Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beatles The Beatles]
==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Welcome_to_the_Dollhouse Welcome to the Dollhouse] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bring_Me_the_Head_of_Alfredo_Garcia Bring Me the Head of Alfredo Garcia] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Godfather The Godfather] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norma_Rae Norma Rae] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sixteen_Candles Sixteen Candles]
==Television References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scooby-Doo Scooby-Doo]
==Pop Culture References== '''Emily''': You're missing [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katie_Couric Katie Couric].
'''Emily''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Godfrey Arthur Godfrey] was their spokesman.
'''Sookie''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charing_Cross_Road Charing Cross Road] or [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abbey_Road_(street) Abbey Road], something classic.
'''Logan''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trix_(cereal)#Marketing_and_advertising Silly rabbit, speed limits are for kids].
'''Logan''': It's not just a purse. It's a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Birkin_bag Birkin bag].
'''Richard''': We're missing [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Rose Charlie Rose].
'''Lorelai''': I'm "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1972_Andes_flight_disaster crash-landed in the Andes, eat my teammates]" starved.
'''Michel''': Was [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joan_Rivers Joan Rivers] or [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suzanne_Somers Suzanne Somers] holding it up?
'''Richard''': It's usually at this point in the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_le_Carr%C3%A9 John le CarrÃ©] novels where things start to go horribly wrong.
'''Emily''': It's Goodwill, Lorelai, not [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sotheby%27s Sotheby's].
'''Logan''': No. This is cool. I got a tree stump I can use as a boost out here. Or you can [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapunzel let down your hair]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Welcome to the Dollhouse| up=Season 6 | next=Let Me Hear Your Balalaikas Ringing Out}} {{Infobox episode |name = Twenty-One Is the Loneliest Number |Image = 607.jpg|250px |season_num = [[Season 6|6]] |ep_num = 7 |air_date = October 25, 2005 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Robert Berlinger]] }}
Since Rory was a tyke, the Gilmore girls have planned her 21st birthday: in Atlantic City, sipping martinis, playing 21. But with the estrangement, Emily plans the birthday party - and it's soooo not Atlantic City.
==Plot Outline== [[Lorelai]] refuses to listen to [[Richard]]'s plan to bribe [[Rory]] into resuming school, saying that Rory has to want to go back on her own. Both Rory and Lorelai are saddened by the fact that their estrangement is keeping them apart on Rory's 21st birthday. [[Emily]] takes it upon herself to plan a party for her granddaughter when Rory shows no interest in the event. Richard and Emily find out that Rory and [[Logan]] have been sleeping together. Lorelai tries to convince [[Luke]] to participate in her mad scientist Halloween skit.
==Music== *"One" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Dog_Night Three Dog Night]
==Book References== *''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alice%27s_Adventures_in_Wonderland Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]'' by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lewis_Carroll Lewis Carroll]
==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Girl,_Interrupted_(film) Girl, Interrupted] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_40-Year-Old_Virgin The 40-Year-Old Virgin] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/March_of_the_Penguins March of the Penguins]
==Television References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Waltons The Waltons]
==Pop Culture References== '''Lorelai''': When Rory wants help, she will ask for it. The minute she does, I will fly in faster than the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gulfstream_Aerospace Gulf Stream] I'm sure you're going to offer to buy her next.
'''Rory''': So, do I look older? '''Madeline Albright''': Oh, yeah. Walk into [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denny%27s Denny's] before five and you've got yourself a discount.
'''Rory''': I just had a dream that [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madeleine_Albright Madeline Albright] was my mother.
'''Lorelai''': I want to be a mad scientist, I'm going to come out in a blood-stained white lab coat and freaky makeup and a big giant [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don_King_(boxing_promoter) Don King] kind of hairdo.
'''Lorelai''': Okay, and so I come out and do mad scientist banter, like, 'Hey, who here's from [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bellevue_Hospital_Center Bellevue]?'
'''Luke''': What are the odds of you getting me to do a skit where you electrocute me, cut me open, and pull link sausages out of me? 'Cause I'm thinking they're right up there with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pia_Zadora Pia Zadora] making a big comeback.
'''Lorelai''': Determined, demented, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/It%27s_De-Lovely delovely].
'''Sookie''': I can't believe Rory's turning 21. It seems like just yesterday she was crying because you told her [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlotte_Bront%C3%AB Charlotte BrontÃ«] couldn't come to her sleepover because she's dead.
'''Rory''': It's been weeks since I've had anything that hasn't been [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supersize supersized] for dinner.
'''Luke''': It tasted pink. I mean, like, really tasted really pink. Like pink-pink...it's like drinking a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/My_Little_Pony My Little Pony].
'''Lorelai''': We were going to drink martinis. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rat_Pack The Rat Pack] drank martinis. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Bond_(character) James Bond] drank martinis.
'''Lorelai''': No, me and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_O%27Hurley John O'Hurley]. Luke doesn't know yet. I hope he takes it okay. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

page.title: Let Me Hear Your Balalaikas Ringing Out

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=Twenty-One is the Loneliest Number | up=Season 6 | next=The Prodigal Daughter Returns}} {{Infobox episode |name = Let Me Hear Your Balalaikas Ringing Out |Image = 608.jpg|250px |season_num = [[Season 6|6]] |ep_num = 8 |air_date = November 8, 2005 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Kenneth Ortega]] }}
Who can finally get Rory thinking she made a ''big'' mistake dropping out of Yale? If you guess Jess, you're right. Her old flame returns with exciting news about his life...and some blunt advice about hers.
==Plot Outline== [[Rory]] is pleasantly surprised when her old flame [[Jess]] appears at her grandparents' [[Gilmore house|house]] and reveals an amazing development in his life. Rory agrees to go to dinner with Jess, and when [[Logan]] unexpectedly joins them, an ugly confrontation develops, leaving both Rory and Logan to face the choices they have made, and Jess finally encourages Rory about going back to Yale. [[Emily]] is concerned about Rory's sudden evasiveness and tries to exert some parental discipline. Meanwhile, [[Luke]] agrees to sponsor a local girls' soccer team and [[Lorelai]] channels all her concerns about Rory into caring for her dog, [[Paul Anka]].
==Music== *"Back in the USSR" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beatles The Beatles] *"[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Dooley_(song) Tom Dooley]" *Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/INXS INXS]
==Book References== *''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oliver_Twist Oliver Twist]'' by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Dickens Charles Dickens]
==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wizard_of_Oz_(1939_film) The Wizard of Oz] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sophie's_Choice_(film) Sophie's Choice] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bend_It_Like_Beckham Bend It Like Beckham] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scarface_(1983_film) Scarface]
==Television References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Get_Smart Get Smart] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Twilight_Zone The Twilight Zone] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battlestar_Galactica Battlestar Galactica] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doogie_Howser,_M.D. Doogie Howser, M.D.]
==Pop Culture References==

'''Lorelai''': But his career is hot. Go with Tobey. '''Luke''': What about that Vito Morgenstern? '''Lorelai''': Sure. Or [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viggo_Mortensen Viggo Mortensen]. Or [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Sutherland Donald Sutherland].
