[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marcel_Proust Proust]?
'''Logan''': I was just challenging him, jeez. Hey, if [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernest_Hemingway Hemingway] could take it, so can he. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Let Me Hear Your Balalaikas Ringing Out| up=Season 6 | next=He's Slippin' 'Em Bread...Dig?}} {{Infobox episode |name = The Prodigal Daughter Returns |Image = 609.jpg|250px |season_num = [[Season 6|6]] |ep_num = 9 |air_date = November 15, 2005 |writer = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] |director = [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]] }}
Like meat and potatoes, like salt and tomatoes, the Gilmore girls belong together: Rory comes home. And a super-smart middle schooler shows up at Luke's Diner with a startling idea for a science-fair project.
==Plot Outline== [[Luke]] becomes jealous when [[Lorelai]] receives a phone call from [[Christopher]]. Luke makes a big deal about being honest with each other, but when he discovers that he has a [[April|daughter]] he never knew about, he is unsure of how to tell Lorelai. After [[Rory]] moves into [[Lane]]'s apartment, re-enrolls in Yale, and scores herself a job, Rory and Lorelai take the first steps towards reconciliation.
==Music== *"The Sound of Silence" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simon_%26_Garfunkel Simon & Garfunkel] *"Saturday Night's Alright for Fighting" by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elton_John Elton John] *Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elvis_Presley Elvis Presley]
==Book References== *''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Primary_Colors_(novel) Primary Colors]'' by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Klein Joe Klein]
==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Shining_(film) The Shining] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mask_(film) Mask] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Side_Story_(film) West Side Story]
==Television References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Comeback_(TV_series) The Comeback] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desperate_Housewives Desperate Housewives]
==Pop Culture References== '''Episode Title: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parable_of_the_Prodigal_Son The Prodigal Daughter Returns]'''
'''Lorelai''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Land_Shark_(Saturday_Night_Live) Land Shark. Candygram].
'''Lorelai''': Say hello to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yao_Ming Yao Ming] for me.
'''Lorelai''': I'm convinced it's haunted, and one night Luke will come back from the bathroom and find nothing but a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Hook bloody hook] hanging from the cherubs.
'''Lorelai''': I think they enjoyed watching a show for once that didn't have [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teletubbies Laa-Laa] playing the guitar.
'''Lorelai''': When I was in fifth grade, I told everybody that [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erik_Estrada Erik Estrada] was my boyfriend and that we used to make out on his motorcycle. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=The Prodigal Daughter Returns | up=Season 6 | next=The Perfect Dress}} {{Infobox episode |name = He's Slippin' 'Em Bread...Dig? |Image = 610.jpg|250px |season_num = [[Season 6|6]] |ep_num = 10 |air_date = November 22, 2005 |writer = [[Daniel Palladino]] |director = [[Kenneth Ortega]] }}
Thanksgiving arrives, and after months of emotional turmoil, all is well on Planet Gilmore. Except for one teeny issue: Luke doesn't know how to tell Lorelai about his daughter. Lane's band plays a showcase.
==Plot Outline== After a long absence, [[Christopher]] reappears in [[Lorelai]] and [[Rory]]'s lives. [[Luke]] struggles with what his [[April|daughter]] will mean to him and to his relationship with Lorelai. Lorelai and Rory enjoy their first Thanksgiving at the [[Dragonfly Inn]], and Rory receives surprising news about [[Logan]]. Meanwhile, on the eve of an important gig for the band, [[Lane]] has to deal with [[Zack]]'s jealousy over a song [[Brian]] wrote about her.
==Music== *Referenced: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_Prima Louis Prima]
==Book References==
==Movie References== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dig! Dig!]
==Television References==
==Pop Culture References==
'''Lorelai''': Hey! Make a noise, so I don't think you pulled an [http://memphis.about.com/od/elvis/f/elvisdeath.htm Elvis]. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=He's Slippin' 'Em Bread...Dig? | up=Season 6 | next=Just Like Gwen and Gavin}} {{Infobox episode | Image=The Perfect Dress.JPG | name=The Perfect Dress | season_num=[[Season 6|6]] | ep_num=11 | air_date=January 10, 2006 | director=[[Jamie Babbit]] | writer=[[Amy Sherman-Palladino]]}} ==Summary== Lorelai and Sookie manage to plan Luke and Lorelai's wedding in just one day. Luke goes to have a talk with his former girlfriend [[Anna Nardini]], mother of his daughter [[April Nardini|April]]. Rory has a breakdown while talking to the school psychologist as Logan tries to get Rory back as his girlfriend. ==Recap==
==Trivia== * June 3rd the year before was Rory's court date after she stole the yacht. ("[[New and Improved Lorelai]]") [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=The Perfect Dress | up=Season 6 | next=Friday Night's Alright For Fighting}} {{stub}} {{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode || Image=Just Like Gwen and Gavin.JPG | name=Just Like Gwen and Gavin | season_num=[[Season 6|6]] | ep_num=12 | air_date=January 17, 2006 | director=[[Stephen Clancy]] | writer=[[Daniel Palladino]]}}Luke is showing signs that he hasn't slept much. Lorelai wakes up so early that she gets a lot done. Kirk is organizing the Winter Carnival. Lorelai and Rory volunteer to man a carnival booth calledÂ "The Amazing Doggy Swami." At the inn, Lorelai takes care of the New England Maple Syrup Council. Zach is jealous of the time Lane is spending with a 30-year-old Asian man named Joe. At the Yale Daily News, Paris is making everyone except Rory uncomfortable with her demands, expectations and ideas. Later, the reporters gather together and talk about Paris and the fact that they think the paper is going down hill. The reporters don't ask Rory to be part of their discussion since she's living with Paris. But Rory sees the reporters in their meeting and they confide in her. Logan tries to mend his relationship with Rory by hiring the coffee cart guy to follow Rory around all day so she has instant access to coffee. Logan drops by the Inn to get help from Lorelai in regards to his relationship with Rory. Last but not least, Lorelai finds out about Luke's kid, April, and Luke asks Lorelai to postpone their wedding. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Just Like Gwen and Gavin | up=Season 6 | next=You've Been Gilmored}}{{Infobox episode || Image=Friday Night's Alright for Fighting.JPG | name=Friday Night's Alright For Fighting | season_num=[[Season 6|6]] | ep_num=13 | air_date=January 31, 2006 | director=[[Kenneth Ortega]] | writer=[[Amy Sherman-Palladino]]}} While Luke deals with the reality of having April in his life, Lorelai tries to pretend she doesn't mind the repercussions the new situation is having on their engagement. Rory's concern over Paris' lack of management skills at the Yale Daily News finally reaches a crisis point when most of the staff quits in protest. With Logan's help, Rory makes a valiant attempt to get the paper out on time. Meanwhile, Lorelai breaks the news to Richard and Emily that their money will no longer be needed for Rory's education, and the resentment starts to build. The subsequent Friday night dinner erupts into an emotional confrontation where all four Gilmores finally get their issues out on the table. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Friday Night's Alright For Fighting | up=Season 6 | next=A Vineyard Valentine}}{{Infobox episode || Image=You've Been Gilmored.JPG | name=You've Been Gilmored | season_num=[[Season 6|6]] | ep_num=14 | air_date=February 7, 2006 | director=[[Stephen Clancy]] | writer=[[Jordon Nardino]]}} Emily tells Lorelai that she'd like to get to know her future son-in-law better and asks her to invite Luke over for dinner - Lorelai purposely fails to mention that the wedding has been postponed... The Yale Daily News staff finally fires Paris and chooses Rory to be the new editor. A furious Paris kicks Rory out of the apartment, Logan subsequently convinces her to move into his place. Christopher tells Lorelai about Rory's new living arrangement. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=You've Been Gilmored | up=Season 6 | next=Bridesmaids Revisited}} {{stub}} {{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode || Image=Vineyard.JPG | name=A Vineyard Valentine | season_num=[[Season 6|6]] | ep_num=15 | air_date=February 14, 2006 | director=[[Daniel Palladino]] | writer=[[Daniel Palladino]]}} ==Summary== In this episode, [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] invites [[Luke Danes|Luke]], [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] to spend the [[Valentine's Day]] weekend with him at his family's house in Martha's Vineyard. On Saturday, the two couples visit the gym and then eat. Later, Lorelai and Luke discuss their upcoming wedding. The following day, [[Mitchum Huntzberger]], Logan's father, reprimands him and commands him to leave. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=A Vineyard Valentine | up=Season 6 | next=I'm OK, You're OK}}{{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode || Image=Bridesmaids.JPG | name=Bridesmaids Revisited | season_num=[[Season 6|6]] | ep_num=16 | air_date=February 28, 2006 | director=[[Linda Mendoza]] | writer=[[Rebecca Rand Kirshner]]}} Lorelai offers to help Christopher out by babysitting his 3-year-old daughter, Gigi, and is horrified by the toddler's terrible behavior. The next day, Rory and Logan attend the wedding of Logan's sister, Honor. While helping the bride and her three bridesmaids get ready, Rory is devastated to learn how Logan spent his time during their recent breakup. Heartbroken Lane gets a surprise proposal from Zack at the diner. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Bridesmaids Revisited | up=Season 6 | next=The Real Paul Anka}}{{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode || Image=I'm OK.JPG | name=I'm OK, You're OK | season_num=[[Season 6|6]] | ep_num=17 | air_date=April 4, 2006 | director=[[Lee Shallat Chemel]] | writer=[[Keith Eisner]]}} Rory forgives Logan, then needs some time for herself, so she pays a visit to Lorelai in Stars Hollow. Although Lorelai refuses to admit that she is upset, Rory can tell that she is bothered by the news that Luke will be gone for a few days on a field trip with his daughter, April. Against Lorelai's wishes, Rory pays a visit to the store owned by April's mother, Anna, to spy on her. Meanwhile, when Zack finally works up the courage to ask Mrs. Kim for permission to marry Lane, he is surprised at the deal she makes with him. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

page.title: I Get A Sidekick Out of You

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=The Real Paul Anka | up=Season 6 | next=Super Cool Party People}} {{stub}} {{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode || Image=Sidekick.JPG | name=I Get A Sidekick Out of You | season_num=[[Season 6|6]] | ep_num=19 | air_date=April 18, 2006 | director=[[Amy Sherman-Palladino]]
[[John C. Flinn III]] | writer=[[Amy Sherman-Palladino]]}} ==Synopsis== Lorelai is sad and hurt because she thinks she will never get married. Lane and Zach get married ==Plot outline== Lane and Zach get married. Because Lanes Grandmother is a Buddhist, they have to marry buddhistic. Chris buys Rory a Sidekick. Luke goes to Aprils class trip. Lorelai calls Christopher when she discovers, that even "when I have a Man, Im still the Woman who hasÂ´nt a man". They go together to the wedding. On the party, Lorelai is drunk and orates. She says that she will never get married. At the end, Rory gets a call from the hospital: Logan has a severe injury. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Super Cool Party People | up=Season 6 | next=Partings}}{{Infobox episode || Image=Driving Ms Gilmore.JPG | name=Driving Miss Gilmore | season_num=[[Season 6|6]] | ep_num=21 | air_date=May 2, 2006 | director=[[Jamie Babbit]] | writer=[[Amy Sherman-Palladino]]
[[Daniel Palladino]]}} Logan comes home from the hospital and is cared for by an overprotective Rory; Liz has big news for Luke; Emily has LASIK eye surgery, so Lorelai has to serve as her chauffeur; Rory is upset by a statement Logan's dad made about her in an interview in the Wall Street Journal; Jackson discovers that former employees planted marijuana in one of his fields, and he and Sookie try to dispose of it. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 6 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Partings | up=Season 7 | next=That's What You Get, Folks, For Makin' Whoopee}} {{stub}} {{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode ||Image=The Long Morrow.JPG |name=The Long Morrow |season_num=[[Season 7|7]] |ep_num=1 |air_date=September 26, 2006 |director=[[Lee Shallat Chemel]] |writer=[[David S. Rosenthal]]}} [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] questions why [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] gave her a two-foot rocket as a parting gift when he leaves for London to work for his father's company. After searching through Google, blogs, and chat rooms, she finds a rocket-geek who tells her that the rocket is a replica from a Twilight Zone episode. Rory goes back through her memory bank, and finally realizes that she and Logan had watched this episode in her grandparent's pool house in the earlier stages of their relationship. When they were watching the episode, Logan commented on it: "that is true love."
Meanwhile, [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] wakes up in [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]]'s bed. Christopher calls her later, but Lorelai tries to downplay what happened. [[Luke Danes|Luke]] has realized Lorelai was right, and he tells Lorelai he is ready to get married right then. Lorelai reveals she slept with Chris, and Luke, hurt, wordlessly drives away as Lorelai looks on. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes|7.01]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes|7.01]]

page.title: That's What You Get, Folks, For Makin' Whoopee

revision.text: {{Epnav | prev=The Long Morrow | up=Season 7 | next=Lorelai's First Cotillion}}{{Infobox episode || Image=Makin Whoopie.JPG | name=That's What You Get, Folks, For Makin' Whoopee | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=2 | air_date=October 3, 2006 | director=[[Bethany Rooney]] | writer=[[Rebecca Rand Kirshner]]}} ==Summary== [[Luke Danes|Luke]] deals with the aftermath of last week's crash, including [[Kirk Gleason|Kirk]]'s new diner, but first he takes time to visit and punch [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] in the face. [[Lane Kim|Lane]] returns from her honeymoon with an aversion to sex and a pregnancy. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] recreate Asia at Lorelai's house. Rory finds out that Lorelai slept with Christopher. Luke and Lorelai run into each other in town, once with hostility, and again without the yelling, and Lorelai returns home to cry. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes|7.02]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes|7.02]]

{{Epnav | prev=That's What You Get, Folks, For Makin' Whoopee | up=Season 7 | next='S Wonderful, 'S Marvelous}} {{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode || Image=First Cotillion.JPG | name=Lorelai's First Cotillion | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=3 | air_date=October 10, 2006 | director=[[Lee Shallat Chemel]] | writer=[[Rina Mimoun]]}} ==Summary== [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] helps prepare young girls for their cotillion, and one catches [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]]'s eye. Lorelai wonders if she does anything because she really wants to do it, or she does the opposite of what her parent's want. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] tries to figure out phone and texting sex. [[Lane Kim|Lane]] tells [[Zack Van Gerbig|Zack]] she's pregnant. [[Luke's Diner]] reopens. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes|7.03]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes|7.03]]

{{Epnav | prev=Lorelai's First Cotillion | up=Season 7 | next=The Great Stink}} {{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode || Image=Swonderful.JPG | name='S Wonderful, 'S Marvelous | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=4 | air_date=October 17, 2006 | director=[[Victor Nelli, Jr.]] | writer=[[Gayle Abrams]]}} ==Plot== [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] begin to date and attempt a relationship once again. Although Lorelai finds it hard to stay committed and all in on the relationship between her and Christopher. Christopher keeps on trying to make romantic dates and think of ones to bring Lorelai to so that he can finally win Lorelai over.
At an art exhibit, [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] meets some eccentric and colorful girls named [[Olivia]] and [[Lucy]] who become her friends and she finds nice.
[[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] becomes a guest lecturer at [[Yale]] when a professor at Yale and a past classmate of Richard can't teach the class, he asks Richard to do it for him.
[[April Nardini|April]] stays with [[Luke Danes|Luke]] for a couple of weeks while her mother, [[Anna Nardini|Anna]], is out of town and Luke and April seem to really be bonding and getting along much better.
Lorelai and Chris have to bail [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] out of jail for failing to take a breathalizer test after being pulled over for talking on her cell phone in her car which is illegal in Connecticut. Emily is infuriated and exclaims the man that arrested her should be fired and that her lawyer will call the police department. Lorelai finds it very amusing that she had to bail Emily out of jail and can't stop laughing and smiling about it. When they get to the police station she takes pictures of the police men with her phone. Emily is escorted out without her shoes on and when they give them to her in a bag, Lorelai starts laughing.
When Chris drops Lorelai off for the night at her house, he's worried if bailing her mom out of jail "beat" his date. Lorelai tells him that it didn't and for him not to worry about her. They kiss good-night and Lorelai invites him inside, implying that they sleep together, later. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes|7.04]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes|7.04]]

Synopsis [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] returns to town on business to acquire an internet company and pays [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] a surprise visit. Rory is thrilled, but during a dinner with Logan's colleagues, she realizes that she has no connection to his new business world, and is especially threatened by one of his beautiful co-workers. [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] is pleased to see [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] at [[Friday night dinner]]. Christopher makes plans to send [[Georgia Hayden|Gigi]] to Paris (France, not Geller), to see [[Sherry Tinsdale|Sherry]], which [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] has some problems with. In [[Stars Hollow]], a pickle mishap is creating a foul odor. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=The Great Stink | up=Season 7 | next=French Twist}} {{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode || Image=Go Bulldogs.JPG | name=Go, Bulldogs! | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=6 | air_date=November 7, 2006 | director=[[Wil Shriner]] | writer=[[David S. Rosenthal]]
[[Rebecca Rand Kirshner]]}} ==Plot summary== [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] talks [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] into going to Parents Day at Yale with Rory even though Rory and Lorelai think that Parents Day is for kids who don't like their parents. Christopher makes up his own emblem from his name tag in the middle of his chest. Lorelai finds out [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] have been going to the Parents Day since Rory was a Freshman. Lorelai is hurt because they take her to a nice fancy restaurant each time. Trying to prove he is a cool Dad and he will always be there Christopher comes into the [[News Room]] with Lorelai to see Rory and invites Rory to lunch and ends up inviting everybody on the staff at the [[Yale Daily News]] to the fancy restaurant Richard and Emily always take Rory to. Although they have a great time a lot of them are drunk and a little tipsy when Rory gets a cell phone call about a new boycott outside of Yale and she whisks them off to cover the story. [[Luke Danes|Luke]] meets April's swim coach who says he should take the parents swim class and when [[April Nardini|April]] finds out she laughs and wants to call her Mom when she finds out. Luke does not know that the Coach Bennet has a reputation of sleeping with the swim students parents. At the parents swim Coach Bennet asks Luke out and he accepts. When they go out on a date he notices the place they went to is all vegan and the food is disgusting. He now realizes that she sleeps around with the students parents/fathers. [[Lane Kim|Lane]] babysits April while Luke goes on a date but it ends up Lane falling asleep and them playing Monopoly. Lane really wants to play Boggle because of a big word she learned so they play it. ==Popular Culture== ===Film/Television=== * America's Next Top Model * Antiques Roadshow * Laverne and Shirley * Pleasantville * Project Runway * Top Gun ===Music=== * Living on a Prayer, by Bon Jovi * You've Lost That Loving Feeling ===Other=== * Zinf, the name on Lorelai's nametag * The Riddler * Groucho Marx * Clark Kent of Superman * Condoleezza Rice [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes]]

[[File:Gilmore-girls-french-twist-04.jpg|thumb]]Plot [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]], [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Georgia Hayden|Gigi]] head to Paris to bring Gigi to see her mother, [[Sherry Tinsdale|Sherry]], who left in Season 5 to accept a job offering in Paris. Christopher notes that Lorelai was very good with Sherry at the airport, and she was very good with Gigi on the plane.
Christopher packs the car, refusing to tell Lorelai and Gigi what time the plane leaves. Lorelai tells Gigi that Paris is called the "City of Love" because it has lots of love and pigeons, but nobody would want to go and visit the "City of Pigeons." When they get in the car, Chris tells them they can go get a coffee because the plane does not leave for three hours. Lorelai and Gigi laugh and say they knew it.
[[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] ends her job as Editor-in-Chief of the [[Yale Daily News]] and becomes unsure of what she wants to do with her life. Should she go to Grad School or become a journalist? [[Olivia]] and [[Lucy]] suggest a girls night out in [[Stars Hollow]], so they go there and look through scrapbooks of Rory's past, including past boyfriends. Lucy talks about her boyfriend. When they all get back home to Yale, Lucy's boyfriend [[Marty]] is in the apartment and she introduces Rory to him. Marty is Rory's old friend, and much to Rory's shock, Marty pretends not to know her.
Despite jet lag, Chris and Lorelai have a romantic time. They get engaged and married in Paris, after Chris pops the question during dinner. (Many fans have pointed out that because of legal reasons, they would have not been able to get officially married in a foreign country so quickly; the issue has not been dealt with on the show.)
[[Lane]] and [[Zack]] find out that not only are they pregnant but pregnant with twins. They tell [[Mrs. Kim]] but they are so shocked by her calm and happy attitude towards the pregnancy, that Zach accidently agrees that they would move in with her. They both realize that they are going to be parents and that they make the rules. They then confront Mrs. Kim and tell her that they do not want to move in with her. But Mrs. Kim decides that she is going to move in with them instead. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes|7.07]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes|7.07]]

{{Epnav | prev=French Twist | up=Season 7 | next=Knit, People, Knit}}{{Infobox episode ||Image=Introducing Lorelai Planetarium.JPG |name=Introducing Lorelai Planetarium |season_num=[[Season 7|7]] |ep_num=8 |air_date=November 21, 2006 |director=[[Lee Shallat Chemel]] |writer=[[Jennie Snyder]]}} ==Summary== [[Lorelai]] invites [[Rory]] over to dinner to tell her that she and [[Christopher]] got married in Paris. Rory pretends to be thrilled while Christopher is in the room, but later tells Lorelai how hurt and angry she really is. [[Logan]] surprises Rory with a visit and an announcement that he is relocating to New York to start his new internet company. Meanwhile, when [[April]] faces a medical emergency, a frantic [[Luke]] turns to Lorelai for help. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Introducing Lorelai Planetarium | up=Season 7 | next=Merry Fisticuffs}} {{stub}} {{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode || Image=Knit.JPG | name=Knit, People, Knit | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=9 | air_date=November 28, 2006 | director=[[Lee Shallat Chemel]] | writer=[[David Grae]]}} ==Summary== [[Stars Hollow]] holds a knit-a-thon to raise money, and [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] alienates the townspeople. [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] pushes for a wedding party for Christopher and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]]. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Marty]] have some awkward moments, and it's clear Marty still has a thing for Rory at [[Olivia]]'s and [[Lucy]]'s 2002 party. [[Anna Nardini|Anna]] announces she's taking [[April Nardini|April]] to New Mexico and [[Luke Danes|Luke]] asserts his rights as a parent. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Knit, People, Knit | up=Season 7 | next=Santa's Secret Stuff}} {{stub}} {{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode || Image=Merry.JPG | name=Merry Fisticuffs | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=10 | air_date=December 5, 2006 | director=[[Jackson Douglas]] | writer=[[David S. Rosenthal]]}} ==Summary== [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]]'s plans get bigger for the wedding party, creating a rift between the loving couple. [[Luke Danes|Luke]] watches [[Dula]] for [[Liz Danes|Liz]] and [[T.J.]], and shares a moment with the baby and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]]. [[Anna Nardini|Anna]] keeps [[April Nardini|April]] away from Luke. He visits a lawyer. Luke finds out it's not so easy to win partial custody of [[April Nardini|April]]; [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] finds out it's not so easy to keep from getting jealous. Luke and Christopher come to blows in the town square, messing up Christmas decorations. [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] tells [[Lucy]] that [[Marty]] and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] have known each other for a lot longer than she thinks. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=Merry Fisticuffs | up=Season 7 | next=To Whom It May Concern}}{{Infobox episode || Image=Santas Secret Stuff.JPG | name=Santa's Secret Stuff | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=11 | air_date=January 23, 2007 | director=[[Lee Shallat Chemel]] | writer=[[Rebecca Rand Kirshner]]}}
Lorelai postpones Christmas celebrations until Rory returns from London. Luke asks Lorelai to write a character recommendation for his custody battle over April. Lorelai struggles with the task. Rory decides she will write an apology letter to her friend Lucy. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes|7.11]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes|7.11]]

{{Epnav | prev=Santa's Secret Stuff | up=Season 7 | next=I'd Rather Be In Philadelphia}} {{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode || Image=To Whom It May Concern.JPG | name=To Whom It May Concern | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=12 | air_date=January 30, 2007 | director=[[Jamie Babbit]] | writer=[[David Babcock]]}} Rory writes Lucy a letter to explain and apologize for the disastrous double date in which Logan informed her that Rory already knew Marty, Lucy's boyfriend. Paris, sensing that this issue is interfering with Operation Finish Line, confronts Lucy about the situation in the Yale cafeteria. Rory and Lucy make amends, much to Paris's relief.
Jackson and Sookie have scheduled a ski trip and when they come back home earlier than expected, because of a moody and self conscious Sookie, Lorelai comments that Sookie may be pregnant again. Jackson confesses that she may be because he didn't get the vasectomy his wife told him to get.
While installing the new plasma television and looking for a level, Christopher finds the letter that Lorelai wrote as a character reference for Luke's custody battle.
==Character Reference Letter== The character reference letter was written by Lorelai. It is dated January 9, 2007 and was read aloud by the judge in the case that Luke ensued for custody of April. It has become one of the most popular and heartfelt moments in the Gilmore Girls episodes.
''To whom it may concern, ''
''In the nearly ten years that I have known Luke Danes I have come to know him as an honest and decent man. Heâ€™s also one of the most kind and caring persons I have ever met. ''
''Iâ€™m a single mother and I raised my daughter by myself. But once Luke Danes became my friend in this town, I never really felt alone. Luke and I have had our ups and downs over the years, but through it all his relationship with my daughter Rory has never changed. Heâ€™s always been there for her no matter what. He was there to celebrate her birthdays, he was there cheering her on at her high school graduation. Luke has been a sort of father figure in my daughterâ€™s life. ''
''With his own daughter Luke wasnâ€™t given the opportunity to be there for her first twelve years, but he should be given that opportunity now. Once Luke Danes is in your life, he is in your life forever.''
''I know from personal experience what an amazing gift that is and not to allow him access to his daughter would be to seriously deprive her of all this man has to offer, and he offers so much. Thank you for your time.''
''Sincerely, Lorelai Gilmore'' [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes|7.12]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes|7.12]]

{{Epnav | prev=To Whom It May Concern | up=Season 7 | next=Farewell, My Pet}} {{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode || Image=Philadelphia.JPG | name=I'd Rather Be In Philadelphia | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=13 | air_date=February 6, 2007 | director=[[Lee Shallat Chemel]] | writer=[[Rebecca Rand Kirshner]]}} After having a heart attack in front of his economics class, [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] is in the hospital. [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]], [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] are all there for support. [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] receives news and rushes to be there for the Gilmores. [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] does not show up and after being asked by a curious Emily as to why not, Lorelai makes countless phone calls to keep him updated, but her attempts fail as Christopher never arrives at the hospital. [[Babette Dell|Babette]] has been informed of the situation (as she is in charge of Paul Anka) and when he hears the news, [[Luke Danes|Luke]] arrives at the hospital to help out. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes|7.13]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes|7.13]]

{{Epnav | prev=I'd Rather Be In Philadelphia | up=Season 7 | next=I'm A Kayak, Hear Me Roar}} {{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode || Image=Farewell, My Pet.JPG | name=Farewell, My Pet | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=14 | air_date=February 13, 2007 | director=[[Jamie Babbit]] | writer=[[Jennie Snyder]]}} [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] is in the hospital recovering from his bypass surgery and will be discharged soon. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] decides that she will return to [[Yale]]. [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] also decides to return to the [[Dragonfly Inn]]. On her return she discovers that [[Michel Gerard|Michel]]'s beloved dog [[Chin-Chin]] has died. Lorelai is then forced into planning a funeral to make Michel feel better. As [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] and Lorelai try to plan the funeral Michel decides that they are not working hard enough. As Michel is yelling at them [[Christopher]] appears after not being there for Lorelai while her father was undergoing surgery. They have a short talk but nothing is resolved and they agree to talk later.
Back at Yale, Rory meets the attractive TA that is taking over her grandfather's job while he is recovering. Rory, both when she meets him and when she runs into him in the book store, is flustered and inarticulate. This crush worries Rory, especially in light of [[Paris Gellar|Paris]]'s earlier comments in the dorm of how she has "broken" [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]]. Rory explains it all to Logan and he comforts her, tell her that it is normal and she hasn't broken him.
Back in [[Stars Hollow]], [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] and Lorelai speak again at their home. A reoccurring fear of Christopher's is brought up again, that Lorelai is not over [[Luke Danes|Luke]], to whom she was once engaged. Again nothing is accomplished and they agree to talk later.
Lorelai still has the funeral to deal with, and back at the inn she talks with Sookie about her relationship with Christopher and her relationship with Luke. Lorelai wants to cut Luke out of her life, but Sookie wants to know if without the Luke breakup, would Christopher be the one? Lorelai is unable to answer her.
Later that night Christopher and Lorelai talk once more in the living room, and after a short time Lorelai cries over how she wants to be married to Christopher, but she just doesn't feel the same way about him that he feels about her. Though they do not yet get a divorce, their marriage is over. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes|7.14]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes|7.14]]

page.title: I'm A Kayak, Hear Me Roar

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=Farewell, My Pet | up=Season 7 | next=Will You Be My Lorelai Gilmore?}}
{{Infobox episode | Image=Kayak.JPG | name=I'm A Kayak, Hear Me Roar | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=15 | air_date=February 20, 2007 | director=[[Lee Shallat Chemel]] | writer=[[Rebecca Rand Kirshner]]}} ==Summary== Lorelai has a hard time confessing to Emily about her failed marriage to Christopher. When she finally does, she encounters sympathy from Emily, much to her surprise. Rory surprises a Gilmore-ish themed party for Logan's twenty-fifth birthday to show him that birthdays can be fun - this includes ice skating, pinatas and other activities based on the themes that Lorelai had used for Rory's past birthday parties - as opposed to the Huntzbergers' way of throwing birthday bashes. Before going skating, Logan receives a call from his business partner informing him that his company's patents are invalid. He decides quickly not to tell Rory about this. ==Trivia== *The gas station Lorelai knows about is the same one mentioned in [[French Twist]]. *First time the Gilmores don't serve alcohol at Friday night dinner. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes]]

page.title: Will You Be My Lorelai Gilmore?

revision.text:
{{Epnav | prev=I'm A Kayak, Hear Me Roar | up=Season 7 | next=Gilmore Girls Only}} {{Infobox episode | Image=Episode_image_placeholder1.jpg | name=Will You Be My Lorelai Gilmore? | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=16 | air_date=February 27, 2007 | director=[[David Paymer]] | writer=[[Gayle Abrams]]
[[Gina Fattore]] }} While planning Lane's baby shower, Rory gets a call from The New York Times offering her an interview for the Reston Fellowship. Lorelai finds herself brokering peace between Lane and Mrs. Kim over how the twins should be raised. Logan finally admits his business disaster to Rory. In an attempt to make Logan feel better, she offers to leave the baby shower early, but Logan has already decided to go to Las Vegas with Yale classmates Colin and Finn to blow off steam. When Luke discovers that Liz and T.J. are trying to sell his boat, he decides to make some changes in his life. He sells the boat to Kirk and purchases a new and bigger boat. Lane is put on bed-rest, but the shower must go on. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes]]

revision.comment: moved [[7.17 Gilmore Girls Only]] to [[Gilmore Girls Only]]
revision.text: {{Epnav | prev=Will You Be My Lorelai Gilmore? | up=Season 7 | next=Hay Bale Maze}} {{Infobox episode | | Image=Episode_image_placeholder1.jpg | name=Gilmore Girls Only | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=17 | air_date=March 7, 2007 | director=[[Lee Shallat-Chemel]] | writer=[[David Babcock]] }} ==Summary== Lorelai plans a road trip to North Carolina to attend the wedding of Mia, the woman who took in Lorelai and Rory and served as a surrogate mother/grandmother for many years. Rory has a fight with Logan over his immature reaction to his business disaster, and agrees to go on the trip with Lorelai. Emily invites herself along in an effort to get away from Richard, who is driving her crazy while he recuperates at home. At the wedding, Emily is upset by the close relationship Mia shares with Lorelai and Rory. Lorelai learns that Emily came to see Mia five years earlier to ask for pictures of Lorelai and Rory during the years they were estranged. Logan makes a surprise appearance and asks Rory to forgive him. Meanwhile, Lane and Zach ask Luke to be the godfather to their twins. Finally, Lane goes into labor and Luke helps get everyone to the hospital. ==Trivia== *When Rory went outside to talk to Logan with her cake, Logan said you didn't have to bring me cake. It is reminiscent of [[You Jump, I Jump, Jack]] when Logan found Rory alone during the LDB party. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes]]

{{Epnav | prev=7.17 | up=Season 7 | next=7.19}}
{{Infobox episode | | Image=Episode_image_placeholder1.jpg | name=Hay Bale Maze | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=18 | air_date=April 17, 2007 | director=[[Stephen Clancy]] | writer=[[Rebecca Rand Kirshner]] }}As Stars Hollow prepares for its annual Spring Fling festival, Rory brings Logan home and shows him around town. Lorelai sees how serious their relationship has become and worries that Logan is too irresponsible for Rory. Taylor angers the town by spending the entire Spring Fling budget on a huge hay bale maze. At an unexpected encounter in the maze, Lorelai and Luke apologize to one another and admit they both made mistakes that led to the end of their engagement. Meanwhile, Rory has a job interview with the Providence Journal Bulletin and struggles with decisions about her future. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes]]

page.title: It's Just Like Riding a Bike

revision.text: {{Epnav | prev=Hay Bale Maze | up=Season 7 | next=Lorelai? Lorelai?}} {{Infobox episode | Image=Riding a Bike.JPG | name=It's Just Like Riding a Bike | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=19 | air_date=April 24, 2007 | director=[[Lee Shallat Chemel]] | writer=[[Jennie Snyder]]}} Lorelai stops into Luke's diner for breakfast for the first time since their break-up, but finds they are awkward and uncomfortable together. Later, Lorelai's Jeep breaks down and she asks Luke to help her shop for a new car. While they look at cars, Lorelai and Luke's irritation with one another finally explodes into a fight, which Lorelai secretly takes as a good sign. Meanwhile, Paris gets accepted to numerous law schools and medical schools, and decides she must break up with Doyle so their relationship won't influence her choice of a graduate school. Finally, Rory gets a surprising letter that will have an impact on her future plans. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes|7.19]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes|7.19]]

{{Epnav | prev=It's Just Like Riding a Bike | up=Season 7 | next=Unto the Breach}} {{Infobox episode || Image=LorelaiLorelai.JPG | name=Lorelai? Lorelai? | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=20 | air_date=May 1, 2007 | director=[[Bethany Rooney]] | writer=[[David S. Rosenthal]]}} With graduation looming, Rory is anxiety-ridden over her future, so Lorelai tries to cheer her up with a day of eating and shopping. Lorelai notices happily that Luke is once again wearing the baseball cap she gave him, and invites him to join her and Rory for karaoke night at a local bar. After a few drinks, Lorelai takes the stage to sing a heartfelt number which is obviously directed at Luke. Logan returns from a business trip to California and comes to see Lorelai to discuss his future with Rory. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes]]

It's Rory's graduation from Yale. Lorelai and Sookie are engaged in preparation. Lorelai is waiting for Logan will make a proposal to Rory and she is nervous. Luke comes to Liz to choose a present for Rory's Graduation and they talk about the "serenade". Lorelai comes to the diner and tries to understand what she feels about Luke. But, he ignores her. At the diner Lorelai understands that almost the whole town wants to come to the Graduation, but Rory has just four invitations, so in the town meeting they all decide to make a stage version of the Graduation at the town square. Paris and Doyle are packing and Rory becomes sentimental. Rory's grandparents have a party for her and sing her a song. Logan proposes to Rory and she says she must think about it. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes]]

{{Epnav| prev=Unto the Breach | up=Season 7 | next=Pilot}} {{PlaceholderImages}} {{Infobox episode | Image=Bon Voyage.JPG | name=Bon Voyage | season_num=[[Season 7|7]] | ep_num=22 | air_date=May 15, 2007 | director=[[Lee Shallat Chemel]] | writer=[[David S. Rosenthal]]}} ==Plot== After [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]'s rejection at the New York Times, Rory sends out multitudes of resumes and plans a roller coaster vacation with [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]]. Rory still feels bad about the breakup with [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]], but Lorelai reassures her the pain will decrease in time. Meanwhile, Lorelai figures her shot with [[Luke Danes|Luke]] has come and gone. Luke meets with his sister, [[Liz Danes|Liz]], and tells her the same. He did, however, previously pick out an extra necklace, as a backup for his present for Rory, and Liz notes it really is for Lorelai.
Since the townspeople of [[Stars Hollow]] couldn't come to Rory's graduation, they have decided on a reenactment next week. Unfortunately, it isn't to be, because Rory does get a job after all, covering Barack Obama and she starts in three days.
The reenactment is canceled, but Luke soldiers on to throw a graduation party, for Rory and to please Lorelai.
When it becomes clear that rain will ruin the party, Luke refuses to give up and creates makeshift tents.
The whole town shows up to bid farewell to Rory. [[Kirk Gleason|Kirk]] has even made a sash for her.
Lorelai thanks [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] for the party, but Sookie tells her Luke was responsible for it. Lorelai thanks Luke, and he tells her he just wanted to see her happy. They kiss.
It's early in the morning, and the Gilmores Girls stop at [[Luke's Diner]]. Without any direct comment, Rory picks up on that Lorelai and Luke are once again together and Rory is happy. Luke quietly prepares their orders in the background.
==Notes== *Rory's hero, [[Christiane Amanpour]], guest stars. *The final scene of the series echoes the final scene of the first episode, where the camera pulls out from Luke's diner and into the street. [[Category:Gilmore Girls Episodes]] [[Category:Season 7 episodes]]

This category includes past and present members of [[Hep Alien]] and associated characters. [[Category:Stars Hollow]]

Gilmore Girls opens with a cold open, followed by the opening credits. The credits have changed in minor ways throughout its seven seasons. Some of these changes are due to cast members being added or being raised to featured status. Some are simply cosmetic changes.
==Season 1== Shot: Aerial view of town, presumably [[Stars Hollow]]
Shot: Autumn trees Caption: Gilmore Girls
Shot: [[Lorelai]] joins [[Rory]] on Lorelai's old bed at [[Gilmore's House|Emily and Richard's]] (ep. [[1.06]])
Shot: Rory hugs Lorelai at Rory's birthday party (ep. [[1.06]])
Shot: Lorelai does Rory's toenails on their front porch (ep. [[1.02]])
Shot: Lorelai "dances" towards Rory in [[Sookie]]'s kitchen at the [[Independence Inn]] (Ep. [[1.04]]) Caption: Starring [[Lauren Graham]]
Shot: Lorelai comes down stairs in cutoffs and boots (Ep. [[1.02]])
Shot: Lorelai and Rory in car tilting heads at [[Chilton]] (Ep. [[1.02]])
Shot: Rory in knitted golfing hat in [[Luke's Diner]] (Ep. [[1.03]]) Caption: [[Alexis Bledel]]
Shot: Rory rises in awe (at sight of unseen [[Dean]]) at [[Stars Hollow High School]] (Ep. [[1.01]])
Shot: Rory stalks off from Lorelai (Ep. [[1.01]])
Shot: Rory puts head on pillow during argument with Lorelai (Ep. [[1.01]])
Shot: Lorelai kisses top of Rory's head at wedding at the Independence Inn. (ep. [[1.03]])
Shot: Sookie in kitchen cooking sauce. (Ep. [[1.01]]) Caption: [[Melissa McCarthy]]
Shot: Lane dances to a Rancid song, and stops. Caption: [[Keiko Agena]]
Shot: Lorelai walks with [[Michel]] Caption: [[Yanic Truesdale]]
Shot: [[Luke]] at the counter talking to Lorelai and taking her coffee cup (Ep. [[1.01]]) Caption: Scott Patterson
Shot: Rory and Lorelai walk at night through Stars Hollow
Shot: [[Emily Gilmore]] seated facing the camera, looking pleased after scoring a point against Lorelai in an argument. (ep. [[1.03]]) Caption: and [[Kelly Bishop]]
Shot: Emily leads Lorelai through her house. (ep. [[1.03]])
Shot: [[Richard Gilmore]] hands Rory a section of the paper (Ep. [[1.01]]) Caption: special appearance by [[Edward Herrmann]]

==Changes During Season 1== ==Season 2 Changes== ==Season 3 Changes== ==Season 4 Changes== ==Season 5 Changes== ==Season 6 Changes== ==Season 7 Changes==

[[File:Lukesdiner.jpg|thumb|Luke's Diner]] [[File:Lukeandlorelai.jpg|thumb|left|Lorelai and Luke, in Luke's Diner.]] '''Luke's Diner''' is the place where the citizen's of [[Stars Hollow]] often go to eat. It is owned by [[Luke Danes]], who is known to have said that he finds feeding people somewhat disgusting. The service also highly depends on his mood of the day. On really bad days, it is downright dangerous to be there, like for example during the days when [[Lorelai]] was about to get married to [[Max Medina]] or during the difficult divorce proceedings between Luke and his ex-wife [[Nicole Leahy]]. People have been seen to be rather violently shown the door after a small complaint. There is a "No cell phones" sign above the counter which Luke strictly enforces.
Other than that, the diner is the place to hang out and get good food. Lorelai and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] are particularly fond of the place, and eat many a burger and fries there, while exchanging witty banter and on occasion making fun of Luke, who, again depending on his mood, grudgingly goes along with it or walks away. Luke is also their main supplier of coffee.
The diner is also the place where Lorelai [[A House Is Not a Home|asks Luke to marry her]], sitting on the table to the right of the entrance.
Kirk also drove a car through the front window of the diner in [[7.01]]. [[Category:Locations]] [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Businesses in Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Luke's Diner]]

'''Stars Hollow High School''' is the high school of [[Stars Hollow]].[[File:235456256_3fb53c7be6_b.jpg|right|282px]]
Their school colors are red and white, and the teams are the Minutemen. [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] attended Stars Hollow High before she attended [[Chilton Preparatory School|Chilton]]. [[Lane Kim|Lane]], [[Dean Forester|Dean]], and [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] attended as well. Stars Hollow High was where [[Luke Danes|Luke]] attended high school, where he lettered in track. His track team went to State on several occasions, a sticking point with Luke who doesn't feel track gets as much publicity as it deserves, especially in comparison to the hockey team, of which Dean is a member. Stars Hollow High says the Pledge of Allegiance in 6 different languages.
Through a sign outside of the school, the pilot establishes the school as "Division Champs, 1997-98", and hallway signs indicate that the school has a French club. There is also a small German club, but according to Rory, two of the three members left to join the French club after seeing ''Schindler's List''. Typical of many high schools, the school also has a marching band and a cheerleader squad, both of which Lane is a member of in her time at the school. [[Category:Stars Hollow]]

page.title: Interior Decoration in the Gilmore Girls

revision.text:
Interior Decoration plays an important role in the show to flesh out the characterization of the inhabitants of [[Stars Hollow]], [[Hartford]], [[Yale]], and elsewhere. What living spaces each character chooses, and how they choose to furnish and decorate it gives insight into their personality. In most cases, these elements merely remains in the background, but often they are directly commented upon.
==Lorelai== [[Lorelai]] likes kitschy items, but also maintains a comfortable space. Form outweighs function in many cases, as when her blue, fuzzy alarm clock turns out to be unreliable on [[Rory]]'s first day at [[Chilton]] (ep. [[1.02]]).
In another instance [[Emily]] asks Lorelai where are the elegant candlesticks she gave her, and Lorelai informs her she returned them and bought a monkey lamp instead, which Emily considers pornographic (ep.[[1.09]]).
==Rory== Rory keeps her room tidy, and has some stuffed animals. ==Lane== [[Lane]]'s bedroom at her mother's house epitomizes the double-life she is forced to live by her strict mother, [[Mrs. Kim]]. On the surface, she is an obedient Korean girl, but her closet hides her American teenager side, complete with red lights and a disco ball, and secret panels built into the floorboards hide her CDs. ==The Gilmore house== Meticulously cleaned, well-furnished, and uncomfortable, [[Emily]]'s house's interior is structured and orderly and symmetric. *While preparing for Rory's party [[1.06]], Emily is insistent that the decorating staff keep the candles exactly six inches apart.
==Luke== [[Luke]] lives above his diner, and his space lacks any thought to how things look. [[April]] improves matters after a trip to Target.

'''Mr. Remmy''' (portrayed by [[John Billingsley]]) is one of [[Rory]]'s teacher's at [[Chilton]] during her first year. He teaches literature. On the first day he gives her a massive notebook of last week's notes and suggests she get a copy of another students' notes, which are usually more detailed. He appears in only one episode, [[1.02]]. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]] [[Category:Chilton]] [[Category:Chilton teachers]]

'''Mrs. Ness''' (portrayed by [[Strawn Bovee]]) is a history teacher during [[Rory]]'s first year at [[Chilton]]. [[Paris]] had made a model, apparently of a castle, for Mrs. Ness' class, which Rory accidentally breaks minutes before the start of class. She only appears in one episode, [[1.02]]. [[Category:Chilton]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]
'''Derek''' is an employee at the [[Independence Inn]], apparently a valet. He appears only once, in briefly in episode [[1.02]]. [[Category:Independence Inn]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

{{Infobox character |Title = Drella |Image = |Imagesize = 190px |Actor = Alex Borstein |First = [[Pilot (Episode 1.01)|Pilot]] |Last = [[The Deer Hunters (Episode 1.04)|The Deer Hunters]] |Name = Drella |Age = Unknown |Family = Unknown }} '''Drella''' (portrayed by [[Alex Borstein]]), is the rude harpist hired at the [[Independence Inn]] who appears in the first four episodes of the first season of the Gilmore Girls. She is rude to guests, stops at the very end of songs because the kitchen is calling her name, runs over [[Michel]]'s foot with her harp, and plays Black Sabbath if she thinks no one is listening. She also refuses to play requests on principle, but quickly drops the pretense of principles when offered an extra hundred dollars.Â
==Appearances== ===Season 1=== [[1.01]] â€¢ [[1.02]] â€¢ [[1.03]] â€¢ [[1.04]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Independence Inn]]

'''Ian Jack''' is a divorced father of another Chilton student, who meets Lorelai and Rory on Rory's first day. He flirts with Lorelai at Chilton, and then asks her out at the Independence Inn. Lorelai is attracted to him, but refuses out of concern to let Rory adjust to Chilton. He only appears in episode [[1.02]]. [[Category:Lorelai's Romantic Interests]] [[Category:Chilton]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

'''Mrs. Traister''' (portrayed by [[Jill Brennan]]) is a one-time character on the Gilmore Girls. She appears only in the pilot, [[1.01]], as Rory's literature teacher at [[Stars Hollow High School]]. [[Category:Stars Hollow High School]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

'''Joey''' (portrayed by [[Barna Moricz]]) is a one-appearance character who tries to pick up both [[Lorelai]] and [[Rory]] in rapid succession during the opening of the pilot episode ([[1.01]]) while in [[Luke's Diner]]. He and his friend quickly leave when they find out Rory is sixteen. [[Category:Luke's Diner]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

'''Salvador''' is an employee at the [[Independence Inn]] who works in the kitchen. It is unclear what his job title he has. Lorelai puts him in charge of watching Sookie after she injures herself. He only appears in the pilot episode ([[1.01]]). [[Category:Independence Inn]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]
#redirect [[Taylor Doose]]
#redirect [[Kirk Gleason]]
#redirect [[April Nardini]]

{{Infobox character |Title = Louise Grant |Actor = Teal Redmann |Image = [[File:Louisegrantshot.png|thumb|Louise at Chilton]] |First = [[The Lorelais' First Day at Chilton]] |Last = [[4.17 Girls in Bikinis, Boys Doin' the Twist]] |Name = Louise Grant |Age = 16 at beginning |Family = }} '''Louise Grant''' is a Chilton student and friend of [[Paris Geller]]. Along with [[Madeline Lynn]], she helps Paris intimidate Rory in early episodes. She has blonde hair and is very keen on boys. During the early seasons, she and Madeline are very hostile towards Rory but warm up to her and even express jealousy towards her relationship with [[Lorelai]]. She attends college at Tulane as of season 4 where her close friend [[Madeline Lynn]] stays with her. She eventually drops out of college to stay in Florida on Spring Break. ==Appearances==

{{Infobox character |Title = Madeline Lynn |Actor = Shelly Cole |Image = [[File:Madelinelynnshot.png|thumb|Madeline in Rory's house]] |First = [[The Lorelais' First Day at Chilton]] |Last = [[4.17 Girls in Bikinis, Boys Doin' the Twist]] |Name = Madeline Lynn |Age = 16 at beginning |Family =}}
'''Madeline Lynn''' is a [[Chilton]] student and friend of [[Paris Geller]]. Along with [[Louise Grant]], she helps Paris intimidate Rory in early episodes. She has short brunette hair and is rather dim, but reasonably friendly. She drops out of college after graduating Chilton and spends most of her time with her friend [[Louise Grant]].Though initially hostile to Rory, as the series progresses, she, Rory, Louise and Paris all become better friends - or at least lesser enemies. She never seems to hate Rory and doesn't understand why they are mad at her half the time ==Appearances== ===Season 1=== [[1.02]] â€¢ [[1.04]] â€¢ [[1.09]] â€¢ [[1.11]] â€¢ [[1.13]] â€¢ [[1.16]] â€¢ [[1.17]] â€¢ [[1.18]] â€¢ [[1.20]] â€¢ [[1.21]]
===Season 2=== [[2.02]] â€¢ [[2.05]] â€¢ [[2.09]] â€¢ [[2.11]] â€¢ [[2.12]] â€¢ [[2.16]] â€¢ [[2.18]] â€¢ [[2.22]]

===Season 4=== [[4.03]] â€¢ [http://gilmoregirls.wikia.com/wiki/4.17 4.17] [[Category:Characters|Lynn, Madeline]] [[Category:Chilton|Lynn, Madeline]]

'''Mick''' is a DSL installer who makes one appearance, in episode [[1.02]]. He is one of two secondary characters played by [[Sean Gunn]] (the other was [[Swan Guy]]) before he took the role of [[Kirk]]. Mick has been hired by Emily to install DSL at Lorelai's house, and tells her that things were being held up because they couldn't find the frog with the house key in it. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]
Characters who only appeared one time during the show's run, even if the actor playing the character made more appearances in other roles. [[Category:Characters]]

'''Lucien Mills''' (portrayed by [[Daniel Graves]]) is the food critic for the magazine "Four Star Dining" who appears in episode [[1.04]]. [[Sookie]] is troubled when, in the middle of an otherwise glowing review, he refers to her specialty, risotto, as "fine." She eventually finds out where he lives and shows up at his door step with her risotto and the correct wine that goes with it. [[Category: Independence Inn]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

'''Brian''' is the waiter who appeared in one episode ([[1.04]]). He was the one who served risotto with a mismatched wine to a food critic. [[Category:Independence Inn]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]] [[Category:Characters]]

'''Mrs. Shales''' is the mother of two spoiled twins in episode 1.03. She is arranging, and paying for, their wedding at the [[Independence Inn]], and is exasperated by her daughters' bickering. After the wedding she is elated when the twins announce they are moving hundreds of miles away. [[Category:Independence Inn]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

'''Jackie''' (portrayed by [[Kelly Cohen]]) and '''Jessica''' ([[Ashley Cohen]]) '''Shales''' are identical twins that have a wedding at the [[Independence Inn]]. [[Michel]] and [[Lorelai]] are surprised to find they are marrying a set of male identical twins.
[[Category:Independence Inn]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]
#redirect [[Jackie and Jessica Shales]]
#redirect [[Jackie and Jessica Shales]]
#redirect [[Jackie and Jessica Shales]]
#redirect [[Jackie and Jessica Shales]]

'''Matt''' (portrayed by [[Chris Hoffman]]) and '''Mark''' (portrayed by [[Matt Hoffman]]) are the fiances of [[Jackie Shales|Jackie]] and [[Jessica Shales]] in episode [[1.03]]. Like Jackie and Jessica, they are identical twins. [[Category:Independence Inn]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]
#redirect [[Matt and Mark]]
#redirect [[Matt and Mark]]

Gloria is a member of [[Richard]]'s and [[Emily]]'s country club. After a brief and outwardly pleasant chat, Richard turns to Rory and tells her Gloria is the "most odious woman alive." [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

'''Julian Johnson''' (portrayed by [[Charles C. Stevenson Jr.]]) is one of [[Richard]]'s acquaintances at the club. Richard brags about [[Rory]] in his presence. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]
'''Edward James''' (portrayed by [[Jay Gerber]]) is one of [[Richard]]'s acquaintances at the club. Richard brags about [[Rory]] in his presence. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

revision.comment: I know I really shouldn't do this without approval, but I think this qoute helps point out how eccentric Finn really is. Also, it's my favorite qoute.
revision.text:
{{Infobox_character |Title = Finn |Actor = Tanc Sade |ImageSize = 250px |First = [[Written in the Stars]] |Last = [[Partings]] |Name = Finn |Age = 21 |Family = unknown|Image = Tancsade.jpg}} '''Finn''' is a friend of [[Logan Huntzberger]] and a fellow member of the [[Life and Death Brigade]]. He's an extremely eccentric, Australian friend of Logan and Colin at Yale, he is also forever trying to get [[Rosemary]] to go home with him. In the fifth season, Finn's catchphrase is "Have we met before?" which he asks Rory many times. When Logan has an accident, he and Colin think about adopting Logan by claiming they're gay.
"He has a thing about the Sun." - [[Logan Huntzberger]]
"It's too bright."- [[Finn]] ==Appearances== *[[Written in the Stars]] *[[You Jump, I Jump, Jack]] *[[The Party's over]] *[[But Not as Cute as Pushkin]] *[[Jews and Chinese Food]] *[[Pulp Friction]] *[[A House Is Not a Home]] *[[New and Improved Lorelai]] *[[Always a Godmother,Never a God]] *[[Let Me Hear Your Balalalaikas Ringing Out]] *[[The Prodigal Daughter Returns]] *[[The Real Paul Anka]] *[[Super Cool Party People]] *[[Partings]] ==Gallery== <gallery type="slideshow" position="center"> Tancsade.jpg First meeting logan.jpg </gallery> [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Yale]]

[[File:Logan---Colin---Finn-gilmore-girls-140038_533_400.jpg|thumb|left]]
'''Colin McCrae''' is one of [[Logan Huntzberger]]'s best friends at [[Yale]] , and is a member of the [[Life and Death Brigade]], the Yale secret society. Logan, [[Finn |Finn]], and Colin often go on trips, perform stunts and pranks, and party together. While his character does not have a huge role in terms of plot, he is frequently seen as one of Logan's sidekicks during his time at Yale at important moments in the plot of Logan's life or Rory and Logan's relationship.Â
==Appearances==
===Season 5=== [[Written in the Stars|5.3]] - [[You Jump, I Jump, Jack|5.7]] - [[The Party's Over|5.8]] - [[5.10]] - [[5.14]] - [[5.15]] - [[5.17]] -[[ 5.22]] ===Season 6=== [[New and Improved Lorelai|6.1]] - [[Always a Godmother, Never a God|6.4]] - [[Let Me Hear Your Balalaikas Ringing Out|6.8]] - [[The Prodigal Daughter Returns|6.9]] - [[6.18]] - [[6.20]] - [[6.22]]

'''[[File:Dpaphotos146490-rosamunde-pilcher.jpg|thumb]][[File:Paris_Asher.jpg|thumb]]Asher Flemming''' (portrayed by [[Michael York]]), is a [[Yale]] professor and author, who develops a romantic relationship with [[Paris Geller]]. The two met through [[Richard Gilmore]], because Asher and Richard went to school together. Despite the massive age difference, Paris and Asher had a serious relationship throughout Paris and [[Rory]]'s freshman year of Yale. He dies of a heart attack two weeks before Rory and Paris' sophomore year of Yale begins. ([[5.03]]) He was teaching a Shakespeare class in Oxford when he had the heart attack. He left Paris an eighteenth-century printing press, which she breifly stored in the common room she shared with Rory. [[Category:Yale|Flemming, Asher]] [[Category:Characters|Flemming, Asher]]
#redirect [[Anna Nardini]]

'''Yale''' is the real-life University where [[Rory]] attends college. [[Logan]], [[Marty]], [[Lucy]], [[Olivia]], [[Paris]], and many others also have attended Yale. ==External Links== * http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yale * http://www.yale.edu/ [[Category:Locations]]

[[File:Dooses_market.jpg|right|282px]]'''Doose's Market''' is the grocery store in [[Stars Hollow]]. Rory and Lorelai as well as other townspeople are seen shopping there often throughout the series.Â The business is owned byÂ [[Taylor Doose]],Â town Selectman.
[[Dean]]Â Forester gets a job there on the advice of [[Miss Patty]]. This causes complications for Rory, when they are broken up in the first season, as she can no longer shop there. Lots of drama occurs in Doose's, including many Rory and Dean scenes among others.Â [[Kirk]] also works there for a short period, and is introduced in Season 1, episode 5 as the Assistant Manager, telling Miss Patty that she can't sample produce. Miss Patty is revealed to be one of the shops most frequent costomers.Â
Taylor is protective of his business throughout the series complaining on several occasions when he believes it threatened. It is the only grocery store in Stars Hollow. [[Category:Locations]] [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Businesses in Stars Hollow]]

'''Friday night dinner''' is the weekly dinner meeting of [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]], [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]], [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Rory Gilmore]] in the [[The Gilmore House|Gilmore Mansion]]. It was originally a requirement of the loan Emily provided Lorelai for Rory's [[Chilton Preparatory School|Chilton]] tuition. According to Emily, if she was going to be financially involved in Lorelai's and Rory's life, she wanted to be personally involved in their life as well. Rory seems to adjust quickly to the commitment, Lorelai, on the other hand, bristles at attending.
The dinner frequently becomes a platform for airing current grievances on both sides, sometimes ending in shouting matches. Lorelai often ends up being utterly exhausted by the end of the dinner. [[Category:Gilmore family]]

{{stub}} '''Kelly Bishop''' portrays [[Emily Gilmore]]. In addition to the Gilmore Girls, she was also in the movie Dirty Dancing, and was in the original Broadway production of A Chorus Line. [[Category:Cast|Bishop, Kelly]] [[Category:Main cast|Bishop, Kelly]]

{{stub}}
'''Edward Herrmann''' portrays [[Richard Gilmore]]. In 1997, he won an Emmy Award for Outstanding Guest Actor for his work on The Practice. He won a Tony award in 1976 for Best Actor in a Play for "Mrs. Warren's Profession". He has done a great deal of voiceover work, as well as undertaking a variety of television and movie roles. [[Category:Cast|Herrmann, Edward]] [[Category:Main cast|Herrmann, Edward]]

'''Jeannie''' (portrayed by [[DeLaune Michel]]) is the veterinarian that appears in episode [[1.05]]. She makes a house call when [[Cinnamon]], [[Babette]]'s cat, passes away. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

'''Jed''' (portrayed by [[Floyd Van Buskirk]]) is a [[Stars Hollow]] resident that appears in [[Luke's Diner]] and [[Babette]]'s house, in episode [[1.05]]. He is dressed in overalls and [[Michel]] refers to him as "Hee Haw man." [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]] [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Stars Hollow Residents]]

'''Andre''' is a French-speaking guest of the [[Independence Inn]] in episode [[1.05]]. He tries to speak French to [[Michel]], who claims he is a "simple Texas boy." [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]] [[Category:Independence Inn]] [[Category:Characters]]

'''Mitzi''' (portrayed by [[Bridget Ann White]]) is one of [[Lorelai]]'s old [[Chilton]] classmates. Lorelai runs into her again at the party [[Emily]] throws for [[Rory]], in episode [[1.06]]. She asks Lorelai several rude, prying questions, despite her claim that she's trying to be less rude after her divorce. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

'''Lars''' (portrayed by [[David Booth]]) is one of [[Richard Gilmore]]'s business associates. He comes to [[Rory]]'s birthday party at [[Emily]] and Richard's house, in episode [[1.06]]. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

'''[[File:Gilmore-girls-marvelous-06.jpg|thumb|left]]Lucy''' (portrayed by Krysten Ritter) is one of [[Rory]]'s [[Yale]] friends. Rory met her and [[Olivia]] while covering an art show for the [[Yale Daily News]]. Olivia and Lucy are best friends and roommates. She majored in acting, and was the girlfriend of Rory's old friend, [[Marty]].Â They met at once of her performances.Â Once she discovered Marty and Rory were hiding the fact that they had known each other since freshman year, Marty and her broke up. However, Rory and Lucy reconciled and remained friends.Â Lucy and Olivia end up moving together to an apartment in Manhattan after they graduated.
==Appearances== ===Season 7=== [['S Wonderful, 'S Marvelous|7.04]] â€¢ [[French Twist|7.07]] â€¢ [[Introducing Lorelai Planetarium|7.08]] â€¢ [[Knit, People, Knit|7.09]] â€¢ [[Merry Fisticuffs|7.10]] â€¢ [[To Whom It May Concern|7.12]] â€¢ [[7.19 It's Just Like Riding a Bike|7.19]] â€¢ [[7.21 Unto the Breach|7.21]] [[Category:Yale]] [[Category:Characters]]
People, locations, and other items related to [[Yale]]. [[Category:Locations]]

'''Olivia '''(played by Michelle Ongkingco) is one of [[Rory]]'s eccentric [[Yale]] friends that she met while covering an art show for the [[Yale Daily News]], where Olivia was showcasing one of her pieces. Olivia is an artist/art student. She is usually with her roommate [[Lucy]]. Lucy and Olivia refer to everyone with pet names (like how they called Marty "boyfriend"[[File:Gilmore-girls-marvelous-06.jpg|thumb|right]]). Olivia and Lucy died their hair with Rory and comforted her after their graduation. They are also friends with Paris Geller
==Appearances== ===Season 7=== [[7.04]] â€¢ [[7.07]] â€¢ [[7.08]] â€¢ [[7.09]] â€¢ [[7.10]] â€¢ [[7.19]] â€¢ [[7.21]] [[Category:Yale]]

The '''Yale Daily News''' is the real-life Monday-through-Friday paper of [[Yale]] University. In the Gilmore Girls, [[Doyle]], [[Paris]] and [[Rory]] have all served as its editor. [[Category:Yale]] [[Category:Yale Daily News]]
#redirect [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]]

{{stub}} '''Ceaser''' (portrayed by Aris Alvarado) is an employee of [[Luke's Diner]]. He typically works in the kitchen.

'''Joe''' (portrayed by Brian Berke) is the pizza delivery man who delivers to [[Lorelai]]'s house in ep. [[1.07]]. He is distinctly called Joe by Lorelai, although he is listed in the credits as "Pizza Boy." He is credited in various episodes in various ways, but are probably intended to be the same person. ==Appearances== *[[1.07]] (credited as Pizza Boy) *[[1.20]] (as Customer/Pizza Boy) *[[2.18]] (as Patron) *[[3.18]] *[[4.07]] *[[4.13]] *[[4.15]] *[[4.18]] *[[6.01]] *[[6.12]] (as Bad Aim Guy) ==Other References== *[[1.10]] Lorelai talks to Joe on phone; since his van is busted, he will deliver her pizza by razor scooter. [[Category:Characters]]

#redirect [[Mayor Harry Porter]]

'''Mayor Harry Porter''' (portrayed by David Huddleston) is the Stars Hollow Mayor and one of the [[Battle of Stars Hollow]] reenactors. In addition to defending the tradition of the reenactment to [[Luke Danes]], he presides over [[Stars Hollow]]'s [[Firelight Festival]].
==Appearances== ===Season 1=== [[Love and War and Snow|1.08]] & [[Star-Crossed Lovers and Other Strangers|1.16]] [[Category:Characters|Porter, Harry]] [[Category:Stars Hollow Residents|Porter, Harry]]
Nanette (portrayed by [[Eileen Barnett]]) is one of the members of [[Richard]]'s club, who appears in episode [[1.03]]. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]
#redirect [[Friday night dinner]]

==Food== *[[Luke's Diner]] *[[Al's Pancake World]] *[[Teriyaki Joe's]] *[[Antonioli's]] *[[Weston Bakery]] *[[Taylorâ€™s Olde Fashion Soda Shoppe]] *A place where they sell fiesta burgers from a window
==Other== *[[Miss Patty's School of Ballet]] *[[Doose's Market]] *[[Kim's Antiques]] *[[Stars Hollow Animal Hospital]] (featured in [[1.05]]) *[[Independence Inn]] *[[Dragonfly Inn]] *[[Andrew]]'s shop, where they sell lava lamps *[[Gypsy]]'s auto repair place *[[Stars Hollow Beauty Supply]] *[[Stars Hollow Video]] *[[Stars Hollow Shoe Repair]] *[[Stars Hollow Books]] [[Category:Businesses in Stars Hollow]]

'''[[File:Pilot9.png|right|300px]]Kim's Antiques''' is [[Mrs. Kim]]'s store in [[Stars Hollow]]. In episode [[1.07]], when Rory runs to talk to [[Lane]], the store appears to be located on the [[town square]], opposite of [[Doose's Market]]. It is overstuffed with furniture for sale, and the Kim family lives upstairs. [[Category:Locations]] [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Businesses in Stars Hollow]]

The '''Battle of Stars Hollow''' was an event in [[Stars Hollow]] history, when, on frigid November night in 1776 or an undetermined month in 1779, twelve [[Stars Hollow]] militiamen risked their lives awaiting the redcoats in the [[town square]]. The town takes great pride in this, despite that the British army never showed up. [[Luke Danes|Luke]] seems to be the only one with serious objections to reenacting the "battle" each year, since nothing actually happened. Later (ep. [[Women Of Questionable Morals|5.11]]) it is revealed that a prostitute sympathetic to the colonists delayed a general overnight, allowing Lafayette to attack the British troops. Several townspeople have taken part in a yearly reenactment including Luke's deceased father and Luke's deceased uncle, [[Taylor Doose|Taylor]], the [[Mayor Harry Porter|Mayor]], [[Kirk Gleason|Kirk]], and [[Andrew]]. Despite the historical significance the event has for the townspeople, there seem to be several discrepancies between the accounts of the "battle" between season one and five. [[Category:Stars Hollow]]

The '''town square''' in [[Stars Hollow]] is the scene of many events and festivals, including Easter egg hunts, the [[Bid-a-Basket Festival]], the [[Harvest Festival]], and the [[Hay Bale Maze]]. It has a central gazebo, and is bordered by [[Doose's Market]], [[Kim's Antiques]], among other businesses, plus the [[Stars Hollow Post Office|post office]] and a church. [[Category:Locations]] [[Category:Stars Hollow]]

'''Mia''' (portrayed by Elizabeth Franz and Kathy Baker) is the owner of the [[Independence Inn]]. In ep. [[The Ins and Outs of Inns|2.08]], Mia pays a visit to the inn. In ep. [[French Twist|7.17]], [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]], [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]], and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] go to her wedding in North Carolina. [[Category:Independence Inn]] [[Category:Characters]]

Gilmore Girls was filmed at Warner Bothers Studio, at 4000 Warner Boulevard, Burbank, CA. It is unclear if it is still dressed as [[Stars Hollow]], as it reused for different films and television shows. Most of exteriors are filmed on what the studio calls "Midwest Street", a set built in 1946. Some scenes from Dukes of Hazzard and Friends have been filmed on this set as well.
==External links== A map of the set:
http://web.archive.org/20011018020619/www.geocities.com/ltlstargg/StarsHollow.html

http://www.yalealumnimagazine.com/issues/03_09/gilmoregirls.html

'''Jacob''' (portrayed by [[Kyle Gibson]]) is [[Paris]]' date at the [[Chilton]] formal in episode [[1.09]]. When he asks for [[Rory]]'s phone number, he reveals that he is Paris' cousin. Paris accidentally reveals to everyone she had to give him gas money for him to go with her because she couldn't get a date. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

'''Cissy''' (portrayed by [[Kara Holden]]), is [[Tristan]]'s date to the [[Chilton]] formal dance in ep. [[1.09]]. When Tristan doesn't feel like dancing or eating, she asks if he wants to make out. Since Tristan tells [[Rory]] he is taking Cissy to the dance, it is presumable she knows her, so we can assume she also goes to Chilton. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]] [[Category:Chilton]]
#redirect [[Joshua Reynolds]]

'''Allen Prescott''' (portrayed by [[Richard Fancy]]) is one of Richard's business associates. He comes to the Christmas party in season one. He and his [[Hollan Prescott|wife]] know both Rory and Lorelai, apparently from previous Christmas parties (ep. [[1.10]]). [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

'''Hollan Prescott''' (portrayed by [[Lisa Long]]) is the apparent wife of [[Allen Prescott]], who comes to [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]]'s and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]]'s Christmas party during season one (ep. [[1.10]]). [[Category:Characters|Prescott, Hollan]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters|Prescott, Hollan]]

'''Henry''' (portrayed by [[Joshua Haber]]) is one of the musical bell performers in ep. [[1.10]]. He and [[Chuck]] during a practice are coming in on the wrong beat. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

'''Chuck''' (portrayed by [[David Paul Wichert]]) is one of the musical bell performers in ep. [[1.10]]. He and [[Henry]] come in on the wrong beat during a practice for [[Stars Hollow]]'s Christmas celebration.(ep. [[1.10]]) [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

'''Mrs. Geller''' (portrayed by [[Ann Gillespie]]) is [[Paris Gellar|Paris]]' mother. She is mentioned several times, but only appears in ep. [[Paris is Burning|1.11]]. At the time, she and her husband are in the middle of a nasty divorce, and she is seen berating Paris about blemishes on her face. From references from Paris, she seems to be a mostly absentee parent. [[Category:Characters|Gellar, Mrs.]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters|Gellar, Mrs.]]

'''Todd''' (portrayed by [[Lukas Behnken]]) is [[Lane]]'s date in ep. [[1.12]]. He is a friend of [[Dean]], and they repair their bikes together (Todd has the good tools). It turns out he has no interest in music or reading, and his favorite movie is ''Beethoven''. Lane has a crush on him, but this fades when she finds out they have nothing in common. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]] [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Stars Hollow Residents]]
'''Joshua Reynolds''' (portrayed by [[Brian Evers]]) is Richard's physician. He comes to the hospital after Richard has angina in episode [[1.10]]. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]
#redirect [[Gilmore Girls set]]
#redirect [[Gilmore Girls set]]

'''Skippy the Hamster''' is the hamster that [[Lorelai]] abandons because, according to Lorelai, it would bite her and laugh at her. She filled his cage with kleenexes and dumped its cage at the petstore while the salesclerk was away from the desk. [[Category:Animals]]
Animals that have appeared on ''Gilmore Girls'', who have either appeared onscreen or were only mentioned. [[Category:Characters]]

'''[[File:ImagesCA5B90OV.jpg|frame|Paul Anka on couch]]''' '''Paul Anka (originally named Cocoa)''' is the dog that [[Lorelai]] adopts during her estrangement from [[Rory]] in Season 6 and he remains her dog through Season 7 and presumably into the future. He plays a pretty important role throughout Season 6, because Lorelai treats him in many ways, like a second child. She adopts him from the Petfinder convention Stars Hollow has every year. He is named after the singer Paul Anka for some strange reason. He is a pretty strange dog, simply because he has many quirks. He won't walk down the front steps without having something be put down first. He is scared of peas, tissue-holders, lint, paperbacks, CD's, framed pictures and popcorn. He doesn't like any of the normal dog toys, like rawhide bones and squeaky toys. He also doesn't like when Lorelai or anyone for that matter watches him eat. He cannot see the leash being put on him, but is fine once it is on. He can also get through doors, somehow.

'''''Miss Patty'':''''' Goodbye Paul Anka, thank for letting me rub your butt for an hour!''

[[Category:Animals]]

'''Cinnamon''' is [[Morey]] and [[Babette]]'s overweight, beloved cat, who dies in [[1.05]]. One time Cinnamon got stuck underneath Babette's house, and Babette asked [[Lorelai]] for a shoehorn and some oil to get her out. Morey and Babette take Cinnamon around in a wagon with a covered section, in case she wants her privacy. She gets sick from some bad clams from [[Al's Pancake World]], but the cause of death apparently is simply old age, as she lived to be "260" in cat years, according to the veterinarian who confirms her death. [[Category:Animals]]
