[[Luke]] usually wears a backwards baseball cap as part of his daily outfit. After episode [[1.10]], he wears a blue one that [[Lorelai]] gives him as a Christmas present for helping her get through the hospitalization of her father. He wears this one exclusively until their breakup at the start of season seven. [[Category:Notable objects]]

[[Lorelai]] had a '''dollhouse''' while growing up in the [[Gilmore Mansion]], which is kept in her old bedroom. It is one of the few things that she actually likes from her childhood. [[Emily]] later threatens to give it away to charity if Lorelai doesn't take it from her immediately, but [[Richard]] delivers it to her house so he can talk to her about [[Rory]]. While [[Jackson]] is staying at her house to avoid catching the chicken pox, he accidentally breaks it. [[Category:Notable objects]]
Notable props, articles of clothing that play a role in the plot, and/or recurring elements in the show. [[Category:The show]]

{{stub}} When [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] wakes up after [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] has gone to London, he finds he left her a model '''rocket ship''' as a gift (ep. [[The Long Morrow|7.01]]). She pretends she understands the reference, but only later finds out that it is a reference to an old Twilight Zone episode, called The Long Morrow (also the title of this episode). The rocket ship is symbolic because it is about a man waiting his whole life for someone, as he was going to wait for her while in London.
When Logan calls to see if she likes the gift, she feigns that she understands the reference but she, along with Lorelai, are utterly confused. Rory ends up spending the whole day researching into rockets on the internet until she finally stumbles upon someone in a forum who recognizes the rocket, informing her of the exact reference and Rory soon adores it.
As it turns out, the rocket refers to a past moment in their relationship (which has not been depicted on the show) where she and Logan are watching an episode of The Twilight Zone from 1964 called 'The Long Morrow'. The episode is about an astronaut named Douglas Stansfield who is sent on a space expedition 114 light years from Earth which will take 40 years. However, prior to that, he falls in love with a woman named Sandra Horn but is distressed that when he returns, she will be 40 years older, and he will remain the same due to him being in suspended animation for the trip. He leaves tragically for the expedition, heartbroken, but it is revealed that during the trip, he turned off the suspended animation to be the same age as Sandra, unaware that Sandra has put herself in suspended animation to remain youthful with him.
This gets through to Logan as the man willingly wasted 40 years of his life to become a 80 year old man just to spend his last few years with Sandra to which Logan comments, "That's true love". The episode is Logan's favorite episode of the series and Rory now completely understands that Logan gave her the rocket to let her know she is his true love and that regardless how far apart they are, he will always wait for her, to which she gleefully adores and swoons about to Lorelai after much research on Logan's mysterious gift.
Strangely enough, even after their break-up shortly after Rory's graduation, the rocket can still be seen in Rory's possession, giving hope to fans of the couple that Logan wasn't the only one who believed their relationship was true love. [[Category:Notable objects]]

*In an episode of ''Family Guy'', Lorelai and Rory are depicted talking really fast and end making out with each other.
'''TV''': ''We now return to "Gilmore Girls".''
'''Rory''': ''Mom, I need to talk to you about Dean.''
'''Lorelai''': ''Which Dean? Howard Dean, James Dean or Jimmy Dean?''
'''Rory''': ''Uh, too old, too dead and too fattening.''
'''Lorelai''': ''You don't have to tell that to my thighs.''
'''Rory''': ''Can you ask your thighs if they borrowed my Gap Capris?''
'''Lorelai''': ''They did not and are insulted that you'd ask such a thing.''
'''Rory''': ''As insulted as Kitty Kelley when people accuse her of taking liberties with her best selling tell-alls?''
'''Lorelai''': ''Almost. Wanna make out?''
'''Rory''': ''Absolutely not.''
'''Lorelai''': ''Oh, you are so lying.''
'''Rory''': ''I so am.''
*In another episode of ''Family Guy'', "From Method to Madness", (season 3, episode 18) Stewie Griffin claims to have a three-episode guest starring role on the Gilmore Girls as "Rory's motorcycle-driving boyfriend". *In the fifth episode of the first season of ''Six Feet Under'', Claire and Ruth are watching the show with some relatives. *One episode of ''MADtv'' featured a parody of ''Gilmore Girls'' called "The Gabmore Girls" which spoofs its fast talking and feel-good joyfulness by showing them talking fast for long periods of time and then making snow angels.
'''Rory''': ''Hi, Mom.''
'''Lorelai''': ''Rory. Prodigal daughter. Fellow sister. Soul mate. What are you doing back from college?''
'''Rory''': ''We all have dirty laundry in our past. As it turns out mine is in the present. No doubt in the future. But soon, your Maytag willing, once again in my past.''
'''Lorelai''': ''See, now, I would have laughed, but I'm not sure what you said is actually funny.''
'''Rory''': ''Anything said quickly can seem wittier than it is.''
*In an episode of ''Scrubs'' (Episode 517: My Chopped Liver, Season 5), it's revealed that Turk and J.D. watch the show on their night off. After watching the show, Turk calls J.D. over the phone to discuss it.
'''Turk''': "''Mothers and daughters... they speak so fast, but they speak so true.''"
'''J.D.''': "''I'm so mad at Lorelai, I can't even talk right now.''"
*In another episode of ''Scrubs'' Ted is found hanging upside down in his office. He asks what day it is and when he find out it is Wednesday he says "Oh man! I missed the Gilmore Girls!" *In an episode of ''Will & Grace'', Jack is talking to Karen about Stan's mistress Lorraine Finster saying "We hate her! We hate her even more than the know-it-all daughter on the ''Gilmore Girls''!" *In episode 1.02 of "Greek", Cappie says "How about we all be mature and say what's really on our minds. How the hell could they cancel the Gilmore Girls?!?!" *In the sixth seasons of ''Girlfriends'' and ''Gilmore Girls'', the shows referenced each other. In ''Girlfriends'', the character Joan Clayton mentions that she lives near a ''Gilmore Girl''. In ''Gilmore Girls'', Lorelai makes fun of Christopher's selection of saved [[TiVo]] programs, one of them being ''Girlfriends''. *In episode 3.15 of ''Veronica Mars'', Wallace is seen reporting on Logan and Parker's lunchtime tÃªte-Ã -tÃªte to a bemused Veronica,
'''Wallace''': "''What?''"
'''Veronica''': "''I'm just trying to figure out which Gilmore Girl you are.''"
*In the 2006 movie Accepted, the character of "Rory" has a breakdown over not getting into Yale. *In the 2007 movie Blades of Glory, Will Farrell's character, Chazz Michael Michaels, calls Jon Heder's character, Jimmy MacElroy, and tells him that he taped "The Gilmore Girls" for him. * In ''Joey'', he once says that he just passed a "Gilmore Girls" set and wanted a relationship like that with his mother

'''Cyrus''' is the dog owned by [[Jason Stiles]]. He has taught him obscure commands, such as move "a little to the left.". However, he still hasn't gotten the hang of the "a little to the right" command yet. He does react to a hand gesture which tells him to turn around and face the wall, though, as seen when Jason and [[Lorelai]] kiss for the first time. [[Category:Animals]]

'''Buttercup''' is an abandoned dog. According to her description card, she is a cocker spaniel, golden retriever, bouvier des flandres and rottweiler mix. [[Lorelai]] temporarily wants to adopt her, but is talked out of it after being reminded of her treatment of [[Skippy the Hamster]]. Buttercup is skittish, her card reads, and tends to react badly towards blonde haired females, brunette males, children of either sex, other animals, red clothing, cabbage or anyone in a uniform. [[Category:Animals]]

'''Princess''' is a dog who shows up without tags at the elder [[The Gilmore House|Gilmore residence]] in ep. [[Women Of Questionable Morals|5.11]] ("Women of Questionable Morals"). [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] panics when she sees the dog through the window and calls her then-estranged husband [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]], who is living in the pool house, for help. While trying to find the dog's owner and caring for the lost dog, their relationship starts to mend. While [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] visit the pool house, Emily is even on hand, watching the dog. Richard shows Emily how to arrange its blanket, and gets her a fresh drink when he sees a dogs hair in it. The Gilmores are confused about the sex of the dog, since it is hairy, but eventually they find out it is female when the owner claims her. Princess is a long-haired Jack Russell Terrier. [[Category:Animals]]

'''Straub Hayden''' was [[Christopher Hayden]]'s father. They are not close, but Chris is still devastated when he dies in episode [[Women Of Questionable Morals|5.11]]. Straub tried to convince [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] that [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] should have an abortion when Lorelai found out she was pregnant. However, Emily refused. Straub had limited contact with Rory and in 1.15 said, "I don't care how smart that girl is... she (Lorelai) ruined Christopher's future."
Straub was an attorney and donated money to worthwhile causes. He and his wife [[Francine Hayden|Francine]] were living abroad and only came back when he became ill.
==Appearances== ===Season 1=== [[Christopher Returns|1.15]]
===Season 3=== [[Dear Emily and Richard|3.13]]
==References== [[Women Of Questionable Morals|5.11]] - Straub dies [[Category:Characters|Hayden, Straub]] [[Category:Hayden family|Hayden, Straub]]

'''Swan Guy''' is an unnamed character in episode [[1.03]] who delivers the swans to the [[Independence Inn]] for a wedding. When asked if he has twenty swans when he obviously has only two he sarcastically replies, "Sure, why not?" He is notable in that he is played by [[Sean Gunn]], and may be another instance of [[Kirk]] before he was given a name. [[Category:Independence Inn]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

The '''incidental music''', or background music, for the show was written and performed by [[Sam Phillips]]. In addition to numerous other musical cues used throughout the show's seven seasons, a few have been presented on "[[Our Little Corner of the World: Music from the Gilmore Girls]]." Prototypical cues are guitar strums with simple "la la la" vocals, ==Featured on Our "Little Corner of the World"== *Waltz #1 (track 1) - Waltz, one vocal line, acoustic guitar, simple percussion *Getting Married (track 8) - 4/4 time?, "la la" vocals with separate backing vocal lines, acoustic guitar, no percussion. *Maybe Next Week (track 13) - faster tempo, single vocal line, guitar, shaker *Rory and Lane (track 22) - faster tempo, bass guitar, single vocal line, bells? ==Other== Official names unknown. Incomplete list.
*Sneaky music - muted guitar bass line and percussion, no vocals

{{stub}} The '''Bid-a-Basket''' festival is an annual festival held in [[Stars Hollow]]. Residents (mainly women) make picnic baskets to auction off, and whoever bids the highest wins a picnic with the maker of the basket, enjoying the contains of the auctioned basket <small>([[A-Tisket, A-Tasket]])</small>. [[Category:Festivals in Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Stars Hollow]]

The festival of living art is yet another one of those crazy festivals [[Stars Hollow]] is hosting. During the festival, many famous pieces of art are portrayed with actual human beings that are standing still. At the festival, [[Kirk]] plays Jesus in "The last supper" by Leonardo da Vinci, and takes his role a little bit too seriously, shunning the person who poses as the character of Judas. [[Lorelai]] is not cast in the festival at first, because [[Taylor]] claims that she flinched while portraying the "Renoir Girl" at the festival seven years before. Lorelai is very upset about this, and ends up talking Taylor into letting her play the Renoir Girl again, adding that she is the spitting image of said girl. [[Rory]] is recruited by Taylor to play the featured painting that Stars Hollow is adding to the original set of paintings. During the festival, just as Lorelai is posing as the Renoir girl, [[Sookie]]'s baby pager goes off. Luckily, Lorelai does not flinch, but as soon as the curtain closes, Lorelai and Rory rush off to meet Sookie. [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Festivals in Stars Hollow]]

'''Al's Pancake World''' is a restaurant in [[Stars Hollow]]. After the first or second year [[Al]] got bored of pancakes. Every week is a different international cuisine theme. [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] and [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] eat here less then they eat at [[Luke's Diner|Luke's]] but they eat here a lot. They order mainly Chinese here. Although the restaurant and Al are never seen in the show, Al and his restaurant are mentioned several times.Â [[Category:Businesses in Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Stars Hollow]]

{{stub}} '''Milo Ventimiglia''' is the actor who plays [[Jess Mariano]].
Date of Birth 8 July 1977, Anaheim, California, USA
Birth Name Milo Anthony Ventimiglia
Height 5' 9" (1.75 m)
Mini Biography
Nurturing an impressive body of work that encompasses film and television, Milo Ventimiglia is positioning himself as one of Hollywood's most promising young talents as his career continues to evolve with exciting and challenging projects. Ventimiglia will next be seen starring in Tom Fontana's new WB Series "The Bedford Diaries" (2006), which focuses on a group of college students in a human sexuality class. Ventimiglia quickly garnered attention when he joined the cast of the critically acclaimed television drama "Gilmore Girls" (2000), as the quiet and complicated 'Jess.' Last year Ventimiglia joined the cast of another critically acclaimed show, NBC's "American Dreams" (2002). He portrayed a 60's war radical and helps bring the show into the 70's. He was also a recurring character on David. E. Kelley's drama "Boston Public" (2000). Before joining "Gilmore Girls" audiences became familiar with Ventimiglia when he starred in the Fox series "Opposite Sex" (2000) which secured him a holding deal with Warner Brothers. His other television credits include guest starring roles on prime time series such as "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air" (1990), "CSI: Crime Scene Investigation" (2000), "Sabrina, the Teenage Witch" (1996) and "Promised Land" (1996).
Segueing effortlessly between the big and small screen, Ventimiglia's passion for the art of acting keeps him drawn to both studio and independent features. Ventimiglia recently starred in the Wes Craven/Kevin Williamson thriller Cursed (2005) and next up is the indie film Dirty Deeds (2005). His other film credits include Winter Break (2003) and Massholes (2000). Additionally he starred in the short films Nice Guys Finish Last (2001) and Must Be the Music (1996), which debuted at the 1996 Sundance Film Festival to rave reviews. Ventimiglia currently resides in Los Angeles and enjoys skateboarding, snowboarding and wake boarding. He also has a passion for restoring vintage muscle cars. IMDb Mini Biography.
Trivia
Has been a vegetarian since childhood.
Has signed on for at least 6 episodes of a currently untitled spin-off of "Gilmore Girls" (2000). The series will focus on the relationship between Jess, his character from "Gilmore Girls" (2000), and his estranged father.
The "Gilmore Girls" (2000) spin-off (which was to be titled "Windward Circle") has been canceled due to the high cost of filming on location in Venice, California.
Directed the 2003 and 2004 WB Image Campaigns for popular shows such as "Gilmore Girls" (2000), "One Tree Hill" (2003), "7th Heaven" (1996), etc... Some of the WB stars he directed included David Boreanaz, Tom Welling, Kristin Kreuk, Michael Rosenbaum, Jamie Kennedy, James Marsters, Rose McGowan, Allison Mack, Chad Michael Murray, James Lafferty, Beverly Mitchell and 'Reba McEntire'.
When he was seven, his two sisters used to dress him up like Madonna!
After the proposed spin-off series for his character "Gilmore Girls" (2000) character Jess fell apart, he chose not to reprise the role as a regular again on the series, citing that he feels that the character has "run his course" [He returned a few times for guest spots].
Didn't have to audition for "The Bedford Diaries". The WB had Milo, and only Milo, in mind for the role.
The part of Chris Pierce on "American Dreams" was written specifically for him after he met with the show's creators.
He attended El Modena High School in Orange, CA. He graduated in 1994.
Made his debut in "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air: Bourgie Sings the Blues (#6.4)" (1995).
Boyfriend of "Gilmore Girls" (2000) co-star Alexis Bledel from 2002 to 2006.
He and Bo Barrett once traded seats on an airplane having no idea who each other were.
He is of Sicilian Italian descent on his father's side and a combination of Irish, English, Scottish, French, Cherokee and Blackfoot descent on his mother's.
He has a '67 Chevelle Super Sport named "Evelyn".
Is best friends with "Heroes" (2006/II) co-star Adrian Pasdar.
Milo and _Heroes_ co-star Adrian Pasdar auditioned for roles in the proposed _Gilmore Girls_ spinoff where Milo was to be the son of Pasdar's character. As there are only 12 years difference between them, the casting director said they would be better off playing brothers. Eight years later, they were playing brothers Peter (Milo) and Nathan (Pasdar) Petrelli in Heroes.
He was with his co-star Ali Larter on the Red Carpet of Golden Globe 2006.
Started a production company named DiVide Pictures (or the Divide Social Club) with 2 childhood friends.
Originally auditioned for the role of Clark Kent in "Smallville" (2001). Although the role went to Tom Welling, the producers at WB liked him so much they gave him the role of Jess on "Gilmore Girls" (2000).
Close friend of Heroes co-star Kristen Bell.
Similar to his fellow "Gilmore Girls" (2000) cast, also donates to the Pediatric Brain Tumor Foundation, one of his favorite charities.
His favorite book is The Long Walk (Richard Bachman).
Close friend of Sophia Bush.
He has a great interest in directing.
His Favorite Bands are The Strokes, Deftones, A Tribe Called Quest, The Hives.
Starred in a season three episode of "Gilmore Girls" (2000), which was the backdoor pilot for a California-set spin-off titled "Windward Circle", that was to have starred Ventimiglia, Sherilyn Fenn and Rob Estes. The network dropped the project citing cost issues due to filming on location in Venice, California.
Is the boyfriend of Heroes co-star Hayden Panettiere; the press have dubbed them "Haylo". [2008]
His family name, pronounced VEN (as in VENice)- TEE - ME - LIA (as in "LIAison"), is the name of a small city in Liguria (Northern Italy) just 9 km away from the border with France).
Milo ranked #2 of 20 on DC's list of Hottest Comic Hunks, losing the #1 spot to Hugh Jackman.(2009).
His favorite actors are Sean Penn and Edward Norton.
Broke up with Hayden Panettiere on Valentine Day (2009).
Personal Quotes
I'm tough on the outside and soft on the inside [...] I'm really a shy guy.
I'm a homebody, I'd rather be in the kichen cooking than hanging out in a bar.
It's [high school] an interesting time in your life because you're trying to act older and mature but you really have no idea what you're doing. You're scared and it's okay to be scared. It's okay to not know completely what you want or what you should be doing and to stumble a little bit.
Every job built my career in some way or made me grow as a person or I got to meet someone great. I had one line on The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air, but I met Will Smith and he took 20 minutes out of his day to talk to the kid with one line. To this day, I think that guy is amazing because of that.
On the WB holding deal "Basically?yeah! They said, "Here's a lot of money and don't work for anybody else. We don't have anything for you, so you're going to be sitting for awhile." That was an interesting thing."
My favorite episode is 'Teach Me Tonight,' the one with the car accident [Jess trashed the car Dean had remodeled for Rory.] Alexis and I were both so tired and laughing and goofing off and having fun, so it was funny for me to watch.
The Godfather" 1 and 2, "Goodfellas," "The Matrix" -- those are movies I can sit down and watch over and over again,
I just try not to subscribe to the ways of celebrity. I'm not a celebrity, I'm a working actor. A lot of the events -- the parties and the premieres that people go to to get noticed -- I'm just not into. I'll hang out with my friends, go see punk shows, read at home. At the same time, I have a production company, which is a lot of work.
Oh my God. Nothing against the magazines (teen magazines) because they definitely have their purposes, but I don't want to answer questions like "Do you have a girlfriend" and "What is your favorite color". Answering more adult questions is more intriguing and that's the vibe I'd like to give off.
I'm just a person and I'm not larger than life!
I like to read, too. It's good because Jess carries a book all the time. If it's one I haven't read, I'll sit down and read between takes
I don't drink, I don't smoke, I don't do anything ... but I bowled like a crazy mouther.
I don't seek attention. If anything I'd rather blend in, remain anonymous.
The kid I play, Jess, moves to town. he's a troublemaker - he steals, drinks beer, smokes. He's seventeen - he shouldn't be doing any of this stuff.
I drive the thing like a granny. I've only gotten one ticket in that car, and it was for an illegal left-hand turn.
I'm sure I'll find something to do. Some kind of trouble to get into.
Where Are They Now
(December 2003) In a T-Mobile Cell Phone Service commercial.
(2006) Filming "Heroes" (2006).
(June 2007) Starring in Fergie's video for "Big Girls Don't Cry".
(February 2008) Filming Armored with Skeet Ulrich, Matt Dillon, Columbus Short, Laurence Fishburne, Jean Reno and Fred Ward.
(January 2008) Filming Game
(May 2006) Filming Heroes
(2008) Filming Order of Chaos
(2008) Filming third season Of Heroes [[Category:Cast|Ventimiglia, Milo]]

'''[[File:48599_1218742295559_400_300.jpg|thumb]]Mitchum Huntzberger''' is the father of [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] and [[Honor Huntzberger]] and the husband of [[Shira Huntzberger]]. He is a big-shot in the newspaper industry and is very wealthy. He is actually not a bad person and can be nice. He treated Rory better than his father and wife did when they all first met her in Season 5. He offers [[Rory]] an internship at the Stamford Gazette, but eventually he tells her he doesn't think she "has what it takes." He takes it back in Season 7, and tells her he would be willing to help her get any job she wanted at any newspaper she liked.
==Early history== Mitchum was born in 1953, the second of four children and the oldest son. He is a Yale undergraduate and was on the track team. He did not attend grad school and had some "lost" years. He worked as a reporter and editor on two of the Huntzberger papers before taking over as CEO of the company.
==Appearances== *[[5.19]] *[[5.20]] *[[5.21]] *[[6.05]] *[[6.20]] *[[7.15]]
==Trivia== *Mitchum hates peas and is interested in sailing and wine (he even wrote a wine column for some time). *He only sleeps 4 hours a night. *There are 12,053 entries on Google about him. *Was shortlisted for the Pullitzer for covering the Iranian hostage crisis when he was 25. *Also covered Haiti in 1985. *He likes jazz. *He hates it when people quote My Favorite Things from The Sound of Music. *He switches to decaf after 4:00 because of high blood pressure. *He hates double talk, but he's really good at it. '''Scott Gordon Patterson''' (born September 11, 1958) is an [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States <u>American</u>] [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Actor <u>actor</u>]. He is known for his role as [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Gilmore_Girls_characters#Lucas_.22Luke.22_Danes <u>Luke Danes</u>] in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilmore_Girls <u>Gilmore Girls</u>]'' and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Strahm <u>Agent Strahm</u>] in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saw_IV <u>Saw IV</u>]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saw_V <u>Saw V</u>]'' and ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saw_VI <u>Saw VI</u>]''. He also starred as Michael Buchanan in the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NBC <u>NBC</u>] drama series ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Event_(TV_series) <u>The Event</u>]''. == Early life==
Patterson was born in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philadelphia <u>Philadelphia</u>], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pennsylvania <u>Pennsylvania</u>], the son of Hope, a homemaker, and Frank Patterson, a boxer turned advertising executive. His parents divorced in 1974.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-0">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Patterson#cite_note-0 <u>[1]</u>]</sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-1">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Patterson#cite_note-1 <u>[2]</u>]</sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Patterson#cite_note-2 <u>[3]</u>]</sup> Patterson was raised in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haddonfield,_New_Jersey <u>Haddonfield, New Jersey</u>]. He attended [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rutgers_University <u>Rutgers University</u>], pursuing a degree in comparative literature, but eventually dropped out. He studied acting in New York with renowned coaches Robert Lewis and Sondra Lee. He was exposed to the teachings of such luminaries as [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Newman <u>Paul Newman</u>], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Penn <u>Arthur Penn</u>] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Corsaro <u>Frank Corsaro</u>] at The Actors Studio. He appeared in numerous productions, including Rasputin and Miss Julie. ==[[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Scott_Patterson&action=edit&section=2&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro <u>edit</u>]] Baseball==
Patterson spent seven years, from [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1980_in_baseball <u>1980</u>] to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1986_in_baseball <u>1986</u>], as a professional [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pitcher <u>pitcher</u>] in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minor_league_baseball <u>minor league baseball</u>], topping out at the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minor_league_baseball#Triple-A <u>Triple-A</u>] level (the highest before the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_League_Baseball <u>major leagues</u>]). He played in two major league farm systems for seven different minor league teams. He was initially selected by the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlanta_Braves <u>Atlanta Braves</u>] in the first round (12th overall pick) of the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1980_in_baseball <u>1980</u>] amateur entry draft. He played his first pro season with their [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minor_league_baseball#A <u>Class A</u>] [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anderson_Braves <u>Anderson Braves</u>] in 1980, and his last with the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_Yankees <u>New York Yankees</u>]' [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minor_league_baseball#Double-A <u>Double-A</u>] [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albany-Colonie_Yankees <u>Albany-Colonie Yankees</u>] and Triple-A [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Columbus_Clippers <u>Columbus Clippers</u>] in 1986.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-baseballcube_3-0">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Patterson#cite_note-baseballcube-3 <u>[4]</u>]</sup>
In 1982, Patterson was traded from the Braves to the Yankees for [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Watson <u>Bob Watson</u>].<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-4">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Patterson#cite_note-4 <u>[5]</u>]</sup> ==[[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Scott_Patterson&action=edit&section=3&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro <u>edit</u>]] Acting career==
Patterson completed filming the leading role in the feature film ''Her Best Move'', directed by Norm Hunter and co-starring [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lisa_Darr <u>Lisa Darr</u>]. He also appeared on the big screen in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_Big_League <u>Little Big League</u>]'', with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timothy_Busfield <u>Timothy Busfield</u>] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jason_Robards <u>Jason Robards</u>], and in ''Three Wishes'', with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_Swayze <u>Patrick Swayze</u>] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Elizabeth_Mastrantonio <u>Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio</u>]. He also starred in the independent films ''Highway 395'' and ''Rhapsody in Bloom'', with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penelope_Ann_Miller <u>Penelope Ann Miller</u>].
On television, he has landed romantic roles guest starring opposite some appealing leading women; his most notable role, which he played for seven years on the television show ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilmore_Girls <u>Gilmore Girls</u>]'', is [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luke_Danes <u>Luke Danes</u>], the on-again, off-again love interest of the show's protagonist, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lorelai_Gilmore <u>Lorelai Gilmore</u>], played by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauren_Graham <u>Lauren Graham</u>]. On ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seinfeld <u>Seinfeld</u>]'', Patterson was deemed "spongeworthy" by Elaine ([http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julia_Louis-Dreyfus <u>Julia Louis-Dreyfus</u>]). He had a profound effect on Grace ([http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Debra_Messing <u>Debra Messing</u>]) in the "Das Boob" episode of ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Will_%26_Grace <u>Will & Grace</u>]'', and he played the love interests of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jennifer_Grey <u>Jennifer Grey</u>] in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/It%27s_Like,_You_Know <u>It's Like, You Know</u>]'' and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sharon_Lawrence <u>Sharon Lawrence</u>]'s character in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fired_Up_(TV_series) <u>Fired Up</u>]''. He has also guest starred on ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arli$$ <u>Arli$$</u>]'' and ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Get_Real_(TV_series) <u>Get Real</u>]''.
Among Patterson's recent projects are a co-starring role on ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aliens_in_America <u>Aliens in America</u>]'' and voicing the character of King Faraday in the 2004 animated series ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justice_League_Unlimited <u>Justice League Unlimited</u>]'', from Warner Bros. Animation.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-WB_5-0">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Patterson#cite_note-WB-5 <u>[6]</u>]</sup> He has also starred as Agent Strahm in two iterations of the Saw franchise, ''Saw IV'' and ''Saw V'' respectively, also appearing through flashback sequences in ''Saw VI''.
Patterson appeared in some episodes of the second season of ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/90210_(TV_series) <u>90210</u>]'' as [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liam_Court <u>Liam Court</u>]'s ex-con father who has recently been released from prison and wants to reconnect with his son.
Patterson starred as Michael Buchanan in the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NBC <u>NBC</u>] drama series ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Event_(TV_series) <u>The Event</u>]'', which premiered on September 20, 2010. His character was killed off in episode 17.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-6">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Patterson#cite_note-6 <u>[7]</u>]</sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-7">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Patterson#cite_note-7 <u>[8]</u>]</sup> ==[[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Scott_Patterson&action=edit&section=4&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro <u>edit</u>]] Filmography==

'''[[File:Leannhunleyreal.jpg|thumb]]Shira Huntzberger''' is the mother of [[Logan Huntzberger|Logan]] and [[Honor Huntzberger]] and the wife of [[Mitchum Huntzberger]]. She is on the Pediatric Hospital Committee with [[Emily Gilmore]] and is good friends with her.
She is a smoker more so when stressed and believes women are born for nothing more than socializing and taking care of house, husband and home that women should not work.
During the first DAR event, Emily and Richard find out that Lorelai wasn't lying when she told them that the Huntzbergers told Rori that she wasn't good enough for their family. So when Emily moves her to a center table she tells her that Rori and Logan will be together and long as they want to. Then in response Shira tells Emily that their money is inadequate compared to theirs. However, Emily calls her a gold digger and asks her what bar she met her husband at, and walks away, leaving Shira embarrassed at the table.

[[File:Tricia1.jpg|thumb|she had red hair during the show]]Nicole Leahy was [[Luke Danes]]' girlfriend in Season 3. They met through [[Taylor Doose]], when Nicole served as his attorney. Nicole and Luke went on a seven country cruise in the summer and spontaneously got married. They soon realized the marriage was a mistake and planned to divorce. However, they decided to give their marriage a chance. They bought a townhouse in a neighboring area, upsetting [[Lorelai]]. Luke discovered that Nicole was cheating on him in [[4.17]] and Luke signed the papers to officially divorce Nicole in [[4.18]]. [[File:Tom.jpg|thumb|258px]] '''Tom'''Â is a contractor frequently featured whenever there is construction or renovation around town. He first appears in the second season. ==Projects==
Tom's projects throughout [[Stars Hollow]] are as follows:
Season 2:
As a contractor when [[Rory]] performs community service building a house.
Season 3:
- Renovates Luke's property as a joint project for [[Luke]] and [[Taylor]] to expand Luke's apartment and open Taylor's Old Fashioned Soda Shoppe and Candy Store.
- Attempts to renovate the [[Independence Inn]] after its fire.
Season 4-Season 5:
-Â [[Sookie]] and [[Lorelai]]Â use Tom as theÂ contracter when they renovated the [[Dragonfly Inn]]Â in season 4. As this takes the entire fifth season, he is featured regularly.
Season 6:
- After Lorelai and Luke's engagement, Tom works as the contractor to expand Lorelai's house. Because Luke promised to hire [[T.J.]] as the contractor, Lorelai hires Tom as a second contractor and also pays him more to pretend that T.J. is the real contractor.
Season 7:
- When [[Kirk]] drives Taylor's car into [[Luke's Diner]] while participating in the ceremony of a traffic light camera, Tom fixes and renovates the property. [[Category:Stars Hollow Residents]] [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Dragonfly Inn]]

[[File:Screen_shot_2012-07-16_at_2.48.08_PM.png|thumb|Rachel, having coffee at Lukes Diner.]]Rachel was [[Luke Danes|Lukes]] girlfriend when he was younger and she returned to Stars Hollow in Season 1. She also helped [[Lorelai Gilmore]] and [[Sookie]] find the [[Dragonfly Inn]]. In Season 1, Luke fears getting close to her again because she left him before. She apparently gets bored in Stars Hollow and enjoys being in new places. She is a photographer. She leaves Stars Hollow for good in the Season 1 finale, because she believes Luke is in love with Lorelai and she tells him not to wait long. [[Category:Luke's Love Interests]] [[Category:Characters]]

Lorelai bought this house after she saved enough money from working at the Independence Inn. This is where Rory grew up. The house has two levels, Rory's bedroom downstairs while Lorelai's room is upstairs. Throughout the seasons the house takes quite the beating- it is definitely a house that one would call "lived in"- although it is a very remarkable, clean, nicely decorated house. It received most of its nicks and damages from termites, and GiGi, Christophers daughter. In seasons 5 and 6 Luke and Lorelai renovate the house, sprucing it up and painting it as well, since they are getting married. [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Locations]]

'''[[File:Tumblr_lmk298zJSr1qheaxoo1_500.jpg|thumb]][[File:Chad-michael-murray-and-gilmore-girls-profile.jpg|thumb]]Tristan DuGray''' (portrayed by Chad Michael Murray) went to [[Chilton]] with [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] and [[Paris Gellar|Paris]]. ==Character History== He unsuccessfully tries to pressure Rory to date him and obnoxiously calls her Mary, as in the Virgin Mary, a practice common, but dated in catholic schools. Paris, on the other hand, has a crush on him and is jealous of the attention he gives Rory. In episode [[1.13]], we learn that Paris and Tristan have been in the same classes since kindergarten, and he kissed her, on a dare, in sixth grade. Paris also hints he's had a hard life, and his parents weren't that good.
Although Rory rebuffs his attempts, they do share one kiss after a genuine moment at Madeline's party. Upon Rory's advice that he date someone with "a little more substance", Tristan takes Paris on a date. However, when an angry Paris blames Rory for the date not being anything more, Rory confronts Tristan leading to him asking her, "Is it fair that I date her even though I like someone else?". Hinting he has a crush on Rory. Rory naively thinks he is referring to his ex-girlfriend Summer and is confused by his exasperation.
In season two, Tristan's father sends him to military school after he, Duncan and Bowman break into his Bowman's dad's safe and the silent alarm 'kicks in'. He's never seen again.
==Appearances== ===Season 1=== [[1.02]] â€¢ [[1.04]] â€¢ [[1.06]] â€¢ [[1.09]] â€¢ [[1.11]] â€¢ [[1.13]] â€¢ [[1.16]] â€¢ [[1.17]] â€¢ [[1.18]] â€¢ [[1.21]] ===Season 2=== [[2.09]]
==Relationships== ===Summer=== They broke up in [[The Breakup, Part 2]] at Madeline's party. He then kissed Rory who cried. ===Paris=== Tristan had kissed her years ago on a dare causing her to have a crush on him. ([[1.13]])Rory suggested that he date someone with "a little more substance", Tristan takes Paris on a date. He then stupidly mentioned how it was Rory's idea to Paris.
==Trivia== *His character left due to filming One Tree Hill. [[Category:Characters|DuGrey, Tristan]] [[Category:Chilton|DuGrey, Tristan]] [[Category:Rory's Romantic Interests|DuGrey, Tristan]]

Floyd is [[Jason Stiles]]' father. He tries to sue [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]] and Jason after stealing one of his clients. Richard then does a deal with Floyd to leave Jason in the cold. Jason then sues Richard, making [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] break up with him. [[Category:Stiles family|Stiles, Floyd]]

'''The Puffs''' were an elite secret society at [[Chilton]]; there were only ten worth mentioning and the Puffs had been number one for over fifty years. They first appeared in Episode 7 of Season 2. They were lead by former Senior Class President, [[Francie]]. Members include: Sandra Day O'Connor (Leader in 1947 and '48), Francine Jarvis (Leader), Ivy (Francie's spokesperson), Lem (short for Lemon), Dijur, Lily, Celine, Lana, Asia, Anna, Paris Geller, and, temporaily, Rory. Rory joined when she sat downÂ at a random table after being told she was not sociable enough. She was later "kidnapped" by the group and brought to Chilton for a hazing of sorts. Every member of the Puffs was made to recite this peom: I pledge myself to the Puffs, loyal I'll always be, a P to start, 2 F's at the end, and a U sitting in between. They then had to ring the headmaster's historical bell three times. [[Category:Chilton]]

'''Dakin Matthews''' is the actor who plays the role of [[Headmaster Charleston]], leader of [[Chilton Preparatory School]], which [[Rory Gilmore]] attends. [[Category:Cast|Matthews, Dakin]] [[Category:Supporting cast|Matthews, Dakin]]

Most recently, she created the Showtime television show, "Weeds," as well as writing episodes for that show (including the pilot, for which she won a Writer's Guild Award). She has also won an Emmy for writing on "Tracey Takes On...". Other shows she has written for include "The Fresh Prince of Bel Aire," "Mad About You," "Sex and the City," and "Boston Common." == Episodes written == : [[1.07]] [[Category:Writers]]

== References ==
Hi Wolfgang:
I'm glad someone thought of this before me so I don't have to do all the hard work you have done. :)
When I thought of making a Gilmore Wiki, my main reason was to catalog all the cultural references in each episode. Do you have a template for the episode pages? If you do, it would be cool if we could add a "References" section (although it might be named something else). I am watching the 2005/2006 season now and have started on Season 1, too. I would be willing to start cataloging the references that I "get" but many pass me right by. That's why I think it would be a good idea to add "Cultural References."
[[User:Rynosoft|Rynosoft]] 05:03, 10 January 2008 (CET)
:: Hi there, there is not really a template for episodes, other than the navigation links on the top and the information box with an image. Feel free to use whatever format you see fit. A "Cultural References" section seems fine to me :) Thanks for contributing and let me know if you need any help. -[[User:Wolfgang|Wolfgang]] ([[User_talk:Wolfgang|talk]])

It might be nice to add some of the links on the [[Main Page]] to the navigation box. I'm thinking of [[Main Characters]] and [[Episodes]], but you could certainly include others.

{{delete}} The '''Aerie Girls''' was an advertising campaign for American Eagle that aired during seventh season episodes of "Veronica Mars" and "The Gilmore Girls." In the spots, a group of teenage girls analyzed the current episode and provided their uniquely adolescent perspective on what they saw. This stealthly served to sell a line of intimate apparel from American Eagle Outfitters called "aerie". It is believed this ad campaign, and the girls in them, were almost universally despised by Gilmore Girls viewers.
#redirect [[Dave Rygalski]]

The '''Life and Death Brigade''' is secret society club at Yale that [[Rory]] wrote an article on. It is mysterious and famous for its dangerous stunts. [[Logan]] takes Rory to a couple of the Life and Death Brigade events. Its motto is 'In Omnia Paratus', which means 'ready for anything'. ==Appearances==
Rory first learns of the club in episode 5.06, [[Norman Mailer, I'm Pregnant!]] when she spots a girl a in ballgown and gorilla mask exclaim 'In Omnia Paratus' and climb into a black SUV. Intrigued, Rory does some research and learns that [[Logan]]'s grandfather was in the club, so she conludes that Logan must be as well. She pesters him for an insider interview, but he disclaims any knowledge of the club. Eventually, he offers her a chance to learn more, but only if she agrees to some unknown conditions.Â
In episode 5.07, [[You Jump, I Jump, Jack]], Rory finds an envelope stuck to her dorm window with instructions to be in a certain location while blind-folded. Rony then is led by Logan and other members to a mysterious location in the woods that is holding aÂ ''Life and Death Brigade ''event. Everyone at the event is dressed in 1930s style outfits and the tents are vintage safari-style. Rory attempts to question the'' Life and Death'''s'' Brigade ''members, but all refuse to answer her questions, because 1) she wasn't wearing 1930's clothes and 2) becasuse she wasn't complying with the game the members were playing. The members were Â conversing only in words that do not contain the letter " e " and refused to answer Rory's "e"-filled questions. The next day, the members partook in bizarre activities like a form of polo with girls in sedan chairs carried by the guys and trap-shooting with paintball guns and human targets who leap onto gym mats. The big event is a leap from a seven-story scaffolding with everyone in formal-wear carrying umbrellas. The safety equipment seems pretty dubious and was apparently tested only on potatoes. However, Logan encourages Rory to be less timid and to become involved in her story for the school paper. Along with four other members, Rory and Logan leap off the scaffolding and in what is a once-in-a-lifetime moment for Rory. After returning from the event, Rory finds at the doorstep of her dorm-room her Â earlier confiscated camera, a gorilla mask and a bottle of champagne. This may imply that she is now apart of the Brigade but, her membership is never mentioned nor depicted after this episode.
While members of the Life and Death Brigade appear in several later episodes and is mentioned by [[Mitchum Huntzberger]] while he is explaining his disappointment in Logan, a Brigade stunt is only mentioned again in episodes [[6.18]] and [[6.20]] when Logan, Colin, Finn and Robert plan and improperly execute a stunt in Costa Rica prior to graduation, which causes a serious injury for Logan.
==Known Members== *[[Logan Huntzberger]] *[[Colin]] *[[Finn]] *Stephanie *[[Robert Grimaldi|Robert]] *Seth *Juliet *Rosemary
==Trivia==
*Â "In Omnia Paratus" is also part of the motto of the U.S. Coast Guard. *In the Brigade Event Rory attends, the members hold a stunt where they jump from a great height wearing formal wear just like the photo she found that she showed Doyle in [[Norman Mailer, I'm Pregnant!]] *[[Daniel Palladino|Dan Palladino]]Â based the Life and Death Brigade on a group at Oxford University that spans centuries and actually invented bungee jumping. Dan used the brigade to represent that which could be done when you are smart, witty, and have infinite money at your disposal. The stunts in the episode You Jump, I Jump Jack were based on ideas he got from other outside sources: Dan read a novel where the author attempted to leave out "e"'s; an issue of Vogue from the 1940's featured women in sedan baskets; the first night of the stunt is supposed to look like the movie Out of Africa. [[Category:Yale]]

Kyle went to [[Stars Hollow High School]] and was good friends with [[Dean]]. He also hosted the party in [[3.19]], behind his parents back. At this party, [[Dean]] and [[Jess]] get in a physical fight after Jess yells at [[Rory]], causing her to cry. Dean and Jess cause a lot of damage to Kyle's house, including breaking a fence. The police break up the party. This party was the main reason Jess left town, causing Rory and him to break up. Kyle's parents found out about the party and Kyle entered the Navy (unclear if this was because of the party itself). Kyle was good friends with Dean, and was part of his bachelor party (when Dean drunkly confesses his love for Rory to [[Luke]]). Dean also moved in with Kyle after [[Lindsay]] and him separated. While Dean lives with Kyle, we found out Kyle was wounded in the Navy and now has a hook for one of his hands. He finds that the hook helps him to meet many women.

There are several instances of inside jokes within the Gilmore Girls, some are listed below. *Dave Rygalsky is said to have left to attend school in California. Adam Brody, who played the character, left to star in "The O.C.," which was set in California. *When Jess shows up again, he says he is now living in Philadelphia. Milo Ventimiglia was starring in "American Dreams" at the time, set in Philadelphia. *Brad Langford returns to Chilton after starring in "Into the Woods" on Broadway. Adam Wylie, in fact, did star as Jack in "Into the Woods" on Broadway between appearances. *Several references are made to the movie, "Dirty Dancing." Kelly Bishop, who plays Emily, starred in that movie.

'''Helen Pai''' started out on the show as a script coordinator, and was credited as producer on several episodes on the Gilmore Girls. She is the best friend of the show's creator, [[Amy Sherman-Palladino]], and has served various roles on the show, from taking notes in the writer's room, typing, to unspecified involvement in set design, publicity, DVD special features, legal clearances, sound mixing and post-production. She also served as the inspiration for the character of [[Lane Kim]]. Like Lane, she is Korean-American and was raised as a Seventh Day Adventist.
She also was in charge of publication of a series of [[Gilmore Girls books|books]] based on the the show, which includedwriting one of the novelizations, "The Other Side of Summer," herself.
==Trivia== [[Dave Rygalski]] is loosely based on and named after her real-life husband, Dave Rygalski, a writer for the Jay Leno show.
==External links== [http://www.asiaarts.ucla.edu/article.asp?parentid=51438 Ode to Gilmore Girls: Behind the Musicality of TVâ€™s Beloved Show]

The '''Family Friendly Programming Forum''' is a coalition of advertisers who seek to increase the amount of family-friendly programming on television. The Forum sponsors a Script Development Fund to help what they consider family-friendly shows reach the pilot stage. The first show to actually air that was developed with the help of the fund was the Gilmore Girls.

'''Mrs. Caldicott''' (portrayed by Deborah Theaker) is a teacher at [[Chilton]] who appears in episode [[1.13 Concert Interruptus]]. She makes it a point to let the class know that [[Tristan]] is more interested in [[Rory]] than in her debating project. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]
'''Jess''' (portrayed by Brandon Routh) is one of the boys that [[Madeline Lynn]] and [[Louise Grant]] meet at the Bangles concert. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]
'''Sean''' (portrayed by Glenn Dunk) is one of the boys Madeline and Louise meet at the Bangles concert. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

Lorelai returns home to find the chick missing and comedy ensues. Also known as "Case Study Number Twelve", and for a few seconds, "Stanley", based on Lorelai's initial assumption that the chick is male. [[Category:Animals]]

'''Dula''' is the daughter of [[Liz Danes|Liz]] ([[Luke Danes|Luke]]'s sister) and [[T.J.]] (her husband), born during [[Season 7]].
Liz, gets pregnant with Doula in [[Season 6]], when she freaks out and decides T.J. will be a horrible father, and doesn't want him a part of this new child's life. When Liz tells Luke the news, he flips, but easily fixes the situation when he realizes the root of the problem is Liz's fear of herself as a mother. Liz was unable to handle her first child, [[Jess Mariano]], and she is worried she will fail at motherhood again. Luke comes to the rescue, and Doula is born with a mother and father, into a very happy home.
One of the critical Luke-[[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] moments in season 7 happens when Lorelai meets Liz, Luke and Doula, and holds Doula for a few moments. [[Christopher Hayden|Christopher]] comes into the scene - and it is obvious that he is jealous. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Danes family]]

'''[[File:Screen_shot_2012-07-13_at_10.33.26_PM.png|thumb]]Jamie''' is [[Paris Gellar]]'s first boyfriend that she meets the summer before she is a senior at [[Chilton Preparatory School|Chilton]]. She meets him at the summer student government program in Washington DC. Jamie is a year older than Paris, and goes to Princeton. Paris falls for Jamie quickly because she has never experienced someone loving her as he did. Paris loses her virginity to him in Season 3 and blames him for her rejection from Harvard and blows up at Chilton's Bicentennial. Paris and Jamie stay together for about a season, although their relationship is marginalized. Jamie's character is brought back when Paris begins to have an affair with a Yale professor, [[Asher Flemming]], and Paris strings Jamie along, even though her heart belongs to Asher. Jamie comes to visit Paris at [[Yale]] on his birthday, and Paris breaks up with him, per Rory's advice, and the character of Jamie is never seen again. [[Category:Characters]]

'''Terrance''' is [[Paris Geller]]'s life coach. Over the summer before Paris begins at [[Yale]], she strives to be a better person, with the help of Terrance. Terrance has a very zen personality and is able to calm Paris down using very strange techniques. In reality, Terrance just comes off as a very nosy person who wants control of every decision Paris makes. He intrudes upon her relationship with Doyle as well as her everyday activities, and drives Paris' roomates crazy. Terrance's corrupted character is revealed many times, sublty, throughout [[season 4]]. [[Category:Characters]]

{{Infobox character | Title=Giselle Gerard | Actor=Janet Hubert | Image=Giselle1.jpg | First=[[Back in the Saddle Again]] | Last=[[Back in the Saddle Again]] | Name=Giselle Gerard | Age=N/A | Family=[[Michel Gerard]] (son) }}
'''Giselle Gerard''' is the mother of Lorelai's every so charming and loyal employee, Michel. She comes into town during season 2. While Giselle is in visiting from France, she and Michel appear to have a perfect mother-son relationship. That is, until Lorelai begins to tell Giselle the truth about her son. This is when Michel reveals that his mother knows nothing about him, and that is why they have the perfect relationship when she comes to visit. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

'''Francie Jarvis''' was a student at [[Chilton]], who made her way onto the scene during [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]'s senior year, in season 3. Francie resented [[Paris Gellar|Paris]]' position as president of her class, and tried everything in her power to manipulate the student body government to do what she wanted to do. Paris wanted the senior gift to be a telescope, whereas Francie would rather use the money to have their final dance in a big fancy mansion. Francie's alternative to the telescope as the senior gift was planting a tree in the quad, just as every senior class before them did. Paris was eventually outvoted and lost the battle against Francie.

revision.comment: New page: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Our_Little_Corner_of_the_World:_Music_from_Gilmore_Girls Our Little Corner of the World: Music from Gilmore Girls From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia Jump ...
revision.text:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Our_Little_Corner_of_the_World:_Music_from_Gilmore_Girls
Our Little Corner of the World: Music from Gilmore Girls From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia Jump to: navigation, search Our Little Corner of the World: Music from Gilmore Girls
Soundtrack by Various Artists Released 2002 Recorded Varies Genre Soundtrack Length 60:02 Label Rhino Records Our Little Corner of the World: Music from Gilmore Girls is a 2002 soundtrack release from Rhino Records consisting of songs that have appeared in various forms on the WB series Gilmore Girls:
[edit] Track listing "Waltz #1 (Cue)" by Sam Phillips. "What a Wonderful World" by Joey Ramone plays when Luke knocks a hole in his apartment wall for Jess to have his own apartment in "Lost and Found" (Season 2, Episode 15). "Child Psychology" by Black Box Recorder is the song that Lane brings over in "Emily in Wonderland" (Season 1, Episode 19) that Rory likes because it depresses her. "Know Your Onion!" by The Shins is the song Rory was listening to when the guidance counselor interrupted her at lunch at Chilton at the start of the episode, "Like Mother, Like Daughter" (Season 2, Episode 7). "I Found Love" by The Free Design plays as the start of "Sadie, Sadie" (Season 2, Episode 1) as the Gilmore Girls walk around a Stars Hollow where everybody has one of Lorelai's thousand daisies. "Car Song" by Elastica is what is playing right before the Jess and Rory get into the car accident in "Teach Me Tonight" (Season 2, Episode 19). "Oh My Love" by John Lennon is playing when Dean told Rory "I love you" in "Star-Crossed Lovers and Other Strangers" (Season 1, Episode 16) and she said nothing. "Getting Married (Cue)" by Sam Phillips. "Where You Lead I Will Follow" by Carole King & daughter Louise Goffin is the theme song for Gilmore Girls. "Clear Spot" by the Pernice Brothers has not yet been played on the show (but the group did have "The Weakest Shade of Blue" on "Chicken or Beef?" (Season 4, Episode 4). "One Line" by PJ Harvey is from the moment in "Love, Daisies, and Troubadours" (Season 1, Episode 21) where Rory tells Dean "I love you, you idiot" and kisses him. "I'm the Man Who Murdered Love" by XTC is the song that Lane plays off of her new CD for Rory in "The Lorelais' First Day at Chilton" (Season 1, Episode 2). "Maybe Next Week (Cue)" by Sam Phillips. "Thirteen" by Big Star is from "Rory's Dance" (Season 1, Episode 9) when she goes walking with Dean through Stars Hollow afterwards. "Human Behavior" by BjÃ¶rk is heard when the Gilmore girls see the perfect snowman has been destroyed after "The Bracebridge Dinner" (Season 2, Episode 10). "I Don't Mind" by Slumber Party is from "One's Got Class and the Other One Dyes" (Season 3, Episode 4) which is when Rory dyes Lane's hair. "Tell Her What She Wants to Know" by Sam Phillips was in "Ballroom & Biscotti" (Season 4, Episode 1). "It's Alright, Baby" by Komeda is the song Rory listens to on her headphones in the Chilton cafeteria at the end of "Like Mother, Like Daughter" (Season 2, Episode 7). "God Only Knows" by Claudine Longet is the song Rory and Lane try to listen to in "Double Date" (Season 1, Episode 12) while Lorelai is trying to study and keeps making them turn it down and then up. "Smile" by Grant-Lee Phillips is from the end of "Application Anxiety" (Season 3, Episode 3), as Luke and Taylor are having a fight and Rory and Lorelai are strolling around Stars Hollow again. "O'Oh" by Yoko Ono is from "Lorelai's Graduation Day" (Season 2, Episode 21), when Rory and Jess are checking out New York City. "Rory and Lane (Cue)" by Sam Phillips. "Girl From Mars" by Ash is at the end of "Nick & Nora/Sid & Nancy" (Season 2, Episode 5) when Jess and Rory engage in cute book talk. The couples in the episode title are Nick and Nora Charles from the Dashiell Hammett novel The Thin Man, and Sid Vicious of the Sex Pistols and his girlfriend Nancy Spungen. "My Little Corner of the World" by Yo La Tengo is from the end of "Love, Daisies, and Troubadours" (Season 1, Episode 21) as Lorelai and Rory run to each other to share their good news (a cover version of the song, performed by Kit Pongetti, formerly of Austin-based Those Who Dig, is heard at the end of "Pilot" when Lorelai and Rory are sitting in Luke's Diner).

redirect.title: Gilmore Girls Wiki talk:Old Main Page

revision.text: #REDIRECT [[Gilmore Girls Wiki talk:Old Main Page]]
#REDIRECT [[Gilmorepedia]]

Today, March 14, 2008, the '''Gilmore Girls Wiki''' has been merged with the '''Gilmorepedia''' (previously located at http://gilmorepedia.com/). This page details aims to answer any questions you may have regarding the current situation. == User accounts == Most SL History users should be able to use their old account names. However, a few usernames were already present in Wikia's shared user database, and so those SL History users had to be renamed during the import. If you find that you cannot login using your old username, please try to use '''GP-[your_old_username]''' and your old password. == Articles == As with users, most articles were simply brought over without any changes. Some, however, already had existing counterparts on Second Life Wikia. These have been renamed and can be found [http://gilmoregirls.wikia.com/index.php?title=Special%3AAllpages&from=Merge&namespace=4 on this list]. == Reporting bugs and filing requests == If you see something wrong or want something changed on the site that the admins cannot do, we're here to help. When reporting a bug, be sure to give '''at least one example''' of the erratic behavior. This not only makes it easier to identify the problem, but also lets us check if the issue has been resolved correctly, rather than asking you to verify. Bug reports should go to [[User_talk:TOR|TOR's talk page]] and requests should go to [[User_talk:Toughpigs|Danny]]. == Contact == For questions regarding Wikia's policies and the move in general, please contact [[User:Toughpigs|Danny]], Wikia's Community Development Manager. You can reach him by leaving a message on [[User talk:Toughpigs|his talk page]]. For technical issues and problems, the person you're looking for is [[wikia:User:TOR|TOR]], a member of Wikia's [[w:Technical team|Tech Team]]. You can reach TOR by: * editing [[User_talk:TOR|his talk page]] * going to the [irc://irc.freenode.net/wikia #wikia] IRC channel and looking for TOR_CNR * writing to [mailto:tor@wikia.com tor@wikia.com] He is available weekdays, usually from about 9 AM to 5 PM CET.

revision.comment: Merge was over a year ago

revision.text: {{w:dannywikis}}

Hi! I am the founder of this fine wiki (formerly known as gilmorepedia.com). If you have any questions or comments, leave them on [[User_talk:Wolfgang|my talk page]].
My favorite episode is [[4.07]] and my favorite character, after the girls and [[Luke]], is [[Jason]]. Just in case anyone wanted to know.
I am, however, mostly retired. Happy editing :)
[[Category:Gilmorepedia Administrators]]

Welcome to my talk page.
Please sign your question or comment with <nowiki>~~~~</nowiki> (four consecutive tilde characters). This will expand to your username (or ip address, if you are not logged in) and the date/time of your edit. I will do my best to reply on this page as soon as possible. ----
== References ==
Wolfgang, how would you prefer to categorize the episodes? By season/episode number, or alphabetical by title? My opinion is that we have episodes listed on the main page in numerical order by season. I also think we should remove episode numbers in the titles (or at least move them to the end), thus allowing the episodes to be listed alphabetically where necessary. Of course, I leave it up to you. Thanks! [[User:JMcKenzie|JMcKenzie]] 07:41, 5 June 2008 (UTC) :: I think the main categorization of eps should be the episode number/season, because this is the chronology of the show. I am good with removing the numbers from the titles, or writing them in brackets at the end, the only thing that should stay in place is the redirect pages that redirect from episode number to episode page, so that the navigation bar on top of the episodes keeps working. No need to leave it up to me either, as long as we give truthful credit to this great show, let's have a ball :) Incidentally, I don't have much time to edit these days, I can always help out with little things here and there. Just let me know if you need anything. Cheers -[[User:Wolfgang|Wolfgang]] ([[User_talk:Wolfgang|talk]]) 07:53, 5 June 2008 (UTC)
== From Dowsiewuwu ==
Do you still edit here often? I was made the other admin to kind of clean up some things around here while you are away. I am just wondering if you will still be an active admin/bureauc.
Please respond on [[User talk:Dowsiewuwu|my talk page]].
[[User:Dowsiewuwu|Elisabeth Perry, Dowsiewuwu]] 04:00, April 12, 2010 (UTC)
== are you the gilmore girls wiki admin? ==
I am kylekroll. I am another person who is gonna get involved with this wiki. Am I supposed to tell you this?
[[User:KyleKroll|KyleKroll]] 03:03, April 13, 2010 (UTC)
: Hi Kyle! Well I am an admin, because I founded the Wiki and made the initial edits, but not ''the'' admin ;) I am also more or less retired now, and there is a new admin in town (see above). There is no need to tell me anything, but thanks for letting me know anyway. Happy editing :) --[[User:Wolfgang|Wolfgang]] ([[User_talk:Wolfgang|talk]]) 05:46, April 13, 2010 (UTC) == Ad free ==
Hi! Would you like this wiki to be ad-free? I'm looking for wikis to be part of a new program which would remove all ads from the wiki for $19.95/month.
If you are interested, please be visit [[w:c:Community:Ad free wikis|here]] to sign up. [[Special:Contact|Let me know]] if you have any questions! - [[User:Sannse|sannse]]<staff /> <small>([[w:c:community:Forum:Community_Central_Forum|help forum]] | [[w:c:community:Blog:Wikia_Staff_Blog |blog]])</small> 05:32, June 2, 2010 (UTC)

==Re: Welcome!== Hi Danny, and thanks. The thing I most need right now is people who write good articles, mainly episodes and characters ;) Other than that, the images on the episodes and character pages are broken, but Tor promised to fix that. I think I want to revamp the main page, as it is currently a bit dull. The old main page here does not look too bad actually so I think I will start from there. I will let you know if I need help, my wiki fu does not extend to all that fancy table formatting, I'm afraid. Cheers! --[[User:Wolfgang|Wolfgang]] ([[User_talk:Wolfgang|talk]]) 07:03, 15 March 2008 (UTC)

[[File:The-Godmothers-Lorelai-Rory-with-Davey-Martha-lorelai-and-rory-gilmore-7997311-450-300.jpg|thumb]]Martha Belleville is [[Sookie]] and [[Jackson]]'s second child. [[Davey]] is their first. [[Lorelai]] is Martha's godmother

Hello all,
I'm a moderate fan of the Gilmore Girls. I love the show because everyone on the show is so beautiful. Who could possible resist those blue eyes. It's also very rare that a mother and daughter actually look related on TV.
I've watched every episode multiple times, and I only wish I could catch up on all of the cultural references.
I hope to become an active contributor to this wiki, especially since the show is over!
Cheers, [[User:Jysung|Jysung]] 07:29, 18 April 2008 (UTC)

{{Template:Episode |name = Pilot |season = 1 |ep_num = 1 |date = October 5, 2000 |writer = Amy Sherman-Palladino |director = Lesli Linka Glatter |prev = |next = [[The Lorelais' First Day at Chilton]]|image = [[File:Gilmore-girls-pilot-01.jpg|280px]]}} '''Pilot''' is the first episode in season oneÂ of Gilmore Girls.Â  ==Summary== The series begins when [[Rory Gilmore]] ([[Alexis Bledel]]) is accepted into the elite Chilton prep school and dreams of attending Harvard. This is bad news for her mother, [[Lorelai Gilmore]] ([[Lauren Graham]]), as she must reconcile with her parents [[Emily]] ([[Kelly Bishop]]) and [[Richard]] ([[Edward Herrmann]]) in order to borrow the money for Rory's tuition. Rory meets [[Dean]] ([[Jared Padalecki]]) and has second thoughts about attending Chilton. ==Plot== Welcome to the small and town of Stars Hollow, Connecticut. Home of the Gilmore girls Lorelai and Rory. Lorelai is a 32-year-old single mother who is so close to her daughter Rory that many people mistake them for sisters. The show opens at the local diner that the girls patronize often. Lorelai has a special relationship with the owner and an addiction to caffeine (coffee). She squares off with the owner on a daily basis over just how much coffee she's allowed to have. We're also treated to an opening scene where an unsuspecting male hits on the both of the Gilmore girls, separately. This creates some of the quirky problems the Gilmore girls have. Clearly, there are hazards in being a mother and daughter pair so close in age. Later, we meet Lorelai's bizarre staff at the inn she manages. There's Michel, the rude French man who runs the front desk, the unbelievably sassy harp player, and Sookie, the chef who is a walking disaster area. Meanwhile, we find out that Rory is the kind of girl who is more interested in academic pursuits and reading Madame Bovary than worrying about clothes and boys. But unbeknownst to Rory there is a new guy in town and he has his eyes set on her. Rory and her best friend, Lane, hang out after school and discuss an upcoming teen hayride. Rory wouldn't be caught dead at the event, but Lane has strict parents who are trying to set her up with the son of a business colleague. The real story is that Rory hears she has been accepted to the exclusive prep school Chilton, which means guaranteed admission to Harvard. Rory is psyched, but Lorelai gets a rude awakening, the school wants a pricey enrollment fee in addition to first semester's tuition. And they want it pronto. Lorelai doesn't have the money, but can't bear the thought of disappointing her daughter. The only thing left for her to do is ask her wealthy parents. But that's not such an easy task since Lorelai's relationship with her parents is beyond strained. As a teenager, Lorelai didn't exactly fulfill her parent's high expectations. (Getting pregnant at sixteen didn't help.) So it is going to take a lot of pride swallowing for her to ask for the money.) Lorelai does indeed end up asking her folks for money, where she receives quite the chilly reception. When she asks for the money, they agree, since it is really for Rory, but have one minor condition. Lorelai's mother, Emily, demands that she get to see her daughter and granddaughter once a week. That means dinner every Friday night. Lorelai hesitates, but agrees. At school, Rory is explaining to Lane about Chilton when she bumps into Dean, the new kid from Chicago who has been eyeing Rory. They talk and Rory begins to really like Dean. Just how hard she falls for him isn't revealed until later when she tells her mom that she doesn't want to go to Chilton anymore. Lorelai is confused and astounded, but Rory doesn't back down. When the truth comes out, Lorelai flips out and says she will not allow her daughter to throw her life away for some random guy. Rory is going to Chilton whether she wants to or not. When the Gilmore girls go to the grandparents' house for dinner, the whole night turns into a big disaster. Lorelai's father starts talking about Rory's dad, Christopher, and all his success he has had with his Internet startup in California. This causes Lorelai to have a mini-breakdown. She and Emily end up fighting in the kitchen and Rory overhears every word, including the part about paying for Chilton. When it's all over, Rory recognizes her mom's bravery and agrees to go to Chilton. ==Music== * "There She Goes" by The La's * "Where the Colors Don't Go" by Sam Phillips * "I Try" by Macy Gray * "My Little Corner of the World" by Kit Pongetti * "Wendy" composed by Wesley Yang & Gavin McNett * "Ballet Waltz #3" by Herman Beeftink * "Heartland" by George Strait ==References== ===Music=== *Macy Gray ===Books=== * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adventures_of_Huckleberry_Finn ''Adventures of Huckleberry Finn''] by Mark Twain * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moby-Dick ''Moby-Dick''] by Herman Melville * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madame_Bovary ''Madame Bovary''] by Gustave Flaubert * ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Second_Sex The Second Sex] ''by Simone De Beauvoir ===Movies=== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosemary%27s_Baby_%28film%29 Rosemary's Baby] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mommie_Dearest_%28film%29 Mommie Dearest] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Side_Story West Side Story] ===Pop Culture=== '''Lorelai''': You're a regular [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Kerouac Jack Kerouac].

'''Rory''': God, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rupaul RuPaul] doesn't need this much makeup.

'''Lane''': My parents still get upset over the obscene portion sizes of American food. I seriously doubt I'm going to make any inroads with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eminem Eminem].

'''Rory''' (looking at her blue plaid Chilton skirt): I'm going to be in a [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C-u5WLJ9Yk4 Britney Spears video]?

'''Sookie''': Where's your pÃ¢tÃ©?
'''Lorelai''': At [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zsa_Zsa_Gabor Zsa Zsa Gabor's] house.

'''Rory''': God! You're like Ruth Gordon just standing there with the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tannis_root tannis root]. Make a noise!
'''Dean''': [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosemary%27s_Baby_%28film%29 Rosemary's Baby].
'''Rory''': Yeah.
'''Dean''': That's a great movie. You have good taste.

'''Lorelai''': Oh you're gonna have to walk faster than that. You're gonna have to turn into friggin' [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Florence_Griffith-Joyner Flo Jo] to get away from me.

'''Rory''': Do we go in or do we just stand here reenacting [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Little_Match_Girl The Little Match Girl]?
'''Lorelai''': Ok, look, I know you and me are having a thing here, and I know you hate me, but I need you to be civil at least through dinner and then on the way home you can [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyle_and_Erik_Menendez pull a Menendez]. Deal? ==Memorable Quotes== ==Trivia==

[http://virtualgilmore.squarepins.org Virtual Gilmore] is a project that began in the spring of 2007 by a group of fans at [[Television Without Pity]]. The fans decided that the television show [[Gilmore Girls]] was gone before its time when the show aired its season finale in May 2007. The group decided to take it upon themselves to continue the plots and characters in story format.
With '''sosmitten''' as head writer and '''Jenepel''' as producer, the group was off to a running start!
Before long, they had an organized group of fans who brainstormed to figure out what was next for [[Lorelai]], [[Rory]], and the rest of [[Stars Hollow]]'s citizens. A core group of writers was selected and on a Tuesday night at 8PM (the show's former timeslot on [[The WB]] and later [[The CW]]) in September 2007, episode 8.01 "Into the Great Wide Open" "aired" online.
The Virtual Season "staff" tried their best to stay true to the original characters and produced 22 "episodes" from September 2007 through May 2008. The "episodes" was written by one or two people per installment, but the whole staff contributed to each episode, working hard to bring the audience a uniformly written story.
The project was well-received at [[Twop|Television Without Pity]] and less so at [[FanForum]], the latter's posters seemingly fed up with the pace of the relationship between [[Luke]] and [[Lorelai]].
There was some question when the last episode of season 8 was presented whether the writers would continue to a season 9. Episode 8.22, "It's All Over But the Crying" was designed so that the story may have continued or may not have; there was no cliffhanger but there was some sense of unfinished business.
In June 2008, the virtual season staff announced they were starting to plan for season 9. '''Robinpoppins''' and '''Jewels''' would replace '''sosmitten''' in the head writer role (with '''sosmitten''' remaining on staff in a "lead writer" role). Episode 9.01 (Untitled as of yet) is set to "air" September 30, 2008.

{{Infobox character | Title = Lulu | Actor = Rini Bell | Image = |Imagesize = 190px | First = [[An Affair to Remember]] | Last = [[7.22 Bon Voyage|Bon Voyage]] | Name = Lulu | Age = | Family= }} '''Lulu''' is [[Kirk Gleason|Kirk]]'s girlfriend. She used to date Kirk's brother, and Kirk always had a crush on her. She has dinner with Kirk at [[Luke's Diner]] in "[[An Affair to Remember]]," and they start a relationship. She teaches third grade at Stars Hollow Elementary School ([[Jews and Chinese Food|5.15]]). It is possible that her last name is "Kuschner". In the episode "[[Jews and Chinese Food]]," Lulu, Kirk, Carrie, and Luke are working on the elementary school's production of ''Fiddler on the Roof,'' and Carrie refers to Miss Kuschner.CARRIE: Okay, fine. Everybody else, tell me or Miss Kuschner by the end of the day..." ([[Jews and Chinese Food|5.15]]) ==References==

==About me== Hey, hi, hello! My name's Jennifer. You'll probably find me helping out around here by categorizing pages and fixing minor things like spelling mistakes and unhelpful edits. I'm around on other wikis as well, so you may know me from another. Probably not though, because I don't talk too much. Feel free to talk to me, though. See ya around!
==Fun facts== * The first episode I saw was [[I Can't Get Started]] (oi with the poodles already!). * I'd initially thought that [[Michel Gerard|Michel]] was a wedding planner. * And that [[Paris Geller|Paris]] wasn't on [[The Franklin]] staff with [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]]. * I didn't see the cast-removal scene. * I actually started to watch that episode out of boredom; I was flipping through channels. * I continued to watch because I saw [[Jared Padalecki]] in it (Supernatural fan here). * My favorite show moment was when [[Luke Danes|Luke]] pushed [[Jess Mariano|Jess]] off the bridge.

revision.text:
'''Papaya''' is the stray cat [[Sookie St. James|Sookie]] finds in the episode [[A Tale of Poes and Fire]].
==Appearances== ===Season 3=== [[6.17]]
[[Category:Animals]]

[[File:Lorelai---Alex-gilmore-girls-139988_533_400.jpg|thumb]]Introduced in I Solemnly Swear , Alex is the business partner of an old friend of Sookie's that Lorelai and Sookie run into at the Learning Center after taking a course on how to run an inn. Alex and his friend Joe are looking into opening a chain of coffee shops. While Sookie and Joe reminesce about old times Lorelai and Alex hit it off resulting in him calling her at the end of the episode to ask her on a date to try different types of coffee. On that date in the next episode, Lorelai Out of Water, he says he has two daughters aged 6 and 9, whose mother he is not with anymore. He is also a big fan of the outdoors and upon Lorelai seeming to take an interest, he invites her to go fishing with him, which despite her lack of experience she excepts. Luke teachers her to fish. Though Lorelai doesn't tell him, he senses she has never fished before and as such takes her to the Shehela Lodge and Spa afterwards. The last time we see him is the episode Swan Song in which he acquires 4 tickets to see the musical Levittown in New York and invites Sookie and Jackson to join them. The musical is a bust but the four of them have a good time anyway. Alex is shown to be kind and considerate to Lorelai and her eccentricities. He is mentioned a few times during the rest of the season when Lorelai runs into Max again and feelings resurface for him, she is said to still be dating Alex though we never see him and when or what exactly caused their break up is unclear. {{Infobox character |Title = Alex Lesman |Actor = Billy Burke |Image = |First = I Solemnly Swear |Last = Swan Song |Name = Alex Lesman |Age = N/A |Family = 2 Daughters (Aged 6 and 9)}} [[Category:Characters|Lesman, Alex]] [[Category:Lorelai's Romantic Interests|Lesman, Alex]]

{{stub}} {{Infobox character |Title = Sasha |Image = |Imagesize = 190px |Actor = Sherilyn Fenn |First = [[Here Comes the Son]] |Last = [[Here Comes the Son]] |Name = Sasha |Age = N/A |Family = [[Jimmy Mariano]] (boyfriend)
[[Lily]] (daughter) }} '''Sasha''' is [[Jimmy Mariano]]'s girlfriend. ==Appearances== ===Season 3=== [[Here Comes the Son|3.21]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

Nicolette Collier:
Character: Georgia "Gigi" Hayden
T.V show: Gilmore Girls
Her and her sister Rory share the same father
Half Sister: Lorelai "Rory" Leigh Gilmore (Kimberly Alexis Bledel)
Father: Christopher Hayden (David Sutcliffe)
Mother: Sherry Tinsdale (Madchen Amick)
"Aunt": Lorelai Victoria Gilmore is considered her Aunt even though she has no relation to her. [[Category:Cast|Collier, Nicolette]]
