{{Infobox character |Title = Francine Hayden |Actor = Cristine Rose |Image = Francine.jpg |First = [[Christopher Returns]] |Last = |Name = Francine Hayden |Age = 60s |Family = [[Straub Hayden]] (deceased husband)
[[Christopher Hayden]] (son)
[[Rory Gilmore]] (granddaughter)
[[Georgia Hayden]] (granddaughter)}} '''Francine Hayden''' is the mother of [[Christopher Hayden]] and wife (later widow) to the late [[Straub Hayden]]. Her relationship with her son is in no means strong, but it isn't as weak as the relationship Chris holds with his father. It was noted that she and [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]] were practically inseparable before [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] became pregnant, and the two were close friends. During first appearance, she is shown to be less hostile to Lorelai. After her husband's death, it's said that she shows up to help Christopher with his daughter, however this is off screen. ==Appearances== ===Season 1=== [[Christopher Returns|1.15]] ===Season 3=== [[Dear Emily and Richard|3.13]] ==References== [[Women Of Questionable Morals|5.11]] - when Straub dies [[Category:Characters|Hayden, Francine]] [[Category:Hayden family|Hayden, Francine]]

== Licensing == {{None selected}}

'''Pennilyn Lott''' was [[Richard Gilmore]]'s girlfriend while he was a student at Yale. He was engaged to Pennilyn, but broke it off to be with [[Emily Gilmore|Emily]]. [[Lorelai "Trix" Gilmore|Richard's mother]] thought Pennilyn was a much more suitable wife for Richard than Emily, and she wrote Richard a letter begging him to call off his wedding to Emily and reconcile with Pennilyn ([[The Reigning Lorelai|4.16]]). As Emily learns at the Harvard-Yale game ([[Ted Koppel's Big Night Out|4.09]]), Richard and Pennilyn have lunch once a year, which makes Emily extremely jealous.
==Appearances== ===Season 4=== [[Ted Koppel's Big Night Out|4.09]] [[Category:Characters|Lott, Pennilyn]] [[Category:Yale|Lott, Pennilyn]]

'''Janet Billings''' (portrayed by Katie Walder) was [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]], [[Paris Gellar|Paris]], and [[Tanna Schrick|Tanna]]'s roommate during Rory's first year at [[Yale]]. She is very athletic and often gets up in the early hours of the morning to go jogging, infuriating Paris. Janet attends Yale on a partial athletic scholarship. [[Category:Characters|Billings, Janet]] [[Category:Yale|Billings, Janet]]

==The Real Me== [[File:Me with Oscar the Grouch.jpg|thumb|300px|Me with my hero: '''[http://grouches.wikia.com/wiki/Oscar_the_Grouch Oscar the Grouch]'''.]] Hi, I'm T.J. but you can call me Teej; many people do. I'm a great swimmer, artist & cook & I can imitate the voices of cartoon characters & real people extremely well. I've been able to for, about, most of my life. I am very proud of this incredible talent. '''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Green Green]''' is my favorite color in the world. I also '''LOVE''' the '''[http://grouches.wikia.com/wiki/Grouches Grouches]''' from [http://muppet.wikia.com/wiki/Sesame_Street Sesame Street], my favorite TV show. I love trash as much as they do. I even celebrate '''[http://grouches.wikia.com/wiki/National_Grouch_Day National Grouch Day]''' like the '''Grouches''' every [http://grouches.wikia.com/wiki/October_15 October 15]th. My favorite '''Grouches''' of all are '''[http://grouches.wikia.com/wiki/Oscar_the_Grouch Oscar the Grouch]''' & his girlfriend '''[http://grouches.wikia.com/wiki/Grundgetta Grundgetta]'''. Also, if I could I would totally live in a dirty beat up old trash can. My specialty is gettin rid of redirects w/ the | button. I've gotten rid of redirects with the | key on many other Wikis as well. I'm also an administrator & bureaucrat on the '''[http://grouches.wikia.com/wiki/Grouches_Wiki Grouches Wiki]'''. So if anybody ever has a question about that or anything please feel free to leave a message on [[User talk:GrouchMan|my talk page]] & I'll respond A.S.A.I.C. (as soon as I can). ==The Fictional Me== '''GrouchMan''' is 1 of the meanest, grouchiest, rottenest [http://grouches.wikia.com/wiki/Grouches Grouches] around. His birth name is '''Oscar the Grouch II''' named after his uncle, that true rotten legend, '''[http://grouches.wikia.com/wiki/Oscar_the_Grouch Oscar the Grouch]''' of [http://muppet.wikia.com/wiki/Sesame_Street_(location) Sesame Street]. Oscar & his identical twin brother '''Travis the Grouch''' were extremely popular at Grouch school. He soon became better known as GrouchMan at school, but he became '''Scar the Grouch''' after receiving a scar across his left eye after a tragic Grouch petting zoo accident. He mostly goes by Scar nowadays, but, nevertheless, he's still GrouchMan. At school, Scar also met a Grouch girl who was actually equally grouchy whose name was '''Grundgetta'''. She became '''GrouchGal''' shortly after that. Travis, soon after, met her identical twin sister '''Toxica'''. Not too long after they graduated Scar & Grungie became Grouch boyfriend & girlfriend, as did their siblings. They call each other Oskie & Grungie, but Grungie still goes by GrouchMan. However, shortly after graduation, Scar & Travis' parents, '''Oswaldo the Grouch''' & '''Trashy the Grouch''', the brother of Oscar & sister of Oscar's girlfriend, '''[http://grouches.wikia.com/wiki/Grundgetta Grundgetta]''', were killed in a terrible car accident. Right after that, both Scar & Travis, immediately moved into their Uncle Oscar's [http://grouches.wikia.com/wiki/Oscar's_trash_can trash can] on [http://muppet.wikia.com/wiki/Sesame_Street_(location) Sesame Street], so now their Aunt Grundgetta, helps Oscar to protect & take amazing care of their orphaned nephews. Now, all Scar, Grungie, Travis & Toxica do all day is tell other people to scram & argue. ==My contributions== *[[Special:Contributions/GrouchMan|User contributions]]

Hi! I'm Nanna :) I'm 17 and from Denmark!

I fell in love with Gilmore Girls after it ended through friends of mine that loved the show. I watched it all from start to finish and loved every second. Sadly, when I came to the series finale, Gilmore Girls was over for me - I had a very short run without long breaks and hiatuses but that doesn't change my love for it! I love how it's different from the usual over-the-top drama-filled shows, or the shows that are just funny and have no continuation. Don't get me wrong, I love those types of shows too, but Gilmore Girls was a breath of fresh air and I am so sad it ever got cancelled!
I'm on this Wikia to still share some of my love for the show, and though I don't edit as often here because there will be no more new information, I still like to come here every once in a while!
'''If you'd like to find me at other Wikias, I also enjoy editing Wikias of these shows:'''

[http://www.onetreehill.wikia.com One Tree Hill]

#REDIRECT [[Merry Fisticuffs]]
'''Chad''' was the man that danced withÂ [[Emily]] at a resturant in the episode [[There's The Rub]]. [[Category:Characters]]

'''Shane''' was the girl [[Jess]] had a relationship with after the summer following Sookie's wedding in the [[season 2]] [[I Can't Get Started|finale]]. She worked at [[Stars Hollow Beauty Supply]], at least temporarily. Shane and Jess had a lot of PDA, but Jess had no feelings for her. He told [[Luke]] that he didn't even know her last name. [[File:660874_1299912968979_full.jpg|thumb]][[File:Xgl5wn.jpg|thumb]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Stars Hollow Residents]]
#REDIRECT [[Sophie Bloom]]

'''[[File:Th_89334_HSwedberg-GGS3E04-018_122_436lo.jpg|thumb]]Debbie Fincher''' is the mother of [[Cathy Fincher]] and the wife of [[Bill Fincher]]. She was very fond of [[Lorelai Gilmore|Lorelai]] when [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] went to [[Stars Hollow High School]] where Cathy also went. When Rory would come over to see Cathy to go swimming in their pool, Lorelai had long conversations after she'd drop Rory off at their house. Debbie was also the one that got Lorelai and [[Luke Danes|Luke]] the gig to speak at Stars Hollow High about business and Lorelai told Rory she didn't remember Debbie. [[Category:Characters|Fincher, Debbie]] [[Category:Stars Hollow|Fincher, Debbie]] [[Category:Stars Hollow Residents|Fincher, Debbie]] [[Category:One-Appearance Characters|Fincher, Debbie]]

'''Stars Hollow Beauty Supply''' is the beauty supply store of [[Stars Hollow]]. [[Jess]]'s girlfriend [[Shane]] worked there <small>([[One's Got Class and the Other One Dyes]])</small>; as did [[Kirk]] <small>([[Lorelai Out of Water]] & [[Ballrooms and Biscotti]])</small>. Lorelai and Rory often get their supplies there; although they prefer Sephora (large, well-known beauty supply store). [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Businesses in Stars Hollow]]
#REDIRECT [[Sherry Tinsdale]]
#REDIRECT [[The Puffs]]
#REDIRECT [[Francie Jarvis]]

'''Stars Hollow Books''' is the name of the local bookstore in [[Stars Hollow]]. It was arguably [[Rory]]'s favorite store in all of Stars Hollow, since she could easily spend several hours looking at the selection of books.
'''Trivia:''' *[[Andrew]] works here. *Rory got a job sorting books here later in the series, where she ended up buying alot of books. She stated that the job was 'costing her alot'. [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Businesses in Stars Hollow]]

'''Roger''' was a student at [[Chilton]] and participated on the school board with [[Paris Geller|Paris]], [[Rory]], [[Louise Grant|Louise]], [[Madeline Lynn|Madeline]], [[Francie]] and others. [[Category:Chilton]]

The '''End of Summer Madness Festival''' is a festival held in [[Stars Hollow]]. It is held for the first time in the episode [[Those Lazy-Hazy-Crazy Days]] in September. [[Category:Festivals in Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Stars Hollow]]

'''[[File:Sodashoppegilmoregirls.png|thumb]]Taylor's Olde Fashion Soda Shoppe''' is the store located next to [[Luke's Diner]] that sells all kinds of soda and ice cream. It is owned by [[Taylor Doose]]. [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Businesses in Stars Hollow]]
#REDIRECT [[The Gilmore House]]

revision.text: #REDIRECT [[The Gilmore House]]

#REDIRECT [[Dave Rygalski (writer)]]
These are the categories that contain pages of respective characters' romantic interests throughout the run of the show. [[Category:Characters]]

'''Young Chui''' is [[Lane Kim|Lane]]'s cover up boyfriend while she is dating [[Dave Rygalski]]. This eventually becomes a problem as Chui begins falling in love with Lane in the process. He is dating another girl secretly, while dating Lane. He follows her like a lost puppy. [[Category:Characters|Chui, Young]] [[Category:Lane's Love Interests|Chui, Young]]
#REDIRECT [[Weston Bakery]]

'''[[File:Shvideo.jpg|thumb]]Stars Hollow Video''' is the video store in [[Stars Hollow]]. Since [[Lorelai]] and [[Rory]] love watching movies so much, they go there often to rent movies.
'''Trivia:''' *In the episode [[Kiss and Tell]], Lorelai and Rory rent the movie [http://Charlie and the Chocolate Factory Charlie and the Chocolate Factory], and get junk food from Dooses, where [[Dean]] works, and Lorelai invites him to come watch the movie with them at their house. *Also, in the episode [[Richard in Stars Hollow]], Rory sees two young boys looking at a 'mature' video cover. She tells [[Kirk]]- who works there at the time- to move the video to a higher shelf. He tells Taylor, and they end up moving all of the videos except for movies such as [http://Dumbo Dumbo] and [http://Bambi Bambi] behind a curtain, and hang Rory's picture in the window for sensorship. [[Category:Locations]] [[Category:Businesses in Stars Hollow]] [[Category:stars Hollow]]

'''Antonioli's''' is the local pizza place in [[Stars Hollow]]. [[Rory]] made them make the "largest pizza in the world" for [[Lorelai]]'s birthday in [[3.18]]. [[Pete]] works there <small>([[Happy Birthday, Baby]])</small>. [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Businesses in Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Locations]]

#REDIRECT [[Fran Weston]]

'''[[File:ArisAlavaradoakaCaesar.jpg|thumb]]Caesar''' is the chef at [[Luke's Diner]]. He does not appear in many episodes, especially in the early seasons, but [[Luke]] often speaks to an off-camera Caesar. He begins to appear more regularly in the 6th and 7th season.[[File:Screen_shot_2012-07-24_at_9.00.25_PM.png|thumb]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Stars Hollow Residents]] [[Category:Luke's Diner]]
{{delete}}'''Tana Schrink''' was [[Rory]] and [[Paris]]' suitemate at Yale.
#REDIRECT [[Hope]]
#REDIRECT [[Talk:Hope]]

'''Trevor''' was [[Rory Gilmore]]'s classmate in her freshman year English class at [[Yale]] and the first guy she went on a date with after she broke up with [[Jess Mariano]]. That next year, he went to Barcelona to study. He also has a brother named Brian and an unnamed sister. [[Category:Yale]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Rory's Romantic Interests]]

'''[[File:Screen_shot_2012-07-31_at_12.01.43_AM.png|thumb]][[File:The-Godmothers-Lorelai-Rory-with-Davey-Martha-lorelai-and-rory-gilmore-7997311-450-300.jpg|thumb]]Davey''' is [[Jackson Belleville]] and [[Sookie St. James]]' son. He was born in [[4.08]]. He has a sister, [[Martha Belleville|Martha]]. At the end of the series, Sookie is expecting meaning Davey will have a second sibling. Rory is Davey's godmother. [[Category:St. James and Melville family]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Stars Hollow Residents]]

'''Christine''' is [[Lane]]'s friend.
==Appearances== ===Season 4=== [[4.15]] [[Category:Characters]]

{{Infobox character |Title = Marilyn Gilmore |Actor = Marion Ross |Image = |First = [[The Reigning Lorelai]] |Last = [[Wedding Bell Blues]] |Name = Marilyn Gilmore |Age = Unknown |Family = [[Richard Gilmore]] (son)
[[Emily Gilmore]] (daughter-in-law)
[[Lorelai Gilmore]] (first cousin, once removed)
[[Rory Gilmore]] (first cousin, twice removed)
[[Lorelai "Trix" Gilmore]] (aunt) }} '''Marilyn Gilmore''' is [[Lorelai "Trix" Gilmore|Trix]]'s niece and [[Richard Gilmore|Richard]]'s cousin. She appears to be a little older than Richard, and possibly in her mid sixties. She only appears in two episodes. ===Season 4=== Marylin first appears in the episode of her Aunt's death, the Reigning Lorelai. She asks Lorelai about barglasses she plans on taking due to them being of valuble, but Lorelai lies and says she hasn't seem them. She appears to know alot about her Aunt, and tells stories. Rory even listens to some of them. She's the one who refers to Lorelai as the Reigning Lorelai, and also the one who points out that Trix is very fond of her, even showing her photo off. ===Season 5=== Marylin returns and appears at Richard and Emily's reconcilation party. [[Category:Characters|Gilmore, Marilyn]] [[Category:Gilmore family|Gilmore, Marilyn]]

page.title: 7.15 I'm A Kayak, Hear Me Roar

revision.text: #REDIRECT [[I'm A Kayak, Hear Me Roar|I'm A Kayak, Hear Me Roar{{Episode |name = I'm a Kayak, Hear Me Roar |season = 7 |ep_num = 15 |date = 2/20/2007}}]]At Friday night dinner, Lorelai works up the courage to tell her parents about the break-up of her marriage, but is derailed by their argument over the healthy meals and no-alcohol policy Emily has instituted to help Richard recover from his heart attack. Lorelai enlists Sookie to bring Richard healthy but delicious meals, then helps Emily organize Richard's business affairs. Over a shared bottle of scotch, Lorelai finally tells her mother about the breakup of her marriage. Rory attends an awkward birthday dinner for Logan with Mitchum Huntzberger, who asks her to help him steer Logan in the right direction. Later, Logan receives disturbing news about the online company he purchased. Also, Luke shares his home with Liz , T.J. and their baby daughter while their house is being fumigated.

[[Lindsay Lister]](sister-in-law) |First = [[Love, Daisies and Troubadours]] |Last = [[Tippecanoe and Taylor, Too]]}} '''Clara Forester''' is [[Dean Forester]]'s little sister. ==Trivia== *She likes Avril Lavigne. *She liked [[Rory Gilmore|Rory]] better than [[Lindsay Lister|Lindsay]]. *When she was younger she had blonde hair but in '''[[Tippecanoe and Taylor, Too|5.4]]''' she had red hair. It possible she may dyed her hair that color sometime before. *She rides horses ==Appearances== ''[[Love, Daisies and Troubadours|1.21]]'' ''[[The Bracebridge Dinner|2.10]]'' ''[[That'll Do, Pig|3.10]]'' ''[[Tippecanoe and Taylor, Too|5.4]]'' [[Category:Characters|Forester, Clara]] [[Category:Forester family|Forester, Clara]] [[Category:Stars Hollow|Forester, Clara]] [[Category:Stars Hollow Residents|Forester, Clara]]

'''Miss Celine''' is [[Emily Gilmore]]'s personal stylist. She is portrayed by Alex Borstein (the original [[Sookie]]). She knew classic Hollywood celebrities like Marlene Dietrich, Ginger Rogers, Olivia De Havilland or Marilyn Monroe. Â She helped Emily decide on a wedding dress for Emily and Richard's vow renewal.

'''Stars Hollow History Museum''' is what the [[Twickham House]] became after [[Old Twickham]] died.
[[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Businesses in Stars Hollow]]
'''Josh''' is [[Honor Huntzberger]]'s fiancÃ©e and later husband. ==Appearances== [[5.19]] [[Category:Huntzberger family]] [[Category:Characters]]

'''[[File:Errrrrr.jpg|thumb]][[File:49764_1202090237823_full.jpg|thumb]]Honor Huntzberger''' is [[Logan Huntzberger]]'s sister.
In episode 5.19, Honor appears in her brother's room at Yale, to announce that she is going to marry Josh, and that he needs to go home for dinner, so that their parents will be in a good mood.
Honor is also seen to smoke cigarettes.Â
The Huntzbergers believes that Josh is better suited for that family than Rory. Although, they seem to not like him very much.Â
She thinks Rory is very nice and is good friends with her. She tells Rory how sorry she feels about Logan and Rory breaking up when Rory thought that they were still together.
===Season 5=== *[[5.19]] ===Season 6=== *[[6.20|6.10]] *[[6.16]] *[[6.20]] [[Category:Characters|Huntzberger, Honor]] [[Category:Huntzberger family|Huntzberger, Honor]]

'''Rebecca Thurston''' wrote the blog that informed [[Paris Geller]] about [[Rory Gilmore]]'s yacht-stealing incident. The blog is mainly about the guys she has had sex with and how much she hates her mother. Coincidentally, Rebecca had sex with the son of the guy that owns the boat Rory stole, on the boat Rory stole, which made Rebecca write on her blog about it.
==Appearances== [[6.03]] (mentioned) [[Category:Characters|Thurston, Rebecca]]
#REDIRECT [[Chilton Preparatory School]]
The '''New England Maple Syrup Council''' is a maple syrup tasting council. They had a gathering at the [[Dragonfly Inn]] in the episode [[6.12]].
'''Martia''' is [[April Nardini|April]]'s friend. She is on her mathematics team at school and attended the birthday party [[Luke]] threw for April. [[Category:Characters]]

revision.text: '''The Old Muddy River Bridge Knitathon''' was a knitathon thrown to raise money for the rebuilding of the [[Muddy River Bridge]] in [[Stars Hollow]]. [[Category:Stars Hollow]] [[Category:Festivals in Stars Hollow]]

[[File:Tumblr_kqy1haLxYC1qzhzgqo1_500.png|thumb|316px|Rory: The Subsect. Written by Jess Mariano. Jess: Itâ€™s no misprint. Rory: You wrote a book? Jess: A short novel. Rory: You wrote a book?]] Truncheon books is a publishing house which is first mentioned in episode 8 season 6, when Jess Mariano turns up at Rory's grandparents house to show her the short novel he wrote called The Subsect, the book was published by Truncheon books.
JESS; I didnâ€™t think youâ€™d believe it if I didnâ€™t show it to you in person. [hands her a book] RORY; Oh, color me curious. A book. [reads front the cover] The Subsect. Written by Jess Mariano. [she looks at him] JESS; Itâ€™s no misprint. RORY; You wrote a book? JESS; A short novel. RORY; You wrote a book? JESS; And, through a fluke, I got it to these guys that have a small press and they read it. I donâ€™t know if they were high or something, but they decided to publish it. RORY; You wrote a book. JESS; Thereâ€™s no money in it. They only printed, like, five hundred of them. Believe me, Iâ€™m not quitting my day job. RORY; But - you wrote it. You wrote a book. JESS; Yeah, I know, itâ€™s hard to believe. RORY; You sat down and wrote a novel. Jess This is amazing!
The owners/founders of Truncheon books (who are seen) are Chris and Mathew, Jess joins the company later, But you don't actually see Truncheon books until episode 18 season 6, where they host an open house and Jess invites Luke, April and Rory. He is surprised at Luke's appearance and even more so when he meets his cousin. Luke asks Jess to give him a tour
JESS; This is where we work: Truncheon Books. There's usually desks and crap piled up everywhere but we cleaned up for today. Those are the books that we put out. We publish our 'zine once a month, except last August when my partner forgot to pay the printer. We let local artists hang their stuff up without ripping them off on commissions, we do performances over there, and a few of us live upstairs, and that you don't want to see. It's a disaster zone.
In this same episode, in truncheon books, Rory and Jess kiss, but Rory confesses that she is in love with Logan and that she only came because she was angry at Logan for cheating on her. Jess tells her that she can tell Logan that something happened if it will make her feel better. And we never see Truncheon books again...
{{Delete}}

[http://www.justfriv.com/ Friv] is different from most other online games websites. The visitor is welcomed by a nice user interface: a grid filled with tiny icons showing a screenshot of the games offered. All the games that can be played are visible at a glance! When you click on an icon, you get to another page where the chosen game is framed into a window with a side panel that shows which keys on the keyboard are used to play the game. No downloads are necessary: all games are online flash games that you play directly from your browser.
Each game is going to present its own challenges so you are going to find that you are never going to be bored playing. There is always something new and interesting waiting for you around the corner which is going to peak your interest and you are going to want to know just what is going to happen next. Friv makes sure that all of the games you play are of the highest quality so you never have to worry about the graphics being horrible or not being able to play. You are going to find that the story lines are just as captivating.
Donâ€™t worry if you are not sure where to go and get it. Once you click on a game that you want to play a screen will pop up and ask you to download the player. As soon as this is complete you will be on your way to playing the games of your choice on Friv. Of course the better your speed is for your internet connection the better your play time is going to be as well.
You can see that this is a site that is perfect for gaming online with all of the latest streaming games in flash. There is something that everyone can enjoy and that will bring hours and hours of excitement for all in your home. With [http://www.justfriv.com Friv 2] games there is no time to waste in playing all of your favorites and perhaps even finding a few new favorites that you want to come back and play time and time again.

[[Rory|Rory Gilmore]] and [[Jess Mariano]] had a complicated relationship
Jess's mother, Liz, sent Jess away to Stars Hollow, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Connecticut Connecticut] to live with her brother, [http://gilmoregirls.wikia.com/wiki/Luke_Danes Luke Danes]because she couldn't handle him and thought that Luke could. But Jess's arrival in Stars Hollow wasn't well received by the town at large. Luke has an even bigger problem controlling Jess's personal life while he's in Stars Hollow. Despite his actions, Jess's knowledge of books and pop culture eventually appeal to Rory Gilmore. They become friends despite others' disapproval, and Jess pursues Rory, despite her relationship with Dean. Jess leaves town for a while following a car accident which leaves Rory injured. Rory skips school to visit him in New York, where they officially say goodbye. Jess and Rory officially start dating after the local dance marathon when Dean tells Rory he knows she is interested in Jess and breaks up with her. Their relationship runs into trouble because of both Jess's and Rory's constant insecurities and difficulties communicating. Rory later confesses to her friend Lane Kim that, while she was initially attracted to Jess due to their similar interests, she was ultimately too used to Dean's affection and reliability, expecting Jess to treat her the same, only to realize that he never would. When Luke finds out that Jess would not be allowed to graduate from Stars Hollow High because he had cut too many classes, he tells Jess that he must repeat his senior year or leave. Unwilling to accept Luke's stipulations, Jess goes to Calfornia to live with his father. [http://images.wikia.com/gilmoregirls/images/3/38/Big_alexis_bledel_milo_ventimiglia_una_mamma_per_amica.jpg]Rory & JessAdded by [http://gilmoregirls.wikia.com/wiki/User:P_Sawyer P Sawyer]Jess briefly returns to Stars Hollow in season four to steal back his car from Luke after his mom tells him Luke stole it from him nearly a year earlier. Jess also sees Rory several times, though every encounter ends with him giving her the cold shoulder. Jess leaves after telling her that he loves her. A few months later, Jess returns to Stars Hollow for his mother Liz's wedding. After the wedding, Jess visits Rory at Yale and asks her to run away with him. She declines. Two years later, a much more mature Jess returns to deliver a copy of the book he has written to Rory, explaining his new life working at an independent publishing company, and explaining that he could not have achieved any of his recent success had she not believed in him when they were teenagers. At the time, Rory had dropped out of Yale and moved into her grandparents' house. They decide to get something to eat, but are interrupted by an agitated Logan, who invites himself along. During the reunion, Logan treats Jess ironically in the same way Jess's has teased Dean in the past; he is condescending and arrogant. Jess walks out amid an argument with Logan. Although Rory goes after him, Jess refuses to stay. He is shocked that Rory is dating someone like Logan, and more importantly that she has dropped out of school with no plans for the future, and repeatedly demands to know what's going on, telling her "this isn't you, Rory, you know it isn't." His criticism and refusal to accept excuses make Rory take a serious look at her life and are instrumental in her return to Yale. He then says this is a bad time for them to meet up, so he'll see her another time. Jess appeared for the final time in the Season 6 episode "The Real Paul Anka", where he, Luke and Rory meet again at the new book store/art gallery/publishing house in Philadelphia where Jess works. Rory and Jess exchange a kiss, but Rory tells Jess that she is still in love with Logan and only did it because she found out Logan had been with someone else while they were broken up. Jess is hurt at being used, but says that she can tell Logan something happened. After that he is never mentioned again.

'''William Albert "Billy" Burke''' (born November 25, 1966) is an American actor. He is known for his role as [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Twilight_characters#Charlie_Swan <u>Charlie Swan</u>] in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twilight_(2008_film) <u>Twilight</u>]'' and its sequels, ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Twilight_Saga:_New_Moon <u>The Twilight Saga: New Moon</u>]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Twilight_Saga:_Eclipse <u>The Twilight Saga: Eclipse</u>]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Twilight_Saga:_Breaking_Dawn <u>The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn Part 1</u>]''. He is also known for his role as [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gary_Matheson <u>Gary Matheson</u>] in the second season of ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/24_(TV_series) <u>24</u>]''. In 2011 he played Cesaire in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Riding_Hood_(2011_film) <u>Red Riding Hood</u>]''. He notably played Alex Lesman, Lorelai's boyfriend for 3 episodes. {| class="toc" id="toc" | ==Contents== [[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)# <u>hide</u>]] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#Life_and_career <u>1 Life and career</u>] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#Filmography <u>2 Filmography</u>] **[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#Actor <u>2.1 Actor</u>] **[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#Writer <u>2.2 Writer</u>] **[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#Producer <u>2.3 Producer</u>] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#See_also <u>3 See also</u>] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#References <u>4 References</u>] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#External_links <u>5 External links</u>] |} ==[[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Billy_Burke_(actor)&action=edit&section=1&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro <u>edit</u>]] Life and career== Burke was born in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bellingham <u>Bellingham</u>], Washington. He is married to actress Pollyanna Rose; they have a daughter named Bluesy LaRue Burke.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-0">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#cite_note-0 <u>[1</u>]]</sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-1">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#cite_note-1 <u>[2</u>]]</sup>
His television credits include roles in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_Trek:_Deep_Space_Nine <u>Star Trek: Deep Space Nine</u>]'' (in the episode "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Skin_(DS9_episode) <u>Second Skin</u>]"), ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Party_of_Five <u>Party of Five</u>]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilmore_Girls <u>Gilmore Girls</u>]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karen_Sisco <u>Karen Sisco</u>]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fringe_(TV_series) <u>Fringe</u>]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monk_(TV_series) <u>Monk</u>]'' and ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Closer <u>The Closer</u>]'' (Season 4, episode 13, "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_of_Attorney <u>Power of Attorney</u>]" playing the attorney Phillip Stroh). He also plays Detective Eric Box in the movie ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Untraceable <u>Untraceable</u>]''.
His motion picture credits include ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jane_Austen%27s_Mafia! <u>Jane Austen's Mafia!</u>]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Along_Came_a_Spider <u>Along Came a Spider</u>]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Final_Jeopardy_(2001_film)&action=edit&redlink=1 <u>Final Jeopardy</u>]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flashpoint_(TV_series) <u>Flashpoint</u>]'' and ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ladder_49 <u>Ladder 49</u>]''. His upcoming film credits include [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Fallen_(film) ''<u>The Fallen</u>''], ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Forfeit_(film)&action=edit&redlink=1 <u>Forfeit</u>]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fracture_(2007_film) <u>Fracture</u>]'' and ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Retirement_(film)&action=edit&redlink=1 <u>Retirement</u>]''. He also appeared in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feast_of_Love <u>Feast of Love</u>]'' (2007), co-starring [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Selma_Blair <u>Selma Blair</u>] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morgan_Freeman <u>Morgan Freeman</u>]. In 2008, Burke appeared in ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twilight_(2008_film) <u>Twilight</u>]'', based on the best-selling novel by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephenie_Meyer <u>Stephenie Meyer</u>], playing the role of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Swan_(Twilight) <u>Charlie Swan</u>].<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#cite_note-2 <u>[3</u>]]</sup> He also portrayed Bobby's brother Jack on the show ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/My_Boys <u>My Boys</u>]''. Burke reprised his role as Charlie Swan in ''Twilight'''s sequels, ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Moon_(2009_film) <u>New Moon</u>]''<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-3">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#cite_note-3 <u>[4</u>]]</sup> and ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eclipse_(2010_film) <u>Eclipse</u>]''.
Burke is one of the "famous faces" on the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Online_poker <u>online poker</u>] website [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hollywood_Poker&action=edit&redlink=1 <u>Hollywood Poker</u>], which is run in conjunction with [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ongame_Network <u>Ongame Network</u>].<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-4">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#cite_note-4 <u>[5</u>]]</sup> In February 2010, Burke was cast as Jonah King, the primary antagonist featured in the thriller ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drive_Angry <u>Drive Angry</u>]'',<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-5">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#cite_note-5 <u>[6</u>]]</sup> which was directed by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_Lussier <u>Patrick Lussier</u>]<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-6">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#cite_note-6 <u>[7</u>]]</sup> and co-starred [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amber_Heard <u>Amber Heard</u>], [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicolas_Cage <u>Nicolas Cage</u>], and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Fichtner <u>William Fichtner</u>].<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-7">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#cite_note-7 <u>[8</u>]]</sup> It was released on February 25, 2011.
As of July 2010, Burke appears in the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TNT_(TV_channel) <u>TNT</u>] drama series ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rizzoli_%26_Isles <u>Rizzoli & Isles</u>]''.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pr01-21-10_8-0">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#cite_note-pr01-21-10-8 <u>[9</u>]]</sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-9">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#cite_note-9 <u>[10</u>]]</sup>
In 2012, he was cast as the lead in the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NBC <u>NBC</u>] science-fiction series ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Revolution_(TV_series) <u>Revolution</u>]'' created by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Kripke <u>Eric Kripke</u>] and produced by [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._J._Abrams <u>J. J. Abrams</u>].<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-10">[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Burke_(actor)#cite_note-10 <u>[11</u>]]</sup> ==[[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Billy_Burke_(actor)&action=edit&section=2&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro <u>edit</u>]] Filmography== ===[[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Billy_Burke_(actor)&action=edit&section=3&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro <u>edit</u>]] Actor=== {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="background: rgb(249, 249, 249); margin: 1em 1em 1em 0px; border: 1px solid rgb(170, 170, 170); font-size: 90%; border-collapse: collapse;" |- align="center" bgcolor="#b0c4de" !Year !Film !Role !Notes and awards |- |1990 |''Daredreamer'' | | |- |1991 |''To Cross the Rubicon'' |James Bird | |- | rowspan="2"|1994 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Party_of_Five <u>Party of Five</u>]'' |Guy in Club |TV, 1 episode |- |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_Trek:_Deep_Space_Nine <u>Star Trek: Deep Space Nine</u>]'' |Ari |TV, 1 episode |- | rowspan="3"|1995 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strange_Luck <u>Strange Luck</u>]'' | |TV, 1 episode |- |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vanishing_Son <u>Vanishing Son</u>]'' |Spider McKeun |TV, 1 episode |- |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All_American_Girl_(1994_TV_series) <u>All-American Girl</u>]'' |Cody |TV, 1 episode |- | rowspan="4"|1996 |''Marshal Law'' |Monk |TV movie |- |''The Ultimate Lie'' | |TV movie |- |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gone_in_the_Night <u>Gone in the Night</u>]'' |Rob Kinney |TV movie |- |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Party_of_Five <u>Party of Five</u>]'' |Gil |TV, 1 episode |- |1997 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VR.5 <u>VR.5</u>]'' |Marco |TV, 1 episode |- | rowspan="3"|1998 |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don%27t_Look_Down_(film) <u>Don't Look Down</u>]'' |Mark Engel | |- |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Without_Limits <u>Without Limits</u>]'' |Kenny Moore | |- |''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mafia! page.title: User blog:Oywiththepoodlesalready/Book list and updating season five!

revision.text: So I've been using this wiki pretty extensively while re-watching each season in order to make a list of books seen and referenced in the show, and I've just started season five and noticed that only the first few episodes have book/music/pop culture references, so I'd like to start updating those at some point, maybe after I've finished the book list. I'm making an excel spreadsheet and lists on goodreads listopia by season, if you're interested you can just search gilmore girls on goodreads! [[Category:Blog posts]]

'''Arielle Caroline Kebbel''' (born February 19, 1985) is an [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States American] [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Model_(person) model] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Actress actress]. Arielle is perhaps best known for her roles in films such as ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Pie_Presents:_Band_Camp American Pie Presents: Band Camp]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Tucker_Must_Die John Tucker Must Die]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vampires_Suck Vampires Suck]'', and ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aquamarine_(film) Aquamarine]'', as well as TV series including ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/90210_(TV_series) 90210]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Vampire_Diaries_(TV_series) The Vampire Diaries]'', ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilmore_Girls Gilmore Girls]'', and ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Life_Unexpected Life Unexpected]'', on which she played Paige Thomas. She is often considered a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scream_Queen Scream Queen], due to her work in notable [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horror_film horror] films including ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Uninvited_(2009_film) The Uninvited]'' and ''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Grudge_2 The Grudge 2]''.

[[File:Screen_shot_2012-07-09_at_2.03.24_PM.png|thumb]] Natalie Zimmerman was the interior designer for the Dragonfly Inn. She also helped [[Emily Gilmore]] with her upstairs remodel. She appeared once in [[4.05]]. [[Lorelai]] fired Natalie because she felt uncomfortable about her mother also working with her. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

Graham was the boy [[Rory]] went on a casual date with following final exams during her freshman year of Yale. ([[4.21]]) Rory's grandmother, [[Emily]] introduced the two while Rory was packing up her things after her last final. Emily had known Graham since he was baby. Graham had mentioned to Emily that he was going out with some friends that had also had a Saturday final. Graham invited Rory to come along. The group went bar-hopping, and Rory felt uncomfortable, so when they left to go to the next bar, Rory opted out and called [[Dean]] to come get her. Graham had actually appeared to like Rory quite a bit. Rory referred to Graham as a prick. [[Category:One-Appearance Characters]]

[[File:Vlcsnap-2013-08-14-00h54m03s102.png|thumb|"Al" from Season 5, Episode 2]]Al is the owner of [[Al's Pancake World]]. It was originally a pancake house, but later changed to a restaurant that served various types of cuisine.
Lorelai says good morning to a man named Al in the beginning of the episode [[A Messenger, Nothing More]]. It is suspected that this coud potentially be Al from Al's Pancake World.

==Welcome==
Hi, welcome to Gilmore Girls Wiki. Thanks for your edit to the [[:The Gilmore House]] page.
'''[[Special:Userlogin|Please sign in and create a user name]]'''. It's an easy way to keep track of your contributions and helps you communicate with the rest of the community.
If you need help, and there are no local admins here, you may want to visit the [[wikia:Forum:Community Central Forum|forums on the Community Central Wiki]]. You can also check our [[w:c:community:Blog:Wikia Staff Blog|Staff blog]] to keep up-to-date with the latest news and events around Wikia.
Happy editing, [[User:Trellar|Trellar]]<staff /> <small>([[w:forums|help forum]] | [[w:sblog|blog]])</small>

Play all Friv [http://www.frivkizi.org/ kizi] online at Frivkizi.org. We updating new games everyday. Play hot and new games of your favorite www.friv.com,kizi.com kids games, barbie games, toy story games, mario games and all other cute friv games you love! [[File:Frivkizi.org.jpg|thumb]]

If you need help, and there are no local admins here, you may want to visit the [[wikia:Forum:Community Central Forum|forums on the Community Central Wiki]]. Looking for live help? Then join us for an upcoming [[w:c:community:Webinars|webinar]] to chat with staff and other Wikia editors. You can also check our [[w:c:community:Blog:Wikia_Staff_Blog|Staff blog]] to keep up-to-date with the latest news and events around Wikia.
Happy editing, [[User:Trellar|Trellar]]<staff /> <small>([[w:forums|help forum]] | [[w:sblog|blog]])</small>

{{delete}} Really, we are blessed with a ton of cool games online. For Adults, playing online games is a great approach to beat boredom. For Children, playing online games is a brilliant way to have healthy fun and to learn new skills at the same time. In the up side, you can find a wide verity of cool games for all age groups. And it is such an easy task to find perfect games that are suitable for your child. Games are organized by category and by gender. Some games are developed specifically for boys, while others are designed for girls. So, you can determine which games are perfect for your child easily. This article will guide you to how to search for games on the World Wide Web. Just read on.

Numerous websites offer endless options for playing cool games online free of charge, but some sites require paying certain fees for subscription. If the website is reputable, it will worth the money.

In all reality, when parents allow their children to play games on the web, they provide them with a wide range of creative and innovative activities that help in building their mental capabilities. Generally, gaming lovers can enjoy all sorts of games on the Internet without paying a penny.

Some people have a deep belief that playing online is not safe for children. However, it is a myth, because we can supervise our kids while playing. Firstly, install a firewall and an effective antivirus program to handle the security threats. Secondly, ask your children not to share their personal information when using their gaming consoles. And teach them that downloading any software from unknown sources can hurt their gaming devices. In this way, you protect them from the sending of sexually explicit photos, images, text messages, or e-mails. And generally when creating an account at any website, use a strong password that includes letters, numbers and special characters.

Types of Cool [http://babynewgames.com kids Games] Online

In the World Wide Web, you can find a broad selection of games to choose from. You will find them categorized by age groups and by types. It is just a matter of finding a trusted website that has an easy-to-explore interface and provides safety to visitors as well.

When it comes to searching for unique games on the web, we have a vast collection of games such as racing, fighting, sports, parking, naughty, cooking, fashion, cards, puzzle, coloring, dressing up, make up Barbie and so on.

Closing words

Encourage your kids to search for games and to play on the World Wide Web. Playing games online will not cost you money because many websites offer this service for free. Just select a reliable website to protect your children from different dangers of the Internet.

If you want a trusted website for playing [http://frivy8miniclip.com friv] games online, just visit this link for the best [http://newkizigames.info kizi].

Created page with "

''''There's so many extra children, '''

'''we could just feed the children, to these tigers.''''
revision.text:
''''There's so many extra children, '''

'''we could just feed the children, to these tigers.''''

Hello there, my name starts with ''L'' and does not end with ''ove''.

I'm new to Wikia or at least new to the registered part. And I want to apologize for my grammar and spelling mistakes in advance. I fail a lot without SpellCheck. SpellCheck is the worst invention ever, it makes the user so..incompetent. D=
Well. I currently watch Pretty Little Liars, the Vampire Diaries, Misfits and I used to watch Gilmore Girls, Crossing Jordan, CSI:NY, Full House, Hoganâ€™s Heroes, Stargate and some more. I think Harry Potter and The Lord of the Rings are incommensurable. And I like both, in different ways.
My favorite HP character are Severus Snape and Bill Weasley. Can't reasonable explain why I like Bill but I don't like Snape out of pity. I liked him for hating the son of the guy he hated and for the way Rufus Beck voiced him. I mean hating someone for such a unreasonable reason is so.. human. I didn't read the last volume right off the bat so when all those Snape-lovers popped up I was like "WTF is wrong with you? He killed Dumbilidore and now you love him? Get any stranger please?!" I mean I do know - now - that most people simply pity him and: Okay, go ahead but please stop comparing every pitiful person to him. It's so annoying.
My LotR favorite characters are... more than two. Merry&Pippin, Sam, Gimli, Aragorn, Legolas and the Ents. I mean talking trees are like the most amazing creatures ever. Forget Pirates and sparkling Vampires get a Tree! Back to the roots, baby! Btw, what's the fucking point in having one motheralish-thingy board to register to (wikia) then you gotta put basic stuf like a profil in every fucking wiki you start to use?

revision.comment: This is Jess and Rory's first kiss at Sookie's wedding!!! =)
revision.text: This is Jess and Rory's first kiss at Sookie's wedding!!! =)

[[File:Jess and Rory 2.jpeg|right|Jess and Rory's first kiss!]]Hi, my name is Brynne. I am a die-hard Gilmore Girls fan!!! I aboslutely love them!!! My favourite couple on the show would be Jess and Rory, as you can probably see! I also love to read! My favourite series are the Divergent Series and the Hush Hush Series!!! I really wish that Jess and Rory ended up together!! And I wish that they made a couple more seasons as was planned!!!
==My favorite pages==
* Add links to your favorite pages on the wiki here! * Favorite page #2 * Favorite page #3
==Gilmore Girls Lovers!!!== This is a place where you can post all you want about Gilmore Girls!!! You can comment on any of my blog posts or the pictures I share!!!! Have fun!!!

I don't understand why people hate Jess so much! He is the best boyfriend Rory's ever had. He treated her right. He understood her! Dean and Logan never were good enough for her! They weren't good for her. She was perfect and happy with Jess. Logan made her so sad all the time. And Dean always pushed her to do something and always complained when she wanted to do something else. And also she never cheated on Jess but she cheated on Logan and Dean with Jess, so that just proves to show how much she loves him but won't admit it to herself. [[Category:Blog posts]]

revision.comment: Created page with "I thinks nowadays as computer has become a common tool found in every home and office,and the popularity of online gaming is increasing tremendously. Friv is one of the best g..."
revision.text:
I thinks nowadays as computer has become a common tool found in every home and office,and the popularity of online gaming is increasing tremendously. Friv is one of the best games found online. They have excellent collection of intellectual games for making the mind sharper and analytical skills perceptive. Children returning from school or people coming home from offices find these online games as very good form of de-stressing and rejuvenation. You can play these games with young, old, friend, family, colleague or neighbor, as they are sure to entice any age group of people.
So, you can say what you need about being older and still performing video games online, but using internet sites like friv.ind.in me seem was back to my childhood . its help games again and is my escape from the harsh reality of work!
----
Wish all you relax in comfort and fun with [http://friv.ind.in/ friv ]games online daily.

Lorelai Gilmore is the name of three characters in the Gilmore Girls series. The series name is derived from the younger two of the three and each of the characters was named after their elder (expect Trix).
==Lorelai Gilmore== * [[Lorelai Gilmore]] or Lorelai Victoria Gilmore- is one of the main characters. She is the mother of 'Rory' Gilmore by [[Christopher Hayden]] and the daughter of [[Emily Gilmore]] and [[Richard Gilmore]]. She a driven and loving woman with a witty sense of humour. * [[Rory Gilmore]] or Lorelai Leigh Gilmore- is the daughter of [[Lorelai Gilmore]] and [[Christopher Hayden]]. She is bright, studious young woman with ambitions in journalism. * [[Lorelai "Trix" Gilmore]]- is the mother of [[Richard Gilmore]] by [[Charles Gilmore]] and therefore the grandmother and great grandmother of [[Lorelai Gilmore]] and [[Rory Gilmore]]. She has a very tense relationship with her daughter in law [[Emily Gilmore]].

[[File:Glenn.jpg|thumb|Glenn working for the Yale Daily News]] Glenn Babble is a student at Yale University who lives in [[Rory]]'s dorm during her freshman year and serves on the [[Yale Daily News]]Â writingÂ staff.
==Important Appearances==
Glenn is seen as a very nervous, geeky, social awkward and flustered person. He is first seen in an episode of Rory and [[Paris]]' first party at Yale when he is trying to carry a keg up the stairs of the dorm and hopes someone will help him (episode 4.3Â [[The Hobbit, the Sofa, and Digger Stiles]]). Other important appearances include:
- Episode [[4.10]] : Glenn is along side Rory and Paris trying to join the Yale Daily News. They have to make a newspaper hat and Glenn is very nervous and unable to make one.
- Episode [[4.17]] : Rory and Paris end up accompanying [[Janet]] and Glenn to Florida for freshman year Spring Break. While Glenn has a crush on Janet, she is only traveling with him because her friends went down without her. Paris forces Glenn to let her drive his mother's minivan because Paris feels "if I'm going to die, it's going to be by my own hands." Later in the episode, Rory and Paris find him drunk and running out of the ocean with his bathing suit on in the middle of the night.
- Episode [[4.21]] : While everyone is packing up at the end of freshman year, Glenn tells Rory that he is getting back together with his girlfriend from back home. He shows Rory a picture, however she gets freaked out when it is a picture of a young girl ("Glenn, this girl is like 12 years old!"). Glenn responds: "It's a picture of her when she was younger. Don't turn this into something dirty; she drives and everything!"
- Episode 5.6 ([[Norman Mailer, I'm Pregnant!]]): When Rory gets back into being involved with school and the school newspaper, she (along with [[Doyle]]) get jealous of the fact that one of Glenn's stories from the previous year got picked up by the New York Times. It makes Rory feel guilty about spending the whole summer traveling around Europe with her grandmother instead of working on her craft. [[Category:Yale Daily News]] [[Category:Yale]] [[Category:Friends]]

Although he only appears in four episodes, the '''Second Troubadour''' of Stars Hollow is a very recognizable character, perhaps because of his charm and humor. In addition, most of his appearances occur at monumental moments near the end of seasons. He is portrayed by Dave 'Gruber' Allen.
==Appearances==
- Episode [[1.21]] : Allen's character first appears as a troubadour who performs around town but intimidates the original troubadour, [[Grant]]. At a town meeting, Grant complains and trys to obtain a license as the only town troubadour. Although he wins, Grant and the Second Troubadour perform together on the street. We learn that he owns a Kinko's in Groton.
- Episode [[2.17]] : The Second Troubadour comes back and is intended to be the same character as the one who appeared in the first season. He is selling fruits and vegetables at a stand in the town square, which drives [[Taylor Doose]] crazy. Taylor refers to him as "that long-haired freak" and loses business from the produce being sold. While Taylor complains to the rest of the town at a town meeting, he finds out at the end of the episode that the Second Troubadour was only selling that which he grew in his garden himself and, after selling it all, is going to use the money to take a vacation.
- Episode [[4.21]] : At [[Liz]] and [[T.J.]]'s wedding, the Second Troubadour serves as the minister. He dresses in a Renaissance costume and sings a song comparing love to toys at the beginning of the ceremony. The song makes [[Lorelai]], [[Luke]], and [[Jess]] have to control their laughter. It is said that he was seen making out with [[Carrie Duncan]] at the wedding. Since most of those in the wedding were either friends of Liz and T.J. on the Renaissance Fair Circuit or townspeople, and the Second Troubadour does not seem to be a resident of [[Stars Hollow]], we can assume that he was also involved in performing at Renaissance fairs.
- Episode [[6.22]] : In the last episode of the sixth season, we find out that Grant was "discovered" by an agent and chosen to open for Neil Young. As a result, literally hundreds of troubadour performers come to Stars Hollow looking for their big break. The only visiting performer that speaks is the original Second Troubadour, when he is approached by Taylor. He informs Taylor about Grant's discovery and why all of the performers are showing up.

revision.comment: Created page with " Carrie Duncan, often referred to as 'Crazy Carrie', is portrayed by Jill Brennan. Carrie was one of [[Liz Danes]]' best friends when they attended [[Stars Hollow High School..."
revision.text:
Carrie Duncan, often referred to as 'Crazy Carrie', is portrayed by Jill Brennan. Carrie was one of [[Liz Danes]]' best friends when they attended [[Stars Hollow High School]].
==Appearances==
- Episode [[4.12]]: Carrie is first mentioned when Liz first makes an appearance in [[Stars Hollow]] . When Liz tells [[Luke]] that she is staying with Carrie, Luke refers to her as 'Crazy Carrie Duncan', at which point Liz says: "She's not crazy, she just likes the boys." We find out that the unseen Carrie thinks that she made out with Luke underneath the bleachers at the Homecoming Game. Luke denies it.
- Episode [[4.13]]: Carrie is mentioned again when Luke first meets [[T.J.]] Liz tells T.J. that Luke and Carrie went out, and again Luke denies it. We first see Carrie at the [[Firelight Festival]]. She approaches Luke, asking why he doesn't remember 'The Night'. She refers to him as 'Butch', which we found out was his high school nickname in the third season ([[One's Got Class and the Other One Dyes]]). In addition, Carrie and a few other women invite Luke to a Styx, REO Speedwagon, Journey concert. As a way to fend off their advances, Luke tells them: "Well if it was just Styx and REO Speedwagon, I'd be there. But Journey freaks me out." We find out that all of the women are married.
- Episode [[4.21]]: Carrie serves as Liz's maid (matron?) of honor for her wedding to T.J. She, along with a few other women, get a stripper for Liz's bachelorette party, which takes place in [[Luke's Diner|Luke's Dine]]Â . She tries to get Luke to dance with her at the wedding, after which he tells [[Lorelai ]] that Carrie makes him very uncomfortable. Later we find out she was seen making out with several men at the wedding, including [[The Second Troubadour|the minister]], T.J.'s brother and her own husband, Barry.
- Episode [[5.15]]: Carrie serves as the director of the Stars Hollow Elementary School's production of Fiddler on the Roof. [[Lulu]] is also involved as she is the teacher of the class and [[Kirk]], while the only adult, will be playing Tevye. Luke is helping to build the sets and has to fend off passes by Carrie at rehearsals. At rehearsals, Carrie can't seem to be able to keep track of her daughter, who is in musical and seems to frequently hide from her mother.

'''Archie Skinner''' is the reverend at the church in [[Stars Hollow]]'s town square. He shares the church facilities with the Rabbi David Barans and is seen conducting the funerals of [[Fran Weston]]Â ([[3.20]] )Â and Stan ([[4.11]] ), the man who gave money to fix the church bells, and the baptism of Sookie and Jackson's children, Davy and Martha Belleville. He is first seen with the Rabbi in episode [[Take the Deviled Eggs...|3.6]] deciding whether to allow the 'Town Loner' to protest on the steps of the church, since [[Taylor]] turned him down to protest in the town square. He is also seen participating in other town events, like the discussion and reenactment of the [[Battle of Stars Hollow]] in episode [[5.11]].
==Appearances==
[[Take the Deviled Eggs...|3.6]]
[[3.20]]
[[Ted Koppel's Big Night Out|4.9]]
[[4.11]]
[[5.11]]
[[Always a Godmother, Never a God|6.4]]
[[6.21]] [[Category:Stars Hollow Residents]]

[[File:Gilmore-girls-pulp-friction-14.jpg|thumb|Robert at Finn's Tarentino-themed party.]] '''Robert''' is a student at [[Yale ]] University with [[Rory]] who she meets through [[Logan Huntzberger]]. He is first seen at the [[Life and Death Brigade]] stunt that Rory is invited to cover for the newspaper in You Jump, I Jump JackÂ (5.7) and a few months later at a poker game that Logan hosts for his friends. While Rory and Logan are dating but not exclusive, Rory tries to make Logan jealous by accepting Robert's offer to be his date at [[Finn]]'s Quentin Tarentino-themed birthday party in the episodeÂ [[Pulp Friction]]. While we are not sure whether Robert's last name is really Grimaldi, it is what Rory tells Lorelai when Lorelai seems concerned that little is known about Robert. The confused look on Rory's face when she says it makes the viewer wonder if she made his last name up on the spot to appease her mother. We see Robert one more time while he is planning a final Life and Death Brigade stunt in Costa Rica before graduation with Logan, [[Colin]] and Finn in season six.
==Appearances== 5.7
[[5.14]]
[[5.17]]
[[6.18]] [[Category:Life and death brigade]] [[Category:Yale University]] [[Category:Logan's friends]]

revision.comment: A brief summary of the story of Gilmore Girls. Unfinished.
revision.text:
[[File:Placeholder|video|right|300px]] [[File:Placeholder|right|300px]] Gilmore Girls follows the story of Rory Gilmore and her thirty-something single mother, Lorelai Gilmore, who live in the small town of Stars Hollow, Connecticut.
The town is filled with all kinds of quirky characters, including Sookie St. James, a chef and close friend of the Gilmore girls, and Luke Danes, Lorelai's on-and-off boyfriend who owns a diner in the town centre. ==Section heading==
Write the first section of your page here.
==Section heading==
Write the second section of your page here.

Created page with "

'''play fun games free'''
revision.text:
'''play fun games free'''

If you are wondering what games can you play for free when you have online many hours daily, to refresh our mind and boost the energy.

I Think. One of these games you laugh every play time that is theÂ  [http://www.f-r-i-v.com/ friv] online games. Easy to play, without download or registration forms, these games will cheer you up fast.

There are many fun games such as:

Sniper school is inspired by classic shooting online games where you will learn to apply precision shooting skills under all conditions.You'll have a chance to practice your shooting skills on 3 training games, before embarking on your first mission.

A cool friv game for kids is Cube,made up with basic graphics. In this game you've to navigate your little ship through a huge cluster of cubes and avoid colliding with them.

If you want to have fun with your online friends,an interactive friv game is the perfect choice for that.African Detroit Cop is one of these. You have to guide Eddie make his way through Detroit as a cop.

There are thousands of online games friv and the best that you can choose what you like:, Friv Action, Friv Sport, Super Mario Friv, Friv Car, Friv Girls, Friv Racing, Most Popular Friv, Friv Shooting, Friv Adventure, Fighting Friv, Friv 4 School, Friv Kids, Friv Oyunlari .. [http://www.k-i-z-i.com/ kizi].

New games updatingÂ  everyday!
